description: THERE are many lessons a person might rightly or wrongly divine from the horse meat scare in Europe, including this: You should perhaps think twice before buying meatballs from a furniture purveyor, unless those meatballs are humongous and nonperishable, and double as ottomans.

title: Fan Sees Riveras Retirement as the Start of His Own Goodbye to Baseball
description: Watching Mariano Rivera on Saturday announce his plan to retire at the end of the season, after nearly two decades with the New York Yankees, David Quinones said that an era was drawing to a close  not just for Rivera or the sport he so thoroughly dominated, but also for Mr. Quinoness life as a fan.

title: The Liberals Against Affirmative Action
description: WASHINGTON

title: The Gun Report: March 9, 2013
description: After Roger Hartley lost his friend Mark Hummelsto gun violence in January, he realized Hummels was the ninth person he knew whod been killed or injured by a gun. So he posed a question to his Facebook friends: How many people have you known whove been the victims of gun violence? Suicide, accidental, murder. No politics. No judgment. Just a number.

title: Los Angeles Frets After Low Turnout to Elect Mayor
description: LOS ANGELES  The roughly $19 million spent in the 2013 mayoral primary here made it the most expensive on record. But that is not the number that has people agog. Just 21 percent of registered voters turned out for last weeks election  the lowest rate for a primary without an incumbent since at least 1978.

title: Dont Be Afraid of Genetic Modification
description: IF patience is a virtue, then AquaBounty, a Massachusetts biotech company, might be the most virtuous entity on the planet.

title: Chicagos Blistering Pace Punctuates Whirlwind First Half
description: How short is this lockout-abbreviated N.H.L. season? After seven weeks, it is half over, and the homestretch is about to begin. Here is a look at the best and worst of the 48-game schedule so far, and what to look for in the second half.

title: eToys vs. Goldman Sachs: The Documents
description: The following are a selection of documents that are part of the litigation between eToys creditors and Goldman Sachs over the 1999 eToys IPO.

title:
How a U.S.
    Citizen Came to
    Be in Americas
    Cross Hairs
description: WASHINGTON  One morning in late September 2011, a group of American drones took off from an airstrip the C.I.A. had built in the remote southern expanse of Saudi Arabia. The drones crossed the border into Yemen, and were soon hovering over a group of trucks clustered in a desert patch of Jawf Province, a region of the impoverished country once renowned for breeding Arabian horses.

title: Rigging the I.P.O. Game
description: ONCE upon a time, in a very different age, an Internet start-up called eToys went public. The date was May 20, 1999. The offering price had been set at $20, but investors in that frenzied era were so eager for eToys shares that the stock immediately shot up to $78. It ended its first day of trading at $77 a share.

title: Student Debt and the Economy
description: The student loan debt crisis has become a drag on the economy. Younger Americans who are saddled with bankrupting payments  or credit ratings damaged by delinquency  are in no position to buy homes, save for retirement or start businesses.

title: Putting Corporate Cash to Work
description: What should successful companies do with their growing piles of cash? Apple, which has $140 billion on hand, is being forced to address this question by one of its prominent shareholders.

title: Malaysia Detains 79 in Fight Against Filipinos
description: MANILA  Malaysian authorities announced Saturday that they had detained 79 people they suspected of being sympathizers of Filipino fighters who recently landed on Borneo in an attempt to re-establish a historic claim to part of the island.

title: The Right to Counsel: Badly Battered at 50
description: A half-century ago, the Supreme Court ruled that anyone too poor to hire a lawyer must be provided one free in any criminal case involving a felony charge. The holding in Gideon v. Wainwright enlarged the Constitutions safeguards of liberty and equality, finding the right to counsel fundamental. The goal was fair trials before impartial tribunals in which every defendant stands equal before the law.

title: Birth Culture
description: Cultural expectations and practices of birth vary around the world.

title: Living With Less. A Lot Less.
description: I LIVE in a 420-square-foot studio. I sleep in a bed that folds down from the wall. I have six dress shirts. I have 10 shallow bowls that I use for salads and main dishes. When people come over for dinner, I pull out my extendable dining room table. I dont have a single CD or DVD and I have 10 percent of the books I once did.

title: The Danger of Suppressing the Leaks
description: IMAGINE if American citizens never learned about the abuse of prisoners at Abu Ghraib. Imagine not knowing about the brutal treatment of terror suspects at United States government black sites. Or about the drone program that is expanding under President Obama, or the Bush administrations warrantless wiretapping of Americans.

title: Lifes Unequal Beginnings
description: FOR the past six years I have been photographing birth, looking at its universal as well as cultural aspects, and the struggle to provide women with safe, respectful care. An estimated quarter of a million women die each year from pregnancy-related causes like pre-eclampsia. Though the number of women who die in pregnancy or childbirth is half what it was 20 years ago, most of these deaths could have been prevented.

title: Big East Memories: When the Huskies Were Pups
description: Writers who covered the Big East Tournament at Madison Square Garden share their favorite memories.

title: Repeal the Military Force Law
description: Three days after the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks, Congress approved the Authorization for Use of Military Force. It was enacted with good intentions  to give President George W. Bush the authority to invade Afghanistan and go after Al Qaeda and the Taliban rulers who sheltered and aided the terrorists who had attacked the United States.

title: Getting Stuff Done: Its a Goal, and a Rating System
description: This interview with  Kris Duggan, C.E.O. and a co-founder of Badgeville, which designs game-based programs for businesses, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Big East Memories: One Moment, Many Times Over
description: Writers who covered the Big East Tournament at Madison Square Garden share their favorite memories.

title: In the South and West, a Tax on Being Poor
description: BALTIMORE

title: The Revolution Will Be Tweeted!
description: IN the pantheon of world leaders who have embraced 140-character communication, Hugo Chvez, Venezuelas late president, neared the top. Since he first logged on to Twitter three years ago, President Chvez out-tweeted many of his peers with an average of 12 messages each week, nearly all from a BlackBerry. He had more than four million followers and was the second most followed leader on Twitter, after President Obama, whom Mr. Chvez once called a clown. In a tweet, Mr. Chvez decried both Mr. Obama and his gringo imperialist government.

title: Is There Life After Work?
description: SANIBEL, Fla.

title: Big East Memories: An Off Broadway Beginning
description: Writers who covered the Big East Tournament at Madison Square Garden share their favorite memories.

title: Giuliani Tells Donors Lhota Would Keep City From Slipping Backward
description: Rudolph W. Giuliani, the former mayor of New York City, has signed his name to a fund-raising letter for Joseph J. Lhota, the Republican candidate for mayor, highlighting how closely the campaign will work with a figure who has, at times, polarized the citys political world.

title: A.C.P.T. 2013: In the Beginning
description: SPECIAL POST  Puzzle 4 has just started, and the big news at the end of puzzle 3 is that computer solver Dr. Fill finished with a mistake. That surely will not help him in his quest to beat reigning champion Dan Feyer.

title: Keep Calm and Carry On... Buying
description: OUR fully automated, meme-conscious information economy might seem a paradise of reason and rationality. But it also has a seamier, surreal side. Just consider how the phrase Keep Calm and Rape a Lot came to appear on T-shirts sold on Amazon.co.uk.

title: Insomnia and the Poet
description: Insomnia is never far from my thoughts, especially when I am writing. A poor sleeper even as a girl, I spent many nights scribbling diary entries in a notebook on the bathroom floor after our crowded household had gone to bed. As an adult, with three spirited children and a full-time job, I often sought the desk in the wee hours by necessity. Those liminal hours between dark and dawn continue to haunt my praxis even now that my nest is empty. At night the smallest noises, including the surprising veracity of my own breathing, are more apparent and seem to command an acute attention. For me, there is nothing as inimitably private and attuned as nocturnal writing. As I type away at this piece, for example, I find myself grateful that a lifelong habit of insomnia churned me awake at 5 a.m. from my usual choppy spell of semiconsciousness, affording at least a couple of deliciously quiet hours to think and work before even the dog will rouse and the winter windows lighten.

title: When Customer Service Isnt Even Half-Baked
description: SOME companies resolve consumer complaints in ways that are both efficient and empathetic, demonstrating not just a grasp of what defines good service but also the ways that brand loyalty is nurtured. Then there is Whirlpool.

title: Big East Memories: The Face of the Hoyas
description: Writers who covered the Big East Tournament at Madison Square Garden share their favorite memories.

title: Corralling Mobsters, if Not Many Big Banks
description: EVERYONE knows about the mobsters and terrorists that Mary Jo White successfully put behind bars during her nine years as United States attorney for the Southern District of New York. Less well-known is Ms. Whites record bringing cases against large financial institutions during her stint as the top criminal prosecutor in New York.

title: Big East Memories: 6 Overtimes, 1 Memorable Night
description: When I think of the six-overtime Big East tournament quarterfinal between Syracuse and Connecticut that began on March 12, 2009, and ended March 13, I think of Jonny Flynn.

title: To Relocate or Not? Its More Than Math
description: Q. You have been offered a job in another part of the country. How do you determine whether it makes sense to embark on such a major life change?

title: Trained by a Life of Change
description: DURING my earliest years, my father was in the Army and I often spent time with my grandparents, who farmed cotton and raised tobacco in rural Georgia. Later, my father and mother settled in Swainsboro, Ga., where my brother, seven years younger than me, was born.

title: Yes, Were Confident, but Who Knows Why
description: THE recovery in housing, the stock market and the overall economy has finally gained sustainable momentum  or so it is said.

title: 30 Seconds With Stephane Matteau
description: For Rangers fans, Stephane Matteaus goal in double overtime in Game 7 of the 1994 Eastern Conference finals against the Devils is a sweet memory. The Rangers went on to defeat the Vancouver Canucks for the Stanley Cup.

title: A Billion Years of Time and Toil Are Etched in These Old Hills
description: Heres a musical post honoring a classic March transition in the Hudson Valley from a blast of snow on Friday to a blaze of sunshine and hint of spring today. The sap is running strong in the sugar maples, guaranteeing good times at the sap to syrup festivals tomorrow at theTaconic Outdoor Education Center in Fahnestock State Park and on March 24 at Little Stony Point Park, where visitors will likely hear Pete Seeger sing about maple syrup time.

title: N.Y.U.s Global Leader Is Tested by Faculty at Home
description: Embarking on an ambitious expansion at home, constructing a network of new campuses around the globe, wooing intellectual superstars and raising vast amounts of money, John Sexton of New York University is the very model of a modern university president  the leader of a large corporation, pushing for growth on every front.

title: Joining the Bandwagon? Dont Lose Your Balance
description: STOCKS are back. And that could be dangerous.

title: Online Emotions, in Hundreds of New Flavors
description: TO say that I like to send text messages is like saying Garfield likes lasagna. It is my expressive medium. On Wednesday alone, I sent at least 100  but I like to send more than just words. Im a big fan of using emoji, the colorful symbol alphabet that contains nearly a thousand images of cute animals, food items and expressive smiley faces to convey what words cannot.

title: The Minimum Wage  and the Economy
description: To the Editor:

title: Gauging Veterinarians Future
description: To the Editor:

title: A Fee-for-Health Model
description: To the Editor:

title: The Price of Marriage in China
description: FROM her stakeout near the entrance of an H & M store in Joy City, a Beijing shopping mall, Yang Jing seemed lost in thought, twirling a strand of her auburn-tinted hair, tapping her nails on an aquamarine iPhone 4S. But her eyes kept moving. They tracked the clusters of young women zigzagging from Zara to Calvin Klein Jeans. They lingered on a face, a gesture, and then moved on, darting across the atrium, searching.

title: The Two Venezuelas
description: Claudia Astor and her mother, Norma Astor, were on opposite sides of Venezuelas political divide as they watched Hugo Chvezs funeral on their television in Caracas.

title: A.C.P.T. 2013: Puzzle 3 Shake Out
description: SPECIAL POST  Six puzzles are part of A.C.P.T. lore now, and with three judged and scanned, there are new standings to report.

title: Condensation
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  I hope you all brought towels, or at least a raincoat. Were going to get wet today, but depending on how you feel about rebus puzzles, that will either make you feel happy or extremely frustrated. Lets just say that there is no danger that anyone will CATCH FIRE around this grid.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, March 10
description: Former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida made headlines in the past week after acknowledging he would be open to a run for the White House in 2016. But the renewed attention on Mr. Bush has been mixed. His book on immigration reform is dividing a Republican Party that is trying to connect with Latino voters. Mr. Bush is doing damage control, and will be featured on almost all of this weeks Sunday shows.

title: The Leading Liberal Against Affirmative Action
description: My Capital Ideas column this week looks at liberals who would see some upsides if the Supreme Court made substantial changes to affirmative-action programs. The justices heard arguments in such a case in October  Fisher v. the University of Texas  and are expected to issue their decision between March 18 and late June.

title: Buying High and Selling Low
description: Over the long term, investors in equity mutual funds have underperformed the S.&.P. 500.

title: Venezuelan Election Set for April
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Venezuela will hold a special election on April 14 to choose a new president to complete the term of Hugo Chvez, the charismatic socialist who died last week after a battle with cancer.

title: Homegrown Talent at This Years SXSW
description: After last years South by Southwest, talk focused largely on a pair of superstars. Its not every day that Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band and Jay-Z drop into Texas to play relatively intimate venues. Meanwhile, nearly 2,000 other acts were showcased, including Fun., Ed Sheeran and the Lumineers, who all went from being virtual unknowns to Grammy performers just 10 months later.

title: Step on Toes in Austin, and You Might Get a Slap
description: Only the brave and the foolish go against the legislative pack  even when they are on the side of the angels.

title: Declared Innocent in a Killing, but Still in a Cell
description: TENNESSEE COLONY, Tex.  In 2008, Ben Spencers family bought him clothes in preparation for a day they had prayed for since 1987. A Dallas County judge had declared Mr. Spencer innocent of the robbery and killing that sent him to prison for life.

title: Recipe for Divided Europe: Add Horse, Then Stir
description: OLOMOUC, Czech Republic  For Zuzana Navelkova, it was just another day at the office. She showed up for work last month and found a two-pound bag of frozen Swedish meatballs awaiting her attention.

title: U.T.-El Paso President Still Making Waves
description: Days after Diana Natalicio became president of the University of Texas at El Paso in 1988, the first woman to hold that job, a local newspaper ran an illustration of her as Wonder Woman. As she begins her 26th year at the helm  the longest tenure at the head of a Texas public university among current presidents  that depiction remains apt.

title: Power Struggle on Reforming Vatican Bank
description: VATICAN CITY  Negotiations over the Vaticans adherence to international banking standards were reaching a delicate point. During a lunch, a European official later recalled, discussion turned to the need for more openness from an institution steeped in centuries of secrecy.

title: Grandmaster Draws Persist, but So Do Fights to the End
description: Grandmaster draws, the scourge of competition, are unfortunately alive and well.

title: In Public Eye, Shining Star of Myanmar Loses Luster
description: YANGON, Myanmar  She endured years of house arrest and was steadfast as her political movement was decimated and her colleagues were tortured. But now, as the leader of Myanmars opposition in Parliament, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the Nobel Peace laureate, is courting her former jailers.

title: On Questioning the Jewish State
description: I was raised in a religious Jewish environment, and though we were not strongly Zionist, I always took it to be self-evident that Israel has a right to exist. Now anyone who has debated the Israeli-Palestinian conflict will have encountered this phrase often. Defenders of Israeli policies routinely accuse Israels critics of denying her right to exist, while the critics (outside of a small group on the left, where I now find myself) bend over backward to insist that, despite their criticisms, of course they affirm it. The general mainstream consensus seems to be that to deny Israels right to exist is a clear indication of anti-Semitism (a charge Jews like myself are not immune to), and therefore not an option for people of conscience.

title: Neighborhoods Seek to Banish Sex Offenders by Building Parks
description: LOS ANGELES  Parents who pick up their children at the bus stop in this citys Harbor Gateway neighborhood say they often see men wearing GPS ankle bracelets and tell their children to stay away. Just up the street, 30 paroled sex offenders live in a single apartment building, including rapists and child molesters. More than 100 registered sex offenders live within a few miles.

title: Moshiach Oi! Performs
description: The citys top and perhaps only Hasidic hardcore band, Moshiach Oi!, plays to a group at a Brooklyn community center.

title: Jeter Makes His Debut
description: TAMPA  Derek Jeter returned to game action Saturday for the first time since he broke his ankle in the 12th inning of Game 1 of the American League Championship Series, and it went well.

title: A.C.P.T. 2013: The Competition Heats Up
description: SPECIAL POST  After a particularly devilish puzzle 5 by Patrick Blindauer and a somewhat easier puzzle 6, the top three contenders for the finals are still Dan Feyer, Tyler Hinman, and Anne Erdmann. Francis Heaney is in 4th place and Stella Zawistowski and Kiran Kedlaya are tied for 5th place. The puzzle by Mr. Blindauer is the one that everyone seems to be talking about, and with good cause: puzzle 5 at the A.C.P.T. is notoriously the most difficult solve of the entire tournament. I apologize for not being able to share more about the puzzles, but all details are secret until those solving by mail and online are finished.

title: Stoudemire Is Out Six Weeks for Knee Operation
description: Knicks forward Amare Stoudemire will have surgery on his right knee and is expected to miss six weeks, the team announced Saturday.

title: With No Tears, Rivera Confirms That This Season Will Be His Last
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Throughout what could have been a highly emotional day, from the morning news conference to the first strains of Enter Sandman and the two standing ovations he received from the crowd at a sold-out stadium, Mariano Rivera never shed a tear, at least not publicly.

title: Newspaper Adds New Obstacle to Tribunal Investigating Lebanese Officials Death
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The first shock came when a leading Lebanese newspaper published a confidential list of 17 witnesses who may testify in the murder trial of a former prime minister  showing their names, passport pictures, dates of birth and where they work.

title: Savoring Parting Shots of a Rivalry, the Hoyas Overpower the Orange
description: WASHINGTON  The curtain came down with a thud on one of college basketballs most storied rivalries Saturday as No. 5 Georgetown trounced No. 17 Syracuse, 61-39, in the final regular-season meeting between the teams before the Orange leave the Big East.

title: Before a Falklands Vote, Bad Blood Surges Anew
description: LONDON  On Sunday and Monday, the inhabitants of the Falkland Islands, a wind-swept, sparsely populated archipelago that was a final way station for early 20th-century explorers like Ernest Shackleton en route to the icy wastes of Antarctica, will go to the polls in a referendum on the islands future.

title: Menachem Froman, Rabbi Seeking Peace, Dies at 68
description: Menachem Froman, a maverick Orthodox rabbi who helped lead settlers into the territory seized by Israel in its 1967 war with Arab nations, then became a fervent, startlingly unconventional voice for conciliation with the Palestinians, died on Monday in Tekoa in the Israeli-administrated West Bank. He was 68.

title: Unrelenting Woods Stands Apart, With Field Struggling to Stay in Touch
description: DORAL, Fla.  It would have been easier on Saturday for Graeme McDowell to reel in a marlin off the coast of Florida than Tiger Woods at the Blue Monster. McDowell began the day two strokes behind Woods in the Cadillac Championship, and after playing the front nine in 32 strokes, equaling the low start of the day, he was still one shot behind.

title: Dirk Coetzee, South African Official Who Led Apartheid-Era Killings, Dies at 67
description: Dirk Coetzee, who led a South African police hit squad that killed antiapartheid activists, and who eventually confessed to his crimes as his country began shifting away from official racial segregation, died on Wednesday at a hospital in Pretoria. He was 67.

title: Police Shoot Man During a Traffic Stop on Staten Island
description: A police officer shot a man in the torso as he tried to flee during a traffic stop on Staten Island on Saturday, the police said. The man, who was not immediately identified, appeared to have reached for a weapon, the authorities said.

title: Santana Misses Workout, but Mets Play It Down
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Johan Santana did not work out with his teammates Saturday morning. Instead, he remained indoors to stretch his arm and receive extra treatment on it.

title: Den Dekker Comes Up With Another Highlight in Center
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Matt den Dekker, a Mets minor league center fielder who has already compiled a substantial highlight reel of athletic and improbable catches, made another spectacular catch Saturday.

title: Threats Sow Concerns Over Korean Armistice
description: North Koreas latest threats to annihilate its enemies have included a vow to scrap the 1953 armistice, the main legal document that theoretically stands in the way of a resumption of the Korean War, a conflict that by some estimates left nearly five million people dead, including more than 33,700 American soldiers.

title: Corrections: March 10, 2013
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Kings Point, a Magic Kingdom for the Retirement Set
description: I loved my mom very much, but never looked forward to visiting her at Kings Point, a huge, gated retirement community in Delray Beach, Fla.

title: Too Young to Retire, but These Deals Cant Wait
description: BOCA RATON, Fla.  Susan Shapira, who is 58, recently moved into a condominium in Century Village, a gated retirement community here where most residents are almost as old as the name.

title: Share of Homes With Guns Shows 4-Decade Decline
description: The share of American households with guns has declined over the past four decades, a national survey shows, with some of the most surprising drops in the South and the Western mountain states, where guns are deeply embedded in the culture.

title: Stoudemire Needs Operation on What Was His Good Knee
description: Amare Stoudemire made his season debut for the Knicks on New Years Day, and the team embraced his return as a way to breathe fresh life into the roster just as their sensational start began looking more serious.

title: No Barrage by Williams, but Success Is the Same
description: ATLANTA  One night after his 3-point bonanza, Deron Williams gave the nets a break. He did not try to replicate his record night from beyond the arc, but instead controlled the pace offensively and defensively against one of the fastest teams in the Eastern Conference. Williams was the point guard, not the shooting guard, and his floor game helped make for an impressive 93-80 win over the Atlanta Hawks on Saturday night at Philips Arena.

title: Harvard Searched E-Mails for Source of Media Leaks
description: Harvard secretly searched the e-mail accounts of several of its staff members last fall, looking for the source of news media leaks about its recent cheating scandal, but did not tell them about the searches for several months, people briefed on the matter said on Saturday.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, March 10
description: I would still eat these meatballs. No problem.

title: With Loss, Isner Takes a Big Step Down
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  On the court where he had stepped up a year earlier, John Isner stepped down.

title: Against Puerto Rico, Venezuela Comes Up Short Again
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  Luis Sojo arrived in Puerto Rico weeks removed from another championship in a career full of them. Navegantes del Magallanes, the team that Sojo manages in the Venezuelan winter league, took the title over Cardenales de Lara, and Sojo was a central figure. After all, he spent 21 seasons with the Cardenales as a second baseman, collecting five batting titles. In his baseball life, Sojo is intimately familiar with excellence.

title: Anna Resnick, Ilan Caplan
description: Anna Michelle Resnick, a daughter of Wendy Miller Resnick and Marc A. Resnick of Millersville, Md., is to be married Sunday to Ilan Joseph Caplan, a son of Nancy G. Caplan and Cantor Joel E. Caplan of Caldwell, N.J. The father of the groom, who is the cantor at Congregation Agudath Israel in Caldwell, will officiate at the Grand Lodge of A.F. & A.M. of Maryland, a Masonic lodge in Cockeysville, Md.

title: Shaina Schallop, Garrett Kamen
description: Shaina Joy Schallop and Garrett Scott Kamen were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Michael P. Singer at the Four Seasons Resort in Palm Beach, Fla. Cantor Danielle Bensimhon took part in the ceremony.

title: Alfred Boll and Joost van Hout
description: A Truly International Relationship

title: Korin Katzen, Neal Cohen
description: Korin Jill Katzen and Neal Jay Cohen were married Saturday evening at the New Synagogue of Fort Lee in Fort Lee, N.J. Rabbi Meir M. Berger, the synagogues spiritual leader, performed the ceremony. On April 20, Dee Shamo, a justice of the peace for Providenciales, in Turks and Caicos, will lead a second ceremony that will also feature Jewish wedding traditions, at the Somerset Resort there.

title: Alice Wylie and Alexander Schmemann
description: Alice Belle Wylie and Alexander Schmemann were to be married Sunday at St. Nicholas Cathedral in Washington. The Rev. Valery Shemchuk, a Russian Orthodox priest, is to perform the ceremony.

title: Virginia Lam and Marc Abrams
description: Meeting Online (Dont Tell Her Parents)

title: Meryl Rosen, Roderick Bernstein
description: Meryl Gail Rosen and Roderick Samuel Bernstein were married Saturday evening at the Metropolitan Club in New York. Cantor Neil Benisvy officiated.

title: Molly Moran and Mark Synnes
description: Molly June Moran and Mark Andrew Synnes were married Saturday evening at Old St. Patricks Church in Chicago. The Rev. Donald J. Fenske, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Anna Glanfield, Michael Hennessy
description: Anna Elizabeth Glanfield, the daughter of Sheila E. Glanfield and Thomas H. Glanfield of Delray Beach, Fla., was married Saturday to Michael Fitzgerald Hennessy, a son of Patricia F. Hennessy and Michael J. Hennessy, both of Vineland, N.J. The Rev. Dr. Robert S. Norris, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the Royal Poinciana Chapel in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Amy Rublin, Justin Mayer
description: Amy Deborah Rublin, the daughter of Harriet K. Rublin and Burt M. Rublin of Wynnewood, Pa., was married Saturday evening to Justin David Mayer, a son of Debra Mayer of New Rochelle, N.Y., and the late Stephen Mayer. Rabbi Joshua Z. Gruenberg officiated at the Four Seasons hotel in Philadelphia.

title: Talia Davis, Daniel Haykin
description: Small Garden, Big Yield: A Marriage

title: Rachel Rovner, Adam Rozen
description: Rachel Hilary Rovner and Adam Mark Rozen were married Saturday in Chicago. Rabbi Sidney M. Helbraun officiated at the InterContinental Chicago Magnificent Mile Hotel, assisted by Justice Judith J. Gische of State Supreme Court in New York.

title: Ann Ricks and Kevin Duffy
description: Dr. Ann Marie Ricks and Kevin John Duffy were married Saturday in Houston. The Rev. Edward Seton Fittin, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Michael Catholic Church.

title: Christia Blomquist, Samuel Freedman
description: Christia Chana Blomquist and Samuel G. Freedman are to be married Sunday evening at Columbia University Faculty House in New York. Rabbi Jeremy Kalmanofsky is to officiate with Rabbi Morris Allen taking part.

title: Toba Goldfein and Yossi Goldstein
description: Toba Gittel Goldfein, the daughter of Dr. Bea H. Goldfein and Rabbi Ephraim Goldfein of Philadelphia, is to be married Sunday to Yossi Goldstein, a son of Seema E. Goldstein and Jacob Z. Goldstein of Brooklyn. Rabbi David Edelman, the grooms maternal grandfather, is to officiate at the Springfield Country Club in Springfield, Pa.

title: Marguerite Daniels, Sean Anderson
description: Marguerite Danita Daniels and Sean Philip Anderson were married Saturday at the Zoellner Arts Center in Bethlehem, Pa. The Rev. Wilson Kratz of the Journeys of the Heart ministries officiated.

title: Wrights Slam Gives U.S Life in World Baseball Classic
description: PHOENIX  For an understated star like David Wright, it was a telling display of emotion. Wright had crushed a ball toward the left-field seats at Chase Field, and he skipped  just for a moment  on his first steps out of the batters box. He had earned the right to let loose, in his own way.

title: For Chinese, Maldives Boycott Goes Beyond Instant Noodles
description: BEIJING  Call it, perhaps, a storm in a kettle: A report that an upscale hotel in the Maldives removed kettles from the rooms of travelers from China to stop Chinese guests from cooking instant noodles in their rooms and not dining in hotel restaurant facilities has incited an online uproar here amid allegations of discrimination.

title: Retirement Central
description: Lured by the affordable price, Susan Shapira, 58, recently moved into a condominium in the Century Village retirement complex in Boca Raton, Fla.

title: 2 Cabinet Agencies Are Cut in Restructuring by China
description: BEIJING  Chinese officials announced Sunday that the government would consolidate some cabinet-level ministries in an attempt to streamline the bureaucracy. The move is the seventh restructuring in three decades, according to Xinhua, the state news agency.

title: Stephanopoulizing
description: On this morning. I think were talking about horsemeat, or something.

title: The IMF on the Austerity Trap
description: The IMF has just released a new paper on austerity that is kind of heavy going (unnecessarily, I think), but ends up making a simple but important point.

title: Attack, Said to Be Drone Strike by U.S., Kills 2 in Pakistan
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Two people suspected of being militants were killed Sunday morning in the volatile North Waziristan tribal region by what Pakistani and Taliban officials said was a drone strike.

title: Intensive Care
description: Our son was born healthy, large and pink-skinned, with a newborn assessment score of a perfect 10, but an hour after his birth, a nurse told us that something was wrong. He was jaundiced. It was not a typical case of jaundice; his bilirubin levels kept increasing at an alarming rate. Id only seen him for a few moments  hed been delivered by C-section, then whisked away for the usual tests and procedures  but now, as I was moved to a recovery room, the doctors couldnt tell me when I might see my baby again.

title: With a Tour of the City, Quinn Declares Her Candidacy for Mayor
description: When the bus driver in the Bronx called out her name, Christine C. Quinn did not hesitate. The City Council speaker  and, as of Sunday, official candidate for mayor  bounded up the vehicles steps and gave him a warm handshake as passengers, unbothered by the delay, began to applaud.

title: North Korea and the U.N. Sanctions
description: Kim Jong-un and Uncle Sam face off.

title: Inside the Conclave
description: The last few conclaves have been brief, selecting a pope in just a few days. In 2005, Pope Benedict XVI was elected a day after the conclave began.

title: Myanmar Opposition Leader Vows Party Reform
description: YANGON, Myanmar  Myanmars main opposition party ended a congress over the weekend with the partys leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, calling for a good relationship with the powerful military. She vowed to infuse new blood into the party, which is still recovering from more than two decades of persecution under military rule.

title: A.C.P.T. 2013: The Last Waltz
description: SPECIAL POST  As if a whirlwind weekend of puzzling and late night socializing wasnt enough, Daylight Savings Time has robbed the solvers of an hours sleep. There are more coffee cups on the tables of the ballroom than I remember in recent years.

title: A Military Mom Goes Back to School
description: On my first day of school I cried, Mommy, what if theyre all smarter than me? I wasnt a first grader. I was a 40-year-old Army wife, a mother of four and a new student.

title: North Korea Faces Pressure From U.N. on Human Rights
description: GENEVA  Already angry over tougher sanctions imposed last week to punish its nuclear tests, North Korea faces renewed pressure over its human rights record as the United Nations Human Rights Council meets Monday to consider calls for an international inquiry into possible crimes against humanity.

title: The (Very) Grand Tour
description: Culturati whove had enough of art-fair globe-trotting can now move on to music and dance. Londons Royal Opera House and the Ultimate Travel Company offer privileged access to some of the worlds best operas, ballets and symphonies. Each journey begins in London with a performance and private dinner at the Royal Opera House. Then maybe its off to St. Petersburg for a show at the Mariinsky Ballet followed by a backstage tour led by the companys director. Past trips have included V.I.P. treatment at the Salzburg Easter Festival in Austria, a visit to ballet schools, lectures, private concerts and a chance to meet virtuosos like the South African tenor Johan Botha. From $4,640 per person; theultimatetravelcompany.co.uk/roh.

title: Attack of the Trust Fund Zombie
description: So, Ive Stephanopoulized, along with Senator Ron Johnson, who began by declaring that we need to agree about the facts  then promptly rolled out the old trust fund zombie. Ive explained this one over and over again, for example here. And I have to say, its extremely telling that conservative Republicans dont seem able to make their case without resorting, right from the beginning, to obviously dumb fallacies.

title: Police Kill 16-Year-Old They Say Pointed a Handgun
description: Two plainclothes police officers shot and killed a teenage boy late Saturday night on a Brooklyn street, after he pointed a handgun at the officers, the police said.

title: At a Neighborhood Church in Rome, Dolan Delivers a Star Turn
description: ROME  There was no mistaking the fact that a dignitary was coming to Mass in Monte Mario on Sunday.

title: Disruptions: Digital Era Redefining Etiquette
description: Some people are so rude. Really, who sends an e-mail or text message that just says Thank you? Who leaves a voice mail message when you dont answer, rather than texting you? Who asks for a fact easily found on Google?

title: Icon of Harlems Gay Night Life Gives Way to Wreckers
description: A block in Harlem that once resonated to the sounds of some of Americas top musicians has, in recent weeks, heard nothing more than the mournful rasp of hydraulic shears and a hydraulic excavator clawing away the remains of a century-old entertainment complex.

title: Afghan Leader Says U.S. Abets Talibans Goal
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  President Hamid Karzai leveled particularly harsh accusations against the United States on Sunday, suggesting that the Americans and the Taliban had a common goal in destabilizing his country. The comments cast a shadow on the first visit by Chuck Hagel as defense secretary.

title: Oz the Great and Powerful Has Big Opening
description: LOS ANGELES  It was gridlock on the yellow brick road over the weekend as Oz the Great and Powerful, backed by a megawatt marketing campaign, took in about $80.3 million in North America and $69.9 million overseas.

title: Whats on Sunday
description: 9 P.M. (Lifetime) ARMY WIVES Brooke Shields, playing Air Force Col. Katherine Young; Torrey DeVitto as Maggie Hall, a former airborne soldier with three deployments in Iraq turned housewife; and Ashanti (above right, with Catherine Bell, left, and Sally Pressman), portraying Latasha Montclair, a mother of three with a deployed husband, are among those joining the cast in this Season 7 opener, which finds Fort Marshall mourning the loss of one of its own. In the Season 2 premiere of The Client List, at 10, trust becomes an issue for Riley (Jennifer Love Hewitt), who finds that even those she believes she can count on harbor their own secrets.

title: How Grindr Is Changing the Way We Connect
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  It is easy to write off Grindr  a location-based dating application for gay men  as a hookup application because, well, that is what it is.

title: For One Night, Sequester Becomes a Punch Line
description: President Obama has indeed brought change to Washington: in exchange for his white-tied presence on Saturday night, he successfully pressured the journalistic elite at the 128-year-old Gridiron Club to shorten its often interminably long annual dinner roast.

title: Overrun by Crime, Oakland Looks to Make Allies in Community
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Over the next several months, this city just across the bay from San Francisco will be partitioned into five police districts from its current two. The smaller districts, according to a new plan, will each be led by a powerful captain who will be held accountable for crime reduction in regular meetings with the police chief.

title: A.C.P.T. 2013: The Finals
description: SPECIAL POST  The final round of the American Crossword Puzzle Tournament is actually made up of three rounds: The C Division competitors, the B Division, and, of course, the elite A Division. The puzzle the finalists solve is the same, but the clues that each division receives are different, and if you are lucky enough  and good enough  to make it to the A Division, the clues are not for the faint of heart.

title: After Cashing In on Job Cuts, Wall St. Looks to Worker Upturn
description: Wall Street is hopeful that American companies, after years of gaining ground at the expense of their employees, will start to succeed because of the rising fortune of those workers.

title: In Wake of Cyberattacks, China Seeks New Rules
description: SHANGHAI  China has issued a new call for international rules and cooperation on Internet espionage issues, while insisting that accusations of Chinese government involvement in recent hacking attacks were part of an international smear campaign.

title: Hedge Fund Manager Found and Jailed in Fraud
description: FRANKFURT  Florian Homm, a flamboyant former hedge fund manager who spent the last five years in hiding, was arrested in Italy and faces extradition to the United States on securities fraud charges which could expose him to a lengthy prison sentence, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said.

title: No Sets? No Costumes? No Music? No Problem
description: Contemporary Israeli Dance Week returned on Thursday to the La MaMa Ellen Stewart Theater in the East Village, and the opening-night program of three short dances by Noa Zuk exemplified what New York audiences have come to associate with the words contemporary Israeli dance.

title: Batting Slumber Over, Japan Moves to Semifinals
description: TOKYO  As the jubilant Tokyo Dome crowd roared, Japans manager, Koji Yamamoto, stood on the field and raised his arms in triumph amid camera flashes.

title: Click for Career Enhancement
description: SEATTLE  Anyone who wants to learn calculus, statistics or ancient Greek history can take free online courses in those subjects at a variety of sites from instructors with distinguished academic pedigrees. For more mundane pursuits, like learning how to paddleboard or build a planter box for the garden, there is an inexhaustible supply of free how-to videos on YouTube, eHow and other sites.

title: Boyle Ends Scoring Drought as Rangers Solve Ovechkin and Capitals
description: WASHINGTON  Brian Boyle shot the puck as he glided backward to the top of the face-off circle, and when it went in at 10 minutes 53 seconds of the second period, he dropped to one knee and joyously windmilled one arm.

title: Crude
description: Mark Thoma on Jeff Sachs. Also Ryan Cooper. And heres what happens if you actually read the links from Scarborough-Sachs: you find that what I actually said bears no resemblance to their, ahem, crude caricature of my views.

title: Progress for Francisco as He Throws Off Mound
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The right-hander Frank Francisco threw off a mound Sunday morning for the first time this spring training.

title: Vulgaritys Abrasive Master, but Not at Home
description: When Gilbert Gottfried finds something really funny  like one of his self-deprecating and willfully tasteless jokes  his narrow eyes grow even narrower, he lets out a gruff cackle and buries his face in the palm of his hand.

title: Voices of a Deadly Blizzard, and Then Some Lullabies
description: On Tuesday evening the Oratorio Society of New York presented a concert of American choral music at Carnegie Hall, built around a new work by Paul Moravec, The Blizzard Voices. This oratorio about the Childrens Blizzard of 1888 had originally been scheduled to receive its New York premiere last November, but in a case of nature dislodging art imitating nature, that concert was canceled because of Hurricane Sandy.

title: In Search of Debt Deal, Obama Walks a Narrow Path
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will go to Capitol Hill this week to try to salvage a big deficit-reduction deal, battling not only Republican resistance but also complaints from Democrats that he mishandled his last attempt.

title: Where Everybody Knows Your Bad Jokes and Puns
description: Youll roll your eyes constantly during Clown Bar  at its groan-worthy puns, its lewd double-entendres and its intentionally bad jokes. But youll also laugh quite often. This is a show made for those who enjoy a few winces along with their grins.

title: Prankish Activity
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  You can practically smell the testosterone in this puzzle, cant you? This is a manly puzzle for manly men, although anyone can solve it. You just have to know the names of your male animals.

title: Conversations With Sondheim and His Melodies
description: The pianist Christopher ORileys fascination with the contrapuntal textures of Radiohead songs inspired him to arrange many for keyboard. Art Tatum and Earl Wild were among the pianists to transcribe the works of George Gershwin.

title: Q. and A. With Ken Griffey Jr.: Star Turn Over, Slugger Is Still Beloved
description: PHOENIX  Ken Griffey Jr. batted .524 with 3 home runs in the first World Baseball Classic in 2006. On Sunday, he and Ferguson Jenkins threw out ceremonial first pitches before the United States played Canada.

title: From Head to Toe, Quiet Drama Unfolds
description: In hurry, the solo that Jean Butler performed at Danspace Project over the weekend, this dancer turned choreographer takes her time. Her feet bare, her long red hair tied up in a ponytail, she bends one knee, then the other. She rotates her shoulders, her hips, her ankles. Many of her precise movements retain the look of a warm-up, of someone working things out.

title: In Talk Show Tour, Jeb Bush Promotes Book on Immigration and Replies to Critics
description: WASHINGTON  Stoking speculation about his presidential ambitions, Jeb Bush, the Republican former governor of Florida, performed a rare Washington feat on Sunday, appearing on all the morning talk shows as part of a blitz that has become equal parts book promotion and damage control.

title: Mad Men Draws On an Original
description: In the five seasons that Mad Men has been on television that celebrated series set in the art-directed world of 1960s advertising has never marketed itself the way a 60s ad man most certainly would have: by calling in a hotshot illustrator to do the job.

title: Surprise Hit Was a Shock for Artists Heard on It
description: Hector Delgado gave up being a reggaetn artist five years ago to become an evangelical preacher in Puerto Rico. So it was something of a surprise when his former manager, Javier Gmez, called him three weeks ago and said his voice could be clearly heard on Harlem Shake, a song that had gone viral on the Internet and then climbed to the top of the pop chart.

title: An Everywoman? In So Many Ways, No
description: The Nobel Prize-winning Austrian writer Elfriede Jelinek, in an interview in the Yale School of Drama journal Theater with her translator Gitta Honegger, describes how her male colleagues are allowed to have this subjectivity, this precise, absolutely unmistakable gaze.

title: Speaking Raps Universal Language in the Ferment of the Arab Spring
description: The international language of hip-hop definitely includes Whats up, Brooklyn!, the recurring salutation from the stage of the Brooklyn Academy of Music during Mic Check: Hip-Hop From North Africa and the Middle East on Saturday night. A lineup of Tunisian, Egyptian, Malian and (London-born) Palestinian rappers, including activists from the Arab Spring, brought songs of protest and self-determination. The concert, which including the United States debuts of El Gnral from Tunisia and Deeb from Egypt, celebrated a courageous new forthrightness from Middle Eastern rappers. It also showed the pervasiveness of hip-hop, and how it works differently as a catalyst wherever it arrives.

title: Mic Check
description: Photos from a concert featuring Tunisian, Egyptian, Malian and (London-born) Palestinian rappers at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Words That Hurt and Kill: Lessons for Society From Bullying and Its Psychic Toll
description: When Emily Bazelon was in eighth grade, her friends fired her. She had loved them; now they rejected her  an act, she recalls, that left her crawling with insecurity and self-doubt.

title: Drilling Earth Seems to Get It Annoyed
description: The cast of Ring of Fire, a two-part disaster movie served up by Reelz on Monday and Tuesday, deserves credit for putting some effort into the film rather than sleepwalking through it, as actors often do in these collect-a-paycheck jobs. The script is decent enough too, for the first half. But the closer the world gets to ending, the more wearyingly formulaic Ring of Fire becomes.

title: Dissecting the Dance Even Before It Begins
description: Its not unusual to see small-scale modern-dance performances in which the choreographer and dancers return to the stage for a question-and-answer session. But the Stripped/Dressed series of this years Harkness Dance Festival at the 92nd Street Y has the choreographer and dancers explain things first.

title: 2 Awards Given to Promote Multicultural Childrens Books
description: A month ago a nonprofit called First Book, which promotes literacy among children in low-income communities, announced the Stories for All project, a program intended to prod publishers to print more multicultural books. Kyle Zimmer, First Books chief executive, says that part of the motivation was the chasm between the number of people who want such books and what is available.

title: Night of the Stars at the Richmond Bridge Club
description: After the Night of the Stars charity pro-am event at the Richmond Bridge Club in London on Feb. 28 the players received a booklet. This contained copies of the deals with bidding and play predictions by various experts from around the world. And to give Jason Hackett from England credit, he did mention the unusual contract reached when Shivam Shah sat South, partnering Azad Mahomed.

title: Cory Booker, Twitter Visionary
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Cory Booker  the mayor of Newark and a virtual Twitter superhero for his chronicle of the city  made the trip to the annual South by Southwest conference here on Sunday to impart his tips and perspective on why Twitter is a valuable tool for governing and civic engagement.

title: Looking Divine at South by Southwest
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Playing on screens throughout the South by Southwest festival this weekend were a variety of documentaries focusing on key figures in gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender communities. Continental shines its eye on Steve Ostrow, the owner of the Continental Baths, a bathhouse that became a cultural beacon. Big Joy focuses on the gay poet and filmmaker James Broughton, whose work in the 1960s and 70s made him a voice of the sexual revolution. Mr. Angel spends time with the porn star and activist Buck Angel, whose work has changed perspectives on transgender performers in adult film.

title: John Doyle to Direct a London Revival of The Color Purple
description: John Doyle, who received a Tony Award for best direction in the 2005 Broadway production of Sweeney Todd, will bring his talents to London for his next project, a revival of the musical version of The Color Purple. The Menier Chocolate Factory, a 150-seat performance space in a former factory, will host the engagement from July 5 to Sept. 14.

title: Pearl Theater Company Delays McNally Play
description: The Pearl Theater Company has pushed back the spring premiere of Terrence McNallys And Away We Go to the fall season. The play was previously scheduled to run from April 19 to May 19. This Side of Neverland, which features a pair of one-acts by J. M. Barrie, will now fill that period and close the Pearls 2012-13 season. The delay follows a February letter to subscribers stating that the company was experiencing a cash-flow shortfall and needed to raise an additional $250,000 to continue the current season as scheduled.

title: Footnote
description: Kelly Osbourne  said on her Twitter account on Friday that a seizure caused her collapse on the set of E!s Fashion Police last week. Ms. Osbourne was rushed to the hospital on Thursday and, according to her post on Twitter, which was accompanied by a photo of an I.V. line in her left arm, doctors are still trying to determine why the seizure occurred.

title: For Wheeler, Demotion Is Probably Temporary
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  On Sunday, for perhaps the last time before what is expected to be a promising major league career, Zack Wheeler was cut from a baseball team.

title: Top Contenders to Lead the Roman Catholic Church
description: Cardinals selecting the next pope are looking for someone with the charisma of Pope John Paul II and the grit to tackle the churchs scandals.

title: Economic Reports for the Week Ahead
description: ECONOMIC REPORTS Information to be released includes retail sales for February, import prices for February and business inventories for January (Wednesday); weekly jobless claims, the Producer Price Index for February and the current account deficit for the fourth quarter (Thursday); and the Consumer Price Index for February, industrial production for February and the Thomson Reuters/University of Michigan consumer sentiment index for March (Friday).

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: New Arrested Development Episodes Arent Enough for Some Fans
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  For years after the cult series Arrested Development went off the air, the question was whether a movie about the demented Bluth family would follow. Now that the show, which ended in 2006, is getting new life with 14 more episodes on Netflix this spring, that was still the question of the hour at a South by Southwest festival Q&A session with Mitch Hurwitz, the shows creator, and two of its stars, Will Arnett and Jeffrey Tambor.

title: For Marvel Comics, a Renewed Digital Mission
description: LOS ANGELES  Like the rest of the publishing industry, comic books went digital long ago. You can catch up on Batman via mobile app and unfurl Wolverines claws from your laptop. But Marvel Comics upped the ante significantly on Sunday, unveiling a superhero-size slate of new and expanded mobile and online initiatives.

title: Saudis Consider Firing Squads for Executions
description: CAIRO  After centuries of public beheadings, the kingdom of Saudi Arabia is considering firing squads as an alternative means of execution.

title: G.O.P. in Arizona Is Pushed to Expand Medicaid
description: PHOENIX  In the battle to get the Medicaid expansion being championed by Gov. Jan Brewer approved by the states legislators, her closest advisers are hanging their hopes on the number eight. That is how many of the 17 Republicans in the State Senate they believe they can get on their side.

title: Two Sides to a Deodorant Campaign
description: THE deodorant aisle was once more like the toothpaste aisle, with products mostly unisex rather than marketed strictly to men or women. But today, unisex deodorants account for only 12 percent of the market, according to the research firm Mintel, down from about 35 percent in 1990.

title: Arthur Storch, Stage Director, Dies at 87
description: Arthur Storch, an exacting and successful director on Broadway and in regional theater, who once asked Eugne Ionesco to rewrite a play and goaded a young Aaron Sorkin to work harder, died on Tuesday in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: Police Scatter Demonstrators in Capital of Azerbaijan
description: BAKU, Azerbaijan  The police in the capital of Azerbaijan on Sunday used tear gas, rubber bullets and water cannons to disperse protesters demanding an end to the hazing and abuse of military conscripts, which activists say the government has concealed.

title: Islamists Kill 7 Captives in Nigeria
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Radical Islamists in northern Nigeria have killed seven foreign construction workers who were kidnapped in February, a significant escalation of extremist violence in Nigerias continuing jihadist insurgency.

title: From YouTube to the Cineplex
description: LOS ANGELES  How fast is YouTube building new media companies? Consider the case of AwesomenessTV, a YouTube-based channel for teenagers.

title: Quinn Tour Opens Mayoral Campaign
description: Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, officially began her campaign to become mayor of New York. Even before Sundays formal announcement, she was the perceived Democratic front-runner.

title: Real Madrid on a Rampage; United Wilts
description: Real Madrid put an exclamation mark on an impressive run that began with a Copa del Rey win over arch rival Barcelona on Feb. 26 and continued to Sunday (at least) with a 2-1 win at Celta Vigo, the teams ninth game without a loss in Spains La Liga. Those wins sandwiched a second triumph over Barcelona, in the league, and then last Tuesdays classic demolition of Manchester United to advance to the quarterfinals of the UEFA Champions League.

title: United States Avoids Elimination With Victory Over Canada
description: PHOENIX  Humiliation was just five outs away. Trailing by a run late in Sundays game at the World Baseball Classic, the United States faced the prospect of first-round elimination  and that was not the worst of it.

title: B-Plus for Citys Parks, but Problems Remain
description: The conditions of more than 40 large parks in New York City have improved in the last two years, though problems  including a lack of resources and consistency  remain, according to a survey by an independent advocacy group.

title: British Proposal to Rein In Banks Is Faulted
description: 8:07 a.m. | Updated

title: Marthas Brand Struggling for Right Fit
description: Media companies are often closely associated with their founders  Rupert Murdoch at News Corporation and Sumner Redstone at Viacom come to mind  but none are linked with their products in quite the way Martha Stewart is.

title: Uprooted by Tsunami, Churchs Flock Regroups
description: IWAKI, Japan  After the rumbling and the devastating waves had ceased, the members of a little church a stones throw away from the stricken Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant discovered that a new set of troubles was just beginning.

title: Indiana Player Knows How to Wow a Crowd
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind.  Victor Oladipo believes there is a song for every occasion, and to the resignation of his Indiana teammates, those occasions include blinking, breathing and walking.

title: South Korea Flirts With Nuclear Ideas as North Blusters
description: SEOUL, South Korea  As their country prospered, South Koreans have largely shrugged off the constant threat of a North Korean attack. But breakthroughs in the Norths missile and nuclear programs and fiery threats of war have heightened fears in the South that even small miscalculations by the new and untested leaders of each country could have disastrous consequences.

title: Mildred Manning, Angel of Corregidor, Dies at 98
description: Mildred Dalton Manning grew up poor on a Georgia farm. Her mother made all the family clothes on an old sewing machine. Hoping to escape a life of poverty, she attended nursing school during the Depression and became a nurse at a hospital in Atlanta.

title: CT Scans Find Vascular Disease in Ancient Mummies
description: Atherosclerosis  the buildup of fats and cholesterol on the artery walls that can lead to stroke and heart disease  is generally considered a problem of modern times, a result of fatty diets and inactive lifestyles. But a new examination of mummies from ancient cultures suggests that the disease appeared long before the arrival of junk food and flat-screen televisions.

title: Afghan Says Force Backed by the C.I.A. Beat Him
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan  The 29-year-old engineering student was standing outside his classroom here on Saturday morning when he said two pickup trucks full of armed men pulled up. The men, said to be members of a C.I.A.-backed Afghan strike force, grabbed him, tied his hands behind his back, draped a black hood over his head and drove him to an undisclosed location where, the student says, he was beaten and whipped.

title: The Caretaker of Boston University Athletics
description: BOSTON  In Section 111, Row Q, Seat 1, above a corner of the Agganis Arena ice, a gray-haired man observed the action. Wearing a scarlet team jacket and a white Friends of Boston University Hockey cap pulled over enormous eyeglasses with brown frames, he was easy to miss. A trumpeters brief toot from the opposite end of the rink projected greater sound than the mans enthusiastic clapping after each Terriers goal in a victory against Merrimack.

title: Preparation and Vows of Defiance as Big Sugary Drink Ban Is Set to Start
description: With one day to go before Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs ban on large sugary drinks goes into effect across the city, some big-drink lovers, and the places that serve them, vowed defiance. Others accepted it with a shrug. Then there were people like Leonardo Scarpone, the owner of Sanpanino, an Italian sandwich shop in Greenwich Village, who wondered if the small amount of sugar he added to his fresh-squeezed lemonade would push it into forbidden territory.

title: To at Least One Earthling, Siberia Meteor Proved That Science Is Vital
description: Twice on a recent Friday, the cosmos intruded rudely on us earthlings. A meteor exploded over western Siberia, shattering windows, injuring hundreds and scaring pretty much everyone else. That same day, an asteroid passed within 18,000 miles of us, close enough to arch many an eyebrow among astronomers.

title: No Stumping for Papacy, but Babies Do Get Kisses
description: ROME  The American contender kissed babies and joked about bad food inside the papal conclave. The Brazilian blessed a couple on their 70th anniversary. The Italian blessed a pack of journalists, and a baby, too. The reserved Hungarian did not kiss anybody.

title: Algorithms Get a Human Hand in Steering Web
description: Trading stocks, targeting ads, steering political campaigns, arranging dates, besting people on Jeopardy and even choosing bra sizes: computer algorithms are doing all this work and more.

title: Chvez Heir Faces Challenge in Ties With Armed Forces
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  The multitudes in red shirts, clenched fists thrusting in the air  a dominant image of the political movement that President Hugo Chvez left behind  convey a sense of followers united and loyal to the father of their revolution and his designated heir, Nicols Maduro.

title: Mr. President, Tear Down This Wall
description: BERKELEY, Calif.

title: Before Smoke Rises at Vatican, Its Romans vs. the Reformers
description: VATICAN CITY  The cardinals who enter the papal conclave on Tuesday will walk into the Sistine Chapel in a single file, but beneath the orderly display, they are split into competing lineups and power blocs that will determine which man among them emerges as pope.

title: No Catching or Doubting a Healthy, Happy Woods
description: DORAL, Fla.  On the second hole Sunday at the Blue Monster, Tiger Woods drained a 19-foot putt for birdie. When at last the applause died down, Graeme McDowell stood over a 7-footer for birdie that suddenly looked twice as long. He rolled it in to remain three strokes behind Woods, and as he walked off the green, he made eye contact with a friend and said, Were not playing for second place here.

title: Dwindling Deficit Disorder
description: For three years and more, policy debate in Washington has been dominated by warnings about the dangers of budget deficits. A few lonely economists have tried from the beginning to point out that this fixation is all wrong, that deficit spending is actually appropriate in a depressed economy. But even though the deficit scolds have been wrong about everything so far  where are the soaring interest rates we were promised?  protests that we are having the wrong conversation have consistently fallen on deaf ears.

title: Hold Generic Drug Makers Accountable
description: A New Hampshire woman who was severely injured by a generic drug in 2004 is still struggling to hold the manufacturer liable. Her case will be argued this month before the Supreme Court, which has already severely limited the ability of consumers to sue generic manufacturers and may well limit it further. If so, some way must be found to compensate this plaintiff, Karen Bartlett, and others who have been hurt by generic drugs, which account for 80 percent of all prescriptions in this country.

title: How to Shop for College
description: Colleges often make themselves appear less expensive  and more attractive to cash-poor families  through promotional materials and financial aid letters that hide the true costs. Last month the federal government unveiled an online college scorecard that can help families cut through some of the confusion. It gives students a reasonable idea of what they could owe once they graduate and allows clear cost comparisons among schools.

title: Critics Wait for City to Rein In Bus Lines
description: Last summer, after a federal crackdown on discount bus lines running through Chinatown in Manhattan, city and state officials celebrated as Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo signed a law aimed at bringing some order to the curbside bus business in New York.

title: Confirmation Questions for Mary Jo White
description: Mary Jo White, President Obamas nominee for chairwoman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, is expected to win Senate approval after her confirmation hearing on Tuesday. But unless Ms. White is aggressively questioned, neither the senators nor the public will have a clear idea of the kind of chairwoman she will be.

title: When to Say No
description: The State Departments latest environmental assessment of the controversial Keystone XL oil pipeline makes no recommendation about whether President Obama should approve it. Here is ours. He should say no, and for one overriding reason: A president who has repeatedly identified climate change as one of humanitys most pressing dangers cannot in good conscience approve a project that  even by the State Departments most cautious calculations  can only add to the problem.

title: Private Mannings Confidant
description: In early 2010, Pfc. Bradley Manning methodically uploaded a digital mother lode of classified United States military and diplomatic documents to the Internet insurgents of WikiLeaks. As everyone knows, WikiLeaks made these secret archives available to a few major news outlets, including this one. Many illuminating and troubling stories were published, and Washington has been gnashing its teeth ever since.

title: Megadeals: Something to Cheer, or Fear?
Downside of Drug Courts
description: To the Editor:

title: JOBS Act Successes
description: To the Editor:

title: Working at Home: Pros and Cons
Shopping While Black: Racism in Everyday Life
description: To the Editor:

title: After Criticism, Police Change Policy and Begin Investigating More Traffic Crashes
description: In a marked shift of protocol, the New York Police Department has begun conducting robust investigations of traffic crashes that result in critical injuries but not certain or likely death.

title: The Man Who Sells the Moon
description: The notion that one man can lay claim to all the extraterrestrial bodies in our little corner of the galaxy sounds preposterous. Yet Dennis M. Hope, 65, of Gardnerville, Nev., the subject of this Op-Doc video, believes just that. For three decades, he has built a thriving business by selling land plots in space, on places like the moon, Mars and Venus. Of course, he has no legal authority to do so. How does he get away with this? He told me that, back when he was a ventriloquist in the days before he owned the moon, his dummy taught him a valuable lesson: you can say anything you want to anybody as long as you smile.

title: The Man Who Sells the Moon
description: This short documentary looks at Dennis Hope, a Nevada man who has made a living selling plots of land on the moon.

title: After Rough Patch, The Bachelor Wins Back Viewers
description: No matter which contestant Sean Lowe, the chiseled, strawberry blond, chooses as his fantasy fiance on the three-hour season finale of ABCs The Bachelor on Monday  will it be Catherine Giudici, 26, a quirky graphic designer from Seattle, or Lindsay Yenter, 25, a petite substitute teacher from Fort Bragg, N.C.?  the network has rekindled the romance between the reality series and its viewers.

title: The Small-State Advantage in the United States Senate
description: The Constitution has always given states with small populations a lift, but the scale of the gap has grown in recent decades.

title: Stoudemires Woes Make Deal Look Worse All the Time
description: When the tangled history of the Amare Stoudemire-Carmelo Anthony era is eventually written, it should be framed as a study in high-stakes gambling, in the fickle nature of the risk-reward scale and the consequences of unchecked desperation.

title: Opposition Leader Will Seek Venezuelan Presidency
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  The opposition leader Henrique Capriles Radonski said Sunday that he would run for president in a special election to replace Hugo Chvez, who died last week after 14 years in office.

title: Yankees Are Said to Pursue Derrek Lee as Replacement for Mark Teixeira
description: DUNEDIN, Fla.  With few obvious options available to replace the injured Mark Teixeira at first base, the Yankees are becoming creative in their search. They have asked the retired first baseman Derrek Lee whether he would come out of retirement, according to a person with knowledge of the talks who asked to remain anonymous.

title: Cuts Give Obama Path to Create Leaner Military
description: WASHINGTON  At a time when $46 billion in mandatory budget cuts are causing anxiety at the Pentagon, administration officials see one potential benefit: there may be an opening to argue for deep reductions in programs long in President Obamas sights, and long resisted by Congress.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 10, 2013

title: Harvard Search of E-Mail Stuns Its Faculty Members
description: Bewildered, and at times angry, faculty members at Harvard criticized the university on Sunday after revelations that administrators secretly searched the e-mail accounts of 16 resident deans in an effort to learn who leaked information about a student cheating scandal to the news media. Some predicted a confrontation between the faculty and the administration.

title: Landlord Kills a Tenant in Brooklyn
description: An argument between a landlord and a tenant in Brooklyn on Sunday afternoon ended with a gunshot that left the tenant dead, according to the police.

title: Third Attempt at Trial in Killing of a Therapist
description: The two brothers stood for hours on end at the back of the courtroom last week, vigilantly watching for any sign that their sisters killer might crumble yet again  robbing them once more of resolution in a criminal case that has dragged on for five years.

title: Debates Renewed on Visors and Staged Fights
description: Visors and fighting in hockey are in the headlines again after two prominent injuries.

title: Time on Mound Cant Compare With Experiences Watching From Seat
description: DUNEDIN, Fla.  Mike Harkey, the Yankees bullpen coach for the past five seasons, had his best off-season since the Yankees won the World Series in 2009. The highlight came Nov. 18.

title: C. C. Sabathia Admires Mariano Riveras Send-Off
description: TAMPA  While watching Mariano Rivera announce Saturday that this would be his final season, C. C. Sabathia wondered whether he, too, would one day have that privilege.

title: Success in the Classic Could Help Revive Baseball in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  Puerto Rico fielded a team for the World Baseball Classic that included players from the likes of the Savannah Sand Gnats, the Akron Aeros and the Brevard County Manatees. Such is the state of baseball in Puerto Rico, where the supply of major league talent has sharply declined.

title: Bringing Back Detroit
description: To the Editor:

title: Fish Returns With Win and Guarded Optimism
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  Six months after Mardy Fish pulled himself off one of the biggest stages in tennis, he was finally able to push himself back on Sunday.

title: India Rape Suspect Found Dead in Jail
description: NEW DELHI  One of the men accused in a Delhi gang rape case was found dead in his jail cell on Monday morning, a jail official said.

title: Suspect in India Gang Rape Found Dead in Jail
description: NEW DELHI  One of the men accused in the Delhi gang rape case was found dead in his jail cell on Monday morning, a jail official said.

title: Myths About the Flu Vaccine
description: On Dec. 20, 1968, I got the flu. I remember it still: Christmas was a washout  I couldnt leave the bed unassisted or keep anything down, not even a taste of the goose that someone else had to cook.

title: Corrections: March 11, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Word of the Day | quail
description: quail \kwal\ noun and verb

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, March 11
description: From highway bills to homeland security, small states make out like bandits.

title: Whats on Monday
description: 8 P.M. (Encore) HINDENBURG: THE LAST FLIGHT Maximilian Simonischek portrays an engineer leading the design of the LZ 129 Hindenburg; Stacy Keach is an unscrupulous American industrialist; Greta Scacchi is his wife; and Lauren Lee Smith (above with Mr. Simonischek) is their daughter in this two-part fictionalized account of the May 1937 aviation disaster in which 35 people on board and 1 on the ground were killed when the German airship burst into flames and crashed as it tried to dock at Lakehurst Naval Air Station in Manchester, N.J. Part 2 will be shown on Tuesday at 8.

title: Photo Replay: March 10
description: A view of the day in sports, from college basketball to speedskating.

title: Roy Miller and the Red Bulls Late Show
description: A week after a thrilling season-opening tie against the Timbers in Portland, the Red Bulls returned to the West Coast on Sunday night and produced something decidedly less memorable.

title: Love in the Time of Durjoy Datta
description: A lot of young women you have never met are crazy about Durjoy Datta.

title: News Quiz | March 11, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: A Push to Investigate North Koreas Human Rights Abuses
description: BEIJING  Could North Korea be headed toward an international inquiry into possible crimes against humanity?

title: Smaller States Find Outsize Clout Growing in Senate
description: RUTLAND, Vt.  In the four years after the financial crisis struck, a great wave of federal stimulus money washed over Rutland County. It helped pay for bridges, roads, preschool programs, a community health center, buses and fire trucks, water mains and tanks, even a project to make sure fish could still swim down the river while a bridge was being rebuilt.

title: The Geneva Auto Shows Green Lining
description: With growing consumer interest in green vehicles and a pledge to build aEuropean Union-wide network of electric charging stations, many Europeans are looking forward to the next generation of cars.

title: Cabdrivers Book Club
description: Dear Diary:

title: IHT Quick Read: March 11
description: NEWS President Hamid Karzai leveled particularly harsh accusations against the United States on Sunday, suggesting that the Americans and the Taliban had a common goal in destabilizing his country. The comments cast a shadow on the first visit by Chuck Hagel as defense secretary. Alissa J. Rubin and Thom Shanker report from Kabul.

title: Apps for Philipss Hue Light Bulbs
description: How many apps does it take to screw in a light bulb? For Philips, apparently, there can never be too many.

title: CVC-Led Group to Sell $1.4 Billion Stake in Indonesian Retailer
description: HONG KONG  A group led by the private equity firm CVC Capital Partners began marketing the sale of a 40 percent stake in Indonesias largest department store operator on Monday, a move that could raise up to 13.13 trillion rupiah ($1.36 billion).

title: Test Yourself | Math, March 11, 2013
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Pete Diamantis at Math for America from the article Think New York Is Costly? In New Delhi, Seedy Goes for 8 Figures.

title: Benches-Clearing Brawl at the World Baseball Classic
description: In At Global Showcase, a Blowout and a Brawl, Tyler Kepner writes about the events that transpired at a World Baseball Classic game on Saturday.

title: How Many Text Messages Are Too Many?
description: Consider a text messageor voice mail or emailjust to say thank you to the recipient for something he or she has done.

title: Gujarat Is Yours, Modi Tells Indian Americans
description: EDISON, New Jersey Gujarats controversial chief minister, Narendra Modi, unfurled his definition of secularism, addressing hundreds of Indian-Americans in New Jersey and Chicago through a live telecast from Ahmedabad on Sunday.

title: From the Safety of Switzerland
description: MOSCOW  The novelist Mikhail Shishkin has won every major Russian literary award and several Western ones, but it is a letter that he wrote to a Russian ministry that has really made him a household name in Russia.

title: Early Warnings About Ram Singhs Safety; Suicide Not Possible, Family Says
description: NEW DELHI  The family of Ram Singh, one of the accused in the Delhi gang rape case who was found hanged in his jail cell on Monday morning, was warned on Friday that his life might be in danger, one of his brothers said on Monday.

title: Framing  and Reflecting  Beauty
description: Inside a beauty parlor in a small Florida town, Carrie is having her hair done. She is oblivious to the commotion around her. Peering intently into a mirror, she is at that quintessential moment of beautification when she must decide if the image she sees pleases her and she is ready to face the world.

title: The Early Word: Silver Linings
description: In Todays Times

title: Thousands of Dead Pigs Found in River Flowing Into Shanghai
description: BEIJING  More than 3,300 dead pigs have been found in a major river that flows through Shanghai, igniting fears among city residents of contaminated tap water, according to official reports on Tuesday.

title: This Week in Small Business: The Next Big Battle
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners this week.

title: Chavismo and Human Development in Venezuela
