The film, directed by Daryl Wein from a script he wrote with Ms. Lister-Jones, who are a couple in real life, very much wants to be a funny, affectionate portrait of a young woman in crisis, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. Lola Versus, unfortunately, is a dismayingly conventional exploration of the vicissitudes of romance. In spite of its scruffy look and slack pacing, it often rings as false as any of the big, shiny and soft studio rom-coms (starring Kate Hudson or Katherine Heigl, say) of the last decade. Lola, he added, deserves better.

title: Maos Anti-Pollution Face Mask
description: BEIJING  With air readings of hazardous or very unhealthy seemingly the new normal, antipollution face masks are becoming a common sight on the streets of China. Even Mao Zedong has donned one. At least his image has, in doctored photos circulating online to widespread amusement (Mao, of course, died in 1976.)

title: Panel Rejects Proposal to Stop School Closings
description: A city panel on Monday night rejected a proposal to stop city-mandated school closings in a tense, often raucous meeting, effectively putting any hopes of reversing Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs education policy into the next mayors hands.

title: In India, Heated Debate Over Teens and Sex
description: NEW DELHI Should it be illegal for 16-year-olds to have sex? What if theyre married?

title: News Quiz | March 12, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Afghanistan: 5 Coalition Soldiers Killed in Crash
description: Five coalition soldiers were killed in a helicopter crash in southern Afghanistan on Monday, the coalition announced on Tuesday. The nationality of the victims was not immediately released, in line with official policy to notify next of kin first. A statement from the NATO-led International Security Assistance Force said the crash was under investigation, but there was no enemy activity in the area at the time. Javed Faisal, a spokesman for the governor of Kandahar Province, said the crash occurred about 11 p.m. in Daman district.

title: IHT Quick Read: March 12
description: NEWS North Korea declared the 1953 Korean War armistice nullified on Monday, following through on a longstanding threat that it renewed last week amid rising tensions with South Korea. Choe Sang-Hun reports from Seoul.

title: Anthonys Return to Lineup Is of Little Help to Knicks
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The knee was sturdy enough, perhaps not for basketball but certainly for the long, lonely walk to the team bus late Monday night. Carmelo Anthonys discomfort by that point was purely spiritual.

title: Test Yourself | English, March 12, 2013
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the On the Runway blog post Trendspotting: Taffeta and Tulle at the Golden Globes.

title: Black Smoke From Conclave Signals No Pope on First Day
description: VATICAN CITY  It billowed, and it was black.

title: Selection of New Pope Cloaked in Secrecy and Tradition
description: In A Strict Adherence to Ritual and Secrecy in Election of Pope, Daniel J. Wakin writes about the intricate traditions involved in selecting a new pope.

title: TVs New Wave of Women: Smart, Strong, Borderline Insane
description: At first glance, this looks like a great moment for women on television. Many smart and confident female characters have paraded onto the small screen over the past few years. But Im bothered by one persistent caveat: that the more astute and capable many of these women are, the more likely it is that theyre also completely nuts.

title: Good Luck and Good Light
description: Daniel Rodrigues is a 26-year-old freelance photographer based in Porto, Portugal. After graduating from the Portuguese Institute of Photography in 2010, he was an intern for the newspaper Correio da Manh and worked for the photo agency Global Imagens. Two years later, Rodrigues was broke. That was when a stroke of good luck  and good light  changed his fortunes.

title: Does Buying and Accumulating More and More Stuff Make Us Happier?
description: Americans love to buy things: tech gadgets, clothing, sneakers, jewelry, you name it. We love to accumulate what we buy too, so it overflows our rooms, closets, garages, basements and yards. And then we throw some of it away and buy more.

title: Bottle Bing
description: The Outer Coastal Plain might be the perfect place to make fine wine in America. The region, which has nearly the same sandy soil composition as Bordeaux, experiences a warm growing season; spring frosts are rare; and the breezes from the Atlantic Ocean and a local bay are ideal for winemaking. The O.C.P. has only one real challenge: its in southern New Jersey, a state associated with many things  Springsteen, Snooki, industrial pollution, the mob  but not great wine. Much of what is bottled there, in fact, isnt even grape-based.

title: Embracing Tradition at Indian Fashion Weeks
description: NEW DELHI Fashion week fever may have died down in Paris, Milan, New York and London, but in India its just getting going.

title: A Conversation With: Prof. Aseem R. Shukla, University of Pennsylvania
description: The University of Pennsylvania recently withdrew an invitation to Gujarats chief minister, Narendra Modi, who was to deliver a keynote address at the Wharton Schools India Economic Forum via video link later this month. The withdrawal, based on questions raised about Mr. Modis human rights record, has spurred an animated debate about freedom of speech and Mr. Modis leadership credentials in India and among the Indian diaspora.

title: Eye-Tracking Tech Will Be Open to iPhones and Other Devices
description: Samsung Electronics wont be the only company that gets a fancy eye-tracking feature. A start-up company called uMoove, which has been developing this type of technology for three years, says it will offer eye- and head-tracking to anyone, including device makers like Apple and software developers who make mobile apps.

title: The Early Word: Called Out
description: Todays Times

title: Wealth, Spending and the Economy
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: Too Many Colonoscopies in the Elderly
description: Bill Fullington doesnt remember exactly where he read that all adults over age 50 should be screened for colon cancer. A magazine? Maybe the local paper?

title: South Korea Disputes Norths Dismissal of Armistice
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea has begun evacuating some citizens into tunnels with emergency provisions and putting military camouflage on buses and trucks, the South Korean Defense Ministry said Tuesday.

title: Is There a Trick to Getting Everything Done?
description: At the most recent meeting of theShe Owns It business group, the owners shared the frustrations of never being able to get to everything. The big things  those critical to the business  get done, said Susan Parker, who owns the dressmaker Bari Jay. But she added that everything else tended to get pushed to the bottom of the pile.

title: Alphabet Soup Kitchen
description: LONDON  This city sometimes seems to defy financial gravity. The national economy is teetering on the brink of a third recession in five years, real wages are at their lowest in a decade, and austerity is shredding the social safety net. Yet a caf 100 meters from my house in Hackney, East London, that sells cupcakes for $4.20 and coffee for more than that is always full. Housing prices rose by almost 10 percent last year, lifting rents along with them. Can this really be the capital of a country whose debt just lost its coveted AAA rating?

title: Quest for a Little-Known Suburban Lizard
description: Jonathan Losos, professor and curator of herpetology at Harvards Museum of Comparative Zoology, writes from Colombia, where he is studying the biodiversity of anole lizards, an evolutionarily successful group that has produced 400 species throughout Central and South America and Caribbean islands. For more on anoles, see anoleannals.org.

title: British Oversight Unit Says Police Failed to Pursue Sex Accusations Against Savile
description: LONDON  Police failures over five decades allowed Jimmy Savile, one of Britains best-known television personalities, to escape investigation for a lifetime of sex offenses dating back to the early 1960s, according to a report published on Tuesday by a police oversight agency.

title: Opinion Report: Access to the Polls
description: From the editorial page

title: To Indict, or Not to Indict
description: Some banks may have become too big to prosecute, Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said last week in testimony before the Senate Judiciary Committee. That comment  an acknowledgment, for the first time, that Mr. Holder has not pursued big bank prosecutions out of fear of possibly harming the financial system  raises a variety of questions, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column. Does this mean that our banks are still too big to fail? Should we prosecute corporations? Should the size of an institution or its systemic importance influence the decision of prosecutors? Whats the right policy?

title: In a Word
description: The file is overflowing, so well go straight to this weeks grab bag of grammar, style and other missteps from recent editions of The Times, compiled with help from colleagues and readers.

title: In Performance: Jenn Harris and Carson Elrod of All in the Timing
description: All in the Timing, a collection of offbeat one-act plays, established David Ives as a playwright when it was first produced by Primary Stages 20 years ago. In this scene from the comedy The Universal Language, Dawn, a stuttering woman played by Jenn Harris, is eager to learn an Esperanto-like language called Unamunda from its creator, Don, played by Carson Elrod. The Primary Stages revival continues through April 14 at 59E59 Theaters.

title: Tweeting the Conclave
description: And so begins the conclave at the Vatican.

title: Baz Luhrmanns Great Gatsby Will Open Cannes Film Festival
description: Who said there are no second acts in American lives? Oh, right: It was F. Scott Fitzgerald, whose seminal novel, The Great Gatsby, is getting a lavish reinterpretation from the director Baz Luhrmann that will open the Cannes Film Festival, its organizers announced Tuesday.

title: Tuesday Reading: What to Do With a Hand-Me-Down Mink Coat
Whats Your Stress Level?
description: Dear Diary:

title: Q&A: Capturing the Windows 8 Screen
description: Q.

title: Rome Tourism Rooting for an American Pope
description: ROME  The tourism industry here is mulling the possible ramifications of the Vatican conclave and some are crossing their fingers for the election of an American pope.

title: Engendering Law
description: HO CHI MINH CITY  In the video, a transgender Vietnamese in a stringy, low-cut top entertains a crowd by balancing three fiery batons in her hands and on her head. A while later, other transgenders talk about the daily challenges of being at odds with your sex of birth, ranging from which restroom to use to bickering with the police over the gender stipulated on your official I.D.

title: Sleeping Beauty
description: Cliveden House, a sprawling Italianate manse overlooking the Thames, was once the home of the Waldorf Astors, who entertained a varied lot, including their pro-fascist aristocratic friends  known as the Cliveden Set  before World War II. It was also the backdrop of the Profumo Affair, the political sex scandal that brought down Prime Minister Harold Macmillans government 50 years ago. A recent renovation has transformed the manor, located an hour outside of London, into an aristo fantasy camp, complete with 38 Edwardian rooms and a storybook riverside cottage that comes with its own butler, on request. Owned by the National Trust, the luxury hotel and spa overlooks 376 acres of forests and meadows. Theres a garden maze, a 19th-century parterre and a full range of anachronistic amusements  from snooker to archery to a lazy river cruise on an electric canoe that Lady Astor had built for herself in the 1920s.

title: Matteo Garrone on Reality Television and Italian Culture
description: In the Italian comedy-drama Reality, a Neapolitan fishmonger named Luciano (Aniello Arena) seeks fame by trying to land a spot on Big Brother, the reality TV show. Along the way he loses his grip on his sense of self and his relationships with those around him. The film plays as a satire of Italian society, but also as a commentary on how such instant fame can affect a culture.

title: Strong Sales for Lucky Guy With Tom Hanks
description: Several new Broadway shows are off to good starts at the box office, none more so than the Tom Hanks vehicle Lucky Guy, which last week became the rare play to make more than $1 million for a week of performances.

title: Is Skype a Telephone Operator? France Will Investigate
description: PARIS  French regulators said Tuesday that they had asked prosecutors to investigate Microsofts Skype unit over its failure to register as a telecommunications operator in accordance with local law, raising the question of what constitutes a telephone company in the age of Internet-based communications.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Regulating Mexicos Telecom Industry and Foxs Push for College Sports
description: 11:47 a.m. | Updated

title: An Energy Coup for Japan: Flammable Ice
description: TOKYO  Japan said Tuesday that it had extracted gas from offshore deposits of methane hydrate  sometimes called flammable ice  a breakthrough that officials and experts said could be a step toward tapping a promising but still little-understood energy source.

title: Senate Panel Approves Two Gun Control Bills
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate Judiciary Committee on Tuesday passed two measures intended to curb gun violence, and the bills are now likely to go to the Senate floor for a full vote. But the committee postponed a vote on the most contentious measure  a proposal to reinstate an assault weapons ban  because its sponsor, Senator Dianne Feinstein of California, was not at the committees meeting.

title: The Eurobeatings Will Continue
description: Until morale improves. So says Jos Manuel Barroso, in a letter to the European Council saying that what Europe needs is  surprise  more austerity.

title: Live Blog: Hearing for S.E.C. Nominee
description: Mary Jo White, President Obamas pick to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission, testified this morning at her confirmation hearing before the Senate Banking Committee, whose members have lingering concerns about her ties to Wall Street and lack of regulatory experience.

title: MetroPCS Urges Shareholders to Back Merger With T-Mobile
description: The cellphone service provider MetroPCS urged shareholders on Tuesday to approve its merger with T-Mobile USA, in the face of strong opposition from two major hedge funds.

title: Guest Post: The Fog of Amendment
description: Another guest post on Hungary from my Princeton colleague Kim Lane Scheppele, after the jump:

title: 2 Parties Budgets Show Big Rift as G.O.P. Renews 2012 Proposals
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats and House Republicans on Tuesday outlined vastly divergent approaches to shoring up the governments finances, a reminder of how far apart they remain on fiscal policy even as both sides insist publicly that a bipartisan compromise is possible.

title: The Latest Republican Budget Plan
description: Representative Paul D. Ryan unveiled the House Republicans budget for 2014, which includes many of the same proposals as previous budgets and promises to erase deficits and balance the budget in 10 years.

title: What Were Reading
description: Epicurious: Stocking up on matzo? Youll need this later: recipes for using it up after Passover.  Julia Moskin

title: The More He Talks About Immigration
description: the less we know, and the less I care. Im talking about Jeb Bush, whos been trying desperately to explain what he really thinks should happen to the millions of people currently living in the United States illegally.

title: Dating Other Mothers
description: I have to start dating again! I wailed to my husband. Its probably closer to the truth to say that my 3-year-old and I were going to have to start dating again.

title: Putting Something Aside for a Future Beyond the Kitchen
description: Things seem so peaceful as The Detour begins. In the quaint kitchen of a Long Island farmhouse in the 1920s, when there were actual farms surrounding these dwellings, a mother and daughter count the money they are saving (and hiding in a vase) for the young womans education as an artist. But by Act II, businesses and marriages are falling apart, and suspense is high. And all because of some roadwork, land greed and the revelation of a family secret.

title: Showbiz Chimp on the Edge of Despair
description: When animals attack, were horrified, scared and also, lets face it, fascinated. Trevor, Nick Joness witty, sly play inspired by the story of a Connecticut woman assaulted by a pet chimpanzee, invites us to feel something else: empathy for the violent animal.

title: German Central Bank Doubles Reserves
description: FRANKFURT  In a profound signal of uneasiness about the health of the euro zone, the German central bank said Tuesday that it had nearly doubled the reserves it held to cover possible losses.

title: Security Leader Says U.S. Would Retaliate Against Cyberattacks
description: WASHINGTON  The chief of the militarys newly created Cyber Command told Congress on Tuesday that he is establishing 13 teams of programmers and computer experts who could carry out offensive cyberattacks on foreign nations if the United States were hit with a major attack on its own networks, the first time the Obama administration has publicly admitted to developing such weapons for use in wartime.

title: Prosecutors Face Test Proving Serious Crime in a Fatal Crash
description: The crash left a young couple and their baby dead. The driver of the speeding BMW who struck them was charged with criminally negligent homicide. But making those charges stick will be a nettlesome challenge for prosecutors.

title: 5 U.S. Soldiers Are Killed in Air Crash in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Five American soldiers were killed in a helicopter crash in southern Afghanistan on Monday, officials said Tuesday.

title: Win a Super Bowl, Hit the Road
description: As the N.F.L. kicks off its annual personnel swap meet, better known as the free-agency signing period, it has gotten an early jump on baring its business side to the masses. That happened in a flurry of pre-free-agency moves, most notably the one in which the Super Bowl champion shipped one of its key players (receiver Anquan Boldin) to another team (its Super Bowl opponent, no less: the San Francisco 49ers) for the football equivalent of a case of shoe polish (a sixth-round draft pick). All this was done before Ravens fans could say, Wha. ...?

title: The Gun Report: March 12, 2013
description: In the weeks since Newtown, I had been repeatedly told that anti-gun rallies were being cancelled because of threatened gun violence, and that individual gun control advocates, especially state legislators, were being intimidated and harassed. No place is this more evident than in Oregon, where Ginny Burdick, a long-time supporter of sensible gun regulation, has been the victim of a series of small but menacing dirty tricks. The latest one is the subject of my column today. Here is todays sampling of gun violence.

title: Scripture and Cheesecake
description: Monks are known to make beer to support their order. The nuns of New Skete, in upstate New York, bake cheesecake.

title: In Schools, a Water-Saving Program Begins With a Flush
description: The toilets in the boys room on the third floor of Bayside High School in Queens flush with a quick but powerful surge and then water gurgles back up into the bowl.

title: Daily Report: Dell Agrees to Show  Financials to Icahn
description: Dell has agreed to open its books to the billionaire activist investor Carl C. Icahn, signaling a possible truce on one front in the battle over the computer makers proposed $24.4 billion buyout, Michael J. de la Merced reports in Tuesdays New York Times.

title: Costa Rica Picks Miller
description: An unmitigated disaster for Roy Miller and the Red Bulls did not dissuade Costa Rica from naming the defender to its roster for next weeks World Cup qualifying match.

title: Prepaid Cards May Lack Protections of Checking Accounts
description: Although they are becoming more popular as an alternative to traditional checking accounts, reloadable prepaid cards dont have to carry federal deposit insurance, as checking accounts do, says a new report from a project of the Pew Charitable Trusts.

title: Ugly Thoughts Defense Fails as Officer Is Convicted in Cannibal Plot
description: A New York police officer was convicted on Tuesday in a bizarre plot to kidnap, torture, kill and eat women, ending a trial whose outcome hinged on a delicate distinction between fantasy and reality.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Deterring North Korea
description: To the Editor:

title: Skullcandy Crushers Vibrate to Boost Bass
description: How many headphones count a threat to make your eyeballs bleed as a virtue? At least one, the Skullcandy Crusher, which uses an unusual speaker technology to generate vibrations that are perceived as powerful bass notes.

title: Fighting to Follow Chvez
description: Simon Romero, a correspondent for The New York Times, looks at the challenges Venezuelas interim president, Nicols Maduro, faces in his bid to win the special election to replace Hugo Chvez.

title: Introducing a New Article Experience
description: In the past several months, a cross-functional team of journalists, designers and technologists  as well as project and product managers and sales staff  has taken on the ambitious task of redesigning NYTimes.com. The first phase of the redesign reflects the focus of our readers: articles.

title: The Other Berlin
description: Over the last decade, as East Berlin has risen to become Europes most fertile breeding ground of cool, West Berlin has languished. By the mid-2000s, once-bustling squares and boulevards were shadows of their glamorous former selves. But the winds of change have shifted. Construction cranes now swing over Breitscheidplatz, and the streets buzz with shoppers and diners. The city is reorienting itself to the west, says Stefanie Hering, who will open a flagship store for her porcelain design company, Hering Berlin, in the new Waldorf-Astoria hotel building this spring. The Waldorf, occupying a new high-rise steps from the Zoo station, is only the beginning. Recently opened on the main boulevard Kurfrstendamm, Haus Cumberland is a restored hotel from the early 1900s that houses several welcome arrivals, among them Grosz  a coffeehouse and restaurant evoking 1920s Berlin.

title: Queen Latifah and Richard Stoltzman to Perform at New York City Ballet Gala
description: Queen Latifah and Richard Stoltzman, the clarinetist, will be the guest artists at New York City Ballets 2013 spring gala, to be held May 8 at the David H. Koch Theater at Lincoln Center.

title: Testing the Limits of Well Take Anything in Trade
description: Gardner Stone employs an unorthodox business strategy at his GMC and Ford dealership in Middlebury, Vt. Mr. Stone, a gregarious fellow who likes to follow his sometimes unconventional instincts, brags that he will take anything in trade  not just any type of car or truck, but anything, period. To quote the Web site for G. Stone Motors, When we say anything, we mean anything!

title: Baking and Praying
description: For the Nuns of New Skete, monastic gourmet still pays the bills.

title: London Theater Journal: That Born-in-a-Trunk Tribe
description: The topic was work and its instability  chasing jobs, landing jobs, losing jobs. Its a common enough subject, especially these days. But the patois of the people sitting behind me at the Charing Cross Theater the other afternoon instantly identified them as members of an ancient and eternal tribe.

title: College Interview Survivor Awaits Scholarship Decisions
description: I spent many nights in February staying up late, applying for more scholarships. Its exhausting, but its better than staying up all night worrying about how Im going to pay for college.

title: An Outsize Intellect, Tilting at Obstacles
description: When Margaret Fuller died in a shipwreck off Fire Island in 1850, her friend Ralph Waldo Emerson was devastated. He sent a mutual friend, Henry David Thoreau, to the scene of the disaster.

title: Personal Shopper | Stars Not Out? Just Add Some Twinkle
description:
There are outdoor lanterns and light fixtures to suit a variety of tastes this season.
By MARIANNE ROHRLICH

title: Francisco Hopes to Find a Home with the Yankees
description: TAMPA  After a disorienting season playing for three different teams in two leagues last year, Ben Francisco was hoping for more stability this year. Perhaps he might even get to stay with one team.

title: All About the Billikens
description: The St. Louis mens basketball team won its first outright regular-season conference title since the 1956-57 season.

title: Fantasy Baseball: Top 10 Third Basemen
description: There are not many third basemen who can do it all, but the position is deep in four-category production. Justin Sablich picks his Top 10.

title: If You Like the Chieftains, Try Lindsey Stirling
description: Each week, Val Haller, a music-obsessed baby boomer and the founder of the Web site Valslist.com, matches tracks from her generation to that of her 20-something sons generation.

title: The Envelope Please: Chandler Buckingham
description: Chandler Buckingham, a senior at Rogers High School in Rogers, Ark., is awaiting scholarship news from John Brown University, one of her top college choices.

title: Charlie Pierce Gives a Journalism Lesson to Ezra Klein
description: If I tweetedwhich I dont, and never, ever willI would have sent out a tweet in praise of this delicious take-down of Ezra Klein by Charlie Pierce at Esquire. It takes all of 10 minutes to read, and it is so full of wisdom and common sense about reporting, then and now, that I hope it gets a wide readership.

title: Germanys Plague of Plagiarism
description: Helmut Schmidt, who as Germanys chancellor from 1974 to 1982 enjoyed his share of societal recognition and admiration, held that there are only two titles that a person should carry with a modicum of pride.

title: Hurricane Gustavs Path
description: Gustav unleashed powerful winds and heavy rains on Monday, after hundreds of thousands of people had evacuated their homes.

title: Billikens Title Is Tribute to What Majerus Taught Them
description: ST. LOUIS  The chant came from the student section as Chaifetz Arena shook, as fans with blue paint streaks in their hair and All About the Billikens T-shirts on their backs stood and roared. The final seconds of a season unlike any other ticked away, history in reach.

title: In Ikes Wake
description: Video and photo reports from around the region that was hit by Hurricane Ike.

title: The Ryan Budgets Step Backward
description: The first long term budget proposed by Paul Ryan, shortly after the Republicans retook the House of Representatives, was a major step forward for conservative policy thinking: It cashed in the Tea Party wave with a serious commitment to entitlement reform, and put every House Republican on record supporting the kind of Medicare changes that will be necessary if small-government conservatism takes its own premises seriously, and doesnt just want to be the partisan arm of the AARP.

title: Even in Afghanistan, a Focus on Budget Battles of Washington
description: FORWARD OPERATING BASE FENTY, Afghanistan  The new defense secretary, Chuck Hagel, arrived at this rugged security outpost situated along a ratline of insurgent infiltration from Pakistan to talk to American troops about the war.

title: Made to Measure
description: A look at the stage roles of Ian McKellen.

title: Investigator From U.N. Gives Iran Harsh Review
description: GENEVA  With presidential elections approaching in June, Iran has cracked down on journalists, rights activists and lawyers apparently in a bid to stifle dissent, a United Nations investigator said on Tuesday. He also said that the judicial authorities in Iran had tortured some Iranians for contacting him.

title: A Red Carpet Stop for Willie Nelson, Then on the Road Again
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  The country music legend and occasional film actor Willie Nelson took time out from touring Sunday for a visit to the South by Southwest film festival and the premiere of When Angels Sing, an Austin-made holiday film directed by Tim McCanlies. Harry Connick Jr. stars as Michael Walker, a family man who is Christmas-averse. He meets Nick (Mr. Nelson), who sells him his mansion for a steal, but Michael only later discovers that the house is on one of the most Christmas-obsessed blocks in town. The movie, which also features performances by Lyle Lovett, the Trishas, Dale Watson and others, plays as kind of a country-western version of A Christmas Carol.

title: The Last Video Rental Start-Up?
description: As noted in Mondays Dashboard summary of the weeks small-business news, Miguel Gomez introduced a very unlikely start-up late last year in Ardmore, Pa., a suburb of Philadelphia. Ready? Its a retail shop called Viva Video! The Last Picture Store. Thats right, its a video rental store. In this age of streaming videos and movie downloads, can an energetic entrepreneur breathe life into what most people assume is a dying business?

title: Fantasy Baseball: Third Base Preview
description: Justin Sablich is one half of the Sablich brothers, who provide fantasy sports advice on nytimes.com and on Twitter at @5thDownFantasy.

title: Judge Said to Be Frustrated Over Lack of Settlement in Spider-Man Battle
description: A federal judge had tough words on Monday for the parties struggling to reach a settlement over copyright control and profits for the Broadway musical Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark as the legal wrangling entered a seventh month and a trial date of May 27 loomed.

title: Not Guilty Plea Is Entered in Colorado Mass Shooting
description: CENTENNIAL, Colo.  A judge here entered a not guilty plea on Tuesday for James E. Holmes, a former neuroscience student charged with killing 12 people and wounding scores more in a mass shooting in a suburban Denver movie theater.

title: Historical Society Exhibition to Explore the Early Days of AIDS
description: The New York Historical Society will revisit the early years of the AIDS epidemic in a new exhibition scheduled to open this summer.

title: Tesla Model X Production Wont Start Until Late 2014
description: Tesla Motors has confirmed that production of its all-wheel-drive Model X electric crossover will begin in late 2014, a year later than the company had originally announced. The revised timing was described in the companys Form 10-K filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission last Thursday.

title: New Book Tackles China and its Environmental Exports
description: BEIJING  The rapid degradation of the environment in China has become a central topic of discussion this year. Air pollution in Beijing and other parts of northern China hit record levels in January. Water pollution was thrust into the spotlight this week when official news reports said that nearly 6,000 dead pigs had been found floating in a river that slices through the heart of Shanghai. Meanwhile, environmental advocates are pressing the government to release data on soil pollution, which officials have categorized as a state secret.

title: Can Wind, Water and Sunlight Power New York by 2050?
description: March 13, 12:43 p.m. | Relevant tweets appended |A group of scientists and energy analysts has laid out a path under which New York State could, in theory, eliminate its use of fossil fuels and nuclear power  including for transportation  by 2050. The graph above charts the contributions played by improved efficiency and adoption of renewable electricity sources as well as hydrogen fuel cells (with the hydrogen generated with renewable energy).

title: The Forgotten Malala
description: It was one of the most ruthless attacks of our time: three Pakistani schoolgirls were on their way home when the Taliban shot them. Their crime? Pursuit of an education. Malala Yousafzai was shot in the head and two other young women sustained injuries to their arms. We are all Malala, roared the world. Protestors marched and lit candlelight vigils. Malala was nominated for a Nobel Peace Prize and became an iconic symbol for young womens educational struggles.

title: Image of the Day: March 12
Two Years After Trade, Nuggets Have No Regrets
description: DENVER  Ty Lawson did not take the bait to talk his way into a trap. He is the Denver Nuggets quick-thinking point guard  not far removed from the conversation that includes the N.B.A.s best  who can turn the direction of the delicate Carmelo question as deftly as he crosses over on the dribble.

title: Faithful and Patient
description: The Timess Rachel Donadio talks to Catholics waiting in St. Peters Square for news about a new pope.

title: Spicy Whiskey From a Usual Source
description: Powers Johns Lane Irish whiskey, which arrived in the United States this month, is named after the Johns Lane Distillery, established in Dublin in 1791. The new quaff is very much an attempt to evoke the origins of Powers Whiskey as a single-pot-still whiskey. (Powers Gold Label, the distillerys benchmark whiskey  and, until recently, the best-selling whiskey in Ireland  is today a blend.)

title: Looking Past the Alter Egos to the Novelist
description: Philip Roth, having recently announced his retirement from writing  news that not everyone takes entirely at face value  turns 80 next week. Celebration, and maybe valediction, are certainly the order of the day. Visitors to Newark can take a bus tour past his old high school and pause at the intersection of Summit and Keer Avenues, now designated Philip Roth Plaza, an honor that will have to suffice until the Swedish Academy gets its act together.

title: Are Conference Tournaments the Best Way to Award N.C.A.A. Bids?
description: The N.C.A.A. tournament hasnt started, but the upsets have. The Liberty Flames, who were 11-20 in the regular season, won four games in six days to take the Big South tournament and earned the conferences automatic bid to the N.C.A.A. tournament.

title: Voters in Falklands Back British Rule Nearly Unanimously
description: LONDON  When the news reached London on Tuesday that 99.7 percent of Falkland islanders who had participated in a referendum had voted yes on retaining their ties with Britain, Prime Minister David Cameron was delighted. The result, he said, proved that the islands were British through and through.

title: One Possible Hitch to an Autonomy Investigation
description: Presumably, the antitrust investigators who looked at Microsoft back in the day had Windows software on their own computers. One could imagine that the prosecutors who brought accounting fraud cases against WorldCom executives might have used its MCI long-distance service. And any number of regulators around the world are likely to have used Google for personal and professional reasons.

title: Living in Oyster Bay Cove
description: President Theodore Roosevelt and his family are prominent in the areas history. He is buried in the Long Island village.

title: More Country, Less Congestion
description: Roseanne OFarrell can watch hawks through her windows. A red-tailed hawk just flew into a tree in my backyard, she said. Hes very still, and then he will swoop down. We have a pair that nest in the hollow behind us. Its so great.

title: A Bumpy Road to a Soda Ban
description: Some of the countrys leading public health experts called Mondays judicial ruling against New Yorks limits on the sale of large sugary drinks a predictable setback in what has become a national campaign against obesity, the countrys newest health epidemic.

title: Necessary Baggage
description: Leave it to the Japanese to turn the touristy fanny pack into a cool travel accessory by slinging it over the shoulder. This version by Coach, already huge in Tokyo, is now on sale stateside. $328; coach.com.

title: Greenberg Forges Ahead With Lawsuit Over A.I.G. Bailout
description: 2:23 p.m. | Updated

title: Catholics Speak: Modernization
description: As Catholics await a new pope, some ask for more transparency, while others hope for a strong, traditional leader.

title: Red Bulls Petke Takes High Road on Roy Miller
description: The Red Bulls Mike Petke, who is still seeking his first victory as a coach in Major League Soccer, did not criticize defender Roy Miller during a conference call Tuesday morning, but he likewise did not issue a soaring endorsement:

title: Google Concedes That Drive-By Prying Violated Privacy
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Google on Tuesday acknowledged to state officials that it had violated peoples privacy during its Street View mapping project when it casually scooped up passwords, e-mail and other personal information from unsuspecting computer users.

title: Tenniss Top 5: How Well Do They Know Each Other?
description: The folks at the BNP Paribas Open decided to brighten up their spot on the tennis calendar by getting the Top 5 mens players to participate in a trivia contest about each other.

title: Intrade Sheds Light on How Gray Markets Can Go Dark
description: Intrade sheds light on how quickly gray markets can go dark. The site, which took bets on everything, including elections, oil prices and even its own demise, was abruptly shuttered on Sunday. While Intrades predictive record was good, it didnt foresee the rising controversy over under-regulated speculation. Its a cautionary tale for others operating in a somewhat shadowed zone.

title: The People Versus the Party
description: The Republicans have hit a sour spot in politics  they are 180 degrees opposed to what most Americans want on just about any issue you care to name.

title: Colorado Legalizes Civil Unions for Same-Sex Couples
description: DENVER  Colorado lawmakers passed legislation on Tuesday to legalize civil unions for same-sex couples, following several years of bitter debate over the issue.

title: War and Healing Depicted in Silicon Valley Art Gallery
description: The bombs that hang from the ceiling in the small art gallery in suburban Silicon Valley are filled with bizarre visions of aquatic pre-dinosaur invertebrates from another age.

title: Woodland Performance
description: A look at a performance of "Invisible Wings" at the Jacob's Pillow festival in Becket, Mass.

title: Mars Could Have Supported Life Long Ago, NASA Says
description: Several billion years ago, Mars may well have been a pleasant place for tiny microbes to live, with plenty of water as well as minerals that could have served as food, NASA scientists said Tuesday at a news conference on the latest findings from their Mars rover. But they have yet to find signs that actual microbes did live in that oasis.

title: Reining In a Restless Lion
description: Elijah Moshinskys striking 1994 production of Verdis Otello played at the Met last October with the tenor Johan Botha in the title role and Rene Fleming as Desdemona. Illness gave Mr. Botha a shaky opening night and forced him to miss most of the run, although he rallied for the final performance, a live HD broadcast.

title: Excerpt: 'Hit the Wall'
description: A scene from the show about the Stonewall rebellion, at the Barrow Street Theater.

title: Sourdough Rye Revisited: Dont Forget the Water
description: My column on whole-grain bread drew a number of e-mails from readers who were justifiably confused about the Sourdough Rye recipe. Unfortunately, a significant quantity of water was left out of the recipe which resulted in a dough that would never come together; so some who tried the recipe wound up with a dry, crumbly mess. If you want to try the recipe again (or for the first time), the correct version of the recipe is online.

title: Live Video: A Pope Is Elected
description: Updated, 2:02 p.m.White smoke poured from the chimney of the Sistine Chapel on Wednesday indicating there is a new pope. The Lede is following the latest developments in the election of a new pope here.

title: Lawmakers Release Carbon Emissions Tax Plan
description: Almost exactly four years after unveiling his doomed cap-and-trade proposal to deal with global warming, Representative Henry Waxman, Democrat of California, released a new plan on Tuesday to address climate change and federal budget woes: a tax on carbon emissions.

title: Bloomberg Again Blasts Court Ruling on Large Sugary Drinks
description: Updated, 3:41 p.m. | A day after a judge struck down his administrations impending limits on large sugary drinks, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg appeared at a Manhattan cafe on Tuesday that was nevertheless adopting the limits, and he delivered a forceful defense of his policy and a rebuke of the judges decision.

title: Telemarketer That Aimed at  the Elderly Is Shut Down
description: The federal government recently acted to halt a telemarketing ploy that tried to trick frail elderly people across the country into paying for medical alert services they didnt order.

title: Notre Dame to Join A.C.C. This Fall
description: Notre Dame announced Tuesday morning that it had reached an agreement with the Big East to quicken its defection to the Atlantic Coast Conference in all sports except football and hockey beginning this fall.

title: Change Agent: Examining How and Why the Pope Can Make a Global Difference
description: Updated: March 19

title: Music Man
description: Photos of shows written by the composer Jason Robert Brown.

title: Flimflam Forever
description: I took Paul Ryans measure two and a half years ago. All the Very Serious People were very angry with me  Ryan was the Serious, Honest Conservative, the guy centrists demonstrated their centrism by praising. But he was an obvious phony. His plan was all smoke (I couldnt even find any mirrors), with all the alleged deficit reduction coming from closing tax loopholes he refused to specify plus projected reductions in discretionary spending that he also refused to specify. Meanwhile, he was pursuing radical redistribution away from the needy to the wealthy.

title: Illustrating an Online Romance Gone Wrong
description: In the magazines most recent issue, Maxine Swann recounts how an online romance led to incarceration in an Argentine jail for the physicist Paul Frampton. But because her article, The Professor, the Bikini Model and the Suitcase Full of Trouble, includes crucial elements that could not be photographed  from Framptons life at the University of North Carolina to his online encounters with someone he believed to be the model Denise Milani to his trip to South America to meet her to his eventual arrest on drug charges  we commissioned Wesley Allsbrook to supply the articles graphic elements. Allsbrook is a Brooklyn-based illustrator whose work accompanied another hard-to-photograph article in the magazine, Jeffrey Gettlemans 2011 article about pirate kidnappings off the coast of Somalia.

title: Extending His Sway, Putin Names Loyalist to Head Russian Central Bank
description: MOSCOW  Asserting further personal control over the Russian economy, President Vladimir V. Putin nominated on Tuesday a close political ally, who is now serving as his chief economic adviser, to become the new chief of the Russian central bank.

title: Balut
description: If you order the balut at Jeepney, be prepared for quite the fanfare when the hard-boiled duck egg is brought to the table.

title: France Proposes New Rules for Internet Equal Access
description: SERRAVAL, France  The French government on Tuesday called for a law requiring Internet service providers to give all the traffic on their networks equal priority, saying existing rules were insufficient for protecting free speech online and ensuring fair competition among Web publishers.

title: Detroit Asks for More Time to Avoid Takeover
description: Under threat of being replaced by an emergency financial manager appointed by Michigans governor, Detroit officials made an 11th-hour plea for patience Tuesday, asking for more time to put in place the changes needed to avoid a state takeover as their beleaguered city inched closer toward bankruptcy.

title: A Tribute to a Troubled Bus Operator
description: The engines of the Fung Wah bus have fallen silent, but into the sonic vacuum rushes Marc Philippe Eskenazi, an assistant cartoon editor at The New Yorker, with this touching musical tribute, which his employer posted today. Extra points for fitting like the clown on the peel of a banana into half a line.

title: Jeremy Tylers New World
description: The transition from high school basketball to a professional league in Israel has not been easy for Jeremy Tyler, an 18-year-old American.

title: On Tiptoe to Reach Elevator Buttons
description: Hotels like to throw around superlatives. And when they do, it is often in categories  customer service, hypoallergenic bedding, size of indoor gym  that matter to guests. But lately, a few hotels have fixated on a factor that isnt usually mentioned in TripAdvisor reviews: height.

title: For Boy Scouts Parents, a Chance to Weigh In on Ban on Gays
description: The Boy Scouts, who are considering lifting the ban on openly gay scout leaders and scouts, have taken the next step toward making a decision: they are surveying volunteers and member parents on how they feel about the ban. Surveys arrived in e-mail in-boxes over the weekend (and can be viewed in full on the Dallas Voice Web site).

title: Jeepney, and Pig and Khao
description: Inside two Asian restaurants that have many things in common.

title: Butler Prepares for Its First Atlantic 10 Tournament
description: INDIANAPOLIS  The Butler mens basketball team concluded a 24-7 regular season with a 67-62 victory over Xavier on Saturday night at Hinkle Fieldhouse. The game was the last home game for the Butler seniors Andrew Smith, Rotnei Clarke, Chase Stigall and Emerson Kampen.

title: G.O.P. to Put Digital Strategy at Center of New Structure
description: As part of a rebuilding effort after its 2012 electoral losses, the Republican National Committee on Tuesday announced plans to put an enhanced digital strategy at the center of its operation, led by a new chief technology officer.

title: Winter TV Schedule Brings Shift in Ratings Race
description: 7:07 p.m. | Updated The television season continues to generate big shifts in the ratings, with cable shows still dominating over most network offerings on Sunday nights and Fox overtaking a flagging NBC for the season.

title: New York Theater Workshops New Season to Feature Caryl Churchill Play
description: The acclaimed British writer Caryl Churchill will return to New York Theater Workshop during the 2013-14 season with a new drama, Love and Information, her first play there since the 2009 staged reading of her controversial work Seven Jewish Children: A Play for Gaza, the theater announced on Tuesday. It will be the seventh American debut of a Churchill play at New York Theater Workshop, where her previous plays included A Number and Far Away as well as Seven Jewish Children, which drew complaints in both London and New York for its portrayal of some Israelis, who speak savagely about Palestinians. James MacDonald will direct Love and Information, as he did last year in a London production. The play, which features dozens of short scenes about characters overwhelmed by the nonstop pace of modern information, is expected to begin performances in early 2014.

title: Soda Supporters
description: The Timess Nicholas Confessore on the ties between beverage companies and the groups that oppose limits on large drinks.

title: Two Roads to the Philippines
description: The cry goes up around the restaurant.

title: Hostess Sells Twinkies Brand to Investment Firms
description: 8:53 p.m. | Updated

title: Garrard Has a Chance to Start for the Jets
description: After missing the past two seasons because of injury, David Garrard wanted only to return to the N.F.L. Being a backup, he said, was fine with him. And then the Jets came along, with a fluid quarterback situation and an opportunity to unseat Mark Sanchez and fend off any other potential contenders. They conveyed that message to Garrard, who signed with the Jets on Monday.

title: A View of the 2013 American Crossword Puzzle Tournament
description: SPECIAL POST  The big boards have been packed up, the pencils are worn down to nubs, and once again, Dan Feyer is the fastest crossword puzzle solver on the planet.

title: U.N. Report Reframes Debate Over Image of a Fathers Agony in Gaza
description: Last Updated, Wednesday, 11:52 p.m. As The Lede reported in November, within hours of the start of Israels Gaza offensive that month, images of the dead and wounded, particularly those of children, were shared widely on social networks by Israelis and Palestinians, as both communities sought to alert the world to their grief.

title: He Wont Upstage His Food
description: When Andrew Carmellini was growing up outside Cleveland, he had a tendency to get a little wild.

title: Los Angeles MOCA Mulls Pact With National Gallery
description: Struggling to maintain its independence in the face of dwindling resources, the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles is close to working out a five-year agreement with the National Gallery of Art in Washington to collaborate on programming, research and exhibitions, according to the chairman of the Gallerys board of trustees.

title: Statistics Challenge Cuomos Claim of Record Job Growth
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos administration has boasted of New Yorks private-sector job growth setting records. But the state actually slightly trailed the nation in private-sector job growth during the governors first two years in office.

title: Ohios Resurgent Natural Gas Industry Spends Millions to Set Up Shop
description: LOUISVILLE, Ohio  The countryside in eastern Ohio is marked by rusting tanks that stand in open fields and along the edges of family timber patches, like graveyard headstones for an era of energy riches that most people here thought had passed.

title: Man Admits Stealing Fixtures From a Bronx Cemetery
description: A man accused of stealing brass fixtures from a Bronx cemetery pleaded guilty on Monday. The man, Louis Peduto, 56, admitted to taking items  a few doorknobs and at least one vent cover  found in a bag when he was caught by security guards at St. Raymond Cemetery on Feb. 18, the Bronx district attorneys office said.

title: High Horse
description: Eleven hundred glass beads and 290 hours of hand embroidery went into transforming a design by the French artist Pierre Pron into this giant silk chiffon scarf for Herms. This piece and seven other couture carrs are now on view at the Madison Avenue boutique. While more art than accessory, these works are available by special order. Herms, 691 Madison Avenue; (212) 751-3181.

title: Bolling Declines Independent Bid for Virginia Governor
description: Bill Bolling, in announcing that he will not leave the Republican Party and run as an independent for governor of Virginia this year, did so with one of the classic political dropout lines: Its not me, its the system.

title: U.S. Backs Boeing Plan for Testing 787 Battery
description: Boeing achieved a major milestone on Tuesday as the Federal Aviation Administration approved its plan to test fixes for the battery problems that have grounded its 787 jets since mid-January.

title: Call It PoHo, Stirring but Still Sleepy
description: The PoHo neighborhood in Hong Kong, once sleepy and residential, has taken on galleries and cafes without losing its low-key atmosphere.

title: Pictures of the Day: Vatican City and Elsewhere
description: Photos from the Vatican, Mali, North Korea and Kenya.

title: Off the Menu
description: Opening

title: Oysters Offer a Reason to Pull Out the Sherry
description: Oysters, seaweed, lemon and a touch of radish bitterness: for me, this recipe by the chef Andrew Carmellini (the subject of a new profile by Jeff Gordinier) calls out for manzanilla, the fino sherry that comes from the seaside town of Sanlcar de Barrameda. One of the joys of the sherry renaissance is seeing its role expanded from aperitif to a wine to be enjoyed throughout a meal. Longtime sherry enthusiasts know how beautifully manzanilla goes with raw oysters. Its silken strength and saline flavors will pair just as well with the other elements of this baked dish.

title: Videos Show Store Rampage by Protesters From Vigil
description: Updated, 5:34 p.m. | The police released two videos on Tuesday showing a disorderly group that descended on a Rite Aid store in East Flatbush, Brooklyn, on Monday night and wrought havoc inside after breaking away from a vigil for a teenager who had been killed by the police.

title: Ordinary Guys Shifting Around, Surveying New Muscular Territory
description: LONDON  Twelve years ago, flying in the face of all reason, two former Royal Ballet principal dancers, Michael Nunn and William Trevitt, formed their own small company. They quickly became known as the BalletBoyz, appealing to a youthful public that appreciated their irreverent, ordinary-guy humor; their flair for combining risk-taking commissions with entertainment; and  credit where due  their idea, later copied by many companies, of prefacing performances with short films that gave choreographers and dancers a chance to speak of the creative process, often amusingly.

title: Where Are the Yankees I Loved to Hate?
description: In their current disorienting austerity drive, the Sons of Boss have it backward.

title: Obama Discusses Entitlement Changes With Senate Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama met for more than an hour on Capitol Hill with Senate Democrats on Tuesday, engaging in a lengthy, detailed discussion about potential changes to entitlements and other ways to balance the budget.

title: Indias Jewish Food
description: Joan Nathan travels to India to look for Jewish food and discovers a rich cultural history in the process.

title: SXSW Music: A Chance at Serendipity Amid the Glut
description: Its time for the annual swarm: the South By Southwest Music festival that runs for five nights in Austin, gathering musicians who want to be heard along with the businesspeople who hope to profit from them. Each year, it sprawls wider, with unofficial events, day and night, surrounding the official showcases that already offer more than 2,000 acts this year. It also moves higher up the pop food chain  gathering not just baby bands hoping for their chance and international visitors dreaming of American exposure  but also big names rolling out their latest efforts  and, inevitably, stealing attention from the underdogs.

title: A Seder Spiced With Indian Flavors
description: KOCHI, India  Dreaming of spices described in the Book of Kings, I came to this southern port city built in the 14th century to learn about its longstanding but tiny Jewish presence and its food, which some believe dates back to the time of the Bible.

title: In Spinoffs, a Chance to Jettison Liabilities
description: A spinoff is a product of Wall Street math that says one plus one can equal three. Yet as shareholders of Time Warner may be about to find out, it can also be all about subtraction, as a company ditches an unwanted business, in this case, magazines.

title: This Weeks Links
description: This is the first in a new series of posts, in which NYT developers share their recommendations from around the web.

title: Metal Gear Rising, Half the Sky Movement, Real Racing 3, MLB 13 and Aliens
description: METAL GEAR RISING

title: A Mother-Son Dance With Many Awkward Steps
description: The bluntly audacious title of the writer-director Xavier Dolans debut feature, I Killed My Mother, is both a twist on a Freudian joke and a complicated assessment of the heros over-cathected relationship with his parent in chief. Deep down I love her, the 16-year-old Hubert Minel (Mr. Dolan) says in one of the movies confessional black-and-white interludes, but its not the love of a son.

title: $10 Million Gift Goes to Juilliard Drama School
description: The Juilliard School on Monday announced that it had received a $10 million gift that will endow the schools new four-year masters-level graduate program in drama. According to a news release the money supports increased instructional costs and new faculty, and provides full scholarships plus stipends for actors in their final and fourth year of the master of fine arts program in drama. A Juilliard spokeswoman said it is the largest one-time gift that Juilliard has received for its drama department.

title: Recess Appointments Ruling to Be Appealed
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has decided that it will appeal to the Supreme Court a sweeping ruling by an appeals court in January that President Obama violated the Constitution when he bypassed the Senate in making three recess appointments to the National Labor Relations Board last year.

title: J.R. Ewing Funeral Brings Season-High Ratings to Dallas
description: The farewell to J.R. Ewing pulled back some lost fans to Dallas on TNT on Monday night, lifting the drama to its best overall audience of its second season.

title: Web Site Investigated for Posting Private Data
description: WASHINGTON  Law enforcement officials said on Tuesday that they had opened an investigation into a Web site that posted the home addresses, Social Security numbers and other personal information for more than a dozen celebrities and politicians, including Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., Michelle Obama and Jay-Z.

title: What the Tide Brought In
description: Nao was easy. The voice of the quirky, troubled 16-year-old Japanese schoolgirl whose words begin A Tale for the Time Being, Ruth Ozekis new novel, came to the author as she was immersed in a Buddhist teaching. But it took five frustrating years for Ms. Ozeki to round out the story.

title: Front Burner
description: To Shop: Five Generations, One New Shop

title: All Me, All The Time
description: The Krugman Times. Funny stuff  but I cant afford to subscribe, having bankrupted myself buying Portuguese wine and antique British cloth and all that.

title: Arizona Governor Introduces Bill to Expand Medicaid
description: PHOENIX  Gov. Jan Brewer of Arizona stepped to the lectern on Tuesday under blazing sunshine and before a mostly friendly audience to introduce a Medicaid expansion bill she has championed.

title: Bloomberg Defends Sugary Drink Limits
description: The day after a judge struck down Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs impending limits on large sugary sodas, Mr. Bloomberg promised to appeal the decision, and to continue his anti-obesity campaign.

title: NPR Wants to Click With Those Who Tweet
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  NPR might not seem like the most obvious host of a party at the sprawling South by Southwest Interactive conference. But it, like so many other old-line media companies, wants and needs what the conference, part of the South by Southwest festivals, has: youthful energy.

title: Champions League: Round of 16/Matchday 7
description: We continue a feature in which we bring Goal readers video of the goals (and some key plays) of the day in the UEFA Champions League, courtesy of Fox Soccer.

title: F.D.A. Raises Heart Alert on Antibiotic in Wide Use
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday toughened a warning it made last year about the potential risks of azithromycin, a commonly used antibiotic that can cause changes in the electrical activity of the heart that may lead to a fatal irregular heart rhythm in some patients.

title: Wary of Attack With Smallpox, U.S. Buys Up a Costly Drug
description: The United States government is buying enough of a new smallpox medicine to treat two million people in the event of a bioterrorism attack, and took delivery of the first shipment of it last week. But the purchase has set off a debate about the lucrative contract, with some experts saying the government is buying too much of the drug at too high a price.

title: Music and Drama
description: A look at the stage performances of Kate Burton.

title: With Isles in Contention, Grabner Is Out With Injury
description: Islanders right wing Michael Grabner will be sidelined for at least a week with a shoulder injury. There is no timetable for his return, the team said, adding that Grabner will be re-evaluated in 7 to 10 days. It is unclear how Grabner was hurt. He is third on the Islanders in goals with 10, and has 3 assists in 26 games.

title: Instruments That Sing, With Singers as Instruments
description: Solo singers who focus on opera and symphonic repertory have few opportunities to perform chamber music, the superb mezzo-soprano Sasha Cooke wrote in her introduction to the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Centers concert at Alice Tully Hall on Friday evening.

title: Vatican Reveals Recipes for Conclave Smoke
description: The papal conclaves recipes for white and black smoke are a mystery no more.

title: Blessings of Low Taxes Remain Unproved
description: The proposition that low tax rates produce higher economic growth has been a central plank of the Republican platform since I was a teenager.

title: Views Mixed After Limits on Sweet Drinks Are Blocked
description: The New York Times article on a judges ruling on Monday striking down the citys impending limits on large sugary drinks drew more than 1,300 comments from readers representing a wide range of regulatory philosophies. Here are some of them. A few have been condensed slightly.

title: Syria Military Shows Strain in a War It Wasnt Built to Fight
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Syrian militarys ability to fight rebels and hold territory has steadily eroded, forcing it to cede the job of running many checkpoints to paramilitary groups, give up a provincial city last week without much of a fight and even enlist the top state-appointed Muslim cleric as a recruiter.

title: Pushing Back Retirement, and Not Always for Money
description: ITS not your grandfathers retirement, not nearly as cut and dried. Its not the simple picture of stopping work at 60 or 65, moving to Florida and devoting oneself to golf and bridge  not that it was ever totally that.

title: Choice for Tight Times: Save More or More Risk
description: BUILDING an investment portfolio that produces enough income to live on is one of the main goals of retirement planning, but lately the goal posts have shifted. With interest rates stuck near record lows, retirees must have more saved up to produce the same income through the usual high-quality investments, like Treasury bonds, or else they must venture into assets with higher yields but potentially higher risk

title: What Do You Want to Be, Now That Youre Grown?
description: FOR most of my working life, I have never had to commute or see the inside of a cubicle. As a television critic, I was forced to watch the tube, and as a sportswriter, I inhabited stadiums and press boxes rather than dingy offices.

title: Hey, at Least You Can Be Virtually Immortal
description: NO one will confuse typical retirees today with the Emperor Augustus, who constructed a huge mausoleum to celebrate his life for eternity. And yet they belong to the first generation of elders within easy grasp of something once so rare and valuable that relatively few historic figures could enjoy it until now: virtual immortality.

title: Going to College at 65, and Going Greek as Well
description: In the 1960s, going to college for Jerry Reid meant not enrolling, but tagging along with his pal William Lloyd Sturman and crashing at his fraternity, Chi Phi, at the University of Virginia. He brought me to U.Va and introduced me to a life I didnt even know existed, Mr. Reid said in a recent telephone interview. Despite coaxing from Mr. Sturman, who died in 1984, Mr. Reid assumed that a university education was unattainable for a boy from Dogtown, the working-class neighborhood in Richmond, Va., where he grew up. I did not see higher education as a possibility, Mr. Reid said.

title: A Little of This, a Little of That for Older Exercisers
description: BY 9:30 a.m., the early crowd at Metro Fitness in Montgomery, Ala., has thinned. Those who must be at work are gone. Those who remain are generally retirees. At that time, every Monday, Wednesday and Friday, 15 to 20 of them gather in the clubs first-floor studio for a class called Fitness Fusion.

title: In Auditing Classes, Older Students Find Welcome on Campus
description: OLDER students audit courses at colleges and universities for many reasons. Some retirees prefer lecture halls to bingo parlors. Travelers might take history or geography classes to learn about future vacation destinations. A philosophy class might help a widow cope with grief.

title: For Modern Retirees, Theres No Place Like Home
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.

title: In Retiree Housing, Talking About Multigenerations
description: THERE seems to be a rule that if retirees move to a communal environment, it must consist only of other retirees. But some older adults are challenging that notion by choosing intergenerational cohousing, living side by side with people of all other ages, including singles, childless couples and families with children.

title: Predicting Commutes More Accurately for Would-Be Home Buyers
description: One of the first things people shopping for a house want to know is how agonizing the commute will be. Its not that hard to get an idea of how bad the pain will be in this era of smartphones and apps. You can punch your work address into Google Maps while youre standing in front of your dream house to get a ballpark estimate of how long you will spend in a car, on a bus or riding a bike to your office. A start-up called Walk Score even has a search engine that lets you find apartment listings within a selected commuting range  say, a half-hour by bus or 15 minutes by car.

title: Venture Capitalists Face Another Sexual Harassment Suit
description: Another lawsuit is raising the issue of sexual discrimination in Silicon Valley. Three female employees have sued CMEA Capital, a venture capital firm based in San Francisco, claiming sexual harassment and retaliation.

title: Revolution and Its Aftermath Play Out on an Avenue That Defines a City
description: TUNIS  An elderly veteran of Tunisias struggle for independence has watched his countrys transformations  through colonialism, a coup and an uprising  from his regular spot at a cafe on the avenue that bears the name of his hero.

title: Barcelona Sends Emphatic Message to the Doubters
description: Ninety minutes of mediocrity led to three weeks of hysterics for Barcelona, all of which was promptly dispatched in less than an hour Tuesday.

title: Case Already Tried in Social Media Heads to Court
description: STEUBENVILLE, Ohio  No cellphones, iPads or laptops will be allowed inside Juvenile Court here on Wednesday when two high school football players go on trial on charges of raping a 16-year-old girl last summer. Anyone who wants to post on Twitter or a blog will have to leave the building to do so.

title: Non-Communist Parties Lend China an Air of Pluralism, Without the Mess
description: BEIJING  For those accustomed to the partisan jousting that frequently paralyzes Washington, the feel-good unity displayed last week by the leaders of Chinas eight so-called democratic parties was eye-opening.

title: Minority Groups and Bottlers Team Up in Battles Over Soda
description: The decision by a New York State judge striking down the Bloomberg administrations ban on large, sugary drinks this week was not just a high-profile victory for the soda companies in their pitched battle against anti-obesity policies that are aimed at their products. It was also a victory for the industrys steadfast, if surprising, allies: advocacy groups representing the very communities hit hardest by the obesity epidemic.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Bitcoin Problem and Tracking the Papacy
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. More Scuttlebot can be found here.

title: Google Elbows Into the Cloud
description: In a battle for dominance in cloud computing, Google is taking on Microsoft and Amazon in their own back yard.

title: The Scoutss Survey on Banning Gays
description: The Boy Scouts of America is surveying about 1.1 million families about the role of gays in scouting.

title: Boy Scouts Sends Survey to Members About Ban on Gays
description: The Boy Scouts of America is reaching out to parents and scouts as it decides whether to continue or rescind the groups ban on gay members and leaders. Surveys went out in recent days to 1.1 million scouts and their families around the nation.

title: With Ancient Rites, Cardinals Make First Attempt to Choose a Pope
description: VATICAN CITY  They filed into the Sistine Chapel on Tuesday reciting a Latin hymn, and then swore an oath on the Bible, pledging secrecy. And then the 115 cardinals were sealed inside to choose from among them the next leader of the Roman Catholic Church. It was a ritual, solemn and ancient, that underscored the continuity of a 2,000-year-old institution.

title: Psychiatrist, Also Victimized, Tells of Attack by Defendant
description: At the murder trial of a man accused of killing an Upper East Side psychologist, several mental health experts are expected to testify about the defendants state of mind on the night of the slaying. But one of those experts, Dr. Kent D. Shinbach, did not come to his conclusions from the comfort of his desk.

title: White Says Her S.E.C. Would Be Tough on Wall St.
description: WASHINGTON  Mary Jo White moved closer to becoming a top Wall Street regulator on Tuesday as she sailed through a Congressional confirmation hearing. But even her supporters on Capitol Hill pointed to significant challenges awaiting the next leader of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Departures Leave Holes On Jets Line
description: The interior of the Jets defensive line disappeared Tuesday, when Sione Pouha was released and the free agent Mike DeVito left for the Kansas City Chiefs. Their departures leave the team with little experience inside besides Kenrick Ellis, a third-round pick in 2011 who has yet to prove he merits a starting job.

title: Hectic Times Square Is Keeping the Developers Busy
description: Some two decades ago, New York City began a huge cleanup of its downtrodden theater district, vastly improving the fortunes of the pedestrian-clogged Times Square neighborhood. In recent months, that progress has gone into high gear, with rents reaching new highs and several redevelopment projects proceeding.

title: Storms Swiftly Claim Trees, but Stumps Stay for Years
description: When a New York City tree crew removed a shade tree whose roots had damaged the sewer line in front of Gwen Grapess home, the workers promised they would be back soon to grind down the stump.

title: Head of U.S. Nuclear Watchdog Emphasizes Preparing for Unknown
description: Appealing for a shift in emphasis on nuclear safety, the new head of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission warned a gathering of more than 3,000 industry executives, experts and government regulators on Tuesday against relying too heavily on their ability to predict the future, and suggested that when it comes to commercial reactors, the industry and the government should be ready to deal with the unknown.

title: A Food Market for New York
description: There is nothing like a grand urban food market, which can anchor a neighborhood and even a city. Think of the 120-year-old Reading Terminal Market in Philadelphia; the Ferry Building in San Francisco, which 10 years ago helped revitalize the Embarcadero; and the ever-popular Pike Place Market in Seattle. Even much-maligned Los Angeles has a permanent mid-city market, in business since 1934.

title: Is Any Hope Left for Mideast Peace?
description: WHAT should Barack Obama, who is to visit Israel next Wednesday for the first time in his presidency, do about the Israeli-Palestinian conflict?

title: Preventing an Arctic Cold War
description: JUST a quarter-century ago, and for millenniums before that, the Arctic Ocean was covered year-round by ice, creating an impregnable wilderness that humans rarely negotiated. Today, as the effects of global warming are amplified in the high north, most of the ocean is open water during the summer and covered by ice only in the winter.

title: Fund That Subsidizes Internet for Schools Should Expand, a Senator Says
description: WASHINGTON  The $2.3 billion federal E-Rate program, which subsidizes basic Internet connections for schools and libraries, should be overhauled and expanded to provide those community institutions with new, lightning-fast connections to the Web, the chairman of a Senate committee that oversees the F.C.C. said Tuesday.

title: Cheers for Reyes in His Return, and Even More After a Rally
description: MIAMI  Robinson Cano touched home plate, and the party started. His Dominican Republic teammates rushed out of the dugout. They mobbed him, patted his head and danced, as if their three-run seventh inning had won the game, as if this were the Little League World Series, not the second round of the World Baseball Classic.

title: Too Close for Profit
description: Chris Lawless knows about bad beats. He has had plenty of particularly painful gambling losses, but he sure did not see it coming Monday night in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference mens basketball tournament championship game between Iona and Manhattan.

title: Good News on the Shark Front
description: At a meeting on the world wildlife trade in Bangkok this week, delegates voted to impose strict rules to keep five species of sharks and two types of manta rays from being fished to extinction. This is excellent news.

title: Mayor Bloombergs Anti-Obesity Campaign
description: A state judge ruled Monday that Mayor Michael Bloombergs ban on servings of sugary drinks larger than 16 ounces was arbitrary and capricious, blocking the limits one day before they were to take effect.

title: Sexual Assaults and Military Justice
description: A Senate Armed Services subcommittee is scheduled to hold a hearing on sexual assaults in the military on Wednesday, the first Senate hearing on the issue in nearly a decade. There will certainly be a lot to talk about.

title: The Worst of the Ryan Budgets
description: Theres nothing wrong with President Obama speed-dating members of Congress. Meeting face to face over food and wine, as Mr. Obama has recently done with several groups of lawmakers from both parties, may ease the demonizing politics of the last four years  along with the presidents well-earned reputation for aloofness. And given how little some Republicans know about his budget proposals  one senator confessed he had no idea what Mr. Obama wanted to cut before last weeks dinner  the shared meals were probably overdue.

title: The Old Peace Is Dead, but a New Peace Is Possible
description: KFAR SHMARYAHU, Israel

title: Mr. Obama Goes to Israel
description: In case you havent heard, President Obama leaves for Israel next week. It is possible, though, that you havent heard because it is hard for me to recall a less-anticipated trip to Israel by an American president. But there is a message in that empty bottle: Little is expected from this trip  not only because little is possible, but because, from a narrow U.S. point of view, little is necessary. Quietly, with nobody announcing it, the Israeli-Palestinian conflict has shifted from a necessity to a hobby for American diplomats. Like any hobby  building model airplanes or knitting sweaters  some days you work on it, some days you dont. It depends on your mood, but it doesnt usually matter when that sweater gets finished. Obama worked on this hobby early in his first term. He got stuck as both parties rebuffed him, and, therefore, he adopted, quite rationally in my view, an attitude of benign neglect. It was barely noticed.

title: Legal Battle Over Limits on Sugary Drinks May Outlast Mayors Tenure
description: A Manhattan judges ruling on Monday striking down New York Citys limits on large sugary drinks set the stage for a test in the states highest court of one of Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs signature policies.

title:
Karzai Bets on
Vilifying U.S. to
Shed His Image
as a Lackey
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The longest shadow in Afghan politics is cast by a traffic post that used to stand in Ariana Square outside the presidential palace: the Taliban hanged Najibullah, the last president of the Communist government, from it shortly after they marched into Kabul in 1996.

title: Eight States Approve Medication Standard
description: Horse racing took a significant step toward adopting tough uniform rules nationwide Tuesday when eight states agreed to operate their racetracks under one set of rules that will severely restrict the administration of medication.

title: Courts Rein In Bloombergs Power to Make Policy
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg has long relished his reputation as a fearless urban innovator, treating New York City as his laboratory for groundbreaking experiments in public health and social engineering.

title: Cond Nast Adds to Job of Longtime Vogue Editor
description: Anna Wintour, who will mark her 25th anniversary as the editor of Vogue magazine this summer and who for the last year has been the subject of persistent rumors about a possible ambassadorship in the Obama administration, is taking on the additional role of artistic director of Cond Nast, the company announced on Wednesday.

title: A Nation of Nonreaders
description: To the Editor:

title: Judgment on Campus or in a Court of Law?
A Setback for Bloombergs Soda Limits
description: To the Editor:

title: Women in Agriculture
description: To the Editor:

title: Teenage Pregnancy
description: To the Editor:
