description: On the Upper East Side, an Israeli start-up is showing off what it thinks will be the future for local drivers, a process it gives the oxymoronic name mobile parking.

title: A Religious Ritual Attracts Even Nonbelievers
description: I grew up a fairly typical Italian-American New York Catholic, says John Corvino, 43, the chairman of the philosophy department at Wayne State University in Detroit. I was an altar boy, and later a lector. By the time I was in high school  at Chaminade, the Catholic boys school on Long Island  I decided I wanted to become a priest.

title: The Dread That Is Ted
description: It is possible that the high point of this week in Washington came when Senator Dianne Feinstein told Senator Ted Cruz to stop treating her as if she were in middle school.

title: U.S. Embassy Criticizes Pardons in Nigerian Corruption Cases
description: ABUJA, Nigeria  Convictions for corruption by top officials in Nigeria are so rare that they are treated as national milestones. So when the government rolled back one of the most prominent of them this week, the shock was commensurate.

title: Every Hair in Its Place
description: If life was fair, Id be 5 foot 5, Atsuko Tanaka said as she fondled a thick strand of hair and worked it over with a comb and blow dryer. Even with the stylist chair set to its lowest level, and standing on tiptoes, Ms. Tanaka had trouble styling the higher regions of the clients head.

title: Corrections: March 16, 2013
description: NATIONAL

title: French Study Indicates Some Patients Can Control H.I.V. After Stopping Treatment
description: French researchers have identified 14 adults who have been able to control their H.I.V. infection for years after stopping treatment with antiviral drugs, a finding that suggests that some patients might be able to achieve a so-called functional cure.

title: Totally Plugged-In
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  This was an interesting puzzle. Maybe its the kind of grid that should be held up as the Platonic ideal of Saturday puzzles.

title: Pitcher Is Said to Be Suspended for Ties to Anti-Aging Clinic
description: WASHINGTON  Major League Baseball suspended the journeyman minor league pitcher Cesar Carrillo on Friday, in the first instance of discipline linked to a South Florida anti-aging clinic. The clinic is under investigation for reportedly providing players with performance-enhancing drugs.

title: Ricky Gervais, Back in The Office Spotlight
description: Ten years ago, when we last saw David Brent in his natural element  the British edition of The Office  he was selling cleaning products, trying to get into the music business, enjoying a minor dating success and exhibiting a tiny spark of self-awareness.

title: Poetry or Striptease? What Night Is It?
description: Sunday and Monday nights, the restaurants stage belongs to poets. Wednesday through Saturday, it is for dancers in pasties and G-strings. Is New York a city of polymorphous perversity or what? I mean, poetry?

title: A Transgender Elected Official Reflects an Evolving Cuba
description: CAIBARIN, Cuba  JOS AGUSTN HERNNDEZ may not be precisely the kind of New Man whom Che Guevara pictured shaping Cuban socialism.

title: Listening to Jazz on 133rd
description: Q. My father once mentioned that when he was a young man, he and friends would listen to jazz in speakeasies on 133rd Street in Harlem. Can you tell me about that stretch?

title: Right to Lawyer Can Be Empty Promise for Poor
description: ADEL, Ga.  Billy Jerome Presley spent 17 months in a Georgia jail because he did not have $2,700 for a child support payment. He had no prior jail record but also no lawyer. In Baltimore last fall, Carl Hymes, 21, was arrested on charges of shining a laser into the eyes of a police officer. Bail was set at $75,000. He had no arrest record but also no lawyer. In West Orange, N.J., last summer, Walter Bloss, 89, was served with an eviction notice from the rent-controlled apartment he had lived in for 43 years after a dispute with his landlord. He had gone to court without a lawyer.

title: The Timess 1963 Article on the Gideon v. Wainwright Decision
description: In the Gideon v. Wainwright decision, which held that states must provide legal representation for the poor in serious criminal cases, the Supreme Court unanimously overturned its own 1942 decision in the landmark case of Betts v. Brady.

title: A Real Carbon Solution
description: Sometime this summer, in Odessa, Tex., the Summit Power Group plans to break ground on a $2.5 billion coal gasification power plant. Summit has named this the Texas Clean Energy Project. With good reason.

title: Knicks and Nets Wont Meet Again, but the Race Is On
description: When the Knicks and the Nets last met, the lasting image was of Joe Johnson, rising over J. R. Smith to sink the jump shot that clinched the game, tied the season series and silenced Madison Square Garden. That was Jan. 21.

title: China: Uighur Detained in Attack
description: An ethnic Uighur farmer has been detained and accused of killing five people and wounding seven in a knife attack on March 7 in Korla, a center of oil production in the western region of Xinjiang, according to a report on Friday on the Xinjiang government Web site that cited an article in the newspaper Xinjiang Daily. The farmer, Aizitiali Mamuti, 27, had been punished by the authorities for three previous knife attacks, the report said. Right before the attack, he had argued with relatives and had decided to take revenge on society. The attack raised questions about ethnic tensions in Korla; in Xinjiang, ethnic Uighurs often speak of discrimination by ethnic Han, who rule China. Four of the victims were Han and one was Hui; the attack also injured six Han and one Uighur.

title: Mexico: 7 Die in Cancn Shooting
description: Seven people, some of them members of a taxi union, were fatally shot in a bar in Cancn, several miles from the citys popular beachfront resorts, the authorities said Thursday. The state prosecutor, Armando Garca Torres, told a local radio station that the motive was under investigation, and that the possibility of the involvement of organized crime gangs, which have targeted taxi workers in other states, had not been ruled out. The shooting took place in a working-class neighborhood not on the tourist circuit, but Mexicos efforts to increase tourism have not been helped by recent episodes of crime near or in tourist spots, including the arrest last month of local police officers in the rape of an Italian woman in Playa del Carmen, near Cancn, and the sexual assault of six women from Spain last month at a beach house in Acapulco, on the Pacific coast.

title: A Last, Long Goodbye at the Garden
description: Moments like these made the Big East tournament, made it less of a basketball culmination and more of a touchstone, complete with a distinct New York flavor. Take Friday. Here was Syracuse, and here was Georgetown, with every seat filled in Madison Square Garden, in a game that went into overtime, undecided until the final shot.

title: Music Upstairs and Downstairs
description: The classical pianist Simone Dinnerstein, 40, has a hectic international performance schedule, but in Park Slope her husband, Jeremy Greensmith, 46, and their son, Adrian Greensmith, 11, keep her grounded. While she plays her nine-foot Hamburg Steinway concert grand on the second floor, Adrian practices downstairs on an electric guitar for his band, the Animation, and Mr. Greensmith cooks dinner or plans lessons for his fifth-grade classes at Public School 321. Ms. Dinnerstein (her first name is pronounced Simona) has a new album, Night, with the singer-songwriter Tift Merritt, being released on Tuesday in the United States; she and Ms. Merritt are scheduled to perform at Merkin Concert Hall on Thursday.

title: Still Together, 30 Years and 6 Deployments Later
description: Maj. Gen. Kenneth Dahl is a deputy commanding general for United States forces in Afghanistan, stationed in Kabul. His current assignment is to oversee the withdrawal of troops from the country, as well as to prepare for the removal of all military equipment and weaponry. From 2010 to 2011, he was stationed in Kandahar, and before that, from 2005 to 2006, he served in Iraq.

title: Character and Fixture Known as Hersh
description: Writers who covered the Big East tournament at Madison Square Garden share their favorite memories.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 15, 2013

title: No Confidence Vote for Head of N.Y.U.
description: The faculty of New York Universitys largest college this week approved a vote of no confidence in John Sexton, the universitys president, handing him an embarrassing setback at a time when he is aggressively selling the universitys expansion plans at home and abroad.

title: Bloomberg Welcomes Big Container of a Different Variety
description: Perhaps Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg did not notice the Coca-Cola supersign at his back, shimmering in Times Squares late morning cold on Friday.

title: Yanks Look for Help in Others Castoffs
description: TAMPA, Fla.  With injuries threatening to derail their season before it has started, the Yankees have acted aggressively during training camp by pouncing on players released by other teams.

title: Quinn Leads Democrats in Fund-Raising for 2013 Campaign
description: Even though she has already raised more than she needs for her mayoral primary campaign, Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, continued to distance herself financially from her main Democratic rivals, according to financial-disclosure reports released on Friday.

title: By Strategy and Luck, a Penguin Finds the Net
description: TORONTO  Pascal Dupuis was in the right place at the right time again.

title: Ex-Detective Gets 3 to 9 Years in Prison for D.W.I. Crash That Killed a Woman
description: A retired New York police detective who once tracked down dangerous fugitives was himself sent to prison on Friday for killing a 66-year-old woman in 2009 while driving drunk in the Bronx.

title: Donovans Pub, a Fixture in Queens, Gets New Owners
description: A week after Jimmy Jacobson started as a busboy at Donovans Pub on Roosevelt Avenue, he heard a rumor that his brand-new job was in jeopardy. In the checkout line at Key Food, a neighbor gave him the dirt: Joe Donovan was selling. The bar, a fixture of Woodside, Queens, since 1966, was going on the market.

title: Q&A: Keeping Files in Sync on Microsoft SkyDrive
description: Q.

title: Cartha D. DeLoach, No. 3 in the F.B.I., Is Dead at 92
description: Cartha D. DeLoach, who as a top aide and confidant to J. Edgar Hoover was the F.B.I.s liaison to the White House and a powerful intermediary between Hoover and President Lyndon B. Johnson during an especially tense political era, died on Wednesday on Hilton Head Island, S.C. He was 92.

title: Rafael Puyana, Famed Harpsichordist, Dies at 81
description: Rafael Puyana, an internationally acclaimed Colombian harpsichordist who was among the last disciples of Wanda Landowska, died on March 1 in Paris. He was 81.

title: Weakened Offense Adds Up to Another Early Exit for the U.S.
description: MIAMI  The chants were sporadic and muffled, nearly drowned out by horns, bells and cheers from the Puerto Rican faithful. It started: U-S-A! U-S-A! A few moments, after a weak effort, it died.

title: An Excerpt From Fever by Mary Beth Keane
description: Prologue1899

title: In Obesity Epidemic, Poverty Is an Ignored Contagion
description: Under the category Summer Rentals That Have Gone Terribly Wrong, there are perhaps few parallels to the experience of Charles Henry Warren, a Manhattan banker who, in 1906, took a house in Oyster Bay on Long Islands North Shore. By the end of the season, Mr. Warrens young daughter had developed typhoid. She was soon followed in illness by Mr. Warrens wife, a second daughter, two maids and a gardener. At the time, typhoid, a bacterial illness spread through contaminated food and water, was largely a disease of the urban poor. The propertys owner, George Thompson, concerned that the house, on which he relied for rental income, would become associated with tenement filth in the minds of wealthy New Yorkers, invited a sanitary engineer to determine the source of the outbreak.

title: Flamencos Foreign Saviors
description: SEVILLE, Spain  Alicia Mrquez raises her arms high above her head to get her students to look up while they stamp their feet. She claps her hands hard to keep them in rhythm. To teach flamenco these days here in the epicenter of the dance, she finds she must rely more on showing than telling: Though the 10 women in her class this morning are all accomplished dancers in their 20s and 30s, only one is Spanish.

title: IHT Quick Read: March 15
description: NEWS Reacting with unusual swiftness, the Vatican on Friday rejected any suggestion that Pope Francis of Argentina was implicated in his countrys so-called Dirty War during the 1970s, tackling the issue just two days after the pontiffs election. On a day when Francis delivered a warm address to his cardinals and continued to project humility, the Vatican seemed intent on quickly putting to rest questions about the popes past, dismissing them as opportunistic defamations from anticlerical leftists. Dan Wakin reports from Rome.

title: Inside Small Schools
description: Adlai E. Stevenson High School used to be one of the most dangerous in New York City. Today, it is home to nine small high schools that teach the same people, and each school has different results.

title: Global Flamenco
description: The thousands of foreigners who train in southern Spains flamenco schools are exporting its culture and passion to different countries.

title: With Sivas Help, Louisville Advances to Another Title Game
description: Few players look as at ease under the lights of the Big East tournament at Madison Square Garden as Louisvilles Peyton Siva. He smiles and winks and banters with referees and cameramen. At times, he carries himself like an on-court diplomat.

title: Whats on Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) THE BEST EXOTIC MARIGOLD HOTEL (2012) Seven financially distressed British retirees (Judi Dench, Bill Nighy, Penelope Wilton, Celia Imrie, Ronald Pickup, Tom Wilkinson and Maggie Smith) are lured by invitation to outsource themselves for a stay at what is billed as a luxurious retreat for the elderly and beautiful in Jaipur, India, in this film directed by John Madden. But upon arrival, they discover that the place is far from what was advertised by their host (Dev Patel, above right with Tena Desae), a wildly disorganized but enthusiastic young man who neglected to mention the lack of working telephones and doors on the rooms. This leisurely paced two-hour movie is a reasonably tasty banquet for the same Anglophiles who embrace Downton Abbey, Stephen Holden wrote in The New York Times. Although its not as tidy or comfy as that self-congratulating fantasy of British noblesse oblige or as elevated as the Merchant-Ivory films set in India, itll do nicely. He added, Besides its sterling cast, its ace in the hole is its pungent depiction of Jaipurs teeming streets, which give an otherwise well-mannered movie a blinding splash of color.

title: Nine High Schools, One Roof
description: When teachers heard footsteps thundering in the hallways at Adlai E. Stevenson High School in the Bronx, they threw down iron gates to stop student gangs from rioting, even as other students tried to deconstruct literature behind locked classroom doors. A decade ago, Stevenson, in the boroughs Castle Hill section, was one of the citys most dangerous, overcrowded schools, barely containing its 3,054 students  when they showed up for class.

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Himachal Pradesh: While the plains are gearing up for summer, there was fresh snowfall Thursday in the high-altitude regions of the northern state, according to an IANS report on the NDTV Web site.

title: At Indian Wells, Crowds Prove Must-See Match Is Doubles
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  For many of the worlds top players, the desert beauty of the BNP Paribas Open is better enjoyed with a buddy nearby. And the fans seem to prefer the pairs play, too.

title: After Negotiations, Cyprus Agrees to a Euro Zone Bailout Package
description: BRUSSELS  Cyprus reached a long-awaited bailout agreement early Saturday worth $13 billion, or 10 billion euros, that puts some of the burden for shoring up the islands beleaguered economy on its bank depositors.

title: The Weekend Word: Backlash
description: Todays Times

title: Ousted by the City, Tenants Seek a Home
description: The accommodations on the fourth floor of 81 Bowery were meager and tight: dozens of people, mostly new Chinese immigrants ranging in age from 19 to 88, crammed into small cubicles, sharing a bathroom. But for people with little money and nowhere to stay, like Zhu Benjin, 52, a construction worker, the closet-size cubicles were home.

title: From One Failing School, Nine Experiments
description: How one New York City high school was split into nine in the same building.

title: Five Arrested in Gang Rape of Swiss Tourist in Central India
description: 7:43 p.m. IST | Updated

title: The Very Confident Jean-Claude Trichet
description: Im somewhat belatedly getting to Jean-Claude Trichets op-ed in the Times; now that I have, I find myself puzzled. What, exactly, was his purpose in writing this? For that matter, what, exactly, did it say? I live and breathe this stuff, and I cant get much of a message here except trust us, we know what were doing.

title: Dropped Apostrophes Spark Grammar War in Britain
description: LONDON  A local council in southern England has sparked a grammar war with proposals to ban the apostrophe from its street signs to avoid what it calls adverse consequences in times of emergency.

title: With Marc Staal Injured, Brothers Reunion on Ice Will Have to Wait
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  Eric Staal noticed the date as soon as the N.H.L. schedule was released in January. On March 18, the Carolina Hurricanes were set to play the Rangers at Madison Square Garden.

title: For G.M.s, a Shortened Meeting Schedule but Lots to Discuss
description: The N.H.L. general managers will gather on Wednesday in Toronto for their only in-season meeting of this lockout-shortened campaign. They usually get together twice a season for two-day sessions, but this year, it is just the one day, for six hours.

title: 2 Tire Factories With Different Trajectories Reveal Social Schisms in France
description: AMIENS, France  This is a tale of two factories, across the road from each other in north Amiens, both owned by the same company, Goodyear Dunlop Tires France. But one, Goodyear, is scheduled to close after the union workers there refused to agree to new working conditions, which they argued were too harsh and benefited only the company. The other, Dunlop, has a promising future, and the company treats it very differently.

title: Variety: Do Your Diagramless
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  I have a love-hate relationship with diagramless puzzles. On the one hand, they are a breath of fresh air after a weeks worth of crosswords, and on the other hand, they take up a lot more of my time than your standard crossword does. As someone who doesnt have a whole lot of spare time and who apparently needs a refresher course in counting, the diagramless puzzles dont give me the satisfaction I look for in solving.

title: 2 Years Late, Zimbabwe Votes on New Constitution
description: HARARE, Zimbabwe  Batsi Munyaka, 27, an unemployed mechanic, had not read the document that could govern his nation for decades to come. But he said he was tired of trying to cobble together a living with little ventures that did not add up to much, and he hoped that a new Constitution, whatever its provisions, could help get Zimbabwes economy on track.

title: Assad Issues a Worldwide Plea as a Top Syrian General Defects
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A Syrian general who was in charge of army supplies and logistics has defected from the army, he said Saturday, a day after the rebels top military commander again called for members of the armed forces to join the uprising against President Bashar al-Assad, now entering its third year.

title: Objections to U.S. Troops Intensify in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The continued presence of American Special Operations troops in Wardak Province, against the wishes of the Afghan government, brought demonstrators to the capital on Saturday and provoked a strongly worded denunciation from Muslim clerics.

title: With Blessing, Pope Shows an Openness to Other Faiths
description: VATICAN CITY  Pope Francis on Saturday offered a silent blessing to an audience of journalists and other news media workers, acknowledging that not all of them were Catholic or believers  a rare gesture for a pontiff and a sign of openness toward other faiths and engagement with the secular world.

title: Pakistans Government Steps Down, a Milestone
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistans fragile democracy reached a milestone on Saturday when the government stepped down at the end of its five-year term, setting the stage for elections due to take place by mid-May.

title: SXSW Music: For 3 Teenage Brothers, Its Only Rock n Roll
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Radkeys tour bus is the family minivan, a venerable 2000 Plymouth Voyager with the nickname Harvey Dent because of a deep dent in one side that was never repaired.

title: For Syracuse, Leaving Big East Means Leaving a Home
description: As soon as the final buzzer sounded for Syracuse 58, Georgetown 55, in overtime Friday night, the fan held up a sign that read, The Rivalry Is Officially Closed. He wore a T-shirt with I Bleed Orange across the front and pulled off a mask with the likeness of the Syracuse coach, Jim Boeheim.

title: Days of Promise Fade for Ethanol
description: MACON, Mo.  Five years ago, rural America was giddy for ethanol.

title: Facing Bailout Tax, Cypriots Try to Get Cash Out of Banks
description: For an updated version of this article, click here.

title: Red Bulls Banish Miller
description: HARRISON, N.J.  Red Bulls Coach Mike Petke not only benched defender Roy Miller for Saturdays match against D.C. United, but dropped him from the clubs 18-man game-day roster so he could return to Costa Rica to prepare for Fridays World Cup qualifier against the United States in Commerce City, Colo.

title: Mens Tennis Tour Loves L.A. No Longer
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  Frank Sinatra sang at the Hollywood Bowl, Mikhail Baryshnikov danced at Shrine Auditorium, George Carlin told jokes at the Improv Comedy Club on Melrose Avenue. In Los Angeles over the decades, more stars have been visible on the night stage than in the night sky.

title: An Aging American Legion Fights for Relevancy
description: ELGIN, Ill.  At first glance, the humble American Legion Post 57 just off Liberty Street in this tired river town near Chicago seems like a perfect slice of Americana  careworn, cozy and forever preserved in the amber of its ale and old-timey, wood-paneled charm.

title: Zimbabweans Place High Hopes on New Constitution
description: Few have read the new draft or know of its provisions, but many hope that it will help set a course of democracy and economic growth.

title: As Big East Changes, So Will Many Spring Rituals
description: As a law student living in New York City less than 10 years ago, Dan Guisbond had to watch his spending. Every March, he would ask for one birthday gift: a book of tickets to the Big East tournament at Madison Square Garden.

title: End of the World as the Yankees Knew It
description: The greatest decline-and-fall stories involve the mightiest empires. Ancient Greece. Rome. The borscht belt.

title: Kenyan Court Asked to Order New Election For President
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Raila Odinga, the second-place finisher in Kenyas presidential race this month, filed a sweeping petition before Kenyas Supreme Court on Saturday contending glaring anomalies in the vote and calling for the court to nullify the results and order a new election.

title: Dodgers Catcher A.J. Elliss Long Climb to Success
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: What the Church Needs Now
description: THE man who was transformed last week from Jorge Mario Bergoglio into the first Pope Francis faces a long list of challenges, each seemingly more daunting than the last. Theres the immediate need to reform a Vatican bureaucracy whose dysfunction helped sabotage his predecessors reign. Theres the larger challenge of lifting the shadow of the sex abuse crisis from the Western church. And then comes the task of making Catholic Christianity seem vital and appealing in cultures where the new popes church is widely regarded as archaic, irrelevant, or malign.

title: When I Hire You, Im Hiring Your Mentors Judgment
description: This interview with  Ilene Gordon, C.E.O. of Ingredion, a company that turns raw materials into ingredients for the food, beverage and other industries, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: The Gender Gap in Pain
description: TO the list of differences between men and women, we can add one more: the drug-dose gender gap. Doctors and researchers increasingly understand that there can be striking variations in the way men and women respond to drugs, many of which are tested almost exclusively on males. Early this year, for instance, the Food and Drug Administration announced that it was cutting in half the prescribed dose of Ambien for women, who remained drowsy for longer than men after taking the drug.

title: As Ethanols Luster Fades, Communities Struggle
description: The drought that has ravaged much of the nations crops has pushed commodity prices so high that ethanol has become too expensive to produce.

title: Unfair Punishments
description: Congress embraced a destructive policy when it decreed in 1996 that people convicted of drug felonies would henceforth be banned for life from receiving food stamps or cash assistance unless they lived in a state that expressly opted out of the ban.

title: Its Lose-Lose vs. Win-Win-Win-Win-Win
description: ONE of my favorite quotes about the state of U.S. politics was offered a couple years ago by Gerald Seib, a Wall Street Journal columnist, when he observed that America and its political leaders, after two decades of failing to come together to solve big problems, seem to have lost faith in their ability to do so. A political system that expects failure doesnt try very hard to produce anything else. Thats us today  our entire political system is guilty of the soft bigotry of low expectations for ourselves.

title: Googling You
description: The settlement last week between a group of state attorneys general and Google over the companys improper data collection from home wireless networks shows the need to overhaul a 27-year-old federal law that is not up to the task of addressing new forms of privacy invasion.

title: Elephants in Danger
description: Tens of thousands of African elephants are killed annually, the continents worst wildlife crisis in decades.

title: Slaughter of the African Elephants
description: THERE is nothing a mother elephant will not do for her infant, but even she cannot protect it from bullets. About a year ago, poachers attacked a family of forest elephants in central Africa. The biologist who witnessed the attack told us that wildlife guards were completely outgunned. In the end, an elephant mother, riddled with bullets and trumpeting with pain and fear, was left to use her enormous body to shield her baby. Her sacrifice was for naught; the baby was also killed.

title: To Catch a Tarpon, Be Ready for a Fight
description: JUCARO, Cuba  I stood on the bow of a Dolphin skiff anchored at the edge of a large channel in Jardines de la Reina. The incoming tide flooded through the strait with the Caribbean, a patchwork of shifting blues and greens, stretching to the south.

title: A Contemporary Circus
description: After decades of decline, the circus is booming. Here are a sample of contemporary acts from around the world.

title: Wozniacki Survives Battle of Moonballs
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  A thin crescent moon rose over Indian Wells about 4 p.m. Friday. But the moonballs began to take flight a few hours later.

title: Moving Beyond the Big Tent
description: SEVERAL years ago, in Paris, I attended a performance of nouveau cirque, or new circus. This was far from your usual lion tamers and elephants: the show took place in a sleek white tent, its lobby filled with fashionable people lounging on red velvet couches. The performers, who wore tattered suit coats and scuffed leather shoes, were actors as much as acrobats, dancers as much as daredevils. They chanted Proust into crackling microphones and shouted Simon and Garfunkel lyrics.

title: Open and Closed
description: CAN 3D printing be subversive? asks a voice in the creepiest Internet video youll be likely to watch this month. Its a trailer for Defcad.com, a search engine for 3D-printable designs for things institutions and industries have an interest in keeping from us, including medical devices, drugs, goods, guns.

title: Israeli Areas Near the Old City
description: Israeli houses and settlements in East Jerusalem.

title: Bishop Daniel Flores
description: Daniel Flores is the bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brownsville, Tex., a border town where 85 percent of the population is Catholic, the highest concentration in the United States. Known for his accessibility, empathy and advocacy of immigration reform, he has a devoted following among Catholics and non-Catholics alike.

title: Lean In, Buddy Boy
description: Lean Back (and Relax!)

title: Smart Drones
description: IF you find the use of remotely piloted warrior drones troubling, imagine that the decision to kill a suspected enemy is not made by an operator in a distant control room, but by the machine itself. Imagine that an aerial robot studies the landscape below, recognizes hostile activity, calculates that there is minimal risk of collateral damage, and then, with no human in the loop, pulls the trigger.

title: A High Line in Queens: Just Imagine the Food
description: For almost a century, American railroads of all sizes have been shedding branch and feeder lines, leaving more than 100,000 miles of abandoned railways across the country. And for the last 50 years, conservationists have been working to re-engineer these railways into long, narrow strips of parkland.

title: Beyond the Bedroom
description: IT was too much to hope that after the white smoke rose and the TV anchors began nervously filling time and the cameras lingered for what seemed an eternity on that balcony over St. Peters Square, the man who stepped onto it would be someone open to revisiting the most archaic, obsolete matters of Roman Catholic doctrine. The group electing him was assembled by the last two popes, both conservatives. Its choice was bound to be more carbon copy than new page.

title: Healing the Hospital Hierarchy
description: A hospital is, by its nature, the scene of constant life-or-death situations. Its the work we nurses, doctors and other health professionals do; we chose it. The threat of harm can jazz you up or bring you down, but what it should demand, always, is the highest possible level of professionalism. Whos at risk when that doesnt occur?

title: Sunday Dialogue: As the U.S. Reacts to North Koreas Threats
description: Readers discuss whether military defense and deterrence or diplomacy is most effective.

title:
Even on Reserves, Scant Protection for Elephants:
Three Stories From One Region
description: Like so many of Africas wilderness areas, the Buffalo Springs and Samburu reserves in Kenya are too cramped  smaller than the city of Detroit  for the majestic elephants they are supposed to protect.

title: The Real Spending Problem
description: The budget fight in Washington, which entered a new round last week as Senate Democrats and House Republicans introduced dueling plans, is usually cast as a contest between raising taxes and cutting spending. In fact, the taxes-versus-spending distinction is largely meaningless.

title: Palin Bolsters Insurgents at Conservative Retreat
description: Sarah Palins appearances no longer inspire speculation about her presidential aspirations, but her reception at a large gathering of conservatives on Saturday underscored her enduring popularity with the right. In a speech here, she offered zingers for the Republican base but also a strenuous defense of her Tea Party friends who are challenging the Republican establishment.

title: How Much the N.Y.C. Mayoral Candidates Have Raised and Spent
description: A table and maps show who is ahead in the fund-raising race.

title: JPMorgans Follies, for All to See
description: BE afraid.

title: Its One Mistake for Another Here
description: THE Senate committee report on the $6.2 billion loss at JPMorgan Chase offers a peephole into the minds of the traders as they realized their big complex bets were melting down.

title: Embrace New Skills, and Open New Doors
description: IM a classically trained professional dancer, and I have three different jobs. My main one is performing with a group named Evidence, A Dance Company, which is based in Brooklyn. Im also a co-choreographer and dancer in a three-person musical comedy group, Adira Amram and the Experience. On Saturdays, if not on the road with one of those groups, I teach dance at the Ailey School.

title: SXSW Music: After a Hiatus, Green Day Returns
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Green Days Billie Joe Armstrong said little about his recent stint in rehab during a two-hour concert at Austin City Limits Live on Friday night, but he made it clear that he was in a celebratory mood, whipping the crowded theater into a frenzy with exhortations to get crazy.

title: A War, Before and After, Part 1
description: Ten years ago this week, on March 20, 2003, the United States invaded Iraq.

title: Does Affirmative Action Do What It Should?
description: WHATS more important to how your life turns out: the prestige of the school you attend or how much you learn while youre there? Does the answer to this question change if you are the recipient of affirmative action?

title: How to Force Ethics on the Food Industry
description: A COURT has struck down, at least for now, New York Citys attempt to slow the growth of obesity by limiting the portion size of sweetened beverages.

title: SXSW Music: The 1960s, Getting Better With Age
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Ever since Ive been coming to the South by Southwest Music Festival (and the CMJ Music Marathons, too), Ive been running across young bands aiming to recreate the psychedelia of the late 1960s  which is, as the years go by, a time before many of them were born. You might expect that as the era recedes, so do its traditions, not to mention the inevitable breakdown and disappearance of authentic equipment. And beyond the indie-rock circuit, its pretty unlikely that that totally 1960s-style psychedelia would become a commercial force. But against those odds, young bands keep doing the 1960s better.

title: Road Runners Facing Difficulty Months After Marathon Uproar
description: The furor over New York Road Runners handling of its marathon last year has died down, but questions about the groups future persist, including whether its dominance has started to erode because of rival race organizers and disaffected runners. Read full story here.

title: No Trading Nuclear Arms for Aid, North Korea Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea said Saturday that its nuclear weapons were not a bargaining chip to trade for economic concessions, warning that it would never negotiate with the United States as long as Washington maintained its hostile policy toward the North.

title: Coffees Economics, Rewritten by Farmers
description: IN 2005, Kenneth Lander, a lawyer in Monroe, Ga., moved with his wife, stepdaughter and the youngest three of his seven children to a coffee farm in San Rafael de Abangares, Costa Rica. He always had a heart, he said, for Latin America, and after a vacation to the lush cloud forests near Monteverde in 2004, he was determined to return on a more permanent basis.

title: Taking Over the Supply Chain
description: Thrive Farmers Coffee is built on a system that pays coffee farmers after their coffee has been exported, packaged and sold to retailers.

title: Questions of Vulnerability as Heat Stay Hot
description: For the Miami Heat to win their 21st consecutive game, they had to get through one of the few teams to win 20 in a row, the Milwaukee Bucks. Of course, the Bucks of this season are a far cry from the 1970-71 team that was led by a big three that rivals Miamis: Lew Alcindor, Oscar Robertson and Bob Dandridge.

title: Celebrating St. Patricks Day
description: People around the country celebrated the holiday with parades and green attire.

title: Ian M. Ross, a President at Bell Labs, Dies at 85
description: Ian M. Ross, who helped perfect the transistor and calculate whether the moons surface could support a spaceships weight, and then went on to lead Bell Laboratories, the legendary fount of technological marvels and Nobel Prize winners, died on March 10 at his home in New Smyrna Beach, Fla. He was 85.

title: 36 Hours in Bangkok
description: How to spend 36 hours in Bangkok, a modern city with no shortage of tradition and graceful beauty.

title: A Profession With an Egalitarian Core
description: ECONOMICS is sometimes associated with the study and defense of selfishness and material inequality, but it has an egalitarian and civil libertarian core that should be celebrated. And that core may guide us in some surprising directions.

title: Challenging Management (but Not the Market)
description: SOME investors make bold bets on the market, wagering on the financial effects of budget battles in Washington or the latest leadership shuffle in Beijing, Tokyo or Rome. David Booth, whose name is on the door of the University of Chicago Booth School of Business, made his fortune another way.

title: Never Turning Away
description: GROWING up, I spent a lot of time in hospitals. My sister died of complications from birth defects when she was a year old, and in later years my mother developed multiple sclerosis. Both she and my grandmother died from the disease. I faced several difficult situations and learned to remain calm in a crisis.

title: Jewish and Muslim, Bonding Over Dieting
description: BROOKLINE, Mass.  Your mother-in-law fixes you a plate of food. Does she determine what you eat, and how much?

title: Red Bulls Rewind: Over the Line?
description: Did it or didnt it? That was the question Saturday afternoon after D.C. United goalkeeper Bill Hamid swatted a ball off his line in the first minute of added time to preserve a 0-0 tie against the Red Bulls at Red Bull Arena.

title: In Effort to Try Dictator, Guatemala Shows New Judicial Might
description: XIX, Guatemala  Tiburcio Utuy thought he saw fear cross the former dictators face.

title: Wrights Backup Justin Turner Rolls His Ankle
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Justin Turner, the primary candidate to replace David Wright for however long he will be sidelined, picked up his own injury Saturday during the Mets 4-2 loss to the Miami Marlins.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, March 17
description: In the wake of President Obamas meetings on Capitol Hill with lawmakers from both parties, the Sunday shows feature discussions of whether Congress is any closer to a fiscal agreement.

title: Murmurs About Political Outsider at Conservative Gathering
description: OXON HILL, Md.  A new face generated curiosity and unexpected 2016 speculation at the Conservative Political Action Conference on Saturday: Ben Carson, the celebrated neurosurgeon.

title: Ten Years Later
description: Anniversaries of important events generally lead to a spate of articles and news reports looking back at those events. Its not exactly irrational: the date can serve as a kind of focal point, in which articles that could have been written at any time can be published in the expectation that other pieces on the same subject will be published at the same time, raising the story to prominence.

title: Any Pun for Tennis?
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  First of all, how did I get to this point in my life and not know that Barbie a) had a last name, and 2) that that last name was ROBERTS? Granted, I wasnt big on Barbie dolls, but it seems like the kind of pop culture factoid I should have known.

title: How Top Students of Different Incomes Apply for College
description: A new study found that a majority of high-achieving high school seniors from low-income families did not apply to any selective colleges.

title: Better Colleges Failing to Lure Talented Poor
description: Most low-income students who have top test scores and grades do not even apply to the nations best colleges, according to a new analysis of every high school student who took the SAT in a recent year.

title: Jeter Starts Second Straight Game at Shortstop
description: TAMPA, Fla.  For the second consecutive game, Derek Jeter started at shortstop, which normally would not be too significant. Jeter has been the teams starting shortstop since 1996.

title: Walter Pierce, Modernist Architect, Dies at 93
description: Had Paul Revere made another pass through Lexington, Mass., only this time in the 1940s, he might have issued a different warning as he galloped again past the familiar old saltboxes and Colonial houses still bordering its New England streets:

title: Diverting Your Dollars From the Purpose Theyre Meant to Serve
description: Some people will do anything to stay away from tax bills and budget cuts.

title: Water Rate in Small Town Has Residents Fuming
description: BLUE MOUND, Tex.  Minnie Wengert does not have a washing machine or a dishwasher. The 94-year-old conserves water by hand-washing dishes, using her shower sparingly and not watering the lawn.

title: A Tough Road for Charter Proposal
description: When Jeb Bush, the former governor of Florida, told Texas lawmakers recently to go big or go home on education reform, the Senate education chairman, Dan Patrick, had already embraced that advice.

title: So Much for Hoop Dreams, at Least for This Year
description: On Friday the University of Texas at Austin will play host to the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament for the first time in eight years. But what you may not see on the court at the Frank Erwin Center is a single team from Texas.

title: Ukraine Wins Womens Event Skipped by Many Big Names
description: It is not easy to round up national squads for international competitions, judging by the notable absences at the Womens World Team Championship in Astana, Kazakhstan.

title: Guatemalas Long March Toward Justice
description: Few believed the trial of the former dictator Efran Ros Montt for genocide and crimes against humanity committed during his rule would ever take place. But Guatemalas justice system has begun a transformation.

title: U.S. Cancels Part of Missile Defense That Russia Opposed
description: MOSCOW  The United States has effectively canceled the final phase of a Europe-based missile defense system that was fiercely opposed by Russia and cited repeatedly by the Kremlin as a major obstacle to cooperation on nuclear arms reductions and other issues.

title: Worker Is Crushed by Garbage Truck Compactor in Brooklyn
description: An 18-year-old man was killed in Brooklyn on Saturday morning after being struck by the compactor of a privately owned garbage truck, the police said.

title: Trying to Make the Majors, a Met Copes With the Death of a Child
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Spring training is full of players who say that they are in the best shape of their lives, that they are raring to grab the game by its scruff and bend it to their will.

title: The Cossacks Are Back. May the Hills Tremble.
description: STAVROPOL, Russia  Outside this citys police headquarters on a recent night, a priest in a purple velvet hat and gold stole moved from one man to the next, offering a cross to be kissed and drenching their faces with holy water from a long brush.

title: Russias Cossack Revival
description: As the Russian government aims to promote a more conservative tone, Cossacks are playing a growing role, but threatening a gentle ethnic balance.

title: In Final, Nadal Will Meet Del Potro, Who Upset Djokovic
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  Although his nearly uninterrupted clay-court dominance has justifiably gotten most of the attention, Rafael Nadal has also been difficult to stop on the slow, gritty hardcourts in this desert community.

title: Cossacks Expand Their Role in Russian Life
description: Cossacks are revered here for their bravery and pre-modern code of honor, like cowboys in America or samurai in Japan, and men in Cossack uniforms are all over Russia these days, attacking exhibits and theaters as standard-bearers for a resurgent church.

title: Scenes From Day 4 of South by Southwest Music
description: Performances on the fourth day of the festival included ones by Usher, Half Moon Run and Outer Minds.

title: Yankees Unveil a New Outfielder
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Outfielder Brennan Boesch played his first game for the Yankees in Saturday afternoons 7-0 loss to the Philadelphia Phillies at Steinbrenner Field.

title: Scenes From Day 4 of South by Southwest Music
description: Performances on the fourth day of the festival included ones by Usher, Half Moon Run and Outer Minds.

title: Evolution of the New York Drivers License
description: New York State first began issuing paper licenses to chauffeurs in 1910, and the shape, form and style have changed over the past century, adapting to new laws and technologies.

title: Black and White and Wallet-Size, Unfit for Faking
description: ALBANY  Over the years, the authorities across the nation have tried all manner of tactics to combat fake drivers licenses. Holograms. Water marks. Even blunt red letters reading UNDER 21.

title: New Apartments Will Complicate Jerusalem Issue
description: JERUSALEM  The Muslim call to prayer resounds through the traffic circle in the Palestinian enclave of Ras al-Amud, through the taxi stand where waiting drivers sip sweet coffee and the vegetable market where boys help their fathers after school. It can also be heard down the street in Maalot David, where a few Jewish families have quietly taken up residence in newly renovated apartments with prime views of Jerusalems Old City.

title: New Pope Puts Spotlight on Jesuits, an Influential Yet Self-Effacing Order
description: ROME  Men who join the Jesuits, the Roman Catholic Churchs largest religious order, take vows of poverty, chastity and obedience, and promise never to take any high office in the church.

title: Wisconsin Forward Gets a History Lesson
description: CHICAGO  Ah, youth. Wisconsin forward Ryan Evans never heard of Hal Greer, the Philadelphia 76ers star guard from the 1960s, until Badgers Coach Bo Ryan suggested a radical solution to Evanss free-throw-shooting problems.

title: China Names New Team to Secure Its Place in Asia and Face U.S. Competition
description: BEIJING  Chinas new foreign policy team, announced at a news conference on Saturday, includes officials whose records suggest the government will concentrate on consolidating what it considers the countrys rightful place at the center of Asia, even as the Obama administration says it will deploy more military power in the region.

title: Anthony and Chandler Are Likely to Rest Again
description: LOS ANGELES  Carmelo Anthony rejoined his teammates Saturday, two days after having fluid drained from his right knee in New York. But he did not join them on a practice court at U.C.L.A., instead taking a few jump shots off to the side.

title: One Final Home Win for B.U.s Coach
description: BOSTON  Boston University gave Jack Parker, its soon-to-be-retiring head coach, one final victory Saturday night on the rink that bears his name. The Terriers defeated Merrimack College, 5-3, to sweep their Hockey East quarterfinal series, 2-0.

title: Accuser Testifies in Ohio Rape Case; Verdict Expected
description: STEUBENVILLE, Ohio  A 16-year-old girl who prosecutors say was raped by two high school football stars here last August after a night of drinking took the witness stand on Saturday and told a judge that she had no memory of a six-hour period during which each of the teenagers is said to have assaulted her.

title: Louisville Takes Trophy on Its Way Out
description: After a week of nostalgia and remembrance, in this valedictory Big East tournament that threw open and widened memory lane, the championship game boiled down to basketball, plain and simple. That captured perfectly all that the tournament came to mean over the years.

title: Civil Rights Cold Cases: We Are Writing to Inform You ...
description: Examine forty-six letters from the F.B.I. to family members of the deceased regarding homicide cases from the civil rights era.

title: When Cold Cases Stay Cold
description: FERRIDAY, La.  In the spring of 1965, the Federal Bureau of Investigation in Washington received a letter from Concordia Parish in northeastern Louisiana. Addressed to the bureaus director, J. Edgar Hoover, the letter pleaded for justice in the killing of a well-respected black merchant.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, March 17
description: They respect strength here.

title: Brooklyn: The Brand
description: How the borough  with its local, back-to-the-basics lifestyle  morphed from landmass to global phenomenon.

title: Corrections: March 17, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Big East Tournament Replay
description: Images from Syracuses game against Louisville in the final Big East tournament championship game before the leagues core members go their separate ways.

title: Kimberly Holton, Garrett van Ryzin
description: Kimberly Alexis DaCosta Holton and Garrett John van Ryzin were married Saturday at St. Pauls Chapel on the Columbia University campus in New York. The Rev. David W. Havens, a Disciples of Christ minister and the grooms stepfather, performed the ceremony.

title: Rachel Snyder and Drew Katz
description: Rachel Lauren Snyder, the daughter of April J. Snyder and Dr. Robert A. Snyder of Golden Beach, Fla., was married Saturday evening to Drew Alexander Katz, the son of Marjorie J. Katz and Lewis Katz of Cherry Hill, N.J. Rabbi Aaron Krupnick officiated at the Breakers Hotel in Palm Beach, Fla., with Rabbi Edwin Farber taking part.

title: Anna Richardson and Davis White
description: Anna Gabriella Richardson and Davis Cochrane White were married Saturday at the Episcopal Church of St. Mary the Virgin in San Francisco. The Rev. Scott E. Richardson, an Episcopal priest and the churchs rector, performed the ceremony, assisted by the Right Rev. Marc Handley Andrus, the bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of California.

title: Leslie Griffith, David Graham
description: Leslie Ann Griffith and David Andrew Graham were married Saturday in Durham, N.C. The Rev. Bruce B. Lawrence, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the Sarah P. Duke Gardens on the campus of Duke University, where Father Lawrence is a professor emeritus of Islamic studies.

title: Cristina Ros and Alexander Blankfein
description: Cristina Mercedes Ros, the daughter of Dr. Ana M. Viamonte Ros of Coral Gables, Fla., and Dr. Pablo Riera Ros of Cleveland Heights, Ohio, was married Saturday in Miami to Alexander David Blankfein, a son of Laura Jacobs Blankfein and Lloyd C. Blankfein of Manhattan. Rabbi Judy Kempler officiated at the Vizcaya Museum and Gardens.

title: Jamie Alter, Gary Litt
description: Jamie Lauren Alter and Gary Daniel Litt were married Saturday evening at Oheka Castle in Huntington, N.Y. Rabbi Irwin Zeplowitz officiated.

title: Katherine Graziano, Matthew Smith
description: Katherine Graziano and Matthew Jared Smith were married Saturday at St. Bernard Church in Pittsburgh. The Rev. Brian Noel, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Jennifer Polin, Jonathan Grossman
description: Dr. Jennifer Ariella Polin, a daughter of Debra Aaronson Polin and Dr. Kenneth S. Polin of Skokie, Ill., is to be married Sunday to Jonathan David Grossman, a son of Debora G. Nobel and Dr. Elliot A. Grossman of Merrick, N.Y. Rabbi Milton H. Polin, the paternal grandfather of the bride, is to officiate at the Crest Hollow Country Club in Woodbury, N.Y.

title: Alexandra Manzella, Timothy Kistner
description: Alexandra Lynn Manzella and Timothy Hale Kistner were married Saturday evening by the Rev. Kimi Riegel, a Unitarian Universalist minister, at the Colony Club, an event space in Detroit.

title: Erin Mumford, Andrew Glenn
description: Erin Elizabeth Mumford and Andrew Martin Glenn were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Peter Schweitzer at the Tribeca Rooftop in Manhattan.

title: Jeanne Hoffman, William Glod Jr.
description: Jeanne Marie Hoffman and William Davis Glod Jr. were married Saturday in New Rochelle, N.Y. The Rev. Maureen Burwell Pollinger, a minister ordained by the New Seminary for Interfaith Studies in New York, officiated at the Greentree Country Club.

title: Malancha Gupta, John Hennessy
description: Malancha Gupta and John Joseph Hennessy were married Saturday evening at the Eventi Hotel in Manhattan. Pandit Nikhil Trivedi, a Hindu priest, officiated.

title: Susanna Kim and Charles Han
description: Susanna Gyu-jin Kim and Charles Soo Han were married Saturday at the Boston Harbor Hotel in Boston. The Rev. Eugene K. Lee, a minister ordained by the Evangelical Covenant Church of North America, officiated.

title: Leah Sullivan and Joshua Pollack
description: Leah McCord Sullivan and Joshua David Pollack were married Saturday at Dahlgren Chapel at Georgetown University in Washington. The Rev. George R. Fitzgerald, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Kilian Tracy, Fitz Ollison
description: The Dolphins Get a New Fan

title: Virginia VanZanten, Matthew Perlman
description: Virginia Kyle VanZanten and Matthew Blake Perlman were married Saturday at the Dumbo Loft, an event space in Brooklyn. Megan R. Brown, a friend of the bride who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Christina Poulsen, Maxwell Brunner
description: Christina Lee Poulsen, a daughter of Joyce Lee Poulsen and Poul Skoedt Poulsen of San Rafael, Calif., was married Saturday to Maxwell Roy Brunner, a son of Sally Taylor Brunner and Timothy Allan Brunner of Ridgefield, Conn. Canon Mark Stanger, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Grace Cathedral in San Francisco.

title: Nancy Quay and Sherry Marcy
description: A Partner and the Key to Her Survival

title: Italian Lawmakers Elect Speakers, but Stable Government Remains Elusive
description: ROME  The Italian Parliament elected speakers for the two houses of Parliament on Saturday, but failed to find broad agreement among lawmakers in what is shaping up to be an uphill effort to form a stable government after inconclusive elections last month.

title: Dominicans Show Culture in Emotional Style of Play
description: MIAMI  The Dominican Republic has celebrated every hit as if it were its last, every putout as if it had decided the game. Its players have clenched their fists, pounded their chests and screamed  sometimes in the fourth inning. And if the Dominicans took a late lead, the whole dugout would explode, players bursting onto the field, like confetti out of a party popper.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 16, 2013

title: Red Bulls Do Everything but Win, Again
description: HARRISON, N.J.  When they last met, the Red Bulls and D.C. United sat through a one-day postponement of their playoff game because of a snowstorm. The next day, D.C. ended the Red Bulls 2012 season.

title: Dieng Powers Cardinals Defense, and Their Big Comeback
description: Standing in the center circle for the opening tipoff of the last tournament of the old Big East, Louisvilles Gorgui Dieng knew the moment was weighty, but he may not have recognized just how much so.

title: U.S. Soccer: Klinsmanns Choices, Summer Friendlies, Womens Injuries
description: Jurgen Klinsmann will name his roster Monday for the United States next two World Cup qualifiers. The games  against Costa Rica on Friday in Commerce City, Colo., and against Mexico next Tuesday in Mexico City  wont decide whether the Americans play in the 2014 World Cup, but they could make getting there a lot easier, or infinitely more difficult.

title: New Prime Minister Seeks to Reassure World on Chinas Rise
description: BEIJING  Does China have a growing image problem in the world?

title: The U.S. and Afghanistan
description: The long troubled U.S. - Afghan relationship winds down.

title: A Crowded Venue for Justin Timberlake
description: If you want to know how far the South by Southwest Music Festival has strayed from its anti-corporate, indie rock roots, you need only consider this: One of the most popular shows on the final night of the festival was Justin Timberlake, playing a concert sponsored by Chevrolet to promote the newly revamped Myspace Web site.

title:
Turmoil in Cyprus
Over a Bailout
Rattles Europe
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus  Europes surprising decision early Saturday to force bank depositors in Cyprus to share in the cost of the latest euro zone bailout set off increasing outrage and turmoil in Cyprus on Sunday and fueled fears that the trouble will spread to countries like Spain and Italy.

title: In China, New Premier Says He Seeks a Just Society
description: BEIJING  Li Keqiang, in his first comments as Chinas prime minister, laid out a vision on Sunday of a more equitable society in which environmental protection trumps unbridled growth and government officials put the peoples welfare before their own financial interests.

title: The Psychologist as (Wary) Parent
description: Nine years ago, I was eight and a half months pregnant with my first child and sitting with Debby, a treasured senior colleague and gifted psychotherapist. She departed from our regular business to venture:

title: Kenyans Win in Citys First Major Race Since Marathon Cancellation
description: Freezing temperatures and a dusting of snow Sunday did little to slow Wilson Kipsang, who ran away from a pack of elite runners to win the 13.1-mile New York City Half, the first major road race in the city since Hurricane Sandy led to the cancellation of the marathon in November.

title: U.N. Revives Effort on Pact to Regulate Arms Trade
description: In the shadow of the re-energized gun-control debate in the United States, negotiators at the United Nations will reconvene this week to try to reach a final agreement on a treaty to regulate the global trade in conventional weapons, a lucrative business that rights groups call the main source of illicit arms fueling deadly conflicts around the world.

title: Ohio Teenagers Guilty in Rape That Social Media Brought to Light
description: STEUBENVILLE, Ohio  Two high school football stars were found guilty on Sunday of raping a 16-year-old girl last summer in a case that drew national attention for the way social media spurred the initial prosecution and later helped galvanize national outrage.

title: Wright Returns to Mets And Says Pain Is Easing
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Boldface names swept through the Mets spring training complex Sunday, including Regis Philbin, whose ceremonial first pitch sent cellphone cameras aloft around Tradition Field, and third baseman David Wright, whose presence in the clubhouse after his return from the World Baseball Classic also caused a stir.

title: Disruptions: Stuck With a Provider Over the Long Haul
description: If dating were like the cellphone industry, you would have to sign a contract when you entered a relationship stating that you would remain monogamous for two years, even if you wanted to break up. Thats what cellular carriers have pulled off by successfully lobbying for a recent government ruling that you cannot take the phone you paid for and switch to another provider.

title: Whats on Sunday
description: 10 P.M. (E!) PLAYING WITH FIRE The former Top Chef competitor Candice Kumai; the night-life impresarios turned food entrepreneurs Derek and Daniel Koch; the brand ambassador Anna Boiardi; the pastry chef Julie Elkind; the restaurateur Todd English; and the actress and bakery owner Jennifer Esposito turn their lives into open cookbooks as they storm the New York culinary scene in this new reality series. In this premiere episode, the Koch twins prepare for the grand opening of Toy, a restaurant inside the Gansevoort Hotel. Ms. Boiardi, meanwhile, finds that her mother disapproves of her Bolognese-cooking technique. And Mr. English celebrates his birthday and the 10th anniversary of his restaurant Olives. Above, a scene from the show.

title: Disneys Oz Keeps Lead at Box Office
description: Oz the Great and Powerful continued to cast a spell on moviegoers over the weekend, while another magician  The Incredible Burt Wonderstone  essentially arrived to a chorus of boos. Oz (Disney) took in an estimated $42.2 million at theaters in the United States and Canada, for a strong two-week total of $145 million, according to Hollywood.com, which compiles box-office data.

title: Excerpt: 'The Mound Builders'
description: A scene from the Signature Theaters revival of Lanford Wilsons 1975 play.

title: Original Review: The Mound Builders
description: Mel Gussows 1975 review of the Lanford Wilson play.

title: Turkish Authorities Detain Man in Death of Tourist From Staten Island
description: ISTANBUL  A 46-year-old homeless man suspected in the killing of a Staten Island woman was taken into custody on Sunday, the Turkish authorities said.

title: A Low-Carb, Low-Budget Cooking Show, Fiercely Seasoned
description: Television cooking shows, with their globe-trotting superstar chefs, are no longer humble small-studio affairs. But there is one program, glamorous in its own way, that gleefully bucks the trend. It is taped in a cramped apartment kitchen in Jackson Heights, Queens, and appears on public access. Its star is a trim, sassy drag queen named Soraya Sobreidad who preaches the gospel of healthful Puerto Rican cuisine.

title: Funny or Die Makes a Steve Jobs Movie
description: LOS ANGELES  Techies have been keeping a hot eye on dueling Steve Jobs biopics, one an indie starring Ashton Kutcher and the other, written by Aaron Sorkin, in the works at Sony, which made The Social Network.

title: A Senate Plan Alters Waiting Periods for Immigration
description: WASHINGTON  The nations 11 million illegal immigrants would have to wait a full decade for a green card but could earn citizenship just three years after that, under a provision being finalized by a bipartisan group of eight senators working to devise an overhaul of immigration law, several people with knowledge of the negotiations said.

title: The Cypriot Haircut
description: OK, I didnt see that one coming. With all the problems in Greece, Italy, Spain, and Portugal I wasnt watching Cyprus. But thats where the big euro news is this weekend; in return for a bailout, Cyprus is supposed to impose a large haircut  that is, loss  on all depositors in its banks.

title: Appealing to Hearts and Gullets, Francis Delights Crowd on First Sunday as Pope
description: VATICAN CITY  In his first Sunday appearance from the papal apartment overlooking St. Peters Square, Pope Francis charmed a huge crowd by infusing the message of the Gospel with personal recollections and a smattering of humor.

title: Architectural Iconoclast Wins the Pritzker Prize
description: Toyo Ito, a Japanese architect who broke from Modernism and designed a library that survived his countrys catastrophic 2011 earthquake, was awarded his professions top honor, the Pritzker Architecture Prize, on Sunday.

title: G.O.P. Leaders Unswayed by Obamas Charm Offensive
description: President Obama appeared on Sunday to still be enjoying a bit of good karma from his extended outreach to Congress last week, but Republican leaders who hold the most sway over fiscal negotiations were holding firm in opposition to the president.

title: Highlights and Analysis: Selection Sunday
description: Empty brackets become a thing of the past today as the field of 68 is chosen for the 2013 mens N.C.A.A. basketball tournament. Mike Huguenin is providing live updates and analysis.

title: You Really Cant Eat Just One, and Heres the Reason
description: Americans eat 33 pounds of cheese and cheese products per year, per person, which is triple the consumption rate of the 1970s. Fans of Humboldt Fog and Cabot Clothbound Cheddar may hope this signals the return of the artisan producer, but Michael Moss gives all credit to mighty Kraft and the other food giants.

title: Onstage Patter, Before the Feet Move
description: At the Ailey Citigroup Theater last April, Troy Powell talked about having to fill a small womans big shoes. He was referring to his succeeding Sylvia Waters, who was stepping down after 38 years as the artistic director of Ailey II, Alvin Ailey American Dance Theaters junior company. On Wednesday, when Ailey II opened its first New York season under Mr. Powells direction, he said that for himself and seven new dancers everything is new, including my shoes.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: As Kuroda Enters What Could Be His Final Season, Wells Is an Unlikely Guide
description: TAMPA, Fla.  An unlikely friendship was forged in front of Hiroki Kurodas locker Thursday morning when the quiet and clean-cut Kuroda invited the gregarious and tattooed David Wells to pull up a chair.

title: Teixeira Expected to Be Out Longer With Partly Torn Tendon Sheath
description: TAMPA, Fla.  First baseman Mark Teixeira returned to the Yankees spring training complex Sunday morning, wearing a brace on his right wrist and delivering grim news. His injury was originally thought to be a sprain, but is a partly torn tendon sheath. He will most likely be out until June, and maybe longer, if he and the Yankees do not employ an abundance of caution.

title: Drones: A Booming Business?
description: Unmanned aerial vehicles, also known as drones, may soon become commercialized. In Grand Forks, N.D., people are preparing for a coming boom in drones-related business.

title: Domestic Drones Stir Imaginations, and Concerns
description: GRAND FORKS, N.D.  On the pilots computer screen, planted at ground level a few yards from the airport runway here, the data streaming across the display tracked an airplane at 1,300 feet above a small city on the coast, making perfect circles at 150 miles per hour.

title: Republicans Act With Air, if Not a Vote, of Confidence
description: WASHINGTON  A year ago this month, Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin stood on the floor of the House and declared that the ideals of small government, privatized health care and rigorous spending discipline captured in the budget plan about to pass the House would and should be central to the 2012 election campaign.

title: Paintings Removal Stirs Outcry
description: For more than 100 years it hung in the Seward family home in Auburn, in central New York State: a large oil painting by Thomas Cole, the founder of the Hudson River School, that was given to Gov. William H. Seward to thank him for his work expanding the Erie Canal.

title: Summoning Jazz Spirits to the Temple
description: On a small stage facing the Temple of Dendur at the Metropolitan Museum of Art the WNYC radio host Terrance McKnight put on his most serious voice and requested a divine secret of the saxophonist Charles Lloyd. Who does one talk to, he asked, to have ones 75th birthday fall on a Friday night?

title: Mother, as She Lives and Breathes
description: A series called Bates Motel cant open with a shower scene. But since this new drama, starting Monday on A&E, is, after all, a prequel of sorts to the movie Psycho, homage had to be paid to Alfred Hitchcock upfront. The creators went with that directors sly sense of humor.

title: Pregnant Girl Vanishes, and Story Lines Fork
description: There are times during Top of the Lake when you can convince yourself that youre watching a mystery story about a girl who goes missing. But that sensation never lasts.

title: Start With Adolescent Spirit, Then Grow Into a Role
description: A singer trying out a role for the first time anywhere at the barnlike, high-exposure Metropolitan Opera is like a runner taking a chance on a new distance at the Olympics. And that race is the marathon when the role is a touchstone like Violetta in Verdis Traviata, which returned to the Met on Thursday starring Diana Damrau, Plcido Domingo and Saimir Pirgu and conducted by Yannick Nzet-Sguin.

title: Ill Be There for You
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  This was a smooth solve until I got to the payoff. I solved this puzzle by Daniel Landman (who appears to be making a debut) from the outside in, noting the theme entries of two-word phrases that started with S and I. Its an enjoyable solve, perfectly pleasant for a Monday, with a payoff that seems a bit Wednesdayish to me.

title: A Death in Paraguay Leads a Niece to Brutal Truths
description: The style is simple but the emotions highly sophisticated in 108 (Cuchillo de Palo), Renate Costas insistently prodding documentary about the secret life of her gay uncle, Rodolfo Costa, under the oppressive government of the Paraguayan dictator Alfredo Stroessner.

title: Lebhar IMP Pairs in St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS  The winners of the Lebhar IMP Pairs on Saturday evening here were Kent Mignocchi and Joel Wooldridge of New York. They finished 5.36 international match points ahead of Lewis Gamerman of Westwood, Mass., and Robert McCaw of Sudbury, Mass. Third were Robert Cappelli of Bloomfield, Mich., and Robert Katz of Ann Arbor, Mich.

title: Selling Stars, Brands and Baby Bands
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Two images linger from this years South by Southwest Music festival, which ended Sunday after five nights and days with hundreds of performances. One has been the major part of SXSW for all of its 27 years: sharing the crowded sidewalks with sleep-deprived but bright-eyed musicians toting their own equipment to the next gig. The other is more recent: a 62-foot-high outdoor stage built to resemble a snack-chip vending machine that turned into a six-story video billboard when it wasnt showing live performances.

title: Footnote
description: The New York theater company Clubbed Thumb has announced its lineup for the 18th annual Summerworks festival, which is set for May 24 to June 29 at the Wild Project in the East Village. The festival, which highlights original works by American playwrights, is to feature the three new plays; Phoebe in Winter, by Jen Silverman (Crane Story), La Brea, by Gregory S. Moss (Billy Witch) and Clare Barrons Baby Screams Miracle.

title: Waiting for the Run on the Banks
description: The economics Nobel laureate Paul Krugman could not have been clearer about the dangers of forcing depositors in Cypriot banks to take a loss on their accounts.

title: To Reassure Investors, Fed Stresses It Will Not End Stimulus
description: WASHINGTON  Each time in recent years that the Federal Reserve has paused in its efforts to stimulate the economy, it has come to regret the decision as premature. Its leading officials say the recovery has been slower as a consequence of those pauses. It is a mistake they do not want to repeat.

title: South by Southwest Music Festival
description: Scenes from this years festival in Austin, Tex.

title: Zimbabwe Arrests Opposition Officials and a Human Rights Lawyer
description: HARARE, Zimbabwe  Security officials arrested three senior officials of the Movement for Democratic Change, Zimbabwes main opposition political party, and a renowned human rights lawyer on Sunday, one day after a largely peaceful referendum on a draft constitution.

title: A Conference With Dual Constituencies Vows to Improve
description: HERE is a look at some highlights, lowlights and sidelights of the annual Transformation conference of the American Association of Advertising Agencies, known as the Four As, held last week in New Orleans.

title: Pick Your N.C.A.A. Tournament Sleepers
description: Now that we know who will be playing, its time to think about which lower-seeded teams will pull off upsets in this years N.C.A.A. tournament.

title: Spreading Disruption, Shaking Up Cable TV
description: The table in the conference room on the sixth floor of the IAC headquarters in Manhattan was a portrait of organization. In front of each of the 10 chairs was a leather case holding a fresh tablet of paper, with a sharpened pencil placed above it, just so. Everything in the Helm, as they call the room, was precise, orderly, logical. Just the way Barry Diller likes it.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Clippers Overpower Knicks, Whose Skid Reaches 4 Games
description: LOS ANGELES  The easiest way to get embarrassed in the N.B.A. is to be dunked on, to challenge the opposing player as he rises up and tries to put you on his highlight reel. The Los Angeles Clippers are the best team in the league at making opponents look silly, to the point that their video clips go viral seemingly within minutes.

title: Obamas Visit to Israel Renews Effort to Free Spy
description: JERUSALEM  When President Obama lands here on Wednesday, he may encounter some Israelis staging a hunger strike in support of Jonathan Jay Pollard, the American serving a life term in a North Carolina prison for spying for Israel.

title: Free Downloads of Da Vinci Code to Promote Inferno
description: How about this for a promotional thriller: Beginning Monday, on the 10th anniversary of the release of the mega-bestseller The Da Vinci Code, its publisher, Doubleday, will allow anyone to download the entire book free for a week.

title: Economic Reports for the Week Ahead
description: ECONOMIC REPORTS Data to be released include housing starts for February (Tuesday) and weekly jobless claims, existing home sales for February, the Philadelphia Fed index for March and leading economic indicators for February (Thursday).

title: HLNs Jodi Arias Coverage Helps Bolster Ratings
description: The cable news channel HLN, which had some of its highest ratings during the trial of Casey Anthony two years ago, has become fixated on another: the trial of Jodi Arias, a woman accused of killing her ex-boyfriend, Travis Alexander, in Arizona in 2008.

title: The Men's Bracket
description: View and print our N.C.A.A. Tournament bracket. The tournament begins Tuesday.

title: Photo Replay: March 17
description: A view of the day in sports, from skiing to college basketball madness.

title: White House Urged to Fire a Housing Regulator
description: WASHINGTON  Prominent state attorneys general are calling on President Obama to fire the acting director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency and name a new permanent director, arguing that current policies are impeding the economic recovery.

title: Times Health Care Opus Is a Hit
description: Publishing a 36-page cover article called Bitter Pill: Why Medical Bills Are Killing Us certainly didnt seem like a shameless attempt to bolster newsstand sales for Time magazine.

title: Richard D. Lyons, Versatile Times Reporter, Dies at 84
description: Richard D. Lyons, who covered science, Congress and the United Nations during almost 30 years as a reporter for The New York Times, died on Wednesday at his home in Charleston, S.C. He was 84.

title: Tax Breaks: Mostly Tilted Toward the Wealthy
description: Tax expenditures cost the federal government more than $1 trillion a year in lost revenue.

title: Dispute on Transgender Rights Unfolds at a Colorado School
description: FOUNTAIN, Colo.  Coy Mathis was born a boy. But after just a few years, biology succumbed to a more powerful force.

title: Divided Views of SAC Capital Settlement
description: Not many Wall Street executives, let alone hedge funds, could write a $616 million check and remain solvent.

title: San Francisco Symphonys East Coast Tour Is Canceled as Labor Talks Break Down
description: The San Francisco Symphony has announced that negotiations over a new contract with its musicians have broken down with the players rejection of a federal mediators proposal for a cooling-off period. As a result, the orchestras East Coast tour, which was to have included concerts at Carnegie Hall on Wednesday and Thursday as well as concerts in Newark on Friday and Washington on Saturday, has been canceled.

title: Tax Credits or Spending? Labels, but in Congress, Fighting Words
description: WASHINGTON  In a low-income neighborhood in Bozeman, Mont., taxpayers helped pay for the construction of a grocery store, Town and Country Foods. They are doing the same in New Orleans, with federal dollars helping to build new groceries, including a Whole Foods, in an area still suffering after Hurricane Katrina.

title: Louisvilles Pressure Defense Creates Victories
description: Louisville Coach Rick Pitino has his assistants chart deflections whenever his team takes the court, whether for practice or for games. The totals are collected and posted, and Pitino reinforces the message every day, every hour, practically every minute through the season: stay active on defense, keep your hands busy, knock the ball away. At Louisville, deflections form the foundation for the teams swarming defense.

title: Terror Haven in Mali Feared After French Leave
description: NEMA, Mauritania  With France planning to start withdrawing its troops from Mali next month, Western and African officials are increasingly concerned that the African soldiers who will be relied on to continue the campaign against militants linked to Al Qaeda there do not have the training or equipment for the job.

title: Criticizing Bloomberg, Liu Enters Race to Succeed Him
description: Brushing off his legal troubles as the price of taking on powerful interests, an exuberant John C. Liu, the city comptroller, officially began his campaign for mayor on Sunday with a vow to represent the 100 percent, not the 1 percent.

title: A War, Before and After, Part 2
description: This is the second part of a six-part series.

title: Saving Lions by Killing Them
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania

title: Gideons Muted Trumpet
description: WASHINGTON

title: Why Iran May Be Ready to Deal
description: WASHINGTON

title: Drones, Ethics and the Armchair Soldier
description: Ten years ago, I watched the Iraq invasion unfold on TV. It was for me, like most Americans, a remote-control event, the type that you tuned into occasionally to see how it was going before changing the channel, like the Olympics. And, as often happens in the Olympics, we crushed the opposition. But we Americans at home were not the only ones with remote controls. Many of our soldiers also had them, and used them to direct one of the most devastating military assaults in the history of modern warfare.
