The technological superiority of the United States  its ability to strike with precision from a distance  produced something like the shock and awe the media had relentlessly advertised. And it inspired a similar reaction in moral and legal theorists who were concerned about the relationship between advanced military technologies and the legitimation of warfare.

title: Riffs by Cab Riders, Secretly Recorded for the Sake of Art
description: His career as a New York City taxi driver began with a graveyard shift, a creative itch, and a brazen interpretation of privacy laws.

title: Cruelty to Women Overseas
description: Each year some 47,000 women around the world die as a result of unsafe abortions. Efforts to reduce that toll are severely hampered by the Helms amendment, which was originally enacted in 1973 and restricts the use of United States foreign aid money to finance abortions overseas, even in places where abortion is legal.

title: A Worsening Haitian Tragedy
description: The aid group Doctors Without Borders said last Tuesday that the cholera crisis in Haiti was getting worse, for the most unnecessary and appalling of reasons: a lack of money and basic medical supplies.

title: No Nukes on the Korean Peninsula
description: Its little wonder that South Koreans are thinking about ways to defend themselves, given North Koreas bizarre and dangerous behavior. The North has recently launched a long-range rocket and conducted its third nuclear test. It has also unleashed a barrage of apocalyptic threats, including potentially launching pre-emptive nuclear strikes on Seoul and the United States and declaring the 1953 Korean War armistice nullified.

title: Marches of Folly
description: Ten years ago, America invaded Iraq; somehow, our political class decided that we should respond to a terrorist attack by making war on a regime that, however vile, had nothing to do with that attack.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 17, 2013

title: U.S. Looked at Wall Street Journal Over Claims of Bribery
description: The United States governments inquiry into News Corporation broadened last year when the Justice Department investigated claims that employees in the China news bureau of The Wall Street Journal bribed local officials with gifts in exchange for information.

title: Drugs for Early-Stage Alzheimers
description: The Food and Drug Administration has proposed lowering the bar for approving drugs to treat people at the earliest stages of Alzheimers disease, before they have developed any serious impairment or overt dementia. The goal is commendable  to find ways to prevent or slow the progression of this terrible disease before it can rob people of their mental capacities. But the proposal raises troubling questions as to whether the agency would end up approving drugs that provide little or no clinical benefit yet cause harmful side effects in people who take the medications for extended periods.

title: Saving Schools and Libraries by Giving Up the Land They Sit On
description: The Brooklyn Heights library is neither the oldest nor the most dilapidated branch of the Brooklyn Public Library system. But the 52-year-old limestone building is nonetheless ripe for demolition.

title: What Does It Mean to Live With Less?
description: To the Editor:

title: Fire in Bronx Apartment Building Kills 7-Year-Old Girl
description: A fire started in a Bronx apartment building just after 3 a.m. on Sunday, announcing itself with thick clouds of black smoke billowing through the hallways. It burned through a fourth-floor apartment, killing a 7-year-old girl and critically injuring a 3-year-old girl, the authorities said.

title: Hacker Case Leads to Calls for Better Law
description: Matthew Keys, the 26-year-old deputy social media editor at Reuters charged with assisting computer hackers, has emerged as the latest lightning rod in the continuing battle between proponents of Internet freedom and the Justice Department.

title: Clippers Whip Knicks, but Martin Remains Unimpressed
description: LOS ANGELES  In a three-minute postgame interview Sunday, Knicks forward Kenyon Martin indicated his bitterness toward the Los Angeles Clippers, his former team. And he did not give the Clippers much credit for their 93-80 win over the Knicks at the Staples Center.

title: In Florida, a Political Marriage Soured Before a Top Official Stepped Down
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.  As the annual press corps political roast unfolded here on Tuesday evening, Gov. Rick Scott stared stone-faced, holding a secret, while he watched a reporter spoof his strained relationship with his lieutenant governor, Jennifer Carroll.

title: Bubbling Up: The Downside of Being No. 1
description: Of all the numbers in college basketball, No. 1 may be the most ubiquitous. You can find it on jerseys and foam hands and after victories when index fingers are shot skyward. You can hear it  Were No. 1  chanted on most nights.

title: Trial to Start in Class Suit on Stop-and-Frisk Tactic
description: In one of the most significant courtroom tests of a key Bloomberg administration policy, a federal judge will begin hearing testimony on Monday in a trial to determine whether the New York Police Department has been unconstitutionally stopping black and Hispanic males in the street over the last decade.

title: Jos Alfredo Martnez de Hoz, Argentine Official During Dictatorship, Dies at 87
description: BUENOS AIRES  Jos Alfredo Martnez de Hoz, who was the economics minister during Argentinas dictatorship, died on Friday at his home here, where he was under arrest, accused of human rights abuses. He was 87.

title: Starting a Papacy, Amid Echoes of a Dirty War
description: BUENOS AIRES  One Argentine priest is on trial in Tucumn Province on charges of working closely with torturers in a secret jail during the so-called Dirty War, urging prisoners to hand over information. Another priest was accused of taking a newborn from his mother, one of the many baby thefts from female prisoners who were disappeared into a system of clandestine prisons.

title: Trading Hearings Put Focus Back on JPMorgans Chief
description: Jamie Dimon, the influential chief of JPMorgan Chase, watched from New York on Friday while in Washington his top lieutenants were questioned by a Senate panel over a multibillion-dollar trading loss.

title: Does Diplomacy Need Star Power?
Oil Sands Emissions
description: To the Editor:

title: Public Defenders, 50 Years After the Gideon Ruling
description: To the Editor:

title: College Cost Scorecard: A Good Step to Transparency
description: To the Editor:

title: Work at Home, or in the Office?
description: To the Editor:

title: Excavating Lost Artifacts of the 1970s
description: The Mound Builders, a 1975 play by Lanford Wilson, offers a sort of archaeological dig through the atmosphere and the attitudes that pervaded the decade in which it was written. Watching the new Signature Theater Company production, which opened on Sunday night, is like cracking open a time capsule thats been buried for years. Unfortunately, in the director Jo Bonneys slackly acted production, the contents dont prove as fascinating to us today as we had reason to hope.

title: Citys Sheltering of Out-of-Town Homeless, and Mayors Remark, Stir Debate
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, who has a penchant for hyperbole, was at it again this month when he fumed that New York States guarantee to shelter the homeless means you can arrive in your private jet at Kennedy Airport, take a private limousine and go straight to the shelter system, and walk in the door and weve got to give you shelter.

title: A Field With Everything Except an Obvious Favorite
description: A season of extraordinary upheaval in college basketball yielded an N.C.A.A. tournament field with few favorites, several more surprises and a landscape wide open for potential upsets.

title: Protection Orders and Gun Crimes
description: The New York Times examined gun-related crimes committed by people subject to domestic violence protection orders. These documents highlight three such cases across the country.

title: In Clutch Situations, Michigan Turns to Burke
description: In a lineup loaded with talent, point guard Trey Burke stands out as the unquestioned choice when Michigan needs a basket. Everyone knows it, too.

title: Trade Revis? Worth Considering if It Improves Jets, Johnson Says
description: PHOENIX  Woody Johnson, the Jets owner, said for the first time Sunday night that if making his team better meant trading any player  including cornerback Darrelle Revis  he would listen to an offer.

title: Tisch Uneasy About Prospect of Losing Cruz
description: PHOENIX  Steve Tisch, who owns the Giants with John Mara, said Sunday that he was anxious about the idea that receiver Victor Cruz might draw an offer sheet from another team, which would force the Giants to decide whether to match the offer to retain Cruz or lose him and receive a first-round draft pick as compensation.

title: An Unusual Route for a Rising Gonzaga Star
description: Gonzaga has a long mens basketball tradition, more than a decade of consecutive N.C.A.A. tournament appearances, but this season the Bulldogs became one of the most unlikely teams to reach No. 1. And that was in large part because of their unlikely star.

title: Guard Is Steady Force for Miami
description: There are more charismatic stars in the N.C.A.A. tournament, more compelling characters, louder and flashier. There are players who jump on scorers tables, and players who preen after dunks. Shane Larkin of Miami does none of that. He treats basketball like a chemistry exam, and he gets consistently high grades.

title: In Some States, Gun Rights Trump Orders of Protection
description: Early last year, after a series of frightening encounters with her former husband, Stephanie Holten went to court in Spokane, Wash., to obtain a temporary order for protection.

title: Obama Nominates Justice Aide for Labor Post
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama announced Monday that he would nominate Thomas E. Perez, who heads the Civil Rights Division at the Justice Department, to be the next secretary of labor, a choice that promised to provoke a debate with Republicans about voting rights, immigration and discrimination.

title: Soft Landing for Nadal in Triumphant Return
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  Rafael Nadals collapses on a court after winning championship points should not be surprising, given all his successes in past years and recent months. But after injuries had kept him off hardcourts for more than 11 months, his fall to the hardcourt surface at the BNP Paribas Open as a champion on Sunday did seem remarkable.

title: He Hasnt Had It All Either
description: I have not had it all.

title: With Chance to Firm Up Standing, Nets Stumble Against the Hawks
description: It will be April when the Nets next play on the sleek herringbone court of Barclays Center, and by then their game Sunday night against the Atlanta Hawks will linger as either a distant memory or a haunting omen. The Nets are good enough to have secured a solid footing in the Eastern Conference playoff race but too inconsistent to emerge as a credible threat.

title: Lewis Rallies for Title and No. 1 Ranking
description: PHOENIX  With three holes to play, Stacy Lewiss chances of passing Ai Miyazato at the L.P.G.A. Founders Cup and the world No. 1 Yani Tseng in the rankings looked slimmer than a 3-iron.

title: The World in a Grain of Sand
description: Or a coin, or a keyhole. The sculptor Teresita Fernndez ventures outside her usual medium to create a drawing inspired by new verse from Matthew Zapruder.

title: WPP to Invest in SFX Entertainment
description: When the media mogul Robert F.X. Sillerman returned to the music business last year after more than a decade, he said he wanted to use online media to unite the huge but disconnected audience for electronic dance music. One aspect of his plan involves the role of marketing and advertising, as evidenced by a new investment from the ad giant, WPP.

title: Planning for the Next Flu Season
description: The flu season may be winding down, but its not too soon to start thinking about the next one  and what all of us must do differently if we are to avoid a repeat of the epidemic of the past few months.

title: Local TV News Is Following Prints Path, Study Says
description: With shorter stories and scarce coverage of politics and government, local television newscasts in the United States, like local newspapers before them, are suffering from shrinking pains, according to the Pew Research Center.

title: Word of the Day | coercion
description: coercion \ ko-r-zhn, -shn\ noun

title: Corrections: March 18, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, March 18
description: I remember thinking, Cops, I need the cops. Hes going to kill me in my own house. Im going to die!

title: Whats on Monday
description: 10 P.M. (TMC) MY LEFT FOOT (1989) Daniel Day-Lewis, in his first Oscar-winning role, portrays Christy Brown (1932-81), who was born in Dublin with cerebral palsy and learned to write and paint using the only limb he could control, his left foot. Brenda Fricker, who also won an Oscar, and Ray McAnally play Christys parents; Ruth McCabe (above, with Mr. Day-Lewis) is the young woman he falls in love with and eventually marries; and Fiona Shaw is the doctor who largely facilitates his education in what Vincent Canby, writing in The New York Times, called an intelligent, beautifully acted adaptation of Mr. Browns first book, directed by Jim Sheridan. But though My Left Foot is blunt and tough in its presentation of Christys handicaps, it avoids any direct criticism of the handicapped world into which he is born, one in which his mother spends most of her time being pregnant, in which poverty is as likely to make the spirit ugly as beautiful, and in which the church always has the last word.

title: While Sliding Rangers Look Up in Standings, the Surging Penguins Look Down
description: After a trip that ended with three straight losses, the Rangers occupy 10th place in the Eastern Conference with only 21 games to play. They face two games in the next two nights from a perspective they have not seen in more than five years.

title: Kingdom of the Netherlands, the Epitome of the Classic
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The goal of the World Baseball Classic has never been to prove which nation is best at baseball. This is not that kind of sport. Small samples can yield misleading conclusions. The validity of World Series results comes largely from the six-month grind just to get there.

title: N.F.L. Is Pressured on Issues of Gay Rights
description: PHOENIX  The N.F.L.s investigation into why a team employee asked a college player if he liked girls during last months scouting combine has found that the comment was part of casual banter  chatter that was inappropriate  but not part of a formal interview process, said Robert Gulliver, the leagues top human resources executive.

title: Boston Universitys Coach Closes In on Retirement
description: BOSTON  The man at the wake for the father of the future Boston University hockey coach Jack Parker quietly approached Parkers mother to offer his condolences. He also offered something more: cash.

title: The Nets Long and Winding Road Trip
description: When the N.B.A. completed the Nets schedule in August, forward Reggie Evans scanned the dates, and one doozy of a trip immediately caught his eye. The block of road games in late March, the one that involves 17 days, 8 cities, 10 chartered plane rides. Plans had to be made early.

title: Greek Soccer Player Banned for Nazi Salute
description: Last Updated, 11:12 a.m. Giorgos Katidis, a 20-year-old Greek soccer player who celebrated a game-winning goal on Saturday by giving a Nazi salute to fans in Athens, has been banned for life from representing his country in international tournaments.

title: News Quiz | March 18, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck.

title: Puerto Rico Ousts Champion and Nears a Title of Its Own
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Alex Rios had not played here since the 2007 All-Star Game, when the American League manager, Jim Leyland, inserted him in right field in the bottom of the ninth inning. With the bases loaded in a one-run game, a fly ball settled into Rioss glove for the final out.

title: A Conversation With: Pakistani Author Mohsin Hamid
description: One of the most anticipated book releases this year is How to Get Filthy Rich in Rising Asia by the Lahore-born writer Mohsin Hamid. The tome, which debuted March 5, is written in a cheeky self-help format and tells the rags-to-riches story of a man in modern Asia.

title: The Vatican and the Other China
description: BEIJING  There are approximately as many Catholics in the world as Chinese  over 1 billion each, with 1.3 billion Chinese just surpassing the worlds 1.2 billion Catholics.

title: IHT Quick Read: March  18
description: NEWS Europes surprising decision early Saturday to force bank depositors in Cyprus to share in the cost of the latest euro zone bailout set off increasing outrage and turmoil in Cyprus on Sunday and fueled fears that the trouble will spread to countries like Spain and Italy. Liz Alderman reports from Nicosia, Cyprus, and Landon Thomas Jr. from London.

title: Lawmaker Says Britons Agree to New Press Rules After Hacking Scandal
description: LONDON  After months of wrangling and dispute, and centuries of rambunctious freedom, lawmakers agreed to ground rules on Monday for a new press code, the most significant step toward stricter curbs on this countrys scoop-driven newspapers since the phone hacking scandal convulsed Rupert Murdochs media empire and much of British public life.

title: Test Yourself | Math, March 18, 2013
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Patrick Honner at Math for America from the article Keeping an Eye on Online Test-Takers.

title: How Much Do You Know About Your Familys History?
description: Many families have storiesof triumph, of struggle, of events almost too funny or too unlikely to be real, but somehow are. Does your family have stories like these? What family narratives did you grow up hearing? How do you think theyve helped define who you are and how you see yourself?

title: In the Bronx, Nine High Schools Share One Building
description: In Nine High Schools, One Roof, Liz Robbins and Theodoric Meyer write about the Stevenson Campus in the Bronx.

title: Where the Wild Things Are
description: Charles Frger was fascinated by what the human race lost over the millenniums when it evolved from hunter-gather to farmer and, eventually, urban dweller. After learning that there were Europeans who continued ancient pagan rites of celebrating the winter solstice and the beginning of spring, he set out to examine what traditions faded as people became more civilized.

title: Indias Supreme Court Extends Restrictions on Italian Ambassador
description: NEW DELHI  A diplomatic tiff between India and Italy showed no signs of easing Monday after Indias Supreme Court extended its travel restrictions against the Italian ambassador for another week.

title: After Frosty Past, Pope Meets Argentine Leader
description: VATICAN CITY  A day before his formal installation, Pope Francis met privately on Monday with Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner, the president of his native Argentina, with whom he had clashed over social issues like Argentinas legalization of same-sex marriage.

title: Russias New Normal
description: MOSCOW  Its the sort of thing one hates hearing from ones child. You know, mom, my 11-year-old daughter said, It makes me particularly nervous when people make fun of gays.

title: Part 1: Answers to Your Questions About Paying for College
description: The Choice has invited Laura Perna, an author, professor at the University of Pennsylvania and researcher in college finance and affordability, to answer your questions about paying for college in the blogs Guidance Office, a forum for college applicants and their families seeking expert advice.

title: Sexual Offenses Bill to Be Altered to Pass Parliament
description: NEW DELHI A bill aimed at toughening Indias laws on rape and sexual violence will be altered, Indias law minister said Monday, a move expected to garner wider political support in a divided Parliament.

title: The Unregulated Work of Mechanical Turk
description: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. She recently edited and contributed to For Love and Money: Care Provision in the United States.

title: The Early Word: Rise and Fall
description: Todays Times

title: Daily Report: Domestic Drones on Patrol
description: On the pilots computer screen, planted at ground level a few yards from the airport runway in Grand Forks, N.D., the data streaming across the display tracked an airplane at 1,300 feet above a small city on the coast, making perfect circles at 150 miles per hour.

title: Zimbabwe Police Defy Order to Free Lawyer, Group Says
description: HARARE, Zimbabwe  The Zimbabwean police defied a high court ruling issued at midnight on Sunday ordering the release of a renowned human rights lawyer, Beatrice Mtetwa, and continued to hold her on charges of obstructing justice, a rights group said Monday.

title: Indonesian Carrier Orders $24 Billion in Jets From Airbus
description: PARIS  Airbus said Monday that it had received a record order for $24 billion worth of new single-aisle jets from the Indonesian low-cost airline Lion Air, marking a significant inroad for the European plane maker into one of the fastest-growing air travel markets in Asia that until now has been dominated by its American rival, Boeing.

title: Pakistani Militants Kill 4 in Attack on Court Complex
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Militants stormed a court complex in northwestern Pakistan on Monday, killing 4 people and wounding at least 30 people, including a judge, in the latest assault on government authority in the region.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | March 18, 2013
description: Updated: March 19

title: This Week In Small Business: Surviving Shark Tank
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners this week.

title: Up Here on This Island
description: The boy banged his thigh into the corner of the table, stopped mid-stride, grimaced, and the way youd say godDAMmit, he said: johnHANcock! Then, because he knew that in the special school there was an expectation of a show of normality, he said: Youre probably wondering why I said that, but you wouldnt understand.

title: How the Other Half Thinks
description: NAIROBI  For a ringside seat on the spectacle of Kenyan democracys turbulent workings, Id recommend Dormans on Mama Ngina Street. I had just ordered an espresso at the caf, around the corner from the Supreme Court, on Saturday when the mood on this normally bustling street suddenly turned.

title: Blunt Report Says G.O.P. Needs to Regroup for 16
description: WASHINGTON  Republican leaders on Monday offered a sweeping self-critique of a party they said was in an ideological cul-de-sac and needed better outreach and a new brand of conservatism to appeal to younger voters, ethnic minorities and women.

title: SAC Looks on the Bright Side
description: SAC LOOKS ON THE BRIGHT SIDE | The $616 million fine against SAC Capital Advisors that was announced on Friday by the Securities and Exchange Commission would be enough to cripple some hedge funds. But SAC saw the positive in the penalty, which settles two insider trading lawsuits brought by the government, DealBooks Peter Lattman writes. The $15 billion hedge fund said in a statement that the settlements were a substantial step toward resolving all outstanding regulatory matters.

title: Opinion Report: Treating Alzheimers
description: From the editorial page

title: Environmental Woes Could Reverse Global Development
description: Climate change and other environmental disasters could put 3.1 billion people into extreme poverty by 2050, if no significant steps are taken, says an annual United Nations report on the state of global development.

title: March Madness for Book Geeks Rolls On
description: College basketball fans may have to wait until Tuesday for their yearly N.C.A.A. tournament fix, but March Madness for lit geeks is already well under way thanks to The Morning Newss Tournament of Books.

title: Monday Reading: Frugal Travel Along the Yangtze River
Gender Bias Seen in Visas for Skilled Workers
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate Judiciary Committee heard testimony Monday afternoon arguing that the H-1B visa program, which covers highly skilled temporary foreign workers, often in high-tech fields, discriminates against women.

title: Tournament Bracket and Forecast
description: Need help with your N.C.A.A. bracket? Nate Silver is estimating each teams chance of advancing to any given stage of the N.C.A.A. bracket. View his estimates as a table and read his pre-tournament analysis.

title: Advertising Research Foundation Gets Its First Female Leader
description: The Advertising Research Foundation is naming a longtime research executive at General Mills as its next president and chief executive, making her the first woman to lead the organization.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Ben Ehrenreich on Witnessing the Friday Protests in a West Bank Village
description: Ben Ehrenreich is the author of this weeks cover article about the weekly Friday protests against Israeli occupation of Nabi Saleh in the West Bank. Ehrenreich has published two novels, Ether and The Suitors, and contributed to Harpers Magazine, Los Angeles Magazine and other publications.

title: The View of New York Under an Umbrella
description: Dear Diary:

title: An Oracle Veterans Comeback Plan
description: This has the makings of a decent revenge story, or at least a tech giant face-off.

title: Thai Modern
description: Rather than rooms, the Naka hotel is made up of 94 minimalist glass-and-stone pods, elevated and scattered pell-mell among tropical almond trees in this secluded new beach resort on the western coast of Phuket, Thailand. Each unit comes with a private pool and a cantilevered bedroom that juts out 20 feet toward the Andaman Sea. Rates from about $1,000; designhotels.com.

title: A New Focus on Poverty Raises a Question About Times Coverage
description: Poverty was in the news last week, with the coverage of Pope Francis attention to poor people worldwide, particularly those in his home country of Argentina.

title: Cyprus Bailout Puts New Pressure on Europes Banks
description: 12:14 p.m. | Updated

title: Ericsson and ST Microelectronics to Dissolve Venture
description: BERLIN  Ericsson and STMicroelectronics announced plans on Monday to dissolve their unprofitable four-year-old Swiss venture, ST-Ericsson, a move that may eliminate 1,600 jobs worldwide.

title: Senate Report on JPMorgan Loss May Provide Fresh Evidence
description: The Senate report and hearing on JPMorgan Chases multibillion-dollar trading loss provides a portrait of a bank that went right to the edge of acceptable practices, and may have even stepped over the line. The questions now are what type of enforcement action the bank could face, and whether any individuals will be ensnared by the case.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Bribery Inquiry at The Journal, and Taking Aim at Cable TV
description: A United States government inquiry into News Corporation broadened last year after the Justice Department investigated claims that Wall Street Journal employees in China bribed local officials with gifts in exchange for information, Christine Haughney writes. The Journal broke the news of the investigation on Sunday. Paula Keve, a spokeswoman for The Journal, said that the company was conducting its own investigation and had found no evidence of impropriety. The bribery accusations came out of a broader investigation into News Corporations practices, and Ms. Keve suggested that the claims had been made to discredit The Journals reporting.

title: Island Nightmares
description: What is it about islands around Europes periphery? Is there some peculiar psychological thing about proximity plus the illusion of isolation that makes them turn themselves into havens for runaway banks? Inquiring minds want to know.

title: Leading Off: Selection Science or a Dartboard?
description: Normally, one of the best things about N.C.A.A. tournament week is its democracy. No, not every one of the tournaments 68 teams has an equal chance to win the title, but every single person in your circle of acquaintances has a roughly equal chance to win your N.C.A.A. pool. Because no matter how much the rabid basketball fans think they know about R.P.I. and strength of schedule and just how well Coach A does against Coach K, once the tournament starts, all that knowledge has as much to do with picking winners as it does forecasting an election in Burma. The bloke who picks against Notre Dame because it wore those horrific lime green jerseys in the Big East tournament? Our moneys on him.

title: Resistance to HPV Vaccines Needs New Solutions
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommend three vaccinations for preteens and teenagers: a booster for tetanus toxoid, diphtheria toxoid and acellular pertussis vaccine (Tdap) given at 11-12 years; quadrivalent meningococcal conjugate vaccine (MCV4), with a first dose at 11-12 and a follow-up at 16-18; and human papillomavirus vaccine (HPV), given in three doses over a six-month period to boys and girls 11-12.

title: Royal Bank of Canada Hires Co-Heads of U.S. Technology Banking
description: The Royal Bank of Canada said on Monday that it had hired Michal Katz and Michael Carter as co-heads of its United States technology investment banking group. The bank also hired Erik-Jaap Molenaar as a managing director in technology mergers and acquisitions. All three come from Barclays, and had previously worked at Lehman Brothers.

title: Queens Central Library Opens Wider
description: Its a mystery at first. The youngsters on the computers in the childrens center adjoining the Queens Central Library appear to be squatting on floor cushions, but their legs are nowhere to be seen. In a moment, it grows clear. Theyre seated at shallow wells scooped into the floor so theres no danger of falling off their chairs.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York: As a chilly March drags on at the greenmarket, even a ramp would look good right now. Or how about a batch of rutabaga fries?  Patrick Farrell

title: A Blankfein Wedding
description: Lloyd C. Blankfein, the chief executive of Goldman Sachs, has gained a daughter-in-law.

title: Ectopic Pregnancy Treatments Preserve Fertility
description: Each of the three main treatments for ectopic pregnancy  a condition in which a fetus develops outside the uterus, often in the fallopian tube  appears to be equally effective in preserving a womens ability to become pregnant in the future, a new study found.

title: Parity in N.C.A.A. Means No Commanding Favorite
description: Even before the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament bracket was announced on Sunday, there was plenty of discussion about how much parity there was in this years field. The chatter only increased after Louisville, the No. 1 overall seed, was placed in a brutally tough Midwest region that also includes Duke and Michigan State.

title: The Unobstructed Home
description: The houses photographed for Deborah Pierces book, The Accessible Home: Designing for All Ages & Abilities, look so inviting that I want to move in.

title: Beans and Greens: A Power Couple
description: If youve been a longtime follower of Recipes for Health, you know how much I like combining beans and greens. They make a good, nourishing couple and every peasant cuisine in the world seems to know this. Its so easy to put together a hearty, high-protein one-dish meal rich in vitamins and minerals with these two foods as the focus.

title: A Small-Business Office Is Accused of Advocating for Big Business
description: For decades, the Office of Advocacy, a bureau within the Small Business Administration, has worked behind the scenes to soften the impact of federal regulations on small companies. It is charged with, among other responsibilities, representing the views and interests of small businesses before other federal agencies. To learn how regulatory policies might affect small businesses, the office regularly convenes round-table discussions with its constituents.

title: A Dual Review of Whats New, Starring Karen Elson and Buzz Aldrin
description: A dual review of whats new, by model mom and smoky-voiced chanteuse Karen Elson and legendary moonwalker Buzz Aldrin.

title: Maria Shriver Appears on Today for Papal Coverage
description: Maria Shriver, a former NBC correspondent, took a first step toward resuming that role on Monday when she contributed a report to NBC's Today show.

title: Singapores Lessons for an Unequal America
description: SINGAPORE

title: Mali Exit Strategy
description: Back from North Africa, The Timess Eric Schmitt reports on mounting concerns surrounding French plans to draw down troops.

title: Chrysler Warns Dodge Challenger Owners of Fire Risk
description: Concerned about a fire hazard, Chrysler is telling owners of about 2,500 of its 2013 Dodge Challengers with the 3.6-liter Pentastar V-6 to stop driving the cars and not park them near any structure.

title: With New Chinese Leaders in Place, Waiting for an Agenda to Emerge
description: Chinas leadership succession that began last autumn is now complete. Xi Jinping holds the three top positions as general secretary of the Communist Party, chairman of the Central Military Commission and president. Li Keqiang is the new premier.

title: Colleges Hope 8 Seconds on TV Provide Lasting Image
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.  The prime-time national television spotlight landed on the Florida Gulf Coast mens basketball team at 6:14 p.m. Sunday and lasted for about eight seconds, as the Eagles whooped and danced and waved towels in delirium.

title: The ussians Are Coming! The ussians Are Coming!
description: How big a deal is the Russian factor in Cypruss crisis? Pretty big, it seems. Over at FT Alphaville, Izabella Kaminska reports on estimates of 19 billion euros in Russian nationals deposits in Cyprus banks, which is more than the countrys GDP. Without being an expert here, I wonder whether this is an understatement; given what we think we know about the nature of much of this Russian money, is all of it really being declared as Russian?

title: A Triumphant Show by the Artist Yadier Molina
description: San Francisco

title: Discovery Wins Bid to Televise Canyon Crossing
description: Nik Wallenda, the daredevil who crossed Niagara Falls on a tightrope last year, will try a similar stunt at the Grand Canyon in June, he announced on Monday.

title: Image of the Day: March 18
Grand Bargaining
description: Like others, Greg Sargent has been pleading with centrist pundits to acknowledge an obvious truth: Barack Obama has actually proposed the mix of spending cuts and revenue increases they want, while Republicans are unwilling to make so much as a dime of compromise. Greg looks at yesterdays talk shows and finds this confirmed openly by GOP leaders: there is no ratio of spending cuts to revenues that will reconcile them to any tax hike whatsoever.

title: Hillary Clinton Endorses Same-Sex Marriage
description: Saying that gay rights are human rights, Hillary Rodham Clinton, the former secretary of state and potential 2016 presidential candidate, has endorsed same-sex marriage.

title: China Cites Risk of New Tension as U.S. Bolsters Missile Defenses
description: HONG KONG  China said Monday that the United States decision to strengthen antimissile defenses in response to threats from North Korea risked deepening regional tensions, underscoring Beijings caution on further pressuring the North despite its third nuclear test.

title: The Coupon Collector Puzzle
description: Your favorite breakfast cereal has decided to run a tasty promotion. Each box of cereal will contain one of six different coupons. Collect all six coupons and win a prize! How many boxes of cereal can you expect to buy before you have at least one of each coupon?

title: A Contentious Bailout for Cyprus
description: The Timess Peter Eavis explains why markets are on edge over the plan to save Cypriot banks.

title: Race and Republican Politics
description: The Republican Party released a report today that attempts to explain why the G.O.P. keeps alienating large chunks of the American electorate. Well have lots to say about the report on our editorial page, but I wanted to separately address the issue of race.

title: Really? Diabetics Should Avoid Eating Fruit
description: THE FACTS

title: House of Cards: Episode Seven and Father Figures
description: Do reporters care about the tiny trophies of governance? Ashley Parker and David Carr review episode seven of the Netflix series House of Cards, and discuss whether the people who wield pens care about getting one with presidential pixie dust on it.

title: Annie Baker Wins Blackburn Prize and Horton Foote Honor
description: Annie Baker has been awarded the prestigious Susan Smith Blackburn Prize, an international award given annually since 1978 to women who have written works of outstanding quality. The prize, which Ms. Baker won for The Flick, her three-hour incisively nuanced exploration of love and friendship, includes a cash award of $25,000 and a signed, numbered print by the artist Willem de Kooning.

title: Bloombergs Plan Would Make Stores Conceal Cigarettes
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, fresh off a defeat in his campaign to limit large servings of sugary drinks, is returning to a front where he has enjoyed far more success: making it more difficult to smoke, by proposing legislation on Monday requiring stores to put cigarettes out of sight.

title: Man Group Imposes Limits on Cash Bonuses for Executives
description: LONDON  The Man Group, the largest publicly traded hedge fund firm in the world, is imposing its own bonus cap for top executives.

title: Kinky Boots: Step One
description: Part 8: The actor Stark Sands performs Step One from the musical Kinky Boots.

title: Kinky Boots: Billy and Stark
description: Part 13: Lauper and Fierstein discuss what the actors Billy Porter and Stark Sands brought to their characters.

title: Kinky Boots: Intro
description: Part 1: Carol Olsen Day, director of TimesTalks, introduces Cyndi Lauper and Harvey Fierstein, composer and writer of the musical Kinky Boots.

title: Kinky Boots: Working Together
description: Part 2: Cyndi Lauper and Harvey Fierstein talk about the origins of their creative partnership.

title: Kinky Boots: Doing the Show
description: Part 4: Lauper and Fierstein talk about how they each became involved with Kinky Boots, and discuss the individual expertise they each brought to the production.

title: Kinky Boots: Cyndis Influences
description: Part 6: Cyndi Lauper describes her songwriting process and musical influences on Kinky Boots, and explains how she taught herself to write for musical theater.

title: Kinky Boots: Finding Broadway
description: Part 3: Lauper and Fierstein recall their earliest memories of Broadway, and explain what led them to become writers and performers.

title: Kinky Boots: Writing Partners
description: Part 5: Lauper and Fierstein explain the most difficult part of creating a musical adaptation, and reflect on their working relationship.

title: Kinky Boots: Less Rigid
description: Part 9: Lauper and Fierstein discuss the differences between writing musical theater and pop songs, and explain the purpose of out-of-town tryouts.

title: Kinky Boots: History of Wrong Guys
description: Part 10: Lauper and Fierstein reflect on the changes they made to the character Lauren in adapting the show from the film, and discuss her song The History of Wrong Guys.

title: Kinky Boots: The Audience
description: Part 14: Lauper and Fierstein talk about the audiences role in refining the show, and Billy Porter and Stark Sands reflect on their relationship with their Kinky Boots characters.

title: Kinky Boots: Not My Fathers Son
description: Part 11: The actors Billy Porter and Stark Sands perform Not My Fathers Son from the musical Kinky Boots.

title: TimesTalks | Kinky Boots: Preview
description: Cyndi Lauper and Harvey Fierstein talk with The Timess Patrick Healy about their collaboration on the musical Kinky Boots, and discuss the challenges of composing music for the stage.

title: Kinky Boots: Adjustments
description: Part 7: Lauper and Fierstein talk about the process of refining the show and what they learned from its trial run in Chicago.

title: Kinky Boots: Harveys Father
description: Part 12: Lauper and Fierstein discuss the writing process behind Not My Fathers Son.

title: Viewing the Glass as Half Full, but Not Too Full
description: Carl Richards is a certified financial planner in Park City, Utah, and is the director of investor education at The BAM Alliance. His book, The Behavior Gap, was published this year. His sketches are archivedon the Bucks blog.

title: Street Style: Chunky Knits
description: The best of readers photos from the week of March 11.

title: The Gun Report: March 18, 2013
description: We have an unusually long list of violent incidents in which guns were involved this weekend. It couldnt be because Sunday was St. Patricks Day, could it? Here is our weekend report.

title: China Arrests Man After Wifes Self-Immolation Protest
description: HONG KONG  The Chinese police arrested the husband of a Tibetan woman who died last week after setting herself alight in protest, an overseas group said on Monday, following a separate fatal self-immolation at a Tibetan Buddhist monastery over the weekend.

title: Heart Puts Some Led in Its Summer Tour
description: It is hardly unheard of for rock stars to pay tribute to their colleagues and forbears, but Heart is taking professional hat-tipping to a new level.

title: A Risk for Films That Move at a Zombies Pace
description: LOS ANGELES  It was the middle of 2006, and hardly anyone was particularly worried about the zombie apocalypse.

title: What Comes Next for SAC
description: The two settlements reached between SAC Capital Advisors, the hedge fund controlled by Steven A. Cohen, and the Securities and Exchange Commission raise the question of what comes next for the firm.

title: White or Pink Beans With Beet Greens and Parmesan
description: If you use white beans for this savory dish, the beet greens will infuse them with a lovely pink hue. Even more standout is the savory/umami flavor that the Parmesan rinds impart. Parmesan rinds will keep for months. Wrap them in foil and keep in the freezer. They add great depth of flavor to vegetarian soups and stews.

title: New Jersey to Allow Casinos to Offer Daily Fantasy Sports
description: With its plan to legalize sports gambling held up in the courts, New Jersey is allowing casinos to offer daily fantasy sports games as an alternative.

title: Dining Calendar
description: Lent

title: Stealing the Technology Show
description: The Timess Jenna Wortham on expectations versus reality at South by Southwest Interactive.

title: Big Browns Big Victory
description: Big Brown became the first horse since 1915 to win the Kentucky Derby with three or fewer starts coming into the race.

title: Allon Exits Race for New York Mayor
description: Tom F. Allon, a newspaper publisher who switched party affiliations to run as a Republican for mayor of New York but failed to gain early traction among voters, said on Monday that he would abandon his candidacy.

title: Function Over Form
description: Robert Stern may encourage risk and experimentation at Yale, but he is a staunch defender of his more traditional buildings.

title: Dee Dee Bridgewater to Play Billie Holiday Off Broadway
description: Lady Day, Stephen Stahls musical about the jazz singer Billie Holiday, will have its New York premiere at the Little Shubert Theater in September. The production will star the vocalist and actress Dee Dee Bridgewater, who performed the role in Paris and London to acclaim in the 1980s.

title: Fire Commissioners Son Resigns as Offensive Twitter Posts Surface
description: The son of the Fire Department commissioner, Salvatore J. Cassano, resigned on Monday from his job with the department after a series of offensive Twitter posts, many of them racially inflammatory, surfaced.

title: From Lehman to Cyprus
description: The European decision not to honor deposit insurance in Cyprus, by making all depositors contribute to the cost of a bailout, reminds me of the decision to let Lehman Brothers go under. Moral hazard is being avoided. The question is what that will cost.

title: Injuries Affect U.S. Roster for Costa Rica and Mexico Games
description: Injuries and illness have left United States national team coach Jurgen Klinsmann with a patchwork roster heading into two important World Cup qualifiers in the next nine days.

title: Slaves Forgotten Burial Sites, Marked Online
description: They have been bulldozed over by shopping centers, crept over by weeds and forgotten by time. Across the country, from Lower Manhattan to the Deep South, are unmarked slave burial sites, often discovered only by chance or by ignominious circumstance as when construction crews accidentally exhume bodies when building a shopping mall.

title: Philip Crangi for JewelMint
description: For its inaugural Studio Series, JewelMint tapped the CFDA designer Philip Crangi to create a limited-edition collection, which makes its debut online today. Though Crangi says that all of the pieces are original and exclusive to JewelMint, G&B x JM looks like it was plucked right from his classic collection of Giles & Brother. I work from this group of references that I think keeps the continuum going with Giles & Brother, he says about the tribal and equestrian influences on his etched brass and rose gold designs.

title: Tamil Nadu Students Protest Alleged Human Rights Abuses in Sri Lanka
description: CHENNAI, Tamil NaduThe police sought to arrest more than 200 university students in Tamil Nadus capital, Chennai as protests raged on college campuses over allegations of the Sri Lankan armys brutal treatment of Tamil rebels.

title: Marriott Ties in With 42 to Promote Loyalty Program
description: Marriott International is using the release of the new film 42, about Jackie Robinson breaking Major League Baseballs color line, to promote its loyalty program to African-Americans.

title: Locker Room Lies
description: Photos from the Off Broadway play Good Boys and True.

title: Surveying Emancipation
description: President Lincolns issuance of the Emancipation Proclamation on Jan. 1, 1863 lent new urgency to the question of what shall we do with the Negroes. What had been only a possibility a few months before  the freeing of more than 3 million slaves still behind Confederate lines  had now become a likelihood dependent only on the success of Union armies.

title: Monday Motorsports: Raikkonens Lotus Wins Formula One Opener
description: Kimi Raikkonen seemed to outsmart the competition in the season-opening Formula One race on Sunday, scoring a victory for Lotus in the Australian Grand Prix in Melbourne.

title: The Hurdles to a Higher Offer for Dell
description: More than a month has passed since Dell announced its planned $24.4 billion sale to its founder, Michael S. Dell. Since then, a number of shareholders have loudly complained that the price Mr. Dell has offered for the computer company is far too low.

title: Fill-In | Boom Over, St. Patricks Isle Is Slithering Again
description: Directions: Fill in the blanks in the first 10 paragraphs of the article Boom Over, St. Patricks Isle Is Slithering Again by Amy Chozick.

title: A Warning to Clean Bagpipes
description: A prominent Scottish bagpiping school has warned pipers around to world to clean their instruments regularly after one of its longtime members nearly died of a lung infection caused by fungi growing inside his bag.

title: Sodas of The Times: Root Beer
description: The tasting panel found that the best root beers, which can be made with all sorts of ingredients, in varying proportions, were the ones whose flavors integrated seamlessly.

title: Solar Storm Season, a Cancer Cluster in Detail and Twitter Science
description: Massive solar storms and the threat to the power grid and global communications; the story of cancer in Toms River; the science behind being social online.

title: Power and Politics
description: Photos of the Broadway revival of A Man for All Seasons.

title: New Concussion Guidelines Stress Individual Treatment
description: The American Academy of Neurology said Monday that it had revised its guidelines for handling concussions to emphasize treating athletes case by case rather than according to a predetermined scale.

title: A House in the Barclays Centers Shadow Doesnt Linger on the Market
description: On a noisy street in Brooklyn is a little clapboard house that looks as if it dropped out of a charming suburban sky. It has friendly yellow siding and a pitched roof, a chimney and a backyard. It all looks quaint and adorable. Except for the view from its front door: 12,000 panels of arched, rusted steel.

title: Classical Recordings
description: Britten: The Rape of Lucretia

title: Woods and Vonn Join Ranks of Top Sports Couples
description: Tiger Woods announced Monday afternoon that he is dating the world and Olympic champion skier Lindsey Vonn. On his Facebook page, Woods posted some pictures of the couple, along with this statement:

title: Genetic Art, Whale Hearts and Morality
description: BOOK

title: With Your Goats Eye Martini, a Taste of Muskrat
description: James Cameron, the filmmaker (Avatar and Titanic) and explorer who last year dived to the bottom of the Pacific Ocean in his submersible, was about to enter a cocktail party given by the Explorers Club on Saturday evening at the Waldorf Astoria in Midtown, where the menu included a martini with a goats eye, pickled bull penises and strawberries dipped in white chocolate with black sprinkles of maggots. Later that night, Mr. Cameron would be awarded the clubs Explorers Medal. But first, a reporter asked him to name the strangest thing he had ever eaten.

title: Solar Storms and Sunspots
description: The Sun can release sprays of electrons and protons called coronal mass ejections.

title: Sun Storm Forecast: Tiny Chance of Havoc
description: In 1859 the sun erupted, and on Earth wires shot off sparks that shocked telegraph operators and set their paper on fire.

title: A Burst of Solar Power
description: A NASA physicist explains why scientists are increasingly concerned about the effect of solar flares on our wired world.

title: Boys Club: Springs New Haircut
description: While the Chop, a pretty safe, layered bob plus some bang action, is making its rounds across beauty salons, Ive noticed a more daring look on the red carpet in recent months that has a fresh, springlike appeal. At the Oscars, it was Charlize Therons blond Caesar cut that turned heads as much as her Dior gown. And Anne Hathaways grown-out Les Misrables pixie also stirred the pot with its poufy volume. A few weeks before that, at New York Fashion Week, it was Miley Cyruss transformative short crop in a shocking blond that seemed to announce: I no goodie-goodie Disney star.

title: No Time to Lament as Nets Face 8-Game Trip
description: There is no shame in dropping a game to the Atlanta Hawks, even at home, but the Nets projected disappointment in the way they competed Sunday night in a puzzling 105-93 loss that bore a number of implications for playoff seeding.

title: How Recent Popes Differ on Key Issues
description: Try to figure out which pope said what in seven critical areas.

title:
Syrian Rebels Pick
U.S. Citizen to Lead
Interim Government
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrias main exile opposition coalition elected a naturalized Syrian-born American citizen early Tuesday to be the first prime minister of an interim Syrian government, charged with funneling aid to rebels inside Syria and offering an alternative to the government of President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Firing Carmody, Northwestern Aims Higher
description: EVANSTON, Ill.  It made sense that on a gloomy, gray morning, Northwestern announced the firing of mens basketball coach Bill Carmody. Despite leading the program to unprecedented levels of success  including four National Invitation Tournament bids  Carmody never brought the Wildcats to an N.C.A.A tournament.

title: Madonna, Dressed for Camping, Weighs In on Boy Scouts Gay Ban
description: Wearing a Cub Scout summer uniform, a Scoutmasters brimmed hat and hiking boots, Madonna took the occasion of an appearance at the Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamations 24th annual Media Awards ceremony to advise the Boy Scouts of America that the organization should change their stupid rules, specifically its ban on gay members.

title: Walkabout  3/18: Second Life for Hong Kong Airport; Street View at 22,000 Feet
description: Air to Sea A one-time airport in Hong Kong has taken on a new life as a cruise terminal. Though it will not fully open until later this year, The Kai Tak Cruise Terminal welcomed its first 2,000 passengers during a trial run this weekend. (CNN)

title: The Spirit of Adventure
description: Sometimes all it takes to feel transported is a new accessory in an exotic material. See the interactive slide show

title: How One Soldier Learned the Iraq War Was On
description: This week, The Times will feature reflections on the 10th anniversary of the invasion. We invite anyone who was directly affected by the invasion to submit their essays via atwar@nytimes.com. Please keep pieces to 500 words.

title: I Want More Children; He Doesnt
description: When we were first married, my husband and I talked about the big stuff. We discussed religion and politics; we respected the differences in our opinions. We both wanted to raise children in New York City and remain united against the suburbs. With no red flags in sight, we began our union with confidence.

title: A New Approach to Hip Surgery
description: Larry Kufel had always been an active man, tall and rangy, who worked out regularly and picked up basketball games at the gym. But age was taking a toll on his joints, and it had become clear that he needed a hip replacement.

title: The Bible Producers Deny Suggested Obama Link
description: The producers of the hit mini-series The Bible on the History Channel scoffed Monday at online suggestions that an actor who plays Satan on the series was intentionally made up to resemble President Obama.

title: Landmark Status Sought for Public Librarys Rose Reading Room
description: Community Board 5, which represents Manhattans central business district, has requested that the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission designate as an interior landmark the main Rose Reading Room at the New York Public Librarys flagship branch.

title: Vitamin D May Lower Blood Pressure in Blacks
description: African-Americans have significantly higher rates of hypertension, and lower blood levels of vitamin D, than the rest of the population. Now a randomized trial suggests that vitamin D supplements may help lower blood pressure.

title: The Risks of Transferring a Car Loan to a Credit Card
description: The credit card site CardHub.com recently reviewed current zero-balance credit card transfer offers and found that many cards let consumers transfer all sorts of debt  not just credit card debt  onto the new cards.

title: Bancroft Prize Awarded to Two Historians
description: The Bancroft Prize, one of the most prestigious annual honors for historians, has been awarded to two scholars for books published last year.

title: The Lesson From Cyprus
description: The Cyprus fiasco sets a high bar for the euro zones new banking union. The new superregulator might not have been able to stop the blowup, or to avoid losses for insured depositors. The clear lesson from the mess is the need for a procedure to wind down failing banks.

title: What to Make of New Mexico
description: We know what you are thinking. You do not know what to make of New Mexico. Overrated? Underrated? Final Four sleeper? Disappointing early exiter?

title: A New Effort in Boston to Catch 1990 Art Thieves
description: It was one of the most brazen art thefts in history. Two thieves, posing as police officers, prevailed on the night watchman at Bostons Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum to let them in. After tying him up, and a leisurely 81 minutes, they walked out with 13 works of art and into the annals of one of the worlds most infamous unsolved crimes.

title: For Civilian Drones, the Sky is the Limit
description: GRAND FORKS, N.D.  As I wrote in Mondays paper, crossing the hobbyists remote-controlled airplane with cheap electronics from the cellphone industry seems likely to yield highly capable, very inexpensive drones.

title: Ina Drew Takes Risk, Goes on the Defensive
description: Writing a profile about someone who is not cooperating with your story starts to feel a little bit like an exercise in stalking. I did not actually stalk Ina Drew, the chief investment officerwho resigned from JPMorgan Chase following the banks $6 billion loss, as I reported on her for the magazine last October. But I did think about her for many of my waking moments throughout the summer of 2012, as I reported the story. I also showed up at her home once. I rang the doorbell, and met her husband, a tall, genial-looking man who told me that she was not available and would not talk to me, not that day and not anytime soon.

title: In Performance: Judy Kuhn
description: Judy Kuhn, accompanied by Mairi Dorman-Phaneuf on cello, sings Loving You from Stephen Sondheim and James Lapines musical Passion, now in revival at the Classic Stage Company.

title: With a Big If, Science Panel Finds Deep Cuts Possible in Auto Emissions and Oil Use
description: A panel convened by the National Academy of Sciences has concluded that deep cuts in oil use and emissions of greenhouse gases from cars and light trucks are possible in the United States by 2050, but only with a mix of diverse and intensified research and policies far stronger than those pursued so far by the Obama administration.

title: The Labor Agenda
description: Unemployment is persistently high. Wages are low. Inequality is rising. Employee bargaining power is decreasing. The lack of good jobs and the dearth of opportunities cast doubt on any and all indications of economic recovery.

title: The Small Picture: When the Dogs Come Running In
description: We recently asked small-business owners to send us photographs that capture the soul of their businesses in a single shot.

title: A Shining Moment Comes Early
description: The Florida Gulf Coast mens basketball team grabbed a piece of the national spotlight before their first appearance in the N.C.A.A. tournament, if only for eight seconds.

title: Second Thoughts in Europe as Anxiety Rises in Cyprus
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus  The lights were dimmed and the doors were locked. But inside a branch of Laiki Bank, one of Cypruss two dominant banks, a few silhouettes glided about Monday, filling cash machines to calm a wave of anxiety that has washed over this tiny island since European leaders took the unprecedented step Saturday of trying to force depositors to pay for part of an international bailout.

title: Best N.B.A. Games of the Week
description: Off the Dribble will highlight three essential games to watch each week, featuring hot teams, winning and losing streaks, and intriguing matchups in the N.B.A. (All times Eastern.)

title: Peoples Theater
description: A look at some of the shows produced at the Public Theater under its artistic director, Oskar Eustis.

title: For 10th Anniversary of Iraq War, a Low-Key Approach From The Times
description: Anniversary journalism, as Ive noted before, is a tricky proposition. At its best, its an opportunity to look back on an important event and provide the rich perspective that can only come with time. At its worst, its empty  a mere regurgitation of what happened with little that is new or fresh added.

title: Photo Replay: March 18
description: A view of the day in sports, including the dusty beginning to mountain-bike racing in South Africa.

title: Fashion News Were Reading Now
description: The Business of Fashion explains how the SXSW festival explored technological innovations like 3-D printing that will affect the fashion industry.

title: Detecting Heat Stress in Cows
description: Heat stress among dairy cows is a growing problem in the United States as the climate warms and farmers look to increase production from their herds. Now, researchers say farmers can predict which cows are in danger of overheating: the ones that stand for long periods without lying down.

title: A Challenge to Dollos Law
description: Dollos law, named for the 19th-century paleontologist Louis Dollo, states that evolution always moves forward  that an organism cannot redevelop an organ or attribute discarded by its ancestors. But new research on humble dust mites, the tiny arachnids that live in cushions and carpets everywhere, is challenging the law.

title: Columbia Picks New Journalism Dean
description: Steve Coll, a veteran of The Washington Post and The New Yorker whose investigations won him two Pulitzer Prizes, will be the next dean of the Columbia Journalism School, the president of Columbia University announced on Monday.

title: Fantasy Baseball: Outfield Preview
description: Justin Sablich is one half of the Sablich brothers, who provide fantasy sports advice on nytimes.com and on Twitter at @5thDownFantasy.

title: Julie Hochfelder, Aaron Webman
description: Julie Anne Hochfelder and Aaron Louis Webman were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Steven Bayar at the Lighthouse at Chelsea Piers in New York.

title: On the Trail of Cancer
description: ITS HIGH TIME a book did for epidemiology what Jon Krakauers best-selling Into Thin Air did for mountain climbing: transform a long sequence of painfully plodding steps and missteps into a narrative of such irresistible momentum that the reader not only understands what propels enthusiasts forward, but begins to strain forward as well, racing through the pages to get to the heady views at the end.

title: A Parisian Passover
description: Putting on a Seder every year can be a bit of a challenge in Paris.

title: Solving the Passover Puzzle
description: PARIS  A Seder in Paris should never be boring. So when Roger Yvon, an upscale butcher, proposed his signature deboned duck decorated with pitted green olives for the Passover dinner, I ordered two.

title: For Timberwolves Forward, a New Decisiveness
description: Although Minnesota Timberwolves forward Derrick Williams had a career-high 28 points Sunday night in a 97-95 win over the New Orleans Hornets, his reaction was typically low-key. Feels good, he said, brushing aside his individual achievement to talk about the team. We got a close win. Thats even better.

title: Former Romanian Premier Ordered Released From Prison
description: The Romanian former prime minister Adrian Nastase will be released early from prison after serving nine months of a two-year term for corruption, a Bucharest court ruled on Monday.

title: A Newborn, but No Wobbly Legs
description: DISSING JULIA ROBERTSS streetwalker on Rodeo Drive in Pretty Woman; sneering at Elaine Beness tussles with skinny mirrors at Barneys on Seinfeld: the intimidating salesclerk used to be the ultimate signifier of upscale retail. Of late, though, she (for it is often a young, beautiful she) has taken a curious turn toward overweening niceness.

title: Good News Beats Bad on Social Networks
description: BAD NEWS SELLS. If it bleeds, it leads. No news is good news, and good news is no news.

title: Q&A: Playing DVD Movies in Windows 8
description: Q.

title: Justices Appear Divided on Arizona Voting Law
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court appeared divided along familiar lines on Monday as it heard arguments  over whether Arizona can require proof of citizenship from people seeking to register to vote in federal elections.

title: Lifting the Shadow of Scandal
description: There has been so much enthusiasm around the public style of Pope Francis  who has been populist, self-effacing and unscripted in his first few days as pontiff  and so much eagerness from so many quarters to see him as the reformer that the Catholic Church needs, that I felt like a bit of a downer accentuating the negative in my Sunday column, and emphasizing all the moral credibility that still needs to be rebuilt. But if personal holiness and seriousness of faith were sufficient qualities in a Roman pontiff, the last ten years would not have been a period of crisis in Catholicism, and the shadow of the sex abuse crisis would be fully lifted from the church. And its especially important, at the outset of a new pontificate, to understand the precise nature of that shadow, because at this point its no longer really about priestly sex abuse itself. Rather, its about a church that has cleaned house effectively and set up impressive structures of accountability everywhere except at the most prominent levels of the hierarchy.

title: A Gray Jobs Market for All Ages
description: INSIDE the lower-level studio of the McBurney Y in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan, Abbas 1970s hit Dancing Queen is thumping out: See that girl, watch that scene, diggin the dancing queen. Right in step to the bouncing beat is a senior squad of 40 slightly sweaty women and men, ages 60 to 85.

title: The Great Aid Gap
description: IT was an unusually enthusiastic shout-out for the job certificate programs offered by many community colleges. A report found that men with nondegree certificates in computer/information services earned $72,498 a year on average  more money than 72 percent of men with associates degrees and more than 54 percent of men with bachelors degrees.

title: Aquatic Academy Isnt Kid Stuff
description: ATTENTION, reads a sign at the Aquarium of the Pacific in Long Beach, Calif., Sharks Ahead.

title: In Tourism, Classes Can Open Doors
description: JOHN LINDER had a career as a senior human resources manager, but he wanted something more. It was a good job, but I didnt want to be in an office anymore or in a corporate environment, he said. He also did not want extensive schooling, since he already had a masters degree. He loved to travel, and knew his strong people skills would translate well. His answer: a two-week immersion course at the International Tour Management Institute.

title: Back on Campus to Experience Road Not Taken
description: ADITI ROY wasnt looking to become an entrepreneur or head to Wall Street or move up the corporate totem pole like most of her compatriots in the University of Pennsylvanias Wharton School executive M.B.A. program. She was the morning news anchor for WCAU-TV, the NBC affiliate in Philadelphia, and already had a stint as West Coast correspondent for the network.

title: Online Certificate Programs at Colleges and Universities Gain Popularity
description: AS employers demand skills and more skills, many people are turning to online certificate programs to acquire a specific expertise that can lead them to a job or a promotion  or, sometimes, simply to ensure that they hang on to their current position.

title: Those Returning to School Can Find Help in the Tax Code
description: ROCCO ABBATEMARCO, 42, a middle school teacher from New York City, recently moved to Portland, Me., where he landed a teaching spot at a youth correctional facility. His new job required that he become certified in special education. To do so, Mr. Abbatemarco is taking accredited online courses, studying in the evening and on weekends.

title: Colleges Assess Cost of Free Online-Only Courses
description: VIRGINIA M. ROMETTY, the chief executive of I.B.M., recently urged her employees to take 40 hours of continuing education this year. The company would not reimburse tuition, but would pay for expenses, like textbooks.

title: Budding Entrepreneurs Can Choose an M.B.A. Lite
description: THEYRE called entrepreneurship or small-business certificates, and they dont carry the cachet or the credit of an M.B.A. But they take far less time to obtain, and they cost less, too. More colleges are offering them as a way to help people get their businesses off the ground.

title: A Low Seed, but L.I.U. Will Take It
description: The Long Island University Blackbirds arent New York Citys best-known basketball team  they might not even crack the Top 10 of that list  but they might be its most successful.

title: Acupuncture for Allergies (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Welcome Foot Support (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Anthony Speaks About Wednesday Return to Knicks
description: SALT LAKE CITY  Carmelo Anthony ran up and down the court, took jumpers and showed improvement in his lateral movement during the Knicks shootaround Monday at EnergySolutions Arena. Then, for the first time in nearly a week, he spoke to reporters and explained how he felt after having fluid drained from his sore right knee Friday.

title: A Crucial Number (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Weathering the Storm
description: Q. What determined which trees and other plants survived after inundation by Hurricane Sandy?

title: Pictures of the Day: Somalia and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Somalia, Pakistan, Cyprus and West Bank.

title: Washington Post Says Pay Model Will Start This Summer
description: The Washington Post will soon begin charging readers for access to its Web site, adopting a model that has taken hold at hundreds of newspapers as they attempt to make money from their online traffic.

title: Live Streaming: TimesTalks With Cyndi Lauper and Harvey Fierstein
description: 9:01 p.m. | Updated  Tonight ArtsBeat live streamed a conversation with two members of the creative team behind the new Broadway musical Kinky Boots: Harvey Fierstein, who wrote the book, and Cyndi Lauper, who wrote the songs. Click on the image above to watch the event, which was moderated by Patrick Healy.

title: Former Pentagon Lawyer Offers Pros and Cons of Drone Court
description: WASHINGTON  The former top lawyer at the Pentagon during President Obamas first term warned on Monday that the secrecy surrounding the governments use of targeted killings by drone strikes and other means is breeding mistrust, but he voiced skepticism about proposals for court review of decisions about which terrorism suspects the executive branch decides to assassinate.

title: Bringing a Virtual Brain to Life
description: For months, Henry Markram and his team had been feeding data into a supercomputer, four vending-machine-size black boxes whirring quietly in the basement of the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne.

title: Scene City: Madonna in Cub Scout Drag
description: Madonna joins Anderson Cooper, members of the Jersey Shore cast and others at GLAAD Media Awards.

title: Elegant Headphones, Crammed With Features
description: The French technology company Parrot is known primarily for its hands-free systems for cars, but it has added to its lineup a pair of wireless headphones that blend design and comfort with some very clever features.

title: An Emperor in Drag and Other Decadencies
description: A maniacal, lecherous, cross-dressing emperor hosts a blindfolded groping party and packs a corrupt senate with prostitutes. Is this a newly discovered sequel to Fellini Satyricon? A gross-out John Waters film? Or The Real Housewives of Ancient Rome?

title: A Work Trip, an Animal Rescue and a New Puppy
description: I STARTED flying quite a bit for business around 2002. I used to work for a public policy group and I had to go to a ton of meetings. It wasnt really hands-on, and I really wanted to do more with my career.

title: Speedy Check-In Lets Hotel Guests Bypass Front Desk
description: Hotels are changing the way guests check in to their rooms, eliminating the traditional stop at the front desk to speed up, simplify and, in some cases, personalize the process.

title: Medieval Remains, Dwindling Butterflies and Chatterboxes
description: This weeks opening category is interesting stuff buried in the British Isles.

title: Evangelical Groups Call for Path to Citizenship in Immigration Overhaul
description: A coalition including some of the nations largest evangelical Christian organizations said on Monday that Congress should include clear steps to citizenship for illegal immigrants in any bill to overhaul the immigration system.

title: Reggie Miller Twitter Q. & A.
description: Reggie Miller, former star shooting guard for U.C.L.A. and the Indiana Pacers and member of the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame, answered questions via Twitter about the 2013 mens N.C.A.A. basketball tournament. Miller will be part of the broadcast team covering the tournament for Turner Sports.

title: A Soft-Focus Look at Foxs Tough-Talking Tough Guy
description: Hes been called one of the few visionaries in the television business and the most successful executive in TV; a Republican kingmaker who would become the sharpest thorn in the side of Barack Obama and a pit-bull political strategist with only two speeds: attack and destroy.

title: Todays Scuttlebot:  Kickstarting Veronica Mars,  and Microsoft Connections
Congolese Warlord Wanted for War Crimes Surrenders to U.S. Diplomats in Rwanda
description: Last Updated, 10:06 a.m. A Congolese warlord whose troops were routed over the weekend walked into the United States Embassy in Rwanda on Monday and asked to be sent to The Hague to stand trial for war crimes.

title: Lost Sleep Can Lead to Weight Gain
description: The best path to a healthy weight may be a good nights sleep.

title: Moments of Lyricism in a Purely Russian Story
description: In Shostakovichs career, pockmarked with forced commissions, attempts to placate Soviet officials and humiliating bouts of censorship, his string quartets occupy a special place. Many critics have likened them to a confessional into which the composer confided the fears and hopes he had to suppress in public. But most of all, the 15 quartets represent the music Shostakovich wanted to write at a given moment.

title: Giselle Meets Kabuki in a Tale of Love, Madness and Toxic Breath
description: A Rudyard Kipling ballad starts with the refrain Oh, East is East, and West is West, and never the twain shall meet. In the choreographer Yasuko Yokoshis Bell, which had its world premiere on Saturday at New York Live Arts, East and West indeed dont meet. But they share the stage; they overlap; they coincide. The result, unlike any production I have seen, runs a gamut: Its peculiar, admirable, a bit long-winded and sometimes perplexing.

title: Bodyguard and Its Diva, Now Onstage
description: LONDON  Playing a pop goddess in The Bodyguard, the new musical based on the 1992 movie that starred Whitney Houston and Kevin Costner, Heather Headley gives great diva. Ms. Headley, who won (and deserved) a Tony as the title character in Disneys Aida, scores another personal triumph and once again transcends her material as the celebrity in jeopardy in Alexander Dinelariss lumpy adaptation of Lawrence Kasdans original screenplay.

title: Off the Streets, Out of the Mines
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  The South African dance company Via Katlehong began in 1992 as an effort to siphon young men off the tough streets of Katlehong, a township near Johannesburg. About 10 years later French presenters took an interest in the troupes blend of dances from the street and the mines, and it began to tour internationally  a chain that often ends with local idioms being transformed into slick global products.

title: Freedom Is Brief for Canadians Who Fled Prison by Helicopter
description: OTTAWA  In a bold prison break, two Canadian convicts shinnied up a rope at a provincial detention center north of Montreal to a hijacked helicopter hovering overhead and, briefly, experienced freedom.

title: Museums Go Shopping at Maastricht
description: MAASTRICHT, the Netherlands  Every March museum directors and curators from around the world flock to the European Fine Art Fair, held in a soulless convention center here. They come to look at the art, gauge the market and network with colleagues, collectors and trustees. But this year, barely 24 hours after the preview on Thursday, there were reports that more museums than usual were among the serious shoppers.

title: How Fast We Slow Down Running Longer Distances
description: How fast do we slow down?

title: On the Origins of Gadgets
description: Once, maybe, everyone more or less understood everything and how it worked. But society pushed past that point long ago, into a realm where we are dependent on devices and structures we couldnt possibly make ourselves and whose origins we dont even know. As you realize if youre reading this on a cellphone.

title: Love Goddess? Never Saw That Coming
description: One of the more notable things about the season finale of Girls on Sunday is that Hannah, the heroine played by Lena Dunham, kept her clothes on.

title: As Crop Prices Surge, Investment Firms and Farmers Vie for Land
description: From the potato fields of Michigan to the high prairies of Kansas, farmers are receiving record prices for their land  but economists and banking regulators warn that this boom, like so many before it, could end badly.

title: Albums by Low and Phosphorescent
description: LOWThe Invisible Way(Sub Pop)

title: Bloomberg Doubles Its Tech Television
description: 5:53 p.m. | Updated In a world of shrinking newsrooms, real expansion is an increasingly rare story. But next Monday, Bloomberg West, Bloomberg Televisions show on technology, will double its daily programming to two hours. Along with the existing afternoon program, Bloomberg West will present another hour of tech news at 10 a.m. Pacific time.

title: Jordans King Finds Fault With Everyone Concerned
description: CAIRO  King Abdullah II of Jordan leads one of the smallest, poorest and most vulnerable Arab nations. But that does not stop him from looking down on many of those around him, including the leaders of Egypt, Turkey and Syria, as well as members of his own royal family, his secret police, his traditional tribal political base, his Islamist opponents and even United States diplomats.

title: St. Louis Watches Selection Show in Electronics Store
description: St. Louis navigated Virginia Commonwealths full-court press well enough to win the Atlantic 10 Conference tournament title game Sunday afternoon at Barclays Center. It was after the game when the Billikens were slowed by what some might consider a more stressful situation  fighting New York City traffic on the way to the airport.

title: What the Cyprus Bailout Could Mean for Europes Debt
description: The Cyprus bailout is perhaps an even bigger deal than it first seemed, and not for bad reasons.

title: U.N. Rights Council to Vote on Resolution on Sri Lanka
