The research has also rescued from obscurity a little-known Renaissance man, the 16th-century globe maker Johannes Schner, who was responsible for saving the map for posterity.

title: With Acquisition, Apple Looks Indoors for Future of Maps
description: It appears Apple is thinking seriously about what the mobile maps of tomorrow will look like, not just fixing the maps service it has today.

title: When Fig Wasps Cant Take the Heat
description: There are more than 700 species of wild fig in the tropics. Remarkably, most can be pollinated only by a unique species of fig wasp. In turn, the wasps rely on fig plants as hosts for their eggs. Neither species can survive without the other, a relationship known as obligate mutualism.

title: Cold, Wet Wait for Tickets to Supreme Courts Same-Sex Marriage Cases
description: WASHINGTON  Being a witness to history can be messy business. And for those waiting outside the Supreme Court on Monday for one of the few coveted tickets to hear oral arguments in a pair of same-sex marriage cases this week, it was also cold, wet and tedious.

title: Go Find Your Flippers
description: The real estate, and dunes, on Fire Island qualified for a post-mortem in the wake of Hurricane Sandy. Besides the dozen or so homes swept into the sea, nearly 1,600 sustained significant damage  by wind or saltwater or a combination. The Army Corps of Engineers, which so far has five demolition permits for homes too ravaged to repair, is handling the removal of tons of debris.

title: More Join Hunger Strike at Guantnamo Prison
description: A  hunger strike among detainees at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, who have been imprisoned by the United States military without trial  some for more than a decade  is continuing to grow, although there is sharp disagreement between the military and lawyers for the detainees about how many are participating.

title: With or Without Bailout, Cypriots Lose Trust in Banks
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus  With her wedding day three months away, Despina Charalambous is desperate to gain access to her savings, which have been frozen at the Bank of Cyprus for more than a week. She plans to take out all her money once the banks reopen, even though the new bailout plan for her country supposedly guarantees the safety of her deposits.

title: A Russian Supper Club for Natasha Musical
description: A vacant lot in Manhattans meatpacking district is being transformed into New Yorks latest theater spectacle, a sexy Russian supper club that will be the new home of Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812, Dave Malloys acclaimed electropop opera that ran at Ars Nova last fall.

title: Pictures of the Day: Afghanistan and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Afghanistan, Syria, Myanmar and Yemen.

title: In the Shadow of LaFerrari, the Pininfarina Sergio
description: Almost overlooked at the Geneva auto show earlier this month was the Pininfarina Sergio concept. Normally, the product of the worlds most famous Italian coach builder would be a headliner. But this year was different. The show was dominated by the impact of the LaFerrari, the powerful supercar from Ferrari.

title: Walkabout  3/25: No Carry-on? Go to Front of the Line, Says American
description: Flying Light American Airlines is testing new boarding procedures that award passengers who dont bring any carry-ons by allowing them to board before others in economy class. (Today)

title: A Push for HPV Vaccinations
description: The government recommended years ago that all adolescent girls get a vaccine to protect against cervical cancer. But nearly seven years after it first came to market, an overwhelming majority of girls have yet to be inoculated.

title: Female Business Travelers Make a Case for Pen Knives
description: HERE is what the Transportation Security Administration said its screeners discovered in passengers carry-on bags at airport security in the seven days that ended last Thursday: 32 guns, 23 of them loaded and seven with rounds in the firing chamber; eight stun guns; a four-inch knife concealed in a suitcase lining; and an eight-inch tactical spike hidden in a sock.

title: Clearing the Jungle (Barely) on a Wing and a Pilots Prayer
description: SINCE Im in charge of international sales and product development at Numi Organic Tea, my business travel can be crazy. I may not have to leave California, our headquarters, for a few weeks, and then I may be gone for four or five weeks visiting farms overseas, or looking for new business opportunities or potential partners. Much of my travel can be dictated by growing seasons.

title: Avicii Turns to Nashville for Ultra Music Festival Show
description: 1:31 p.m. | Updated  MIAMI  Avicii, the Swedish music producer and D.J., is known for catchy house music like the hits Levels and Silhouettes. But on Friday, at the Ultra Music Festival here, his one-hour set more resembled a Nashville concert than a performance by one of the stars of electronic dance music.

title: The Mouths Guard
description: Humans secrete two kinds of saliva, stimulated and unstimulated, no more alike than most siblings. The prettier child is stimulated saliva. It comes from the parotid glands, between cheek and ear. When a plate of spaghetti carbonara makes your mouth water, thats stimulated saliva. It makes up 70 to 90 percent of the two to three pints of saliva each of us generates daily. Stimulated saliva looks, tastes and flows like water  it is, in fact, 99 percent water with some proteins and minerals. Each persons saliva contains minerals in unique proportions.

title: The Marvels in Your Mouth
description: WAGENINGEN, THE NETHERLANDS  When I told people I was traveling to Food Valley, I described it as the Silicon Valley of eating. At this cluster of universities and research facilities, nearly 15,000 scientists are dedicated to improving  or, depending on your sentiments about processed food, compromising  the quality of our meals.

title: Gulp! The Quiz
description: Chew, swallow, digest, repeat. You probably dont think much about your digestive tract, but there are some amazing things going on in your gut. Take this quiz, based on the new book Gulp! by Mary Roach, excerpted in this weeks Science Times, to find out how intimately you know your innards.

title: Vain Glorious | Kiehls Stress Relief
description: Stress. Our bodies are engineered to cope with a certain amount comfortably, but sustained, intense stress is an entirely different matter. It can negatively impact our minds, our hearts, and our bodys largest organ, skin. Its effects are particularly harsh, causing premature aging and advancing the symptoms of every common skin condition from sensitive skin to eczema and psoriasis, says Dr. Cynthia Ackrill, a fellow at the American Institute of Stress.

title: A Meteors Data Trail, Journey on the Alimentary Canal and Using the Body to Fight Cancer
description: Henry Fountain on how science is tracking the meteor that exploded over Russia back to its source; Mary Roach on our fascinating guts; Denise Grady on a novel treatment for some cancers of the blood.

title: The Multipurpose Airport
description: Jim Rosenberg, the head of online and social media for the World Bank, can vouch that some airports offer a lot more than places to eat and newsstands filled with gossipy magazines.

title: Beware of the High Cost of Free Online Courses
description: That the acronym MOOCs rhymes with nukes seems apt. Massive open online courses, or MOOCs  led by two profit-making start-ups, Coursera and Udacity, founded by entrepreneurial Stanford professors  are a new disruptive force in education. Leading universities have scrambled to join or offer alternatives like edX, a collaboration of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Harvard University and others.

title: Different Versions of a Life, All Lived
description: In the midst of a secret love affair, Ursula Todd discovers that she is an excellent liar. The same can be said admiringly of Kate Atkinson, whose latest novel, Life After Life, is her very best. Ms. Atkinsons wide-ranging body of work includes several novels that resemble mysteries, but she has never had the narrowly deductive mind to suit that genre. Life After Life is a big book that defies logic, chronology and even history in ways that underscore its authors fully untethered imagination.

title: Todays Scuttlebot:  After Google Reader, and Steve Jobs Manga
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. More Scuttlebot can be found here.

title: Solid Sales for Pippin and The Nance on Broadway
description: Two of the highest-profile Broadway shows this spring, the revival of the musical Pippin and the new Nathan Lane play The Nance, had solid ticket sales during their first weekend of performances, according to data released on Monday by the Broadway League, a trade association of theater owners and producers.

title: A Highly Public Trip for Chinas President, and Its First Lady
description: President Xi Jinping of China is on his inaugural overseas trip. Mr. Xi stopped first in Russia, went to Tanzania, and will then visit the Republic of Congo and South Africa, where he will also attend a summit meeting of emerging BRICS economies  Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa.

title: Creating a Brain
description: To the Editor:

title: Optimal Vaccine Doses
description: To the Editor:

title: YouTube Videos Unlock Meteors Secrets
description: Scientists around the world have been using videos made by Russian citizens and uploaded to YouTube to figure out exactly where the meteor that exploded over Russia on Feb. 15 came from.

title: Exploring the Language That Speaks the Inexpressible
description: Listening to the pianist Jeremy Denk play, you never doubt that he is someone who thinks about music deeply and rather a lot. Its not that you sense that he fusses overmuch about tempos and dynamics, or that hes out to demonstrate his awesome cleverness through programming juxtapositions. Rather, what Mr. Denks playing conveys most is an inclusive consideration of where each piece came from, what it reflects about its composer and how music connects to a lifes broader concerns.

title: Where Bowls and Bodies Fly Though the Air
description: Whats the next level after impressed? Amazed? Awe-struck? Whatever it is, that emotion arrives often in Totem, the newest show from Cirque du Soleil.

title: A Beige Wine for a Beige Meal
description: For a meal of relentlessly beige food, may I suggest the beigest of wines? That would be chardonnay, which will go beautifully with Melissa Clarks chicken potpie. I call it beige in the most insulting way, as chardonnay long ago became kind of a generic term for a glass of insipid white wine in any bar in the land. But of course chardonnay also makes some of the greatest, most distinctive white wines in the world. This potpie calls out for a crisp wine, with no oakiness and plenty of lively acidity and herbal-citrus zest to cut through the richness of the filling.

title: Librarian Lets Down Hair and Downs Many Drinks
description: The history of romantic comedies would be considerably shorter without the presence of the shy girl. You know, the mousy one whos overlooked until that magic moment when she. ... (Insert standard plot twist leading to capture of Prince Charming.)

title: A Concerto for a First Among Equals
description: The Orpheus Chamber Orchestra is celebrating its 40th anniversary this season with a roster of new collaborators, including the jazz greats Wayne Shorter and Brad Mehldau, and the contemporary composer-performers Timothy Andres and Gabriel Kahane. But on Saturday evening at Carnegie Hall this conductorless orchestra teamed up with an old friend, the pianist Richard Goode, who joined the players in a lucid performance of Schumanns Piano Concerto.

title: What You Didnt Post, Facebook May Still Know
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Debra Aho Williamson, an advertising industry analyst and devoted coffee drinker, was intrigued by a promotion that popped up on her Facebook page recently. Sign up for a Starbucks loyalty card, it said, and get $5 off.

title: Salesmen in the Surgical Suite
description: When Fred E. Taylor arrived at Harrison Medical Center in Silverdale, Wash., for a routine prostatectomy, he expected the best medical care new technology had to offer: robotic surgery, billed as safer, less painful and easier on the body than traditional surgery.

title: The Grown-Up Behind a Tween Phenomenon
description: CHANTILLY, Va.  If you are one of those people whose lives do not include a girl under the age of 12  and in that case, OMG I am SO SORRY for you!!!  then the Dork Diaries, a series for tweens that has sold over 10 million copies in less than four years, may have escaped your notice.

title: Hearts Suffer and Crumble When Mourning the Loss of Children
description: We see Antony Tudors Dark Elegies (1937) too seldom. There are many who consider it one of the foremost dance masterpieces of the last century; for a few its the greatest. Though Im not among its ardent admirers, I certainly think its an important, compelling and finely made piece  well worth seeing and arguing about.

title: TimesTalks: David O. Russell
description: The film director David O. Russell speaks with The Times's Melena Ryzik about how his craft has evolved over the years.

title: Baseball Fan Clubhouse Gets an Art Gallery
description: An art gallery in the middle of a building devoted to baseball may strike some as a culture clash, but Major League Baseball will try to change that view with the launch of the M.L.B. Fan Cave Art Gallery on April 4 in Manhattan.

title: Caregiver for Disabled People Sues New York State
description: ALBANY  A New York State-employed caregiver for people with developmental disabilities sued the state on Monday, accusing it of retaliating against him for whistle-blowing.

title: The Place That Makes a Riddle of Pitching
description: Scottsdale, Ariz.

title: Festival Glimpses the Future of Film
description: The post-Oscar scarcity of interesting movies in theaters is relieved, as always, by New Directors/New Films, the annual spring festival presented by the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Museum of Modern Art, which continues through Sunday. It is also a place to glimpse the future of movies, as fledgling careers take wing, and new hybrid forms (of science fiction and melodrama, of documentary and personal narrative) are explored. Manohla Dargis and A. O. Scott, chief film critics of The New York Times, discuss this weeks highlights below.

title: Albums by Dido, OneRepublic, Thompson Square, Tomasz Stanko
description: Dido

title: Watching the Choreographers Mind Churn
description: The format of this years Harkness Dance Festival at the 92nd Street Y requires choreographers to discuss their work, lecture-demonstration style, before the dancers perform with lights and costumes. On Friday night the choreographer Kate Weare began her weekend at the Y by explaining how hard it was for her to explain. Her creative process, she said, contains mysteries she is resistant to analyzing.

title: Emblem3 at Irving Plaza
description: The trio, which placed fourth on The X Factor last year, performed at Irving Plaza on Friday night.

title: New Onstage, but Sounding Familiar
description: The modern era of reality-TV singing competitions has been with us for just over a decade, and even though in that time they have minted a few stars  Kelly Clarkson, Carrie Underwood, Jennifer Hudson  its arguable that in terms of impact on the shape of pop music, theyve served absolutely no purpose at all.

title: Art Worth Millions, Yet No Cash for Burial
description: Family and friends gathered in Charleston, S.C., on Friday for the funeral of the New York-based artist Merton D. Simpson, a painter and pioneering champion of African art who accumulated a collection said to be worth millions of dollars. Gathering in the city of his birth, eulogists celebrated Mr. Simpsons expertise on the saxophone, his generosity and his visionary artistic taste.

title: NASA Engines Found, News About Squid and More
description: So few people do favors for NASA these days. So when Jeff Bezos, the Amazon.com founder, announced last week that an expedition he financed had hoisted two F-1 rocket engines from an Apollo mission off the ocean floor, the agency was understandably grateful.

title: Hopes Outside the Supreme Court
description: Protesters and supporters explain why they are standing in freezing rain for a chance to witness hearings on same-sex marriage.

title: Taking Safety Agencys App for a Test Drive
description: Although it has concerns about consumers using smartphones behind the wheel, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration now has its own app.

title: Wood Creek Adds to Music Holdings, Acquiring Concord
description: The Concord Music Group, an independent music company with an artist roster that includes Paul McCartney, Paul Simon and Creedence Clearwater Revival, has been sold to Wood Creek Capital Management, a private equity firm that has been quietly building a collection of music assets.

title: The Emotional Lure of Prepaid College
description: MATTHEW ROGERSS infant daughter was just weeks old when he learned that her grandfather already had plans for her.

title: Among Young Inheritors, an Urge to Redistribute
description: MOST people would probably be quite happy to receive an inheritance. They would pay off debt, maybe their mortgage; save for retirement; take a trip or two. It would be blissful, and it would make their lives easier.

title: After You Read the Listings, Your Agent Reads You
description: EVERY saleswoman will tell you that the customer is always transparent. Maybe not entirely, completely, but compared with the poker face a buyer thinks that he or she is wearing, there are always expressions and signals that are obvious to the practiced observer.

title: Money Talk Before Marriage a Tip You Cant Disparage
description: WHEN Joe, 64, a computer professional in Massachusetts, married for the first time, he was 31 and very in love.

title: For Older Americans, a Deepening Debt Problem
description: OH, to be young and in debt.

title: To Avoid the Biggest Investing Mistake, Stay Strong
description: IF you have been awake for the last five years, your investing experience has probably been anything but smooth. Scary markets like the one that bottomed out in March 2009 often cause us to do crazy things. This craziness may be temporary, but it doesnt take long to make what I call the big mistake: ditching your well-designed investing plan to either buy high or sell low.

title: Growing Up With a Trust
description: STUART LUCAS learned about his trust fund the old-fashioned way: when he was 18 and went east to Dartmouth College.

title: Expense and Emotions in Preparing for Long-Term Care
description: ANDY SHAPIRO had never given much thought to whether he would need help with daily activities as he aged. After all, the 61-year-old software consultant figured, he kept himself in good shape.

title: Emotion, Wild Card of Finances
description: Few topics are as emotionally charged as money.

title: Saving for Retirement as an Act of Wild Optimism
description: WHEN I was 30, the ovarian cancer Id had as a child returned after a 20-year hiatus. The new diagnosis arrived dramatically, when a trip to the emergency room revealed a tumor that was causing internal bleeding. During the week I spent in intensive care, my son, Leo, stopped speaking aloud and talked only in a whisper. He was almost 4.

title: How to Set a Price on the Life of a Beloved Pet?
description: I COULDNT begin to add up the number of times my husband and I have had the Talk. We know illness and death are two of lifes certainties. And weve taken care of the issue when it comes to ourselves. Weve signed medical directives saying we want no extraordinary measures taken to extend our lives if we become incapacitated to the point that were a burden, emotionally and financially, to our families.

title: A Family Manipulated by an Economic Crisis
description: Theres no need to condescend to puppets anymore.

title: Still Bleeding, 10 Years Later
description: Chasing WarThe blades wore a darkened silver sheen, dulled at the edge. Bits of hair, dried salt-sweat and dung-powdered dirt clogged the head so that with each firm scrape, tiny beads of crimson and pus dried into little scab islands in the crease of my neck. There was no water, no cream, no electrical outlets  just a cracked Humvee mirror and the light from the rising sun. My Mach3 wouldnt skive the glaze from a stick of butter, but still I bled.

title: Stricter Rules but Signs of Disarray in Cyprus Deal
description: PARIS  The Cyprus deal announced Sunday, another late-night showdown in Brussels that looked like a shambles, laid down some important new markers for the future of the European Union and the countries that use the euro. The big European powers used the crisis to establish some new, more punitive rules for countries needing emergency aid.

title: Jozy Altidore: One Down, One to Go
description: MEXICO CITY  Warmth, sunshine and clear skies. Just some of the things we all take for granted in everyday life.

title: Mets Executive Moves to MSG
description: Dave Howard, a top executive of the Mets, is leaving Flushing for Manhattan to become the president of MSG Sports, the sports division of Madison Square Garden.

title: Penguins Make Deals With Cup in Mind
description: With just over a week remaining until the April 3 N.H.L. trade deadline, Penguins General Manager Ray Shero pulled off two moves, which could leave Pittsburgh idle on deadline day.

title: Puerto Rico as Haven for the Rich
description: Known for its white sand beaches and killer rums, Puerto Rico hopes to stake a new claim as tax haven for the wealthy.

title: Post-Mortem for Russian Finds No Sign of a Struggle
description: LONDON  A post-mortem examination on the exiled Russian oligarch Boris Berezovsky found the cause of death was consistent with hanging with no sign of a violent struggle, the police said late Monday, after two days of intense speculation over the final hours of one of the Kremlins most vocal critics.

title: Puerto Rico Creates Tax Shelters in Appeal to the Rich
description: Known for its white-sand beaches and killer rums, Puerto Rico hopes to stake a new claim: tax haven for the wealthy.

title: With Speech, Petraeus Returns to Public Life, Keenly Aware of Altered Reputation
description: WASHINGTON  Since he resigned as  director of the Central Intelligence Agency last November after acknowledging an extramarital affair, David H. Petraeus has all but vanished from the national scene.

title: A Tour Puts a City in Reach and at Arms Length
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  A man from Haifa recalled taking his children here in the 1970s, to buy products not yet available in Israel: Ovaltine, licorice, 7-Up, Wrigleys gum. A woman who lives in a Jerusalem suburb said she used to come in the 1980s, for political demonstrations.

title: As Holy Days Dot Calendar, State Budget Must Wait
description: ALBANY  Lord knows, lawmakers in Albany have often had their differences. This week, those differences have been over when to honor the Lord.

title: Shaving Below a Mans Neck, if Thats What She Wants
description: AS bare-chested photographs of the hirsute actors Sean Connery and Burt Reynolds from the 1960s and 1970s suggest there was a time when an abundance of body hair for men was widely considered attractive. But look at magazines like Mens Health and Mens Fitness in recent years, and the vast majority of the shirtless cover models have polished torsos, well-defined six-pack abs and pectoral muscles.

title: N.Y.U.s President: Visionary or Autocrat?
description: To the Editor:

title: Skepticism From Court in Drug Case
description: WASHINGTON  Several Supreme Court justices expressed skepticism on Monday about the legality of payments by brand-name drug companies to potential generic competitors in exchange for keeping their cheaper, rival drugs off the market.

title: Now in Defense of Gay Marriage, Bill Clinton
description: WASHINGTON  He had just flown across the country after an exhausting campaign day in Oregon and South Dakota, landing at the White House after dark. But President Bill Clinton still had more business before bed. He picked up a pen and scrawled out his name, turning a bill into law.

title: Banning Tobacco Displays
description: To the Editor:

title: Recycling Electronics
description: To the Editor:

title: Married Priests
description: To the Editor:

title: Helping Veterans
description: To the Editor:

title: Hit-and-Run Drivers Troubled Past Explains Choice to Flee, Family Says
description: Julio Acevedo has shown a knack for squandering second chances.

title: A Mothers Loss and a Mayors Unwelcome Sympathy
description: For several days and through various channels, the office of Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, a firm advocate of gun control, as well as the mayor himself, had tried to contact the family of a Brooklyn 16-year-old who was killed by plainclothes officers after the police said he had pointed an illegally obtained revolver at them.

title: Deal May End Citys Standoff With Teachers
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and legislative leaders said on Monday that they had reached an agreement to help New York City and its teachers union settle on a teacher evaluation system and save the city from losing hundreds of millions of dollars in future education financing.

title: He Has Millions and a New Job at Yahoo. Soon, Hell Be 18.
description: One of Yahoos newest employees is a 17-year-old high school student in Britain. As of Monday, he is one of its richest, too.

title: For Cyprus, a Better Bad Deal
description: The latest European plan to prevent the collapse of the banking system in Cyprus is a big improvement over the first disastrous attempt to address the crisis. But the deal, reached over the weekend, will still impose harsh austerity on the people of Cyprus and could further sap public confidence in the banks of other weak European economies, like Spain and Italy.

title: Deciding Not to Decide Gay Marriage
description: Washington

title: Africas Voice, Nigerias Conscience
description: LAGOS, Nigeria

title: A 50-State Ruling
description: Californias Proposition 8 rewrote the states Constitution so that only marriage between a man and a woman is valid or recognized in California. The 1996 Defense of Marriage Act, for purposes of any federal law, defined the word marriage to mean only a legal union between one man and one woman.

title: The Killing Chain
description: Lets say you were writing a novel about a homicide. Youd want to describe the killers neighborhood and family background. Youd want to describe his school, his culture and his gang.

title: Rand Pauls Loopy Ascent
description: When youve got loons the likes of Ted Cruz and Sarah Palin fluttering about, I suppose its easy not to seem like such a wacko bird yourself.

title: Anthony Lewis, Champion of the Law
description: My introduction to Anthony Lewis, who died on Monday at 85, came late one afternoon in 1963 in the Washington bureau of The New York Times, where I was a microscopically junior editor and he was one in a towering cast of journalistic stars assembled by James Reston, the bureau chief. It was decision day at the Supreme Court, and Tony handed me brief summaries of three or four articles he intended to write by the time his bus to suburban Virginia left at 6:30. And so, to my astonishment, he did  one big piece on the most important case; smaller ones on the others; each one crisp, learned and requiring almost nothing in the way of editorial improvement.

title: Massachusetts Plan Starts Small for Big Upgrade to Rail System
description: BOSTON  Later this spring, Bostonians eager to flee to Cape Cod for the weekend will have an option other than sitting in bumper-to-bumper traffic for 70 miles and fuming along with everyone else.

title: Rise in  Sexual Assaults in Egypt Sets Off Clash Over Blame
description: CAIRO  The sheer number of women sexually abused and gang raped in a single public square had become too big to ignore. Conservative Islamists in Egypts new political elite were outraged  at the women.

title: Obligations and Motivations in the Battle for Dell
description: Leon Cooperman, the billionaire investor and longtime Wall Street denizen, was railing on Monday about the deal of the moment: Michael Dells $24 billion effort to buy out the troubled computer maker he founded.

title: Staten Island Man Is Convicted of Lying About Plans to Join Terrorists
description: A Staten Island man was convicted on Monday of lying to federal agents about his plans to join terrorist groups overseas.

title: Sochi Organizers Are Stockpiling Snow, Just in Case
description: SOCHI, Russia  The biggest worry among organizers for next years Winter Olympics is not whether the sites will be in order, or that the 30-mile road and the new railroad tracks and the thousands of hotel rooms all being built from scratch will be complete, or that the stands will be full of fans despite this citys remote location.

title: Arrest of Anti-Islamist Figures Is Ordered in Egypt
description: CAIRO  The public prosecutor on Monday ordered the arrest of five anti-Islamist political activists on charges of using social media to incite violence against the Muslim Brotherhood. The order stirred accusations of a vendetta by the groups close ally, President Mohamed Morsi.

title: Adding Rail Service to the Cape
description: Bostonians eager to flee to Cape Cod for the weekend will have another option than sitting in bumper-to-bumper traffic for 70 miles and fuming along with everyone else.

title: With Lives and Careers Destroyed, Asking: Who Watches the Investigators?
description: Louis Scarcella, a retired police detective, is a talkative, charming fellow and the president of the Coney Island Polar Bear Club. Hes the sort who plunges into the ice-cold Atlantic wearing a Santa Claus hat.

title: Harvard Asks Graduates to Donate Time to Free Online Humanities Class
description: Alumni of elite colleges are accustomed to getting requests for money from their alma mater, but the appeal that Harvard sent to thousands of graduates on Monday was something new: a plea to donate their time and intellects to the rapidly expanding field of online education.

title: 43 Hours and 7 Sweaty Shirts Later, Thwack! A Dodgeball Record!
description: HALFMOON, N.Y.  Max Standa bounded up the stairs in a bustling sports complex here, cleats on, shin guards up, urging on friends behind him.

title: Lawyer Outlines Challenges in New Job Fixing Detroit
description: DETROIT  The citys new emergency manager spent his first day on the job trying to build bridges with elected officials while at the same time preparing to impose financial controls that could include pay cuts for the mayor and City Council.

title: Corrections: March 26, 2013
description: SPORTS

title: Wow!
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  This is the kind of goofy, silly theme I absolutely love, and its perfect for a Tuesday: just enough mental distance from the clue to the answer to make it not quite a Monday puzzle, and enough humor to make it an enjoyable solve.

title: Teams That Beat Florida Gulf Coast Watch in Awe
description: At the time, it did not strike Lipscomb Coach Scott Sanderson as particularly noteworthy. About an hour before his team faced Florida Gulf Coast on Jan. 17, Sanderson glanced across the gym and saw that the Eagles had formed a layup line, or at least some futuristic version of one.

title: Offstage, Quinn Isnt Afraid to Let Fury Fly
description: Christine C. Quinn was not pleased.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 25, 2013

title: Jump in Land Assessments Shocks Newark Business Owners
description: NEWARK  For 15 years, Ivo Fernandes, a mechanic, has fine-tuned motors and painted over chronic graffiti at an old brick garage he owns on an industrial block here next to a junkyard encircled by razor wire. In 2003, when the real estate market was hot, Mr. Fernandess property was appraised at $492,000.

title: Terrorist Has Cooperated With U.S. Since Secret Guilty Plea in 2011, Papers Show
description: A Somali terrorist with ties to Al Qaeda whose capture and interrogation aboard a United States naval ship in 2011 fueled debate about the Obama administrations counterterrorism tactics secretly pleaded guilty in Manhattan and has been cooperating with the authorities, court documents released on Monday show.

title: Assembly Panel to Review Deal on Luxury Suite
description: ALBANY  A State Assembly committee has opened a review of the Cuomo administrations decision to negotiate itself a luxury suite at the stadium where the Buffalo Bills play.

title: No Wade, No Problem as Heat Extend Their Streak to 27
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Dwyane Wade sat out his second consecutive game, but again, it hardly mattered.

title: The Players in the Same-Sex Marriage Hearings
description: A quick guide to the parties and lawyers in the same-sex marriage cases before the Supreme Court.

title: Harlon Hill, N.F.L. Star and Trophy Name, Dies at 80
description: The Chicago Bears waited until the 15th round of the 1954 National Football League draft to select Harlon Hill, a receiver from a small Southern school. Hill was not exactly waiting to be chosen, because he had no thoughts of playing professional football.

title: On Campus, Hoping Success Will Be a Draw
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.  It was high noon on the sun-splashed campus, and Sherwood Brown looked perky despite having arrived from Philadelphia at 3 in the morning. He posed for picture after picture after picture with a small army of fans of Americas newest basketball darlings, the Florida Gulf Coast University Eagles.

title: In East Turf Battle, the High Ground Remains in Dispute
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.

title: Stung by Loss, Stephens Insists She Still Wants to Win
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Everything was setting up perfectly for Sloane Stephens to reverse the downward trend she has been on since upsetting Serena Williams to reach the semifinals at the Australian Open.

title: Titanic Director Donates Deep-Sea Craft to Institute
description: The Hollywood director James Cameron is donating the craft that he built and last year rode into the seas deepest spot to the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, as part of a new collaboration meant to speed ocean exploration, the partners announced early Tuesday.

title: U.S. Wants State to Pay After Audit of Youth Care
description: ALBANY  In another critical assessment of New Yorks multibillion-dollar Medicaid program, a federal audit says the state improperly claimed $27.5 million in reimbursements for services to mentally ill and emotionally disturbed children and teenagers.

title: Word of the Day | liaison
description: liaison \le--zn, le-a-, la--\ noun

title: Proposed Rail Projects in Massachusetts
description: Proposed rail projects In Massachusetts.

title: Womens N.C.A.A. Tournament: March 25
description: Top-seeded UConn advanced to the third round of the N.C.A.A. tournament to face Maryland, who knocked off Michigan State.

title: Wang Hopes to Get Back to Where He Started
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Chien-Ming Wang was back in a Yankees cap working out at their minor league complex Monday, attempting to reclaim at least a small portion of the glory he carved out in a different era.

title: Campaigning in Court or the Statehouse
IHT Quick Read: March 26
description: NEWS Account holders, business customers and many experts worry that Europes solution to the banking crisis in Cyprus is only a temporary bandage. Liz Alderman and Landon Thomas Jr. report from Nicosia.

title: Oh Boy! So Many Questions! About China in Africa
description: BEIJING  As President Xi Jinping of China continues his first overseas trip as his countrys leader, arriving in South Africa late on Monday after Russia and Tanzania, he meets with much goodwill  but also some concern among Africans that China may be a new colonial power, extracting resources and selling manufactured goods, as I reported on Sunday.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 8 P.M. (13, 49) TAVIS SMILEY REPORTS: EDUCATION UNDER ARREST Mr. Smiley travels to Washington State, Louisiana, Missouri and California to examine the connection between the juvenile justice system and the dropout rate among American teenagers; as many as three-quarters of those incarcerated in detention centers withdraw from high school. Along the way he speaks with educational experts on the front lines of reform, including Jimmie Edwards, a juvenile court judge and the founder of the Innovative Concept Academy in St. Louis, who believes that the zero-tolerance policy applied by some schools  under which minor infractions, including disruptive behavior, foul language and truancy, can escalate into jail time  is not the best route; and the Loyola and Tulane University law students who work for Stand Up for Each Other!, an advocacy group for children who have been expelled from school. Part 2 of 180 Days: A Year Inside an American High School, which chronicles one year in the life of the first graduating class of Washington Metropolitan High School  a public school where only 7 percent of students are deemed proficient in math, and only 19 percent in reading  follows at 9. (Mr. Smiley, above right, with Michael Triplett, principal of the Innovative Concept Academy.)

title: Old Dog Needs $6,000 Surgery. What Do You Do?
description: The average bichon fris will live to be 16 years old.

title: Womens Team Plays On at Kentucky
description: One week after defending national champion Kentucky made a swift exit from the National Invitation Tournament with an upset loss at Robert Morris, the Wildcats basketball banner is flying high.

title: News Quiz | March 26, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: A Conversation With: U.S.A.I.D. Administrator Rajiv Shah
description: MUMBAI Each year, about 1.5 million children under 5 years old die in India, which has the largest number of such deaths worldwide. A majority of these deaths stem from pneumonia, diarrhea, malnutrition and complications at birth and can be prevented. In February, at the India Call to Action on Child Survival and Development Summit, Indias Ministry of Health and Family Welfare released a strategic road map to tackle preventable child deaths and introduced a National Child Survival Score Card and a dashboard to track progress on child survival and development.

title: Bachmann Is Subject of Ethics Investigation
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Michele Bachmann, Republican of Minnesota, is the subject of an ethics investigation examining allegations of wrongdoing that emerged in the aftermath of her failed bid for the Republican presidential nomination in 2012, a lawyer for the lawmaker confirmed Monday.

title: Agent G.M.O.
description: HO CHI MINH CITY  Its 5 a.m. and the streets already are buzzing. People know that the best time to shop at open-air markets is before daybreak. And they know to ask for fresh, firm vegetables grown locally, rather than in China, where dangerous pesticides are routinely overused.

title: As Scotland Turns the Page, a Lesson for Other Teams
description: When the Scottish Football Association drew up a short list of potential successors to the fired Scotland manager Craig Levein last year, the countrys news media and the teams supporters did the same. Naturally, the lists differed, but there was one commonality: everyone linked with the vacant post was a Scot.

title: Italys Highest Court Overturns Acquittal of Amanda Knox
description: ROME  Italys highest court on Tuesday ordered a new trial in the sensational case of Amanda Knox, an American student accused of murdering her 21-year-old roommate, Meredith Kercher of Britain, in 2007.

title: Test Yourself | English, March 26, 2013
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article Letter by Letter, Keeping a Catholic Outpost Alive.

title: Raising a Hindu Kid in New York
description: How do you teach your children about religion, particularly your own? Are the parents responsible for this vital task, or should they call in some outside help? Its a question I faced when I became a parent almost five years ago.

title: Do Millennials Stand a Chance in the Real World?
description: When I was a kid, my grandmother used to spirit packets of oyster crackers from restaurants. She unwrapped gifts meticulously, peeling back the tape with her nails so that she could reuse the paper. She also stockpiled so many coupon-bought cans that she probably could have had her own show on TLC.

title: Praying for Dry Land in Panama
description: For thousands of years on the Kuna Yala islands, water and prayer were intertwined with daily rituals.

title: Calling All High School Hackers
description: In Luring Young Web Warriors Is a Priority. Its Also a Game., Nicole Perlroth writes about how and why the U.S. government is now searching high schools for talented computer hackers.

title: See the Play, Dont Miss the Program
description: LONDON  One of the pleasures and privileges of theatergoing in London  in addition to those little wooden spoonlets that come with the interval ice cream  is the beauty of the printed theater program. Rather than the advertising-heavy publications of many cities, particularly New York, chock-full of fluffy profiles of the newest musical star and features on the favorite Thai restaurant of a chorus member of Wicked, a London theater program is often a quick study guide  a cheat sheet for the high-brow pop quiz of theater about to unfold.

title: Justices Say Time May Be Wrong for Gay Marriage Case
description: WASHINGTON  As the Supreme Court on Tuesday weighed the momentous question of whether gay and lesbian couples have a constitutional right to marry, six justices questioned whether the case, arising from a California ban on same-sex marriages, was properly before the court and indicated that they might vote to dismiss it.

title: College Decision Checklist: However It Arrives, Check Your Envelope at Home
description: This week, as final college decisions are announced, The Choice blog is running a series of posts dedicated to the climax of the admissions season.

title: The Early Word: Marriage
description: In Todays Times

title: Declining Wealth Brings a Rising Retirement Risk
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: Mexico-U.S.: Tables Turned in 90 Minutes
description: What a difference 90 minutes makes.

title: North Korea Calls Hawaii and U.S. Mainland Targets
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Koreas military said it put all its missile and artillery units on the highest alert on Tuesday, ordering them to be ready to hit South Korea, as well as the United States and its military installations in Hawaii and Guam.

title: Daily Report: He Has Millions and a New Job at Yahoo. And Soon Hell Be 18.
description: One of Yahoos newest employees is a 17-year-old high school student in Britain. As of Monday, he is one of its richest, too, Brian Stelter reports on Tuesday in The New York Times.

title: My Search for Reasonable and Understandable Credit Card Processing
description: I have been accepting credit cards at my business for many years. My recollection is that I first signed up to take them in 1994. During most of that time, I have used my regular business bank, PNC, to process the transactions. When I signed up for PNCs merchant-processing services, I knew that I would be paying fees for the services, but I was wrapped up in other business issues at the time and paid little attention to the details.

title: T-Mobile Unveils New Pricing Plan, Kind Of
description: T-Mobile has unveiled what is presumably its new pricing plan. I say presumably because the company will not confirm or deny that the plan appearing on its Web site is its new plan.

title: The Record Keepers
description: MEXICO  Saturday, March 16, was a sad day for Mexican chefs. A group of 2,333 cooks, all dressed up in their whites, most wearing tall toques, formed a very long line along Paseo de la Reforma, in the heart of the city. But they were 511 short.

title: In Dell, Shifting Attitude Toward Buyouts
description: IN DELL OFFERS, SHIFTING ATTITUDE TOWARD BUYOUTS | The battle over Dell puts into focus the question of whether management-led buyouts are in shareholders best interests, and it reflects a shifting ethos on Wall Street, one that might be slightly less short-term greedy than that of previous generations, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column. It appears that some shareholders of companies involved in buyouts would prefer to ride a wave of gains alongside the buyout kings rather than cash out immediately.

title: Bright Passages
description: Dont worry: the fault-finding proceeds as usual in the In a Word section below. But first, a small and subjective sampling of sparkling prose from recent editions. Nominations are always welcome.

title: In Performance: Tina Packer of Women of Will
description: In Women of Will the actress Tina Packer, the founder and former artistic director of Shakespeare & Company in Lenox, Mass., explores Shakespeares heroines. In this excerpt from Henry VI, Part III, Ms. Packer plays Queen Margaret of Anjou, who has captured the Duke of York and is about to have him killed for usurping the English crown for his children, even though Margarets children are the rightful heirs. The show, which also stars Nigel Gore, continues through June 2 at the Gym at Judson Memorial Church.

title: Opinion Report: Anthony Lewis
description: From the editorial page

title: Oral Arguments Echo in Gatherings Across Nation
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Most United States Supreme Court cases, however significant, pass largely unnoticed when they are argued. But the opening of hearings over the legal definition of marriage was a cultural moment that brought America to its front porch.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Yahoos Big Hire Is 17, and Anthony Lewis Dies at 85
description: Nick DAloisio is living the technology entrepreneurs dream: he sold his news-reading app, Summly, to Yahoo on Monday for tens of millions of dollars and became the resurgent Web giants newest employee, Brian Stelter writes. The only problem is that Mr. DAloisio still has to finish high school; the British programmer is only 17. Mr. DAloisio received venture capital from high-profile investors like Yoko Ono, Wendi Murdock and Li Ka-Shing, the Hong Kong billionaire, when he was just 15. Yahoo plans to incorporate Summly, which summarizes long-form stories for smart phones, into Yahoos suite of mobile apps.

title: The Unnatural Rate Hypothesis
description: When I read opinion pieces by insiders, I often find the ostensible argument less interesting than what is taken for granted. Its the throwaway lines, the statements that obviously are meant to refer to what everyone knows, that can be truly revealing about the state of conventional wisdom.

title: Tuesday Reading: A Push for HPV Vaccinations
When Money and Emotions Collide
description: We all have some sort of history that has shaped the way we relate to money, and those feelings can influence many of the financial decisions we make, both both big and small. Human nature plays a big role, too.

title: A Sidewalk Hit and Run, With a Suitcase
description: Dear Diary:

title: Controversial Media Deal in Taiwan Nears Collapse
description: HONG KONG  The $500 million sale of two of the most liberal publications in Taiwan to largely pro-Beijing investors appeared on the verge of collapse on Tuesday.

title: We Dont Want the Smoking Gun to be an Entitlement Mushroom Cloud
description: Tom Tomorrow. Go read. Also, check out his blasts from the past.

title: 5 Police Officers Killed in Bomb Attack in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Eight suicide bombers stormed the headquarters of a special unit of the Afghan police in the eastern city of Jalalabad on Tuesday morning, killing five officers and wounding four.

title: Cyprus Deal Sparks Anti-German Mood  and Defenders
description: LONDON  In the overheated atmosphere of the Cyprus bailout crisis, Germany has once more been portrayed as a bullying villain wielding its economic power to dominate a struggling Europe.

title: Questions About Pet Health Care
description: Decisions about end-of-life care for pets are heart-wrenching for their owners. Thats even more so now than 10 or 20 years ago because new technology and advances in medical treatments have made their way down to pet care, meaning there are more ways to save or extend your pets life. But it also means more expense, if you choose to do so.

title: What Next From North Korea?
description: North Korea searches for more bluster.

title: Chinas New-Style First Lady and Old-Style Fears
description: BEIJING  When Peng Liyuan, Chinas glamorous, new first lady, stepped out of the Air China airplane in Moscow next to her husband on his inaugural trip abroad, an old fear stepped out too: as a woman close to power might she bring disaster on the country?

title: The Mideast Peace Gap
description: Regarding Bits, bytes and bombs (Views, March 25): Thomas L. Friedman aptly criticizes Israels dream of permanent occupation of the West Bank  especially now with extreme annexationists in the cabinet. Of course not all Israelis have this dream, but many do, and many more wish for more continued settlement expansion beyond todays 320,000 settlers. What is hard to square with either of these wishes is the other wish that Israel claims to have  for peace. Doubtless Israel does want peace. The important question is not whether Israel does want peace  for who doesnt  but just how much it does.

title: Europe Expands Investigation Into Derivatives Market
description: BRUSSELS  European Union antitrust regulators have expanded their investigation into whether a small network of big banks unfairly controls the derivatives market.

title: Q&A: Erasing Saved Web Site Passwords
description: March 29, 2013, 4:03 p.m. | Updated  Added alternate ways to reach the Settings screen on Chrome for the Macintosh in response to reader questions.

title: Site to Be Seen | Victoria Beckham
description: Victoria Beckham, whose eponymous fashion line was heretofore available exclusively at specialty retailers including Bergdorf Goodman, Neiman Marcus and FortyFiveTen and online powerhouses Net-A-Porter and MyTheresa, is now offering e-commerce for her Victoria, Victoria Beckham label and accessories like handbags, denim and eyewear. Its all about modern luxury, and the ability to shop online and have anything delivered to your door is very much a modern convenience, says Beckham. Although her mainline collection is not currently available on the site, a new collection called ICON, which Beckham created exclusively for online shoppers, will feature a selection of her iconic dresses.

title: What Were Reading
description: Mother Jones: As long as moms and dads are getting worked up over the yellow dyes in Kraft Macaroni and Cheese, they might want to look at the products other ingredients. The authors here found them not that different from the stuff in Cheez-Its  which use natural coloring.  Patrick Farrell

title: Oscar Dates Set for Next Year and 2015
description: LOS ANGELES  The Oscars will be held on March 2 next year, slightly later than this years Feb. 24 date, and on Feb. 22 in 2015, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said. The date for next year is the first Sunday after the end of the Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia.

title: Woodss Return to No. 1 Soothes Golf
description: For the traditionalists who had a tough weekend, the status quo fought back for you Monday. There were a lot of people rattled by the rise of Florida Gulf Coast and La Salle and Wichita State  you could spot them staring balefully at brackets dominated by colleges they had actually heard of  but their world grew a little brighter Monday. That is because Tiger Woods showed he could dominate golf again, returning to No. 1 after a long climb from his ignominious fall. This comforted people, unlikeable as he has become. If you cannot count on Woods scowling his way around postcard-pretty golf courses and collecting gobs of money, what can you count on in this world?

title: Shape Up or Dont Fly, Air India Tells Cabin Crew Over 40
description: NEW DELHI  Air India is cracking down on its cabin crew over the age of 40, who could be grounded in coming weeks if they are found to be unfit or overweight.

title: March 26 Updates on Supreme Court Same-Sex Marriage Hearing
description: Thats a wrap for today, but well be back on Wednesday with live updates from the oral arguments as the high court weighs the Defense of Marriage Act. For now, The Timess Adam Liptak and Scott Shane report that the justices might be nervous about acting too quickly on gay marriage, and Jeremy Peters writes about the people who waited for days to witness the discussion. Dont want the argument to end? Room for Debate has a discussion about whether gay marriage is best left to the courts or to states.

title: Feliciano Will Stay With Mets
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  One day after it appeared he would seek a new employer, Pedro Feliciano, one of the last links to the Mets playoff run in 2006, said he would stay with the team somewhere in the organization.

title: How Opinion on Same-Sex Marriage Is Changing, and What It Means
description: The Supreme Court will hear arguments this week on two cases related to same-sex marriage, the first involving a California referendum that barred gay marriage, the other involving a federal law that prevents the government from recognizing same-sex unions. A variety of outcomes are possible, but it seems prudent to take stock of public opinion on same-sex marriage before the decisions come down.

title: $616 Million Poorer, Hedge Fund Owner Still Buys Art
description: Less than two weeks after SAC Capital Advisors, the hedge fund owned by the billionaire trader Steven A. Cohen, agreed to pay the government $616 million to settle accusations of insider trading, Mr. Cohen has decided to buy a little something for himself.

title: The Gun Report: March 26, 2013
description: Every day we cite gun death statistics culled by Slate, which has been publishing the number of gun deaths since the Newtown massacre last December. Slates initiative was prompted in part by the fact that the F.B.I. statistics on gun deaths are woefully outdated, and that there is a void that needs to be filled: no research organization is even trying to create a real-time chronicle of the death attributable to guns in the United States, as Slate puts it. How does Slate compile its information? It uses crowdsourcing techniques, relying especially on a Twitter feed, @GunDeaths, which is run by an anonymous researcher who has been tweeting every reported gun death he can find since the mass shooting in Aurora.

title: Digging Through Mounds of Storm Debris, Seeking Recyclable Objects
description: In the weeks and months since Hurricane Sandy pummeled the New York City area, cleanup crews have hauled off thousands of tons of wreckage, much of it left on city streets by people trying to piece their lives back together.

title: Bill Clintons Regrets
description: The Timess Peter Baker on why the former president says signing the Defense of Marriage Act was a mistake.

title: Cahill Scores  for Australia
description: In his 15-game career (so far) in Major League Soccer, Tim Cahill has scored only one goal.

title: Goldman Amends Warrants Deal With Buffett
description: Goldman Sachs is about to join a rarefied club: the group of banks that count Warren E. Buffett as a big investor.

title: Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles Says Its Endowment Will Reach Record Level
description: The Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles, which has been beset by financial struggles and board defections, announced Tuesday that it had been promised donations that would raise its endowment to more than $60 million, the highest in the museums 34-year history.

title: Petrobras, Once Symbol of Brazils Oil Hopes, Strives to Regain Lost Swagger
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils oil production is falling, casting doubt on what was supposed to be an oil bonanza. Imports of gasoline are rising rapidly, exposing the country to the whims of global energy markets. Even the nations ethanol industry, once envied as a model of renewable energy, has had to import ethanol from the United States.

title: In Egypt, Five Face Charges of Urging Violence in Postings
description: CAIRO  Supporters of President Mohamed Morsi on Tuesday defended an arrest warrant for five activists on charges of using social media to incite attacks against Mr. Morsis allies in the Muslim Brotherhood that took place last Friday.

title: Federal Reserve Faults Citigroup Over Money Laundering Controls
description: The Federal Reserve hit Citigroup with an enforcement action on Tuesday over breakdowns in money laundering controls that threatened to allow tainted money to move through the United States.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Legalizing Aid in Dying
Image of the Day: March 26
Coming to New York, a Smorgasbord Auto Show
description: Arriving in Manhattan a week after the Ringling Brother and Barnum & Bailey Circus rode the rails to Brooklyns Barclays Center, the New York International Auto Show opens its doors just as the populace emerges from its winter isolation and spring teases an appearance  and as the car-shopping season starts to warm up. The show opens to the public on Friday and continues through April 7.

title: Talking Talent | George C. Wolfe
description: The American playwright and director George C. Wolfe, who has won Tonys for Angels in America: Millennium Approaches and for Bring in da Noise/Bring in da Funk, is the director of Lucky Guy, opening at the Broadhurst Theater on April 1. It is the last play Nora Ephron wrote before her death last year, and stars Tom Hanks as Mike McAlary, the Pulitzer Prize-winning newspaper journalist who covered the police beat in New York in the 1980s and 90s. A resident of the city during those years, Wolfe was drawn to the pulse of Ephrons script and the challenge of recreating such a dynamic time in New Yorks history.

title: The GoogaMooga Festival Will Return in May
description: The Great GoogaMooga festival of food, drink and music in Prospect Park, which drew thousands of people to its first outing last spring, will return. And there will be improvements to the festival, where general admission attendees complained last year of hourlong waits for food, drinks and bathrooms at the two-day event. Those who bought $250 tickets for Extra Mooga, the V.I.P. section of the festival, received refunds after organizers acknowledged that the experience was not commensurate with the price tag. (General admission tickets were, and will remain, free for Saturday and Sunday.)

title: A Narrow Escape, and Lasting Guilt
description: I was a new mom at 36, and there was a lot about motherhood that terrified me. I had no experience with infants, nor did my husband, Michael. As happy as we were to be expecting, I was filled with fear and trepidation. How on earth would I know what to do?

title: Publishers Revel in Youthful Cruelty
description: Nobody likes a bully  but these days the book industry loves having them to kick around.

title: A Doll Helps Disabled Women Find Their Voices
description: NEWCASTLE, England  Josephine, a life-size doll, sat on a chair in the middle of a community center in this city in northeast England.

title: Howard Cant Play, So Hed Prefer Not to Watch
description: LONDON  Tim Howard likely wont be watching his United States teammates when they face Mexico in Tuesdays World Cup qualifier.

title: Edward Bland, Cry of Jazz Filmmaker and Composer, Dies at 86
description: Edward Bland made only one film before deciding to pursue a career as a musician, composer and arranger. And that film, The Cry of Jazz, a 34-minute documentary explaining jazz in the context of black history, was by his own account amateurish.

title: D.H. Lawrences War Poems to Be Published, Dirty Words and All
description: Various unprintable words kept the unexpurgated Lady Chatterleys Lover, D.H. Lawrences classic 1928 novel of sexual congress across class lines, off bookshelves for more than three decades. But who knew that words like Salonika and Mesopotamia would keep some of Lawrences poetry out of print until 2013?

title: To Save the King of the Jungle, a Call to Pen Him In
description: After 35 years of field research in the Serengeti plains, Craig Packer, director of the Lion Research Center at the University of Minnesota, has lost all patience with the romance of African wilderness. Fences, he says, are the only way to stop the precipitous and continuing decline in the number of African lions.

title: After a Series of Setbacks, a Music Collective Reopens Its Doors
description: To compare the challenges faced by the Issue Project Room, an experimental music collective in Brooklyn, to Homers Odyssey might be a stretch, but the challenges faced by the group certainly have all the trappings of an ancient tragedy. The recent performance of November  a five-hour piano performance written by Dennis Johnson  was yet another triumph for the organization, which has oscillated between progress and defeat for nearly a decade.

title: As Supreme Court Deliberates, Jeb Bush Speaks
description: Quite a few Republicans have been announcing new stages in their evolution on same-sex marriage, which is being debated in the Supreme Court today and tomorrow. Senator Rob Portman of Ohio said earlier this month that he was prompted to reverse his position when he learned his son was gay  after a two-year period of reflection that included having his name floated as a potential running mate for Mitt Romney, a staunch opponent of gay marriage.

title: If You Like Horse With No Name,  Try Band of Horses
description: Each week, Val Haller, a music-obsessed baby boomer and the founder of the Web site Valslist.com, matches tracks from her generation to those of her 20-something sons generation.

title: For Cohen, a Big Art Deal
description: The billionaire hedge fund manager is paying $155 million for Picassos Le Rve, according to The New York Posts Page Six. The painting is the one that casino magnate Stephen A. Wynn accidentally  and famously  damaged with his elbow.

title: Your Carriage, Maam
description: Queen Elizabeth II marking the 150th anniversary of the London Tube. Those who ride regularly can view historic posters at the Transport Museum.

title: New Laws Ban Most Abortions in North Dakota
description: FARGO, N.D.  Gov. Jack Dalrymple of North Dakota approved the nations toughest abortion restrictions on Tuesday, signing into law a measure that would ban nearly all abortions and inviting a legal showdown over just how much states can limit access to the procedure.

title: Pardon Me, Is That Rihanna in Your Purse?
description: Was I expecting too little of the Stell Audio Couture Audio Clutch?

title: Justices Hear Gay Marriage Arguments
description: After witnessing the same-sex marriage hearings, The Timess Scott Shane assesses the questions posed by the Supreme Court justices.

title: Locking Horns Where Others Might Sing Kumbaya
description: The inevitable Portlandia sketch about The Real World: Portland will probably go something like this: Jocks and cheerleaders and assorted dunderheads converge on an organic farm on the outskirts of Portland, Ore., ready for what happens when people stop being polite and start getting real. One by one, as in most contagion films, the subjects flip. Soon theyre crocheting sweaters, singing indie-rock karaoke, digging in thrift-store bins, pickling vegetables.

title: Cancer Diagnosis: Less Can Be More
description: Dr. Peter Scardino of Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center says current prostate cancer screening is painful and imprecise but vastly improving.

title: New Ways to Assess Prostate Cancer
description: New tests that supplement the prostate-specific antigen (P.S.A.) test.

title: New Prostate Cancer Tests Could Reduce False Alarms
description: Sophisticated new prostate cancer tests are coming to market that might supplement the unreliable P.S.A. test, potentially saving tens of thousands of men each year from unnecessary biopsies, operations and radiation treatments.

title: Hotel Partners, Strange Bedfellows
description: The parent company of the design-driven furniture maker IKEA and the untrendy Marriott International announced this month that they are teaming up to create Moxy, a chain of budget hotels across Europe, news that strikes many travelers as an odd coupling. (And inspires questions, like, will you have to put together your nightside table with an Allen wrench?)

title: Soros to Give $1 Million to NAACP Legal Fund
description: George Soros, the billionaire financier and philanthropist, has pledged $1 million to the NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund, the countrys leading civil rights legal advocacy group, officials there said Tuesday.

title: Sampling Island Flavor With Amber Ales
description: Assuming the occasion does not demand fancy fare, there is very little you cant enjoy with American amber ales. I proved that at a recent Sunday lunch. We had just spent a long weekend at the home of friends in the Grenadines, where Venita Alexander, an accomplished local cook who adds island flavor to some of her meals, made an impossible quantity of conch fritters for lunch one day. We ate them all with Hairoun, the local lager, but it could just as well have been an American amber ale. What made her fritters unusual was that she didnt deep-fry them; rather, she used much less oil to sizzle them like pancakes. I stole her idea, replacing the conch with more easily obtained squid and adding beer (instead of milk) to my batter. FLORENCE FABRICANT

title: Detroits Contemporary Art Museum Finally Has a New Director
description: Detroit might not be doing so well  it was placed this month under the control of an emergency manager as it tries to stave off financial default. But its contemporary-art scene is thriving and on Tuesday the Museum of Contemporary Art Detroit announced that it had selected a new director after more than a year and a half without a permanent leader. Elysia Borowy-Reeder, who was most recently the director of the Contemporary Art Museum in Raleigh, N.C., where she focused on strengthening that museums education programs, will take over in early April.

title: Buyers of Long-Term Care Insurance Prefer Home Care
description: Long-term care insurance, which can help cover the cost of extended care if youre unable to care for yourself, is something no one really wants to think about. Its a product you buy, after all, in the hope that you will never have to use it.

title: Bakery Owner Talks About Coping With Health Insurance Changes
description: Last week, we published a case study about Baked in the Sun, a wholesale bakery and distributor that is trying to decide how best to comply with the Affordable Care Act. Starting in January, the new law requires businesses with 50 or more full-time employees to offer health insurance or pay a penalty. Owned by Rachel Shein and Steve Pilarski, husband and wife, the company employs nearly 100 workers to bake and deliver freshly made pastries to coffee shops, hospitals and hotels in Southern California.

title: T-Mobile Shakes Up Its Service
description: T-Mobile USA, long trailing its rivals in the cellphone industry, is trying to catch up by changing the conversation: it is selling the iPhone cheaper than the competition, and most important, customers would not have to sign a contract.

title: Syrian Opposition Joins Meeting of Arab League
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates  To the outrage of Syrias embattled government, the opposition coalition leader formally took its vacant seat at an Arab League summit meeting on Tuesday and immediately requested broader recognition, including from the United Nations, as part of an effort to further ostracize President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Shrimp and Broccoli Rabe, Done in a Flash
description: In Whats for Dinner?, a column appearing every other week on Diners Journal, Melissa Clark answers that universal question, offering recipes for simple, relatively quick dishes that use ingredients you can pick up on the way home.

title: Rangers, Free to Spend, Dont Spend Freely
description: Surprise, Ariz.

title: Living in High Bridge, the Bronx
description: The neighborhood offers a mix of income-restricted and market rate properties at prices lower than in nearby Manhattan.

title: Buffett and Goldman Scratch Each Others Backs
description: Goldman Sachs and Warren E. Buffett have found a way to scratch each others backs  again.

title: Name to Get Its Meaning Back
description: Straddling a high point in the Bronx, High Bridge takes its name from a near-forgotten pedestrian crossing into Manhattan, closed off in the early 1970s. But in recent years, given plans to reopen the restored High Bridge next year, both it and the neighborhood have been rediscovered by growing numbers of would-be buyers and renters.

title: Photo Replay: March 26
description: A view of the day in sports, including World Cup qualifying soccer matches in Sydney, Australia, and Amman, Jordan.

title: States Chipping Away at Roe v. Wade
description: A number of states in recent years have passed restrictions on abortion rules that give women the right to an abortion until the fetus is viable outside the womb, usually about 24 weeks into pregnancy.

title: Qatar Proposes $1 Billion Jerusalem Heritage Fund
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates  Qatars emir proposed on Tuesday that the Arab League create a $1 billion fund to protect the Arabic and Islamic heritage of Jerusalem, the disputed holy city that remains one of the most intractable issues in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: N.F.L. Free Agents Who Are Still Worth Signing
description: It has been an unusually soft free-agent market this year. There could be multiple reasons for that: the salary caps lack of growth, a deep pool of draft prospects at the same positions that are deep in free agency (defensive end, for example), a subtle leaguewide shift in the way free agents are viewed, perhaps. Whatever the case, its left a lot of really good buys on the market. True, every unsigned veteran has a flaw or two. (After all, theres a reason hes still unsigned.) But a lot of these players still have valuable attributes that can fill an important niche for a team. These unsigned veterans should not be viewed in terms of what they once were; they should be viewed in terms of what they are now. Here are 10 who are worth signing:

title: The Dining Room at the Modern
description: Inside Danny Meyers eight-year-old restaurant in the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Florida Gulf Coast Point Guard Takes Turn in Spotlight
description: Florida Gulf Coast point guard Brett Comer has enjoyed tournament success before, but even then he was used to being overshadowed.

title: Art on the Walls and on the Plates
description: WHEN MY GUEST in the Dining Room at the Modern realized he could order three courses of foie gras, he looked like somebody who had just found a $50 bill on the street. He would have extended his streak to four courses, I think, had the menu offered a foie gras dessert.

title: Copyright Ruling Rings With Echo of Betamax
description: Before Napster and LimeWire, before Megauploads and the Pirate Bay, media companies epic struggle against copying, piracy and generally losing control over their creations can be traced to a legal fight more than 30 years ago over a device that has long since passed on to the great trash heap in the sky: the Sony Betamax.

title: Does Victorias Secret Care That Parents Hate Pink?
description: Victorias Secret manufactures, markets and sells clothes and lingerie intended to make women look and feel sexy. Thats its mission (if not its formal mission statement): to sell more stuff to more people.

title: Orchestra Turns 50, Its Youthful Fire Coming Through
description: It can be inspiring to hear standard repertory works played by young musicians discovering them for the first time. Whatever such performances may lack in assurance is usually compensated for by the involvement and freshness that comes through.

title: In a Chinese Alley, an $8 Tasting Menu
description: Even the strictest of budget should allow for occasional splurges: a modest hotel room after a string of hostel bunks; a just-this-once late-night cab; a beer upgrade from P.B.R. to I.P.A. But some luxuries never enter the frugal equation. Take, for example, the restaurant tasting menu  those drawn-out dinners of 8 or 10 or 25 courses, exquisitely designed (and sometimes served) by the chef. Or so Ive heard.

title: In a Faded Wall St. Scandal, Lessons for a Current One
description: Remember Jacob Alexander? Perhaps you should. For as financial crisis prosecutions seem to fizzle out, his tale is a lesson: not only do financial scandals fade quickly from memory, but sometimes corporate executives really do pay for bad choices.

title: Reader Idea | Discussing Junk Food With English-Language Learners
description: This week, in lieu of our own lesson plans, well be publishing new entries in our Great Ideas From Readers series.

title: An Interview With Ken Mehlman
description: Ken Mehlman, the former chairman of the Republican National Committee, discusses the arguments before the Supreme Court.

title: Yahoos Acqui-Hiring and Its Tax Implications
description: On Monday, Yahoo announced that it was buying the mobile news reader app Summly for about $30 million. Summly has a staff of five and no revenue. It was also reported Monday that Apple was buying the indoor-GPS company WifiSLAM for $20 million. That start-up, only two years old, has a handful of employees.

title: Olivier Awards Nominations Announced
description: The Olivier Awards, Britains equivalent of the Tonys, announced its 2013 nominations on Tuesday, a list brimming with big names: Helen Mirren in The Audience; Rupert Everett in The Judas Kiss; Kristen Scott Thomas in Old Times; and Mark Rylance, a two-time Olivier winner, in an all-male production of Twelfth Night.

title: Tax-Abatement Changes Affect Many Unit Owners
description: Tens of thousands of co-op and condominium owners across New York City are facing a tax increase this year after the recent tweak of tax-abatement regulations.

title: One on One: Nolan Bushnell, Video Game Legend and Steve Jobss Boss
description: There are a lot of highlights to Nolan Bushnells career  he was a founder of Atari, the pioneering video game company, as well as of the Chuck E. Cheeses Pizza Time Theater chain  but one of the more glorious footnotes is that he was one of Steven P. Jobss first and only bosses.

title: The Dell Deal Scorecard
description: With three suitors now in the mix for Dell Inc., it can be a little tough remembering whos offering what and whos working with whom. Were here to help.

title: FIFA Dismisses Costa Rica Appeal
description: Quicker than it takes snow to melt, FIFA on Tuesday dismissed Costa Ricas protest of last Fridays match against the United States that was played in a snowstorm in Commerce City, Colo. The U.S. won, 1-0.

title: First Woman Is Chosen to Lead Secret Service
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Tuesday appointed Julia A. Pierson, a longtime Secret Service agent, as the first woman to head the agency best known for protecting the president, vice president and their families.

title: To Join This Club, Be a Star
description: Chefs Club, a showcase for culinary stars, is having its initial run in Aspen, Colo. But like many a big production, its headed for a New York opening.

title: Son and Lawyer Lose Appeal in Looting of Astor Estate
description: More than three years after they were convicted of looting the estate of Brooke Astor, her son and a lawyer for the estate lost a significant appeal on Tuesday, moving them much closer to being forced to serve their prison sentences.

title: Congolese Rebel Commander Tells War Crimes Court He Was Just a Soldier
description: PARIS  Bosco Ntaganda, the rebel commander in the Democratic Republic of Congo with a reputation for extreme brutality, did not live up to his nickname The Terminator on Tuesday when he appeared for the first time at the International Criminal Court on charges of rape, murder, sexual slavery and using children as soldiers.

title: War on the Heels of a Wedding
description: I remember exactly where I was when American troops invaded Iraq. I was in a newsroom in Fayetteville, N.C., which was closer to war than I ever imagined I would be.

title: In Cyprus, Big Losses Expected on Deposits
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus  With time running out until Cypruss devastated banks must reopen their doors to the public, Cypriot and European officials are scrambling to put in place a set of measures that would allow jittery depositors access to their savings while preventing many billions of euros from fleeing the country.

title: Crystal Bowersox to Play Patsy Cline on Broadway
description: Crystal Bowersox, the runner-up on the 2010 edition of American Idol, will play Patsy Cline on Broadway this summer in a new production of the musical Always  Patsy Cline, a tribute show featuring classic songs performed by the country singer like Crazy, Walkin After Midnight and I Fall to Pieces, the producers announced on Tuesday.

title: Off the Menu
description: Headliner

title: Polls Show Consistent Gains in Support for Same-Sex Marriage
description: With the Supreme Court hearing arguments on Tuesday about the constitutionality of Proposition 8, the 2008 California ban on same-sex marriage, a number of recent polls show that a majority of Americans support legalizing it.

title: Light as a Feather, Hard as a Brick: Harsh Realities at Warp Speed
description: Twenty-six years ago the Belgian choreographer Wim Vandekeybus founded a company called Ultima Vez and staged his first work, What the Body Does Not Remember. The piece made a splash, earning acclaim for its aggressive physicality and brutal confrontations. Now its on an anniversary tour, and at the Michael Schimmel Center for the Arts this past weekend, as part of Pace Presents, it still made waves.

title: Steinway to Sell Its Famed Showroom Building
description: Steinway Hall, the 88-year-old building down the block and across the street from Carnegie Hall where generations of famous and not-so-famous pianists have tried out pianos, is being sold, the piano company and the buyer said on Tuesday.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: High-Tech Bike Helmets and Great Swedish Words
