description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27: 2014 Toyota Highlander

title: Buchenwalds Liberation, as Seen by Louis Nemeth
description: In April 1945, Mr. Nemeth, a U.S. Army Signal Corps photographer, witnessed the horrors of the newly-liberated Buchenwald concentration camp.

title: Some Vintages of Soldera Wine Survive a Vandalism
description: Case Basse di Soldera, the great Brunello di Montalcino estate where more than 60,000 liters of wine were destroyed last year by a disgruntled former employee, apparently did not lose all the wine from six vintages from 2007 through 2012. The proprietor, Gianfranco Soldera, announced recently that the estate had been able to salvage small parts of each of those vintages, at least preserving the opportunity to see how those wines will age and evolve.

title: Cash-Hungry States Eye Sports Betting, to Leagues Dismay
description: LAS VEGAS  It is a lucrative time of year for Nevada, where more than $200 million will be wagered in sports books on the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament, a pot of money that has budget-crunched states across the country pushing for a piece of the action despite strong opposition from the N.C.A.A. and professional sports leagues.

title: Before Attack, Parents of  Gunman Tried to Address Sons Strange Behavior
description: TUCSON  The parents of Jared L. Loughner, the man who killed six people and wounded 13 others during a meet-and-greet event hosted by former Representative Gabrielle Giffords in 2011, told the authorities after the mass shooting that they had become so concerned about their sons strange behavior in the previous months that they had taken away his shotgun, insisted he get psychological counseling and had even begun to disable his car so that he could not go out at night, according to thousands of pages of documents related to the case released Wednesday.

title: Call to a CNN Host Hints at a Shifting Today
description: Last week, it was Jay Leno who learned what NBC imagined his future to be. This week, it is Matt Lauers turn in the spotlight.

title: Brother (and Rival) of British Party Leader Quits Politics
description: LONDON  David Miliband, the former British foreign secretary who lost a party leadership contest to his younger brother, said Wednesday that he was quitting front-line politics, drawing to an end a fraught sibling rivalry that had divided both a family and a political party.

title: Obamas Public Lands Record
description: President Obamas decision to designate five new national monuments is a warm farewell present to the outgoing Interior secretary, Ken Salazar, who has been trying without great success to get Mr. Obama to protect more public lands from development. It also makes a nice welcoming gift for Sally Jewell, the presumed incoming secretary, whose life will be much happier if the President continues along this path. But environmentalists are not dancing in the streets, at least not yet. Conservation issues still do not loom large in this White House, and the lands Mr. Obama has protected over the course of his administration are small change compared to the efforts of his recent predecessors.

title: ABC Family Plans Spinoff of Pretty Little Liars
description: Heres a way to make fans of your television series very happy: Announce another season of the show and a new spinoff series at the same time. Thats what the ABC Family channel did on Tuesday when it renewed Pretty Little Liars for a fifth season (before the fourth one even starts), and revealed plans for a spinoff called Ravenswood.

title: Video of Petraeus Apologizing for Extramarital Affair
description: In his first public appearance since resigning last November as director of the Central Intelligence Agency, David H. Petraeus apologized for the circumstances that led him to step down and cause so much pain for his family and friends.

title: Big Moments in the Womens Game
description: Were you wondering if there was a record Brittney Griner hadnt set? Were you hoping she might use the occasion of her final home game to do yet another stupendous thing?

title: An Emotional Investment in Saving for College
description: One of the first things we did when our children were born was contribute to a state-sponsored 529 college savings plan for each of them. Saving for their education is, for us, as much of an emotional investment as a financial one.

title: Timeline: The London Whales Wake
description: JPMorgan incurred a huge trading loss in a complicated trading strategy that involved derivatives, financial instruments that derive their value from the prices of securities and other assets. The bank most likely structured the trade in a way that magnified losses.

title: Womens History Month
description: New picture books celebrate the lives of extraordinary women, including Louisa May Alcott and Elizabeth Blackwell, Americas first female physician.

title: Deke Richards, Creator of Motown Hits, Dies at 68
description: Deke Richards, the leader of the Motown songwriting and producing team responsible for some of the Jackson 5s biggest hits, died on Sunday in Bellingham, Wash. He was 68.

title: Radwanskas Incredible Twist Vies for Shot of the Year
description: On an unusually brisk Miami evening Tuesday, an absurd Agnieszka Radwanska shot, a fade-away twirl, left her opponent completely frozen.

title: Anthony Lewis in the West Bank
description: RAMALLAH  In 1991 I went for a hike in the hills north of Ramallah with the journalist Anthony Lewis, who passed away on Monday. He was in his early 60s at the time and was not in the best of shape, but he was game, as always.

title: What Was the Familys Least Bad Decade?
description: During yesterdays excitement surrounding the Supreme Court and gay marriage, David Frum linked back to his 2011 column explaining why he had changed his mind on same-sex wedlock. Given my own fascination (obsession?) with family structure in America, I was struck by this passage:

title: Cyprus Sets Up Tight Controls as Banks Prepare to Reopen
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus  The Cypriot government on Wednesday announced severe restrictions on access to funds held in the countrys banks, hoping to control a rush to withdraw money when the banks open Thursday for the first time in nearly two weeks.

title: Womens History Month
description: Alongside grown-up titles like Lean In, Womens History Month brings forth a wave of inspiring books for the pre-Silicon-Valley-job set. This year, biographies are especially strong, with the best among the current crop highlighted below.

title: Reader Idea | Creating Your Own Personal Credo, Inspired by Steve Jobs
description: This week were publishing a series of new Great Ideas From Readers.

title: Bill Carter Interviews: Brian Williams
description: In 2013, Brian Williams sat down with The Timess Bill Carter to discuss the ever-changing news industry.

title: Montenegros Rapid Ascent Stuns England
description: In Englands World Cup qualifying match against the tiny nation of Montenegro on Tuesday night in the Montenegrin capital of Podgorica, there were no bullying tactics by the Montenegro team, as the English press claimed there had been when the teams played to a draw on the same pitch two years ago. There werent any chairs thrown at the visiting teams goalkeeper as there had been in Montenegros match against Poland last fall.

title: Covered in Pacifiers, Trees Signal a Rite of Passage
description: Rachel Rhines apartment in Borough Park, Brooklyn, has a strange view: two small trees standing sentinel at the entrance of her building are covered in used pacifiers.

title: For LaBeouf, a Front-Row View of Production That Fired Him
description: Shia LaBeouf, who was fired from the Broadway play Orphans last month after clashing with the director, Daniel Sullivan, and his co-star Alec Baldwin, attended the first preview performance of the play on Tuesday night at the Schoenfeld Theater  sitting in the first row on the aisle and leaping to his feet before any other audience member to give a standing ovation at the end.

title: Flags Waving Doesnt Come Cheap
description: Nobody can accuse New Yorkers patriotism of flagging, not when the citys parks department alone spends about $160,000 a year keeping its over 1,000 flagpoles in shape.

title: Morning After: Some Views From Mexico
description: Some comments from the Mexican news media and others (mostly in translation via Google  some filling in the blanks might be necessary) the morning after a 0-0 tie against the United States in a regional World Cup qualifying match, played at Estadio Azteca on Tuesday night.

title: House Hunting on ... Capri
description: A THREE-BEDROOM APARTMENT WITH MEDITERRANEAN VIEWS IN A HISTORIC VILLA

title: From a Stone Villa, Mediterranean Views
description: A three-bedroom hillside apartment with a pool is on the market for $4.54 million.

title: Balance Restored, Shard by Shard
description: PHILADELPHIA  The art collector Albert C. Barnes had no compunction about letting people know precisely how much he wanted things his way. In a 1939 letter to the auto scion Walter P. Chrysler Jr. he gleefully torpedoed a request  as he did frequently, especially from the rich and powerful  to visit his personal foundation near Philadelphia, where he housed his world-class works.

title: Digging for Feasts Across the Florida Panhandle
description: I shouldve known this would happen: oyster withdrawal. More than 24 hours had passed since my last dozen. My stomach was making fearsome noises, and my mind was starting to slip. Was that a giant bottle of cocktail sauce in the distance? No, merely a water tower. Perhaps these car seat cushions were edible?

title: Is Abortion Heading Back to the Supreme Court?
description: Forty years after the Roe v. Wade decision made abortion legal and recognized a womans right to control her body and her life, the issue may well be headed back to the Supreme Court.

title: A New Variation of a Costly Tax-Time Offer
description: Tax refund anticipation loans, which are short-term advances made at tax time at high interest rates, are far less prevalent now partly because of a federal crackdown on banks that had been making the loans, according to a new report.

title: Assad Sends Letter to Emerging Powers Seeking Help to End Syrian War
description: President Bashar al-Assad of Syria beseeched a five-nation group of emerging powers on Wednesday to help halt the Syrian conflict, one day after the Arab League moved to further isolate Mr. Assad by ceremoniously filling his governments vacant seat with the opposition coalition that has sworn to topple him.

title: Stepping Outside Manhattan
description: New York City this month introduced a Web guide called Neighborhood x Neighborhood, which highlights areas outside of Manhattan on the citys tourism site. The first featured guide was for Brooklyn, focusing on haunts in Bushwick, Fort Greene and Williamsburg (above) that are not on the well-worn tourist path. Fans of Fette Sau, prepare for an even longer wait.

title: A Start-Up Tries to Give Wine Spritzers a New Image and a Second Wind
description: During the seven years she did product development and design for both Diesel in Santa Barbara, Calif., and Burton Snowboards in Burlington, Vt., Jayla Siciliano attended a lot of work-related parties and dinners and did plenty of social drinking. The problem was that she also had to get up the next morning and work, so during social events she started pouring sparkling water into her wine. It was perfect, she said. I could sip that all night and I would wake up feeling fine.

title: What You Get for ... $1,550,000
description: ENCINO, CALIF.

title: Properties for $1.55 Million
description: Homes in Encino, Calif., Charlottesville, Va., and Phoenix, Ariz.

title: DOMA Case Goes Before Supreme Court
description: The Timess John Schwartz dissects the questions posed in the case against the Defense of Marriage Act.

title: Its Personal
description: To the editor: In Mr. Kellers article [States Gone Wild, Monday, March 25] he repeatedly mentions his strong aversion to restrictive abortion rulesHas Mr. Keller previously shared his rationale for this strong opinion? For example, is it based on his interpretation of the Constitution or perhaps a personal understanding of when life commences. I ask if he might consider replying to this inquiry with a succinct summary of his position. Thank you.

title: In the Wee Hours in Albany, the Talk Turns to Kumquats
description: ALBANY  The great kumquat debate began around 1 a.m. on Wednesday, when State Senator George S. Latimer, a Westchester County Democrat, likened a voluminous budget bill to a Christmas gift basket that contained some items that were desirable, and others that were not.

title: Marriage Security and Insecurities
description: David Brooks: I guess the Supreme Court hearing on same-sex marriage is pretty much dominating the week.

title: (Not a) Model-Morphosis | Caitlin Monahan
description: (function($) {var data = chameleonData[0];var beforeAfterContainer = $('#nytmm_beforeAfter_wrapper411 .nytmm_beforeAfter_container');var options = {leftImage: data.images.left.leftImage,rightImage: data.images.right.rightImage,showFooter: data.footer.showFooter,leftCredit: data.images.left.leftCredit,rightCredit: data.images.right.rightCredit,caption: data.footer.caption,startPoint: data.images.startPoint,showButton: data.footer.button.showButton,leftButtonText: data.footer.button.leftButtonText,rightButtonText: data.footer.button.rightButtonText}beforeAfterContainer.BeforeAfter(options);})(jQuery||NYTD.jQuery);

title: At Mercedes, B Is for Battery
description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27: 2014 Mercedes-Benz B-Class Electric Drive compact.

title: Food Bloggers Unite to Fight Hunger
description: The Power of the Post

title: Investors vs. Occupants in the Housing Recovery
description: One of the big questions about the sustainability of the housing recovery is whether its being driven by owner-occupants  the people who live in the houses they buy  or speculators.

title: A Lighter, Faster Volkswagen GTI for 2015
description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27, 2013: 2015 Volkswagen Golf GTI

title: Jetsons in Their Comfort Zone
description: SOMETIMES THE BEST SHOPPING is watching  seeing how other people move through a space, whether their fingers lightly flit over fabric or linger on the details, if they stop for the obvious blaring-siren pieces or dig out the ones that hang at a low hum. We all have our rhythms and rituals. Im often far more comfortable in a crowded store, where my quirks might pass unnoticed, than stalking a store alone, the only thing moving.

title: Bacteria in the Intestines May Help Tip the Bathroom Scale, Studies Show
description: The bacterial makeup of the intestines may help determine whether people gain weight or lose it, according to two new studies, one in humans and one in mice.

title: Few Know How to Enter; Fewer Finish
description: WARTBURG, Tenn.  On Friday night, in the Cumberland Mountains of eastern Tennessee, 28 men and 7 women will lie in tents half asleep in anticipation of hearing a conch shell being blown at Big Cove Campground in Frozen Head State Park. When they hear the call, which will arrive sometime between 11 p.m. that night and 11 a.m. Saturday, they will know they are 60 minutes from the start of an ordeal once referred to as a satanic running adventure.

title: Hair on the Street
description: One of the biggest growth areas on Wall Street? It may just be on the faces of some executives. Carl Icahn has now joined Lloyd Blankfein as one of the bearded elite of finance.

title: Sit! Staaayyyy. Play Music! Good Dog!
description: Riding on the popularity of other interactive pets, like Hasbros Furby and Mattels Figit, comes the TechPet from Bandai.

title: A Senior Dancer Is Leaving Paul Taylor Company
description: Amy Young, the senior female dancer of the Paul Taylor Dance Company, is leaving the troupe. She made her New York farewell at the end of Sundays performance, the last inthe companys New York season in March at the David H. Koch Theater at Lincoln Center.

title: A Potential Potemkin Fight Over Dell
description: Even losers could emerge as winners from the Dell takeover battle. Blackstone Group, Silver Lake Partners, the Dell board and founder Michael S. Dell could stand to benefit from the impression of a hard-fought auction. A Potemkin fight, if thats what it turns out to be, just may not help shareholders quite so much.

title: A Comeback Story for BMWs Diesel Sedans
description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27: 2014 BMW 328d

title: Musical by Gorillaz Duo To Get Substantial Run in Lincoln Center Festival
description: Monkey: Journey to the West, a music and theater mash-up that also includes cartoon segments, martial arts and acrobatics, will open the Lincoln Center Festival this summer and play more performances than any show in the events history.

title: Its Back. But What Does It Mean?
description: Did you watch the classic 1980 horror film The Shining and think it was about a man driven to insane and murderous rage by a haunted hotel? If so, you blew it. Or rather, you missed profound messages subtly embedded in the film by its enigmatic director, Stanley Kubrick.

title: Full Transcript From Hearing on Defense of Marriage Act
description: The Supreme Court heard arguments about whether married gay couples are entitled to federal benefits.

title: Kenya Opens Hearing on Vote Results
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  With millions of Kenyans staring raptly at television sets and glued to radios, Kenyas Supreme Court began hearing evidence on Wednesday to resolve the nations disputed presidential election as lawyers claimed there had been instances of blatant voter fraud.

title: Sweet Suits
description: The motivation behind the sustainable clothing line Popupshop is clear: create simple, chic, wearable and environmentally defensible garments for women and children. The usual pieces are mostly neutral and work well as basics for everyday mixing and matching. It may be easy to outfit children aged 2 to 10 in a uniform of mostly beige and navy blue, but Popupshop is changing things this season with little swimsuits covered in colorful, tropical birds, nuzzling zebras and dancing flamingos (in the same organic and sustainably sourced cotton it has used in the past). Cotton tees, leggings, jumpers and rompers are also available in bright animal prints, and range from $38 to $78 at Sweet William LTD, the childrens clothing store in downtown Manhattan and Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Popupshop fits right in with the stores stock of other ethically responsible, and mostly independent, brands.

title: Big Changes for Today Show?
description: The Timess David Carr and Brian Stelter discuss the possibility of CNNs Anderson Cooper replacing NBCs Matt Lauer.

title: McCarver to Retire From Broadcasting After Season
description: Tim McCarver has been as close as it is possible to being a ubiquitous baseball announcer.

title: Photo Replay: March 27
description: A view of the day in sports, including snowboarding in Spain and Manny Ramirezs baseball debut for the EDA Rhinos in Taiwan.

title: Shadows and Textures Make a Pie
description: Andrew Scrivani (@AndrewScrivani on Twitter and Instagram) is a freelance photographer and a regular contributor to The New York Times. He writes the blog making SundaySauce.

title: Jailed Bahraini Activists on Hunger Strike
description: Last Updated, 10 a.m. Two jailed Bahraini human rights activists  a father and daughter  have gone on a hunger strike and their medical conditions are worsening, according to a family member and a rights group.

title: Acura Looks to the Front With the MDX
description: Introduced on Wednesday March 27, 2013: 2014 Acura MDX

title: Fetal Heartbeat Laws Gain Momentum
description: Kansas state lawmakers debate their own tough measure to curb abortions on the same day a similar bill is signed into law in North Dakota.

title: I.R.S. Videos Come Under Fire
description: An Internal Revenue Service training and leadership video based on Gilligans Island, the campy 1960s television show, has emerged.

title: Fleeting Thoughts, Captured by Pixels
description: In the early days of personal computers, people talked about how great theyd be for managing recipes. Remember?

title: Packing the Family for a Solar Eclipse
description: A television commercial break during the Super Bowl. The world record for a woman to run a mile. The time it took to board my flight.

title: Wal-Mart Introduces Lockers as It Battles Amazon in E-Commerce
description: Following Amazon.com, Walmart will soon allow shoppers to order items online and pick them up from lockers in local stores.

title: Italys Talks on New Government Stumble
description: ROME  Italys political gridlock deepened on Wednesday as talks to form a government broke down between the center-left leader, Pier Luigi Bersani, and the upstart Five Star Movement, a month after national elections failed to yield a majority.

title: Before They Were Legendary
description: WERE THEY INNOCENT, IRREDEEMABLY wicked or perhaps a little of both? Lloyd Ziffs haunting portraits of Patti Smith and Robert Mapplethorpe, shot in the late 1960s, captured those alternating currents in his subjects personalities, which in those days had yet to take definitive form.

title: Living the B&B Dream, a Couple Plans to Update an Inns Web Site
description: Nancy Galloway and Andre Laporte are living what is, for many, the ultimate retirement dream: owning and operating a bed & breakfast. Their current challenge is figuring out the best ways to attract visitors to their Web site and, ultimately, to a very remote part of Canada where the nearest traffic light is an hour away.

title: Quinn, on CNN, Denies Being Vindictive
description: Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, denied on Wednesday that she had used the power of her office to avenge grievances with elected officials who disagreed with her.

title: $17 Million Gift to Bolster Old Master Collection at Dallas Museum of Art
description: Maxwell L. Anderson, the suave former director of the Whitney Museum of American Art, swung through New York on Wednesday to update folks in the media about goings-on at his latest gig  the Dallas Museum of Art, where he became director 15 months ago.

title: Newly Released Books
description: Paris often becomes the main character in novels, but this month Tulsa, Okla.; Anchorage; and the fictional Illinois town of Marah make an appearance as well, likewise serving as far more than backdrop.

title: Rewriting His Own Meal Ticket
description: When Ben Pundole announced last summer that he had left King & Grove, the boutique hotel chain he helped found, a lot of people wondered what the man behind Ruschmeyers and the Surf Lodge, two hot spots in Montauk, N.Y., was going to do next.

title: In the CLA45, Mercedes Unleashes a Beginners AMG
description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27: 2014 Mercedes-Benz CLA45 AMG sedan

title: Banks Seek to Overturn Judges Ruling in Critical Mortgage Case
description: The nations largest banks, facing a torrent of lawsuits over shoddy mortgage securities, are pushing to overturn a series of tough rulings in an important case.

title: Indomitable Yet Prone to Grieving
description: On Tuesday the Bill T. Jones/Arnie Zane Dance Company began a two-week 30th-anniversary season at the Joyce Theater. After the performance the audience members applauded enthusiastically, but Mr. Jones quieted them with the pall of death. He spoke of Mr. Zane, his former partner, who died of AIDS in 1988, and of Demian Acquavella, a company member who died of AIDS in 1990. There are ghosts in this piece, he said, twice.

title: Mr. T Does Hockey
description: In their current era, you cant fault the Chicago Blackhawks for not making their games entertaining. From the raucous national anthem to the infectious goal song to the fast-paced playing style they employ on the ice, games at United Center are certainly feasts for the eyes.

title: Connecting With the Classical
description: The setting was generic Midtown office building, and possibly even less exciting was a yawning space there filled with rows of straight-back chairs. The audiences long wait for seats was the only glimmer one evening this winter that an experience unrelated to everyday business might occur.

title: Table Talk | The Clove Club
description: With arguably one of the most anticipated London restaurant openings this year, the Clove Club  on Old Street in the vibrant and edgy neighborhood of Shoreditch  is the creative and culinary collaboration of Daniel Willis, Johnny Smith and the chef Isaac McHale. After receiving much critical acclaim for their first restaurant, Upstairs at the Ten Bells, they felt it was time to make a bigger, bolder move. And to the historic Shoreditch Town Hall they decamped. Its impossible not to be impressed by the restaurants ground-floor space, with its soaring high ceilings; original period features; bare, white walls; and dark, reclaimed wood. In the dinner-only room, McHale serves a constantly rotating five-course tasting menu; in the more casual bar area, an assortment of small, shared plates is available.

title: Google Street View Captures Ghost Town in Fukushimas Evacuation Zone
description: The eerily empty streets of Namie, a town deep in the evacuation zone around the crippled Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant, are featured in the latest images captured by Google for its Street View mapping project.

title: Lorne Michaels and Louie Are Among Peabody Award Winners
description: Lorne Michaels, the creator of Saturday Night Live, as well as Scotusblog, the widely followed Supreme Court news source, and the FX series Louie, created by the comic Louis C.K., were among the recipients of the 2012 George Foster Peabody Awards, announced on Wednesday.

title: New Director Selected for Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco
description: After 15 months without a director, the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco announced Wednesday that the board has chosen Colin B. Bailey, a deputy director at the Frick Collection in New York, as the new chief. Mr. Bailey said in an interview that he is excited about his new position and unfazed about the turmoil among the staff that the museums have been experiencing.

title: Kia Adds Some Upscale Touches to the Soul
description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27, 2013: 2014 Kia Soul

title: Padres Know the Fragility of Pitching
description: Peoria, Ariz.

title: How 3-D Printers Are Now Making Weapons
description: In October, I wrote a column about 3-D printed guns, and profiled Cody Wilson, a 24-year-old law student at the University of Texas, who was building a completely functional printed weapon.

title: Stretching From Opera to Saloons
description: The soprano Patricia Racette, celebrated for her portrayals of Puccini heroines, is the latest in a lengthening list of classical singers to venture into cabaret, with her show Diva on Detour at 54 Below. That is also the title of her new album recorded with Craig Terry, her accompanist at Tuesday evenings opening-night performance.

title: Electric Blue Is the Spring Look for Men
description: Lately a kind of analog has emerged: shocking blue, a bright electric blue that is a far cry from the navy suits and light-blue business shirts of traditional mens wear.

title: Shock Value
description: Over the last decade, shocking pink has become so popular that it has lost virtually all of its power to do just that. Once distressingly linked with racy lingerie, Barbie dolls and bad taste, the color has amped, ramped and vamped up those associations and become a tongue-in-cheek beacon of femme feminism.

title: CBS Renews 18 Prime-Time Shows
description: Flaunting the stability that has made it the top-rated network, CBS on Wednesday announced the renewal of 18 of its prime-time shows in one swoop, assuring that most of the networks lineup will return next season.

title: Jared Loughner Files From Pima County Sheriff
description: A selection of crucial documents released from authorities in Tucson about the arrest and investigation of the gunman who killed six people and left Representative Gabrielle Giffords wounded.

title: Fake Ads in India Showing Bound and Gagged Women Lead to Firings
description: The Indian operation of a worldwide advertising agency has fired employees and apologized after an uproar over fake celebrity poster ads that were created for a real agency client, Ford Motor, without Fords approval or authorization.

title: Key Moments From the Hearing on the Defense of Marriage Act
description: The Supreme Court heard arguments over a federal law that defines marriage as the union of a man and a woman.

title: A Nifty 50th for the Porsche 911
description: Not many car companies are associated with a single automobile. Fewer still continue to produce the very car that made the marque. So the 50th birthday of the Porsche 911 is definitely noteworthy.

title: Clip: 'Evil Dead'
description: A scene from "Evil Dead," directed by Fede Alvarez.

title: On Mundell-Fleming (Very Wonkish)
description: Aha. I see that Simon Wren-Lewis is on a campaign against the use of the Mundell-Fleming model, a simple international macroeconomic extension of IS-LM analysis, because of the way it handles the relationship between interest rates and exchange rates. And its true that the simplest version of Mundell-Fleming assumes that interest rates are equalized by capital flows, taking no account of expectations of future exchange rate changes.

title: Court Hears Arguments on Defense of Marriage Act
description: The Supreme Court appeared ready on Wednesday to strike down a central part of a federal law that defines marriage as the union of a man and a woman. It was the second day of intense arguments over the volatile issue of same-sex marriage.

title: Faulkners Past Isnt Dead; You Can Buy It at Auction
description: William Faulkner typed the story on the back of University of Mississippi letterhead, an early exercise in fiction writing about a fur trappers trip to a big city. Its 13 browned pages, stashed in an old, mismarked box in a barn on the Faulkner family farm in Charlottesville, Va., were discovered just last year. Now they, along with a stack of hand-corrected manuscripts, letters, a hand-bound poetry book and Faulkners Nobel medal, are headed to Sothebys for auction in June.

title: Pigs Head Is Just One Plot Point of Many
description: The Burgess Boys has the ring of a story about outlaws in the old West. But its about lawyers from small-town Maine instead. This new novel by Elizabeth Strout, the 2009 Pulitzer Prize winner for Olive Kitteridge, features two Burgess brothers, as well as a Burgess girl. Ms. Strout, whose first books were Amy and Isabelle and Abide With Me, writes most comfortably about women, but this book is mostly about the midlife crises of men.

title: For Cyprus, a Sudden Need to Play Nice With Turkey
description: BRUSSELS  With its economy in tatters, Cyprus urgently needs to tap its natural gas deposits. But opening the spigot will force the easternmost member of the European Union to make the tough choices it has long been loath to confront.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: New Directions in Start-Ups, and  iCloud Trouble
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. More Scuttlebot can be found here.

title: Didnt Like Our Play? Youre Right. Very Sorry.
description: Never apologize, never explain: the familiar aphorism is usually invoked after the fact, when the apologizing or explaining has been done, to deleterious effect. It sprang to mind again as I read the letter that Tim Sanford, the artistic director of Playwrights Horizons, sent to some subscribers of that Off Broadway theater, offering a long and eloquent explanation (with a spoonful or two of apology) of the theaters decision to mount The Flick, the new play by Annie Baker.

title: New Ugliness in a Little Cabin of Horrors
description: Zack Carlson is a huge fan of the 1981 horror film The Evil Dead. Thats why he wont be seeing the new Evil Dead when it opens on Friday.

title: Pictures of the Day: Washington and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Washington, Syria, Spain and the Vatican.

title: A Garden of Delights, Mapped Out in Your Hand
description: The sun and the earth have revolved to the relevant positions in space and spring, ladies and gentlemen, has definitely sprung. While I have the opposite of green thumbs, I now have a handy arsenal of gardening apps to help me in my springtime garden.

title: Are You a Giver or a Taker?
description: The Timess Susan Dominus talks to the organizational psychologist Adam Grant about givers, takers and succeeding in the workplace.

title: Taps Present and Future, in a Meeting of Minds, Hearts and Feet
description: On Sunday, near the start of Rhythm in Motion, the second of two shows that the American Tap Dance Foundation presented at the Theater at the 14th Street Y, the events director, Tony Waag, made an announcement and gave a warning. The announcement: All nine of the works on the program had been created within the last year at his American Tap Dance Center. The warning: The show would be a bit moody.

title: Scene City: Dinner and Dance for Herms
description: Socialites fete a new Herms watch collection.

title: Herms Introduces a Watch With a Dance Performance
description: On Monday night, Herms hosted a dinner party celebrating its latest watch, the Dressage Chrono. And everything about it was serious. Very serious.

title: The N.C.A.A.'s Thankless Task
description: Sure, the National Collegiate Athletic Association has its flaws, but, The Timess William C. Rhoden says, the organization is a product of its environment.

title: Trying to Testify Before the Court
description: For much of Tuesday, the trending topic on Twitter wasnt Kimye baby names, LiLos prehab or Shakira on The Voice. Rather, it was the Supreme Courts hearing of arguments in a same-sex marriage case. Celebrities lent their support for #MarriageEquality. But none of the justices, it should be noted, seem to be active on Twitter.

title: Jaguar High Performance Comes in Threes
description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27, 2013: 2014 Range Rover Sport, Jaguar XJR and XKR-S GT

title: Video: The N.C.A.A.s Thankless Task
description: Sure, the National Collegiate Athletic Association has its flaws, but, William C. Rhoden says, the organization is a product of its environment.

title: The Timberlake Brand, Carried Along on a Media Storm
description: What does it really mean for an entertainer to be a brand?

title: Controlling the Smart Home With Tablets and Smartphones
description: A few years ago, I bought a $25 wall switch that could automatically turn my porch light on at dusk and off at sunrise, hoping to make my 1920s-era home a bit smarter.

title: The War in Syria Through a Childs Eyes
description: This week, Britains Channel 4 News broadcast a devastating video report by the German photojournalist Marcel Mettelsiefen on the impact of the war in Syria on the children of Aleppo, the countrys ruined commercial capital. The film, which contains some disturbing images, focuses on the life of a 12-year-old boy named Mohamed Asaf, who spends long days and nights working in a medical clinic that treats residents and rebel fighters.

title: He Speaks Country in a Dialect of His Own
description: There is no parental advisory warning label on the new Blake Shelton album, Based on a True Story, no special Walmart clean edition.

title: In New Jersey, a Resignation, Then a Search for Redemption
description: Maybe its the shallow, overly friendly filmmaking, or maybe its some kind of former politicians curse, but Fall to Grace, a documentary about what James E. McGreevey has been doing since resigning the New Jersey governorship in 2004, never feels as if it got to the core of the man.

title: New York as a Work in Progress
description: James Gulliver Hancock is one of those people who set impossible tasks for themselves that evolve into blogs and then into books. For Mr. Hancock, a 35-year-old Australian artist and illustrator, the task has been to draw every building in New York. He started in April 2010, while living in Brooklyn. Now back home in Sydney with his wife and year-old son, he returns to the scene of his ambition from time to time and otherwise works from photographs and Google Maps. The drawings are posted on his Web site, allthebuildingsinnewyork.com, where they often inspire commissions, leading Mr. Hancocks pen on an erratic course from Staten Island to the Bronx and from squat warehouses to soaring landmarks. Next week, Universe Publishing will release All the Buildings in New York: That Ive Drawn So Far ($19.95), a sampler of the more than 500 drawings he has executed. Mr. Hancock spoke of his starry-eyed project on the phone from Sydney.

title: The JCP Monogram
description: Seeking the cachet of specialty stores, J. C. Penney (recently rebranded as JCP) is installing home-furnishings boutiques in almost half of its 1,100 stores. These shops will offer dedicated collections by well-known designers. We wanted good partners who could appeal to a wide variety of people, said Paul Rutenis, general merchandise manager for JCP Home.

title: Island Fever in Italy
description: The word bikini became popular referring to minimalist beachwear and to the South Pacific atoll where nuclear tests were conducted. It is also the name of two new furniture projects by Werner Aisslinger for the Italian company Moroso. This work, which is to be introduced next month at the Milan Furniture Fair, is neither lethal nor scandalous, but it does disrupt convention.

title: Within a Sconce, Reflections of Infinity
description: To look into Stella, a sconce from the Brooklyn lighting company Roll & Hill, is to peer at infinity. The fixture has a prismatic lens formed by three one-way mirrors that reflect and multiply the appearance of LED strips within an ebonized ash wood frame. The idea was to maximize volume with very minimal space, said the designer, Rosie Li, a 2011 graduate of the furniture-design program at the Rhode Island School of Design. I was really interested in playing with perspective.

title: A Different Time Stamp
description: You have to root a little for Yellow Owl Workshop, a San Francisco company that makes beautiful paper products in this paperless age. Their newest offering is the Carve-A-Stamp-Kit, a D.I.Y. set for creating ink stamps to adorn thank-you cards or envelopes. The $28 kit includes a rubber stamp block, a carving tool, an ink pad, tracing paper and 25 designs (or create your own).

title: Traditions Honored, Then Sidestepped, at Salzburg Easter Festival
description: SALZBURG, Austria  This years Salzburg Easter Festival began on Saturday with a production of Wagners Parsifal that imagined the sorcerer Klingsors castle of false pleasures as a museum.

title: Sales at Broadway Panhandler, Sferra and Others
description: During Broadway Panhandlers knife sale, through Sunday, knives are up to 80 percent off (a Wusthof Grand Prix II 7-inch hollow-edge Santoku, shown, regularly $125, is about $50; a Global 8-inch cooks knife, with MinoSharp sharpener, regularly $206, is $118); 65 East Eighth Street (Broadway), (212) 966-3434, broadwaypanhandler.com.

title: The Art of Unjumbling
description: ZURICH  It may come as a bit of a disappointment to certain design blog fans to learn that Ursus Wehrli is not exactly a neatnik, or in any way obsessive or compulsive. While Mr. Wehrli, 44, is famous in his country for being half of the anarchic comic duo Ursus & Nadeschkin (think Groucho and Harpo, but in German and with circus skills), he has lately accrued another sort of fame as an author with a particularly fastidious worldview.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. The wood on my dining table is scratched, and it makes the room look kind of scruffy. Although I plan to take the table with me when I move, should I have it repaired before trying to sell my home?

title: The Art of Heavy-Metal Blunders
description: A look at some of the ineffective album cover art from The Merciless Book of Metal Lists.

title: Sleeper Sofas
description: Ron Marvin didnt set out to become an authority on small spaces. But then his handsome 300-square-foot Chelsea apartment was featured in Metropolitan Home and on Apartment Therapy. And before long, Mr. Marvin, a New York interior designer, found he had a string of clients with space-challenged homes, and was making regular appearances as an expert on the HGTV show Small Space, Big Style.

title: Shopping for Sleeper Sofas
description: The sleeper-sofa, your extra bedroom for that occasional overnight guest.

title: Scouting Report
description: Dress for Less

title: Cleaning Up
description: The comedian Ursus Wehrli has been accruing another sort of fame as a best-selling author of picture books based on a simple but satisfying sight gag. His latest is The Art of Clean Up: Life Made Neat and Tidy.

title: Design in the Round
description: A selection of bowls from Object Focus: The Bowl at the Museum of Contemporary Craft in Portland, Ore.

title: Enter the Lighting Expert
description: David and Dorothy Measers house in Los Angeles is neither a cottage nor a bachelor pad, but when the couple met nine years ago, it was both.

title: Finally, the Bowl Gets Its Due
description: Last week, a media frenzy erupted when a small white ceramic bowl carved with a pattern of lotus blossoms sold for more than $2.2 million at auction in New York. That price, which included the buyers premium, was 10 times what the auction house, Sothebys, expected the bowl to fetch, and more than 700,000 times what the sellers had paid for it.

title: A Driving Force Behind Wikipedia Will Step Down
description: Sue Gardner, who oversaw a period of rapid growth and evolution of Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, said she would step down as executive director of the nonprofit foundation that runs it.

title: Better Than a Bachelor Pad
description: Turning a Venice Beach cottage into a house fit for a growing family.

title: Where in the World Are Windows Phones Outselling iPhones?
description: On Wednesday morning, Frank Shaw, the head of public relations at Microsoft, published a blog post tallying Microsofts progress across several different product areas, including Windows Phone, its operating system for smartphones.

title: Elite in China Face Austerity Under Xis Rule
description: BEIJING  Life for the almighty Chinese government official has come to this: car pools, domestically made wristwatches and self-serve lunch buffets.

title: A Palm Beach Society Writers Own Boldface Name
description: Shannon Donnelly, the society editor of the Palm Beach Daily News  the small, must-read chronicle of the outlandishly rich  cant get to every party during the high season.

title: Ready to Talk Amps and Ohms?
description: When the February blizzard unplugged my Connecticut home from the power grid for the fourth time in recent years, the whining started immediately: here we go again with the spoiled food, the lack of running water, the dormant oil burner.

title: North American Championships
description: ST. LOUIS  On Sunday evening, the last day of the American Contract Bridge Leagues North American Championships here, with some 10 inches of snow falling outside, three national titles were decided.

title: Tucker Carlson Takes Over Fox & Friends Weekend Edition
description: Tucker Carlson is the new co-host of the weekend editions of Fox & Friends, the Fox News Channels popular morning talk show.

title: A New Cherokee for Jeeps Next Generation
description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27: 2014 Jeep Cherokee

title: Ashley Judd Passes on Senate Run in Kentucky
description: After a high-profile flirtation with a Senate race, the actress Ashley Judd announced Wednesday that she would not seek the Democratic nomination in 2014 from Kentucky.

title: James McGreevey, This Side of Redemption
description: Cloaked in ivy, the Wedgwood-blue Georgian Revival in Plainfield, N.J., has the air of an upper-crust fortress. Surrounded by 1.7 leafy acres landscaped by the firm of Frederick Law Olmsted, the 17-room house offers few clues about its owners. On a recent afternoon, a black Prius is parked in the drive and Easter-bunny cutouts romp across a lawn that slopes down to the quiet street.

title: The Third Man
description: ON A BLOCK ALREADY filled with a Bavarian biergarten (Zum Schneider), a Serbian restaurant (Kafana) and an Austrian gastro pub (Edi and the Wolf) comes another Eastern European-inspired import: the Third Man, a Viennese-style bar that channels Marshall Plan scruffiness (the mirrors are distressed, the bricks, exposed) with elegant cocktails and Austrian hors doeuvres.

title: Hedge Fund Titan Buys Hamptons Property for $60 Million
description: Steven A. Cohen is known for his rapid-fire trading style, moving in and out of stocks with dizzying speed at his hedge fund SAC Capital Advisors.

title: Obama to Visit Mexico and Costa Rica in May
description: In a trip aimed at reinforcing cultural, familial and economic ties with Mexico and Central America, President Obama will visit Mexico and Costa Rica in May, the White House announced Wednesday.

title: Favorite Brands at Whole Body
description: Whole Body, the beauty department of Whole Foods Market, has provided several niche brands with a national stage. Below, four favorites.

title: Beauty Products in a Health-Food Store
description: Whole Body has been a department in Whole Foods stores since the company started in 1980.

title: Hughes Is Set for D.L.
description: Yankees pitcher Phil Hughes will begin the season on the 15-day disabled list, Manager Joe Girardi said, and may not start until April 11, or even later. Hughes pitched in a minor league game Wednesday and threw 81 pitches, but it was only his second spring game. He had to take two weeks off earlier in spring training because of a back problem that slowed his progress and arm conditioning. Until Hughes comes back, the Yankee rotation will consist of C. C. Sabathia, Andy Pettitte, Hiroki Kuroda, Ivan Nova and David Phelps.

title: For a Holistic Lifestyle, Go to Aisle 2
description: Shortly after New York Fashion Week, I stood with my umbrella dripping on the concrete floor of Whole Body, the health and beauty department of the Whole Foods Market in Chelsea. After days of Champagne and late nights, the thought of rejuvenating with natural beauty products had conjured visions of Sound of Music bliss, but the aisles were jammed with more labels and products than I could easily navigate.

title: Chief Who Led Expansion at Hearst Will Step Down
description: After nearly 30 years of running the Hearst Corporation, the privately held media company, Frank A. Bennack Jr. has announced that he is stepping down.

title: With Trial Suddenly Looming, Russian Activist Expects the Worst
description: MOSCOW  Since his earliest days as an opposition blogger, Aleksei A. Navalny has known that a prison sentence loomed as a possibility.

title: Job Prospects Are Dimming for Radiology Trainees
description: For years, medical students who chose a residency in radiology were said to be on the ROAD to happiness. The acronym highlighted the specialties  radiology, ophthalmology, anesthesiology and dermatology  said to promise the best lifestyle for doctors, including the most money for the least grueling work.

title: Hjalmar Andersen, Norwegian Speedskater, Dies at 90
description: Hjalmar Andersen, a Norwegian speedskater who broke world records in the early 1950s and won three gold medals at the 1952 Winter Olympics in Oslo, died on Wednesday in Oslo. He was 90.

title: U.S. Road Opens on Way to Brazil
description: MEXICO CITY

title: After Plan for Speed Cameras Fails in Albany, a Tirade From Bloomberg
description: As it became clear that a proposal to place speed-tracking cameras on New York Citys streets would fail in Albany, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg let fly a charged and unusually personal attack against state lawmakers on Wednesday, blaming state senators, by name, for the future deaths of children killed by speeding cars.

title: Plaintiff, 83, Is Calm Center in a Legal and Political Storm
description: WASHINGTON  When Edith Windsor and her girlfriend got engaged in 1967, she was too nervous about how to answer the inevitable Who is he? queries to wear an engagement ring. So they compromised on a ring-shaped diamond brooch instead.

title: Riddle Posed by Orange Doesnt Change, or Get Easier
description: WASHINGTON  It is one of college basketballs great riddles. Every season, Syracuse Coach Jim Boeheim unveils another iteration of his 2-3 zone defense and dares opponents to concoct solutions.

title: Dolan Goes Behind Bars to Commune With Inmates
description: WALLKILL, N.Y.  Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan gazed at a group of well-behaved and truly captivated worshipers, flashed a big smile, and launched into a story about his recent participation in the papal conclave in Rome, where he helped elect Pope Francis.

title: Ex-Prisoners Bring Taste of West Bank to Gaza
description: GAZA  Nader Abu Turki first gained a reputation as a confectioner while serving time as a prisoner in Israel.

title: 3rd Oral Drug to Treat MS Is Approved by the F.D.A.
description: A chemical once used to treat sofas  until it was found to cause rashes and blisters in people who sat on them  is now poised to become a major therapy for multiple sclerosis.

title: Officer Tied to Tapes Destruction Moves Up C.I.A. Ladder
description: WASHINGTON  A C.I.A. officer directly involved in the 2005 decision to destroy interrogation videotapes and who once ran one of the agencys secret prisons has ascended to the top position within the C.I.A.s clandestine service, according to current and former intelligence officials.

title: Attacks Used the Internet Against Itself to Clog Traffic
description: An escalating cyberattack involving an antispam group and a shadowy group of attackers has now affected millions of people across the Internet, raising the question: How can such attacks be stopped?

title: Dairy Finds a Way to Let Cows Power Trucks
description: FAIR OAKS, Ind.  Here at one of the largest dairy farms in the country, electricity generated using an endless supply of manure runs the equipment to milk around 30,000 cows three times a day.

title: Dribbling Prodigy Now a Coach
description: LOS ANGELES  It seemed inevitable that Sean Miller would end up here, with a permanent home underneath Hollywoods bright lights, where his prodigious childhood talent for dribbling and handling a basketball drew the attention of film and movie types.

title: Getting to Know Wichita States Mascot WuShock
description: LOS ANGELES  Wichita State will play an N.C.A.A. tournament game here Thursday. For the uninitiated, the teams nickname is the Shockers, shortened from Wheat Shockers.

title: Court Rejects Antitrust Suit in Victory for Comcast
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday threw out a proposed class-action antitrust lawsuit against Comcast, the nations largest cable television company, in which a group of more than two million current and former Comcast subscribers sought to prove that the company had unfairly eliminated competition and overcharged customers.

title: U.N. Close to Curbing Arms Trade With Treaty
description: UNITED NATIONS  The effort over many years to forge an international treaty regulating the booming $70 billion annual trade in conventional weapons headed toward fruition on Wednesday with a final draft sent to the governments of all United Nations member states for approval.

title: New Problem for Boeing 787 Battery Maker
description: TOKYO  Two lithium-ion car batteries produced by GS Yuasa, the same Japanese company that supplies batteries for the grounded Boeing 787 jetliner fleet, have overheated in recent days.

title: James M. Nabrit, a Fighter for Civil Rights, Dies at 80
description: James M. Nabrit III, a civil rights lawyer who fought school segregation before the Supreme Court and helped ensure that the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.s 1965 march from Selma to Montgomery, Ala., was allowed to go forward, died on Friday in Bethesda, Md. He was 80.

title: Beleaguered? Not Teachers, a Poll on Well-Being Finds
description: Recent battles over school funding, performance evaluations and tenure have given rise to public perceptions of a beleaguered teaching corps across the United States.

title: N.F.L. Doctor Says Disease Is Overstated
description: When a government agency prepared a workplace safety fact sheet based on a study of degenerative brain disease in retired N.F.L. players, the organization invited several people to comment on a draft.

title: On the Brink of Justice in Guatemala
description: Haverford, Pa.

title: Twitter Posts Lead Weight Watchers Online to a New Spokeswoman
description: WEIGHT WATCHERS is closely associated with celebrity endorsers like Jennifer Hudson, Jessica Simpson and Charles Barkley, but some celebrities end up joining the program on their own.

title: A Republican Left Turn?
description: If the Republican Party concedes defeat in the culture war, as a number of commentators on the right and the left argue it should, what what will happen to the conservative coalition? Can hard-line stands on social issues be set aside?

title: Antibiotics and the Meat We Eat
description: San Francisco

title: A No-Fly Zone for Knives
description: Washington

title: Immigration in Spotlight as Senators Tour Arizona
description: NOGALES, Ariz.  Four United States senators came to this bustling city on the Mexican border on Wednesday searching for answers to the question that has ensnarled the debate over immigration reform: How secure is that border?

title: Cypriots Criticism of Bailout Rattles Nerves and Raises Ire in Germany
description: BERLIN  If Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany is bothered by images of her wearing a mustache like Hitlers, which are being waved in streets from Cyprus to Spain, she has yet to show it, choosing instead to stress the importance of the protesters freedom of expression.

title: A Vote on Scottish Independence
description: Scottish voters will decide on Sept. 18, 2014, whether Scotland should remain part of the United Kingdom or become an independent nation. After more than three centuries of political union, breaking up would be complicated.

title: Monitoring New York Citys Police
description: Mayor Michael Bloomberg of New York and Commissioner Raymond Kelly are apoplectic about a bill pending in the City Council that would create the position of inspector general, an official with broad powers to review the policies of the nations largest police department. Given the departments long history of episodic misconduct, the idea is one whose time has clearly come. The City Council should press ahead with the bill and be prepared to override a veto by the mayor.

title: Down Syndrome and a Death
description: A grand jury in Frederick County, Md., decided last week not to bring criminal charges in the death of Robert Ethan Saylor, a 26-year-old man with Down syndrome who was killed in a struggle with three off-duty county sheriffs deputies at a movie theater in January. Advocates for people with intellectual disabilities are bewildered and furious, and it is easy to see why.

title: The Indefensible Marriage Act
description: The discrimination embedded in the Defense of Marriage Act is precise yet sweeping. The 1996 statute defines marriage as the union of a man and a woman, and applies that definition to about 1,100 federal laws and programs. One of its many discriminatory results is that same-sex couples are prohibited from collecting many federal benefits available to other couples.

title: Defense in Colorado Killings Seeks Plea Deal
description: CENTENNIAL, Colo.  Defense lawyers for James E. Holmes, who is charged with killing 12 people and wounding dozens more at an Aurora, Colo., movie theater last summer, signaled in court filings on Wednesday that they were willing to have Mr. Holmes plead guilty if he was spared the death penalty.

title: History in Real Time
description: Witnessing a historic moment is such an odd and exhilarating thing. It is hard to register the full scope of it because you are chest deep in it.

title: Cooling on Warming
description: Is spring actually here? We are definitely getting tired of snow stories. Its time for some sun. And then the drought stories!

title: Miami Coach Left a Mark With a Run in 2006
description: FAIRFAX, Va.  The basketball commemorating George Masons run to the Final Four in 2006 is perched inside a modest trophy case near an obscure back entrance of the universitys basketball arena. Embossed with the score of the East Region final  George Mason 86, Connecticut 84  the basketball is not all that easy to find in this sprawling suburban campus 20 miles from Washington, and hundreds of students pass it without notice each day.

title: Hague: 2 Serb Police Chiefs Convicted
description: The Yugoslav war crimes tribunal on Wednesday convicted two Bosnian Serb police chiefs for participating in a violent ethnic cleansing campaign that aimed to drive non-Serbs from their homes in 20 municipalities of Bosnia during the war of early 1990s. The two, Mico Stanisic and Stojan Zuplanin, were each handed a 22-year prison sentence. The verdicts underscored the crucial roles played by the police and armed militia in the notorious persecution of Croats and Muslims, many of whom were beaten, tortured, raped or otherwise abused in as many as 50 wartime detention centers run by Bosnian Serbs. The judges said that many civilians were killed or died from hunger, illness and mistreatment during the campaign to create zones for Serbs only in Bosnia.

title: Connecticut and Shore on Itinerary for a Prince
description: A charming prince is coming and there are no official plans for him to get naked.

title: For La Salle, a Calming Influence at the End of the Bench
description: LOS ANGELES  Before 13th-seeded La Salle upset No. 4 Kansas State last week, the Explorers huddled in the locker room and bowed their heads. Brother Ed Sheehy stood beside the players, dressed in his traditional dark sweater, black shirt and white collar.

title: Automakers Take the Wraps Off Luxury
description: Automakers are filling their showrooms with expensive new models like the ones on display at the New York auto show. The market for high-end cars and S.U.V.s has outstripped overall car demand in the United States, a surge that  analysts see as a sign that wealthy consumers sense the nations financial health is solidly improving.

title: As Sales Rise, Automakers Focus on the Luxurious
description: With the luxury vehicle market booming, automakers are rushing to fill their showrooms with expensive new models now on display at the New York auto show.

Sorry State of the Airports

title: For Matta and Miller, a Long History and a Lot of Laughs
description: LOS ANGELES  Ohio States Thad Matta and Arizonas Sean Miller coached together at Miami of Ohio and Xavier. On Thursday night here at Staples Center, they will coach against each other for a spot in the West Region final.

title: City Lawyer Gets Probation for Lies to the British Bar
description: A New York lawyer who lied about her work experience and shaved nearly 20 years off her age in an effort to gain admittance to the British bar association was sentenced on Wednesday to five years of probation, but avoided jail time.

title: Success on Political Front Can Be Setback in Gay Rights
description: WASHINGTON  As the justices of the Supreme Court struggled with the question of same-sex marriage this week, politicians in Congress kept handing down their own verdict. One after another, a series of lawmakers in recent days endorsed allowing gay men and lesbians to wed.

title: In U.S. Court, a Familiar Argument Over Intentions in Joining a Terrorist Group
description: The narrative heard in federal court in Manhattan on Wednesday was an increasingly common one: a defendant from a faraway land claimed he was not an anti-American terrorist but rather someone who had become involved in his own countrys wars.

title: Bryant Park to Broadway: A Boulevard 41 Is Proposed
description: The march of the pedestrians in Midtown Manhattan may soon spread to another block.

title: Like a Cool Cat
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  To paraphrase Indiana Jones, rebus. It had to be a rebus.

title: Corrections: March 28, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: With Vouchers, States Shift Aid for Schools to Families
description: PHOENIX  A growing number of lawmakers across the country are taking steps to redefine public education, shifting the debate from the classroom to the pocketbook. Instead of simply financing a traditional system of neighborhood schools, legislators and some governors are headed toward funneling public money directly to families, who would be free to choose the kind of schooling they believe is best for their children, be it public, charter, private, religious, online or at home.

title: Manure Becomes a Fuel Supply
description: At one of the largest dairy farms in the country, electricity generated by an endless supply of manure runs the equipment to milk around 30,000 cows three times a day.

description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27: 2014 BMW 335i Gran Turismo

title: A Tiger, a Truck Stop and a Pitched Legal Battle
description: GROSSE TETE, La.  The American truck stop is a promise of certain reliables: a shower, a warm meal, some small talk at the counter, a 24/7 source of diesel, beef jerky and cigarettes.

title: Landlord Accused of Endangering Tenants
description: A Queens landlord who authorities said had packed nearly 50 people in illegally converted apartments, some in garages and cellars, was charged with reckless endangerment and other crimes on Wednesday, reflecting a growing concern about the kind of overcrowded housing that has been cited in several fatal fires in recent years.

title: New Police Chief Appointee Is Hailed as a Bridge Builder
description: Philip Banks III, the New York Police Departments chief of community affairs, has been named chief of department, the agencys top-ranking uniformed position.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 27, 2013

title: Democrats Stake Positions in Special Election for Massachusetts Senate Seat
description: NEEDHAM, Mass.  At the first Democratic debate in the special election to replace John Kerry in the United States Senate, Representatives Stephen Lynch and Edward Markey took entirely different approaches Wednesday night as they introduced themselves to Massachusetts voters.

title: A Bentley That Looks Like, Well, a Bentley
description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27: 2014 Bentley Flying Spur

title: For Mayoral Hopeful Who Lost Fight to Remove Art, No Regrets
description: The deputy mayor, Joseph J. Lhota, never went to see the painting. Just hearing about it was enough.

title: Infiniti QX60 Hybrid Pairs Style and Economy
description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27: 2014 Infiniti QX60 Hybrid

title: Milestones in the Sensations Case
description: A look at crucial moments in the citys 1999 conflict with the Brooklyn Museum over the Sensations exhibition, and Joseph J. Lhotas handling of the dispute as a deputy mayor.

title: California Seeks End to Federal Oversight in Its Prisons
description: SACRAMENTO  Eighteen years after losing control over mental health care in its prisons, California argued in a federal court here on Wednesday that it had made enough improvements to regain oversight.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, Mar. 28, 2013.
description: I have a much clearer understanding of the First Amendment now.

title: Latest Victims of Budget Woes Know Cuts Well
description: WASHINGTON  They have survived the Civil War, the Great Depression and even Newt Gingrich.

title: Yankees to Open Season With Hughes on Disabled List
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Phil Hughes will begin the season on the 15-day disabled list, Yankees Manager Joe Girardi said Wednesday, and may not start a game until April 11, or even later.

title: Rolls-Royce Wraith: A Coupe for High Rollers Only
description: Introduced on Wednesday, March 27: 2014 Rolls-Royce Wraith
