title: An Unlikely Jihadist, Denouncing Assad in Mandarin
description: BEIJING  The man in camouflage fatigues raised his Kalashnikov rifle and fired three shots into the air while trudging through a field of purple and yellow flowers.

title: Europes Second Depression: A Correction
description: Aha  in my post on Europes policy failure, I somehow failed to notice that the new Maddison dataset provides per capita real GDP, which means that I should use per capita GDP in looking at the current crisis. And my point about dismal performance gets even stronger:

title: What Dell Thought of Alternatives to the Silver Lake Proposal
description: Dell Inc. directors have repeatedly emphasized that they considered all potential ways to improve value for shareholders before accepting a $24.4 billion takeover bid by Michael S. Dell and the investment firm Silver Lake.

title: Taking Flight to a Land of Noodles
description: TETERBORO, N.J.  Before Sun Noodle held its first ramen flight here earlier this month, George Kao, the companys sales manager and host of the event, was up until 1 a.m. studying his notes. The five participants in the combination culinary class and tasting probably would have shown up, though, even without the educational part of the program.

title: Feeling Less Guilt and Doing Some Good
description: The first summer I ever earned any money, I started reading the utilitarian philosopher Peter Singer, who had a few ideas about how I should spend it. To Mr. Singer, since it is cheap to save lives in the third world, we are culpable if we have the cash and dont help save them. If you would save a child from drowning in a pond, even if it meant ruining your expensive shoes, he wrote, then shouldnt you also save a child from drowning in poverty, for the cost of your expensive shoes?

title: Ex-Soldier Accused of Joining Terrorist Group in Syria Left Trail of Videos
description: As my colleague Scott Shane reports, a former American soldier was charged on Thursday with fighting alongside a rebel group linked to Al Qaeda on the battlefields of the Syrian civil war.

title: Where the Recipes Call for Sharing
description: Traditional Vietnamese cuisine has the reputation of being one of the healthiest in the world. Considering in the growing popularity of foods that are not only tasty, but also healthful, Saigonese could not have arrived in Hartsdale at a better time. Cooking in this restaurants kitchen is about quick preparations of fresh ingredients with masses of dewy herbs (parsley, mint, sweet basil and cilantro). Few items are deep fried.

title: Applause in Unlikely Places: A Conductor Who Rewrites the Rules
description: During the Infernal Dance of Stravinskys Firebird, which depicts the subjects of the ogre Kastchei spinning with such savagery that they drop in exhaustion, the music builds to vehement, searing chords. In his performance of the complete Firebird on Thursday night with the Los Angeles Philharmonic at Avery Fisher Hall, the second of two programs, Gustavo Dudamel drew such blazing colors, slashing attacks and sheer terror from the orchestra that at the climax of the dance some people in the hall broke into applause and shouted Bravo. This temporarily drowned out the transition that immediately follows: the powerful chords disperse to reveal mysterious, hushed sonorities.

title: Emcee
description: An emcee at a Jamaican dancehall party.

title: A Colorful Palette for a Multicultural Cuisine
description: Rooted in street food, chicken shacks and back-alley cebicherias, Peruvian food has won praise in recent years from such cosmopolitan chefs as Ferran Adri and Dan Barber. And the king of Peruvian restaurants in central Connecticut is Cora Cora, where Hector Ludena and Luisa Jimenez take guests on a tour of their countrys vivid and robust cuisine.

title: New Police Chief Confident He Can Handle Job
description: The first question was simple: What made you want to become a police officer?

title: To Replace Old Cobblestones, Old-Looking Cobblestones
description: They have survived in Brooklyns northwestern corner for over a century  handmade and rounded, their shades weathered to a medley of noble grays  rattling the frames of carriages and Chryslers, buses and bicycles beside the waterfront.

title: Making Robots Mimic the Human Hand
description: As part of a national research project to develop low-cost artificial hands, the Pentagon has released a video of a robot that can change a tire  almost.

title: Reducing Gun Violence: What Works?
description: To the Editor:

title: Charisma, Wealth, Flattery. How Can She Resist?
description: The actor, director and playwright Tyler Perry has long embraced religion in his films, but perhaps never more so than in his slack fable Temptation: Confessions of a Marriage Counselor. Adapted from his 2008 play, The Marriage Counselor, the movie inveighs against deviation from the church, monogamy and the righteous path of cooking meals for a husband.

title: Questions for an Expert on North Korean Propaganda
description: Last Updated, Saturday, 12:35 p.m. As my colleague Choe Sang-Hun reports, North Koreas state news agency released the latest in a series of saber-rattling images on Friday, this time showing the countrys leader, Kim Jong-un, studying what the agency called plans to strike the mainland U.S.

title: Indictments in Atlanta Public Schools Cheating Scandal
description: A grand jury indicted Beverly L. Hall, the former superintendent of the Atlanta Public Schools, and 34 others on charges connected to one of the largest test-score cheating scandals in the country.

title: Developing New Drugs
description: To the Editor:

title: Subversion, Cool and Collected
description: Luis Buuel began his career as a filmmaker with a Dadaist determination to shock and outrage. He cast himself as the square-jawed dandy who, at the beginning of his first film, Un Chien Andalou (1929), impassively draws a straight razor across the eyeball of a compliant young woman without troubling to remove the cigarette from his mouth.

title: Pictures From the Week in Business
description: The bailout in Cyprus was completed, and banks there reopened, albeit under tight capital controls; T-Mobile, now selling the iPhone, introduced a new billing plan; and a top portfolio manager at SAC Capital Advisors was arrested.

title: Poor Baby: Daddys Got a Text Message
description: To the Editor:

title: Italian Classics, Served With Fun
description: Chris Santoro has a sense of humor. The owner of Toro Pazzo, a year-and-a-half-old restaurant in Wantagh, Mr. Santoro said playfully that his name could be translated as holy bull in Italian, so he chose as the restaurants logo a snorting bull with a halo.

title: Hollande Draws Bad Reviews as He Answers Critics on TV
description: PARIS  President Franois Hollande, low in the opinion polls less than a year into the job, went on national television for over an hour on Thursday night in what French commentators likened to an oral exam on his job performance.

title: Natures Case for Same-Sex Marriage
description: BIOLOGY has returned to the nations highest court. Its not Darwins theory of evolution on the docket this time, but the nature of sex. Defenders of Proposition 8, Californias ban on gay marriage, base their case on what they call the objective biological fact that procreation is an exclusively heterosexual process. Citing the 18th-century English jurist William Blackstone, they argue that marriage should be founded in nature.

title: Roster Moves Leave Mets With Two Spots to Fill
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The Mets made several roster moves Friday after they played their final home spring training game. Outfielder Marlon Byrd and pitchers Scott Atchison, LaTroy Hawkins and Scott Rice made the team, while Robert Carson and Omar Quintanilla were sent to Las Vegas, where the Mets have their Class AAA franchise.

title: Celebrating a Writer Who Put Poetry in Pop
description: Among the countless songs written from a soldiers point of view, none is more wrenching than Tom Waits and Kathleen Brennans Day After Tomorrow, a 21-year-old servicemans letter to his Illinois family on the eve of his homecoming. He reflects in a song that is beyond bitter:

title: Silodor Open Pairs
description: At 12:30 p.m. on Thursday, March 21, Billy Cohen of Sherman Oaks, Calif., was getting ready to watch college basketball on his hotel rooms wide-screen television in St. Louis, the site of the Spring North American Championships.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,174 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: A New Dance Move
description: An evolving dance move is performed in a Jamaican dance hall.

title: Just Folk, Inspired by Hungary and Romania
description: Over the last decade, the duo known as a Hawk and a Hacksaw have been exploring the traditional music of Eastern Europe from a distinctly American folk-pop perspective. Though the accordion player Jeremy Barnes was formerly the drummer in Neutral Milk Hotel, and the violinist and pianist Heather Trost played on Beiruts first two records, their inspiration now comes mostly from places like Hungary, Romania, Bulgaria and Macedonia.

title: Jamaican Dancehall Dancing
description: Dancing at a Jamaican dancehall party.

title: Dancehall Fashion
description: Some new fashion at a Jamaican dancehall party.

title: Jamaican Dancehall Dancing
description: A woman performs a dance move at a party in Jamaica.

title: Dancing in a Tree
description: Two party attendees danced in a tree at a Jamaican dancehall party.

title: Arriving at a Party
description: Revelers slowly trickle into a Jamaican dancehall party.

title: Nominee for Energy Secretary Lists Assets and Posts
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas nominee for energy secretary, Ernest J. Moniz, is a consultant to the energy giant BP and a member of the advisory council and board of trustees of King Abdullah Petroleum Studies and Research Center, of Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, among other positions, according to disclosure statements filed with the government and released on Friday.

title: Dancing at a Jamaican Dancehall Party
description: Partygoers dance at a Jamaican dancehall party.

title: Oscars Group Asks for Advice
description: LOS ANGELES  The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences is inviting its roughly 6,000 members to join what promises to be an unusual group discussion of something that has set off much private debate here recently: the Academys future.

title: Events in Westchester
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: A Change of Tune in Caramoors Music Room
description: KATONAH, N.Y.  Nestled amid the stucco buildings on the sprawling campus of the Caramoor Center for Music and the Arts, the Rosen House Music Room, known for the Renaissance artifacts collected by Caramoors onetime owners, Walter and Lucie Rosen, is a stately space where decorous string quartets and the like usually play. So when Caramoor hired the raucous roots group Spuyten Duyvil to entertain at a media event in the room this month, traditionalists found the choice less than wholly palatable.

title: At Twains Home, an Era He Skewered
description: You would expect to be amused at an exhibition generously peppered with the wit and wisdom of Samuel Langhorne Clemens, the writer better known as Mark Twain. And the new show at the Mark Twain House and Museum, The Gilded Age of Hartford, does indeed deliver entertainment as it documents the rising fortunes and changing social framework of Hartford in the 1870s, 80s and 90s.

title: Turin Shroud Going on TV, With Video From Pope
description: ROME  The Shroud of Turin, which since medieval times has been revered by many Christians as the burial cloth of Jesus, is about to make its debut on modern media platforms.

title: Events in Connecticut
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Bill Cunningham | The New Man
description: The mens fashion revolution is in full swing, with looks ranging from 30s styles to a revival of grunge and mouth grilles.

title: Ohio Fangirls Embark on a Perilous Quest
description: With Geek! the playwright Crystal Skillman and the troupe Vampire Cowboys fly high the freak flag of fantasy. An ode to fangirls and fanboys, the show, in Cowboys tradition, celebrates the universe of anime, comics, science fiction, manga and Hollywood effects spectaculars. Its a milieu Ms. Skillman clearly knows well and depicts with affection.

title: Week in Pictures for March 29
description: Here is a slide show of photographs from the past week in New York City and the region. Subjects include the opening of amusement parks in Coney Island, a dodgeball marathon and the Bloomberg administration bullpen at City Hall.

title: Events in New Jersey
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Falling to Earth, Only to Witness a Pole Dance
description: Its easy to be fascinated by our own dreams. Yet when the dreams of others are recounted to us, so much gets lost in translation. Or, to put it more plainly: suffering through someone elses jump cuts and surreal metaphors can be tedious as all get-out.

title: Earnestly, Internationally in Search of Love
description: A romance that whirls halfway around the world, Roundelay: A Comedy skips back and forth from America to India, Kenya and the Caribbean as its multicultural characters either pursue love or run away from it. The Passage Theater Companys production of R. N. Sandbergs new play at the Mill Hill Playhouse in Trenton offers a pleasant, if somewhat hectic, sojourn with 10 individuals of varying ethnicities who all yearn for love.

title: Focus on Healing Arts After Kidnapping Conviction
description: SANTIAGO, Chile

title: Events on Long Island
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: The Young Germans Who Stood Up to the Nazis
description: Jud Newborn, a Holocaust scholar who lives in Plainview, was doing research in Munich as a graduate student in the early 1980s when he became intrigued with the story of the White Rose resistance movement. The small, student-based group wrote and printed anonymous anti-Nazi leaflets in Munich and distributed them in that city and beyond before its key members were captured and executed in 1943.

title: Hospitals Question Medicare Rules on Readmissions
description: It is no longer enough for hospitals to make patients healthy enough to leave. Now, as part of the Obama administrations health care overhaul, they are spending millions of dollars to keep those patients from coming back, often acting like personal assistants to help them manage their post-hospital lives.

title: From the Swinging 60s, a Recipe for Farce
description: The eight sturdy doors that surround the living room of a Paris apartment in Marc Camolettis Boeing-Boeing are a good tip-off that a farce is about to ensue. So is the setup  one bachelor, three fiances  which is outlined early on by the bachelor, an American architect named Bernard.

title: The Harsh and Haunting Winds of Sept. 11
description: For many casual observers, the term wind ensemble will conjure up notions of earnest students huffing and thumping through Sousa marches and college fight songs. But aficionados, and those who have played in a university wind ensemble during the last 30 years or so, know that such groups now constitute a bona fide hotbed of opportunity for contemporary composers. Neo-Romantics, avant-gardists and postclassical eclectics have heeded the call, lured by generous commissions, multiple performances, and rehearsal time measured in weeks instead of hours.

title: Blossoming Colt Stirs Up Dreams Set in Kentucky
description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla.  Itsmyluckyday stops while walking the shed row in Barn 74 at Calder Race Course to gaze at his reflection in the glass door that leads into the office of Eddie Plesa Jr., his trainer. He leans his head to the right and peers intently as if to say, Is that really me?

title: Libya Arrests 2 Men in Attack on 5 British Aid Activists
description: CAIRO  Libyan security officials said Friday that they had arrested two men in the kidnapping this week in eastern Libya of five British humanitarian activists, at least two of them women who had been sexually assaulted.

title: Women (and Men) Face Big Hurdles in Training for Marine Infantry Units
description: QUANTICO, Va.  A group of Marine second lieutenants, all men, stood before the ropes on an obstacle course. They looked exhausted, though the day was far from done. One by one, they took their shots at scaling the line. One by one, most of them dropped short of the top. They were already three hours behind the front-runners in their class.

title: The Point Man of Syracuses Tournament Run
description: WASHINGTON  Gerry McNamara still participates in an occasional practice at Syracuse. Not far removed from his playing career, McNamara is the youngest assistant on Coach Jim Boeheims staff, so the onus often falls on him to get out there and compete.

title: With Policy Moves, Quinn Defuses de Blasios Attacks in Race for Mayor
description: He has hammered her over the surging level of fines against small businesses, chided her for not demanding greater oversight of New Yorks police and denounced her for failing to support a bill providing paid time off for sick workers.

title: Suspects Death Puts Reward in Question
description: LOS ANGELES  In the midst of a frenzied weeklong manhunt, Mayor Antonio R. Villaraigosa put together one of the largest rewards in Southern California history: $1 million for information leading to the arrest and conviction of Christopher J. Dorner, the former Los Angeles police officer who was wanted in multiple killings last month.

title: Ohio States Best Shooter, or Maybe Its Worst
description: LOS ANGELES  According to ESPNs statistics, Deshaun Thomas took 564 field-goal attempts this season. Not all of them were bad. It only sometimes seemed that way.

title: Tonight, Tonight, Its World Is Full of Blight
description: Once again, The Tonight Show rears its hoary head in the headlines. (Unintentional word-play.)

title: Quinn Accepts Sick Leave Deal
description: After blocking legislation for three years, the City Council speaker, Christine C. Quinn, agreed to a compromise that will eventually make thousands of companies give paid time off to sick workers.

title: Two Ohio State Players Join Buzzer-Beater Club
description: LOS ANGELES  The club, among the most exclusive in N.C.A.A. tournament history, includes stars and unknowns, guards and post players, from universities with tradition and without. From Christian Laettner to Bryce Drew, James Forrest to Scottie Reynolds, they are linked by clocks dwindled and buzzers beaten and heartbeats elevated.

title: Pyongyang Blusters, and U.S. Worries About Quieter Risks
description: SEOUL, South Korea  This week, North Koreas young leader, Kim Jong-un, ordered his underlings to prepare for a missile attack on the United States. He appeared at a command center in front of a wall map with the bold, unlikely title, Plans to Attack the Mainland U.S. Earlier in the month, his generals boasted of developing a Korean-style nuclear warhead that could be fitted atop a long-range missile.

title: Nevada Legislator Expelled, Then Arrested, as His Life Unravels for the Public to See
description: LAS VEGAS  Nevadas State Legislature this week voted for the first time to expel one of its own members, and the man was arrested later the same day.

title: Sick-Pay Plan Called Blessing and Burden
description: The compromise reached on a sick-leave law for workers in New York City drew cheers on Friday from employees who have feared that catching a cold could cost them their jobs. But some employers complained that it would unfairly load yet another expense onto their shoulders.

title: Marquette Reaping Benefits From Preseason Bootcamp
description: WASHINGTON  Marquette Coach Buzz Williams called himself cantankerous on Friday. He also conceded he had no compassion on the basketball court. One day earlier, he tried to convince reporters that he was not a good person to be around on game days.

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, Mar. 30, 2013
description: The cheating had been going on so long. We considered it part of our jobs.

title: Devices Like Cable Boxes Figured in Internet Attack
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In the aftermath this week of one of the most powerful attacks on the Internet, finger-pointing quickly ensued.

title: A Cross-Cultural Passover
description: For the last five years, Toloache, a Mexican restaurant on 50th Street near Eighth Avenue, has welcomed the arrival of Passover by fusing Jewish and Mexican cuisines into a kind of south of the border Seder menu. Toloaches chef, Julian Medina, grew up Catholic in Mexico City and converted to Judaism several years ago after marrying a Jewish woman. One way to honor his new tradition was to dream up Mexican riffs on classic Jewish soul food dishes (can you say, tacos de brisket)? The Passover menu, which will continue until April 2, filled the house one evening last week with curious cross-cultural diners and Jewish families  like the Katzes, from North Bellmore, on Long Island.

title: The Attack of the Killer Surplus
description: Its not often we stop to ask ourselves: Whats going on with North Dakota? But I believe this is the moment.

title: Lawmakers and Relatives Want More Details Released About Newtown Gunman
description: Two weeks after the Virginia Tech massacre in 2007, Tim Kaine, then governor of Virginia, closed a loophole in the states gun laws that had allowed a mentally disturbed student to buy the guns used in the rampage, which left 33 dead.

title: On Space Coast, Signs of Comeback After End of an Era
description: MELBOURNE, Fla.  The day after the shuttle Atlantis landed for the last time at the Kennedy Space Center on July 21, 2011, Angel Telles, a man with three masters degrees, scooped up his white Mission 101 coffee mug and drove away from NASA after 24 years on the job there. The shuttle era had ended, and with it the jobs of 8,000 NASA and civilian workers who found themselves unemployed in the midst of a harsh economic downturn and a crush of home foreclosures.

title: The Coach Who Fought Back
description: In 1966, Beryl Shipley, the basketball coach at the University of Southwestern Louisiana, recruited three African-Americans to play for the Ragin Cajuns. Although the school, now known as the University of Louisiana at Lafayette, had accepted black students since the mid-1950s, its teams remained segregated  as did every college athletic team in the state.

title: Estimated Range of North Korean Missiles
description: Missiles currently in North Korean arsenal.

title: Waterfront Plans Threaten Dream to Honor a Warship in Brooklyn
description: On the coast of gentrifying Brooklyn, the famous Civil War ironclad the U.S.S. Monitor is now caught up in another fierce battle.

title: Zumba Instructor Admits to Running a Prostitution Ring
description: A Zumba instructor in Kennebunk, Me., pleaded guilty on Friday to using her dance studio as a front for a prostitution ring that involved scores of men in New England. The plea means that the instructor, Alexis Wright, will avoid a trial, as will the numerous clients who might have been called as witnesses.

title: Wichita State Loose as Ohio State Looms
description: LOS ANGELES  Wichita State was watching highlights of Ohio State on Friday morning, when the whole team shared a big, hearty laugh.

title: The Campaign to Outlaw Abortion
description: Anti-abortion groups have been trying to re-impose restrictions on abortion rights for 40 years, but the Legislature and governor of North Dakota have taken this attack on womens reproductive health and freedom to a shocking new low by passing a bill that they must know perfectly well is unconstitutional by any reading of the 1973 Roe v. Wade decision and others since.

title: Corrections: March 30, 2013
description: NATIONAL

title: Went in Tandem
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  It has been a long, cold March with a lot of activity, and my brain is worn to a nub atop my brain stem. Maybe thats why I found this one by Gareth Bain so tough. Or maybe its the diabolical cluing. Either way, its definitely Saturday, and in my opinion, Dr. Bain and Will Shortz are out for blood.

title: Toyotas and Torch Songs
description: Al Lambert, Staten Islands man of cars and song, can sell you a used Toyota by day and give you Summer Wind with his big band that evening.

title: Strengthening the I.M.F.
description: Lets face it: the International Monetary Fund is not widely loved. It has forced countries in financial distress to adopt counterproductive austerity policies, and it failed to anticipate the financial crisis. But in recent years the I.M.F. has helped stabilize the global economy, most recently by providing loans to troubled European countries like Greece and Ireland. That is why Congress needs to strengthen its governance and bolster its resources by ratifying reforms to the organization that were agreed to in 2010 by its 188 member countries.

title: Provocateur Comes Into View After Cyberattack
description: Sven Olaf Kamphuis calls himself the minister of telecommunications and foreign affairs for the Republic of CyberBunker. Others see him as the Prince of Spam.

title: Some Yankees Fans Have Gnawing Feeling That All Is Not Well
description: There is little that screams the words damage and control like a typically news-media-shy baseball owner suddenly making the rounds of sports talk radio and opening his door to quotation-hungry reporters. In a spate of recent interviews, Hal Steinbrenner, the Yankees managing general partner, has given his personal assurance that his franchise remains committed to fielding a championship-caliber team every year.

title: Relying on Hotel Rooms for Thousands Uprooted by Hurricane Sandy
description: Five months after Hurricane Sandy, more than 2,000 people who were displaced by the storm remain in hotels in New York City, leading some officials to acknowledge that the city had not been prepared for the challenges in finding them housing.

title: New Cabs Could Avoid Hybrid Ban
description: Faced with a lawsuit aimed at blocking New Yorks so-called Taxi of Tomorrow because it is not a hybrid, the Bloomberg administration has proposed a compromise: Some owners can buy hybrids, as long as they are big enough.

title: China: Landslide Buries Workers at Mine in Tibet
description: A huge landslide buried 83 workers at a gold mining site in western China on Friday, setting off a frantic rescue effort, Chinas state-run Xinhua news agency reported. The government said more than 1,000 rescue workers had been called in to stabilize the area and search for the victims, who had been working at a subsidiary of the China Gold Group Corporation. The authorities said the landslide occurred in Maizhokunggar County, about 45 miles east of Lhasa, the capital of Tibet. There were no details about casualties.

title: A Ride Home Thats Not a Taxi, Maybe
description: As I was finishing dinner in Park Slope last Friday, I opened an app on my phone and arranged for a car to pick me up.

title: Japan: Nuclear Plants Operator Cites Poor Preparation
description: The operator of the stricken Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant acknowledged Friday that it had been ill prepared for the tsunami that swept over the site two years ago. Though it was difficult to anticipate a giant tsunami, we should not simply blame nature for this accident, said a report prepared by an internal task force of the plants operator, the Tokyo Electric Power Company. We must sincerely accept that we were unable to draw on human wisdom to prevent it. The acknowledgment was a reversal from the companys earlier assertion that the waves were bigger than it could have predicted.

title: Some Savers in Cyprus May Lose 60 Percent
description: LONDON  Big-ticket savers at the Bank of Cyprus may be forced to accept losses on their deposits that exceed 60 percent in order to keep the stricken bank afloat, bankers briefed on the negotiations said on Friday.

title: Judge Rebukes 2 Lawyers Profiting From U.S. Disability Law
description: The lawyers drafted the lawsuits by the dozens, claiming that local businesses had violated federal law by not providing access to people with disabilities  and generating thousands of dollars per case in legal fees for themselves.

title: Central African Republic: Bodies Found in the Capital
description: Volunteers have collected 78 bodies from the streets of Bangui, the capital of the Central African Republic, since rebel fighters seized control of the city last week, the Central African Red Cross reported Friday. Many of the bodies lacked identification documents, a Red Cross official told Agence France-Presse, and other medical officials said it was not immediately clear whether the dead were rebels, government soldiers, foreign soldiers or civilians. Hospitals in the capital are overflowing with rebels and others wounded in the fighting, above, officials said. A loose coalition of armed groups from the countrys northeast ousted President Franois Boziz on Sunday; the rebels, who are reported to have child soldiers among their ranks, accused Mr. Boziz of breaching the terms of a January peace deal. He first fled to Cameroon but has since requested refuge in Benin, news reports said Friday.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 29, 2013

title: A Prescription for Sick Workers
description: New York City Council Speaker Christine Quinn has finally agreed to require businesses to provide paid sick leave for as many as one million workers. This is good news, although it will take at least a year for most employees to enjoy a basic benefit widely available elsewhere.

title: Platitudes Loom After the Newtown School Carnage
description: HARTFORD

title: Fighting to Join the Ranks
description: The latest chapter in the effort to incorporate women into Marine Corps ground combat units closed Thursday, after two women (and 12 men) were eliminated from a challenging course.

title: France: Most Cities Postpone Plan for New School Hours
description: Most French cities are in no hurry to introduce a new government plan for an extra half-day of elementary school on Wednesdays and have elected to postpone the change until 2014, when it becomes mandatory, the Education Ministry confirmed Friday. The ministry estimated that the plan would affect fewer than 25 percent of Frances nearly six million public school children ages 3 to 11 in the coming school year. But several large cities, including Paris, will begin the half-day in September. For more than a century, the French school schedule has been punctuated by a midweek break, originally created for catechism studies. The new plan, which has drawn opposition from teachers and parents, calls for three hours of class time on Wednesdays while reducing the regular school day  which typically runs from 8:30 a.m. to at least 4 p.m.  by 45 minutes.

title: Savoring the Mellower Music of Home
description: When Vernon Reid, guitarist in the band Living Colour, became a rock star, he bought a Victorian house in the St. George neighborhood on Staten Island. Now, as the band celebrates the 25th anniversary of its breakthrough album, Vivid  which the group will play at Irving Plaza on April 6  Mr. Reid, 54, still enjoys the neighborhoods mix of Fort Greene-style diversity with a maritime vibe. A composer as well as a musician, he lives with his wife, Gabri Christa Reid, 49, a choreographer and filmmaker, and their daughter, Idea Viola Reid, 9. They have three cats.

title: With a Sniffle Here and a Steal There, Louisville Pulls Away From Oregon
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Oregon was the newcomer to the Midwest Region semifinals, joining three of college basketballs blue-blood programs  Louisville, Duke and Michigan State  and, in somewhat self-deprecating fashion, the Ducks brought their lone N.C.A.A. championship trophy on the team plane here.

title: Anyone Can Get a Table, Eventually
description: Jeffrey Tascarella, 33, is the general manager of the year-old restaurant the NoMad, at Broadway and 28th Street. He can be found on the restaurants floor from 10 a.m. to after 11 p.m. daily, solving problems and chatting with the regulars among the 250 nightly guests. He credits his first job in New York City, waiting on tables at Fiamma, a defunct SoHo restaurant, for his love of wine, fine dining and long hours.

title: The G.O.P.s Diversity Deserts
description: Well, that didnt take long.

title: Coming Soon
description: Natan Dvir photographs giant signs in Midtown that advertise the imminent arrival of brand-name stores and transform the streetscape.

title: Michigan Stuns No. 1 Seed Kansas
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  The shot was not a pedestrian 3-pointer, a casual 3 from 20 feet 9 inches. This was a heave. When Trey Burke stepped back, he was at least nine feet beyond the regulation 3-point line. He was drifting and Kansas 6-foot-8 Kevin Young was jumping toward him. The chances of the ball going in were about the same odds many gave Burke and Michigan when they trailed by 14 with less than seven minutes remaining.

title: Avenue of Dreams, and Hot Dogs
description: It was like Attack of the 50 Foot Woman everywhere, except the women werent exactly attacking.

title: Richard Griffiths, Falstaffian English Actor, Dies at 65
description: Richard Griffiths, the rotund British actor whose stage career reached a pinnacle with his Tony-winning performance as an idealistic but tormented pedagogue in Alan Bennetts play The History Boys and who achieved popular fame in the movies as Harry Potters mean-spirited Uncle Vernon Dursley, died on Thursday in Coventry, England. He was 65.

title: Knicks Streak Hits 7 As Smith Stays on Roll
description: The chants were faint but audible.

title: Teachers Vision, but Done New York Citys Way
description: At last years State of the City speech, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg announced the creation of a public high school called the Academy for Software Engineering. The school would be part of an ambitious expansion of computer science education in the city, and Mr. Bloomberg called it the brainchild of a local teacher named Michael Zamansky.

title: Finally Beaten in Florida, Haas, 34, Isnt Stopping
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  One set into his Sony Open semifinal match against David Ferrer on Friday, Tommy Haas could almost taste his first Masters final since 2001. Haas was looking to end a memorable week in the Miami area in style.

title: Dreams of a Harlem Jazz Rebirth
description: As another evening falls, the Lenox Lounge sits dim and lonely. Commuters pour out of the 125th Street subway station and onto Lenox Avenue, past its padlocked door. At Ginnys Supper Club across the street, a mostly black crowd of men in suits and women in heels sips and sways as a band turns out a haunting rendition of John Coltranes My Favorite Things.

title: As Home Opener Nears, the Battered Yankees Are Still Looking for Help
description: WASHINGTON  For almost a century, the Yankees have been a team accustomed to snatching the best players from other organizations, whether it was Babe Ruth, Catfish Hunter or Alex Rodriguez. But that is not the case this spring.

title: Lessons Found in the Mud
description: If you know anything about New York City, you know that there is an insufficient number of preschool spaces for all the children needing to attend preschool, and that this is experienced by the parents who live here with varying degrees of garment-rending.

title: Murray Shrugs Off Slow Start to Advance to Sony Open Final
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Andy Murray ensured that two of worlds top players would meet in the mens final of the Sony Open by coming back to defeat Richard Gasquet on Friday night in the second semifinal, 6-7 (3), 6-1, 6-2.

title: Mens N.C.A.A. Tournament: March 29
description: Michigan shocks No. 1 Kansas in overtime, Florida spoils Florida Gulf Coasts Run, Louisville smothers Oregon and Duke drops Michigan State.

title: IHT Quick Read: March 30
description: NEWS Sven Olaf Kamphuis calls himself the minister of telecommunications and foreign affairs for the Republic of CyberBunker. Others see him as the Prince of Spam. Mr. Kamphuis, who is actually Dutch, is at the heart of an international investigation into one of the biggest cyberattacks identified by the authorities. Because of his outspoken position in a loose federation of hackers, the authorities in the Netherlands and several other countries are examining what role he or the Internet companies he runs played in snarling traffic on the Web this week. Eric Pfanner and Kevin J. OBrien report.

title: Injuries May Affect Ticket Sales of Openers
description: The local forecast on Monday calls for a high near 60 degrees with a mix of sun and clouds. Not bad for fans heading to Yankee Stadium and Citi Field as the Yankees and the Mets open their seasons simultaneously in New York for the first time.

title: Duke Pushes Out Michigan State
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Steven Izzo called it right. Two weeks ago, Steven, the 13-year-old son of Michigan State Coach Tom Izzo, sidestepped family loyalty and picked Duke to defeat the Spartans in his N.C.A.A. tournament bracket. The Blue Devils validated his nerve Friday night by sending the Izzos home.

title: Whats on Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) SNOW WHITE AND THE HUNTSMAN (2012) Kristen Stewart, above, is Snow White, who seeks to usurp the evil queen Ravenna (Charlize Theron) with the help of the Huntsman (Chris Hemsworth) and a specific number of dwarfs (played by Ian McShane, Ray Winstone and Bob Hoskins, among others) in this darkened adaptation of the Brothers Grimm fairy tale, directed by Rupert Sanders. Writing in The New York Times, A. O. Scott said: There is nothing cute about this movie. And that feels right. There is something exciting about how seriously Snow White and the Huntsman takes its themes. He added that Ms. Stewarts Snow White was part of an interesting new breed of warrior princesses  Katniss Everdeen is their current leader  whose ascendance reflects the convergence of commercial calculations and cultural longings. Long may they reign.

title: Nets Fade and Fall in Denver
description: DENVER  The Nets bid to ensure a winning road record for the first time since entering the N.B.A. in 1976 came up well short against the Denver Nuggets home dominance on Friday night.

title: How the Cyberattack on Spamhaus Unfolded
description: A look at the attack and the defense in one of the largest known distributed denial of service attacks.

title: Florida Ends Florida Gulf Coasts Run
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Floridas Mike Rosario seemed thwarted as he looked to make an inbounds pass with two minutes to play. The Gators were safely ahead, so a turnover at this juncture would have been meaningless.

title: Fifty-One Years Across Town, but United in Misery for Six
description: In their 51 years together, the Mets and the Yankees have both been losing teams on only six occasions, and the last time it happened was way back in 1992. Since then, the Yankees have won five World Series and the Mets ... well, theyre the Mets, so they havent won any.

title: North Korea Threatens to Close Factories It Runs With South
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea, reiterating that it considered the Korean Peninsula back in a state of war, threatened Saturday to shut down a factory complex it jointly operates with South Korea and that stands as the last significant symbol of cooperation.

title: The Weekend Word: Checkpoint
description: Todays Times

title: Dogs, Nets and Poverty  a Tough Combination
description: Dogs and developing countries are a rough mix  with the lack of neutering resulting in puppy population explosions and all manner of bad outcomes, from millions of dog bites a year in India to rabies outbreaks in Indonesia to fatal maulings in Mexico City. Learn more from Veterinarians Without Bordersand the Street Dog Welfare page of Humane Society International.

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Jammu and Kashmir: The state government Thursday tabled a bill that seeks to regulate the functioning of private security agencies in the state, the Business Standard reported. Under the new proposal all such agencies will have to seek a mandatory license before they are allowed to operate in the state.

title: Italian President Enlists Special Help on Political Deadlock
description: ROME  Italys president said Saturday that he would turn to a group of outside advisers to help him end the countrys political deadlock, after weeks of inconclusive consultations with political leaders failed to overcome ingrained divisions.

title: After Cyprus, Euro Concerns Over Slovenia, a Former Euro Star
description: LONDON  Will Slovenia be the next Cyprus?

title: Islanders Give Visnovsky Contract Extension
description: The Islanders have signed defenseman Lubomir Visnovsky to a two-year contract extension.

title: The Price Is Wrong
description: But which price  that is the question.

title: No Trickle
description: I should give a shout-out to Larry Mishels note showing that the share of corporate-sector income going to profits has soared to levels not seen in more than 40 years. Heres another way to see the same thing, with total workers compensation in blue and profits in red, both shown as indexes with the quarter before the recession at 100:

title: Kenyan Court Upholds Election of Candidate Facing Charges in The Hague
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Kenyas Supreme Court on Saturday unanimously upheld the election victory of Uhuru Kenyatta as the countrys president, dismissing allegations that the vote had been rigged.

title: Marriage Looks Different Now
description: IN 1997, two prominent conservative writers, David Frum and Andrew Sullivan, debated same-sex marriage for the online magazine Slate.

title: Egypt Orders Arrest of Satirist Over Skits on Islam and Morsi
description: CAIRO  Egypts public prosecutor on Saturday ordered the arrest of a popular television satirist on charges that included insulting President Mohamed Morsi and denigrating Islam, the state news agency reported, a move that amplified criticisms that the Islamist government is moving aggressively to stifle freedom of expression.

title: High-Tech Means of Production Belies Nostalgic Image of Maple Syrup
description: EAST MONTPELIER, Vt.  The rich, sweet tang of sap being boiled into maple syrup greeted tourists at Burr Morses sugar shack here this month  along with Mr. Morse, every inch the rural maple farmer in worn baseball cap and syrup-stained jacket, stirring the steaming evaporator with an old-fashioned dipper.

title: Maple Syrup Takes Turn Toward Technology
description: Over the past decade technology has allowed maple farmers to offset the effects of climate change.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  I must be getting better at these, because Im definitely enjoying cryptics more. The variety of ways to clue an entry in a cryptic crossword gives your brain such a refreshing flossing that there is no way not to enjoy solving.

title: Social Security, Present and Future
description: In the fight over the federal budget deficit, Social Security has so far been untouched. That may soon change.

title: Boston College Faces Tough Road in Title Defense
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.  Besides Boston College, the East regional of the N.C.A.A. mens hockey tournament is not filled with historic powers. With the other three universities coming from lesser-known conferences, it could be easy to overlook the bracket.

title: Who Can Bring the E.U. To Its Senses?
description: Cyprus finally got a revised bailout plan last week. It taxes big, uninsured bank depositors to pay part of the cost of restructuring the countrys two biggest banks while leaving the savings of smaller, insured depositors untouched. But just days before, Cyprus, with the blessings of the smartest bankers and smartest finance ministers in Europe, came within a whisker of adopting a truly reckless plan that would have taxed small savers, undermined deposit insurance and risked sparking disastrous bank runs elsewhere, notably Italy and Spain, the euro zones third- and fourth-largest economies.

title: Resurrecting Californias Public Universities
description: Even before the recession hit, the public colleges and universities that educate more than 70 percent of the nations students were suffering from dwindling state revenue. Their response, not surprisingly, was to raise tuition, slash course offerings and, in some cases, freeze or even reduce student enrollment. The damage was acute in California, whose once-glorious system of higher education effectively cannibalized itself, shutting out a growing number of well-qualified students.

title: Immigrant Detainees and the Right to Counsel
description: DO immigrants who are incarcerated while their legal status is resolved deserve a lawyer?

title: Heats Streak May Be Over, but Show Rolls On
description: NEW ORLEANS  If LeBron James seemed bothered by the lapse of Miamis 27-game winning streak or the hard fouls  physical and verbal  he had absorbed in recent days, it was not apparent Friday morning. His hunger for victory or reprisal seemed outweighed at the moment by his hunger for lunch.

title: Our Inconsistent Ethical Instincts
description: MORAL quandaries often pit concerns about principles against concerns about practical consequences. Should we ban assault rifles and large sodas, restricting peoples liberties for the sake of physical health and safety? Should we allow drone killings or torture, if violating one persons rights could save a thousand lives?

title: Decision on Coyotes Seems Near
description: The Phoenix Coyotes ownership situation, which has been unsettled for nearly four years, could finally be resolved soon. According to published reports and to officials familiar with the situation, the N.H.L. either will sell the Coyotes to the last in a long line of prospective buyers who pledged to keep them in Glendale, Ariz., or will decide as soon as next month to allow the team to relocate.

title: Shawn Askinosie
description: Shawn Askinosie is a criminal defense lawyer turned confectioner. His company, Askinosie Chocolate in Springfield, Mo., makes highly regarded bean-to-bar artisanal chocolate with 10 percent of the profits shared with the companys cocoa farmers in Ecuador, Honduras, the Philippines and Tanzania.

title: Short of Money, Egypt Sees Crisis on Fuel and Food
description: QALYUBEYA, Egypt  A fuel shortage has helped send food prices soaring. Electricity is blacking out even before the summer. And gas-line gunfights have killed at least five people and wounded dozens over the past two weeks.

title: In Brazil, Streets of Dancing Cars and Swagger
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Jos Amrico Crippas 1974 Chevrolet Monte Carlo boasts just about every feature that a lowrider should have, including dazzling chrome wheels, a sliding ragtop roof, a candy-apple red paint job and hydraulic pumps that enable the vehicle to bounce several feet in the air at the press of a button.

title: Why I Count Glass Eels
description: WHO looks upon a river in a meditative hour and is not reminded of the flux of all things?

title: Truth in Rebounding for Tough Nets Forward
description: DENVER  Anyone who deals regularly with Reggie Evans or follows him on social media is familiar with his frequent use of the expression I aint lyin. It started in his hometown, Pensacola, Fla., and his N.B.A. teammates picked it up.

title: America the Innovative?
description: DUBLIN

title: In College Hockey Tournament, Quinnipiac and Canisius Have Doubters
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.  One team was consistently ranked in the top five all season. The other is one game above .500 and barely snuck into the N.C.A.A. mens hockey tournament.

title: An Arenas Stunning Moments, From Floor to Ceiling
description: ATLANTA  The Georgia Dome, the host of the mens Final Four this year, is 21 years old and adequate as a site for major sporting events. But because more money can be made with a new stadium, a path is being cleared for the domes extinction. So this is probably the last time a college basketball champion will be crowned at its climate-controlled environs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Remembering an Easter Miracle in Northern Ireland
description: PEACE, said W. B. Yeats, comes dropping slow.

title: Hope Is All Around in New, Open A.L. East
description: In 10 of 12 seasons, from 1998 through 2009, the Yankees and the Boston Red Sox finished in the top two spots in the American League East. When they open the season this week at Yankee Stadium, there will be no undercurrent of divisional superiority.

title: Need a Job? Invent It
description: WHEN Tony Wagner, the Harvard education specialist, describes his job today, he says hes a translator between two hostile tribes  the education world and the business world, the people who teach our kids and the people who give them jobs. Wagners argument in his book Creating Innovators: The Making of Young People Who Will Change the World is that our K-12 and college tracks are not consistently adding the value and teaching the skills that matter most in the marketplace.

title: For the Sultan of Small Sample Size, a 1.000 Career Average
description: Last season, the intensifying debate over baseball statistics grew a little louder.

title: A Childless Bystanders Baffled Hymn
description: MODERN parenting confuses me. The vocabulary, for starters.

title: Sunday Dialogue: Choosing How We Die
description: Should it be legal for doctors to help end dying patients lives?

title: N.L. Pennant Within the Nationals Grasp
description: For the last 13 years, more often than not, the path to the National League pennant has run through St. Louis. The Cardinals have appeared in seven league championship series since 2000, including the last two without the benefit of winning their division.

title: Will Gays Be Punished for Success?
description: WASHINGTON

title: King Cottons Long Shadow
description: Last month, researchers at University College London made public a database that describes in illuminating detail one of the largest government bailouts in modern history. In 1833, Britain paid 20 million pounds to compensate 3,000 Caribbean slaveholders for the emancipation of their slaves. The payments constituted about 40 percent of total governmental expenditures that year. Conversation about the database in Britain centered on the recipients of these reparations for slaveholders, among them the ancestors of George Orwell, Graham Greene and David Cameron.

title: Introducing a Repurposed President and a Revamped Star
description: We know this baseball season will have breakout stars we never expected, injuries we never saw coming and  based on last year  about 100 no-hitters and perfect games. That all involves players. Here are nine new things to watch on the periphery of the game.

title: Machines of Laughter and Forgetting
description: UNTIL very recently, technology had a clear, if boring, purpose: by taking care of the Little Things, it enabled us, its human masters, to focus on the Big Things. Unless there are slaves to do the ugly, horrible, uninteresting work, culture and contemplation become almost impossible, proclaimed that noted connoisseur of contemplation Oscar Wilde.

title: Anger Over Plan to Sell Site of Wounded Knee Massacre
description: WOUNDED KNEE, S.D.  Ever since American soldiers massacred men, women and children here more than a century ago in the last major bloodshed of the American Indian wars, this haunted patch of rolling hills and ponderosa pines has embodied the combustible relationship between Indians and the United States government.

title: Wounded Knee Up for Sale
description: This haunted patch of rolling hills and ponderosa pines has embodied the combustible relationship between Indians and the United States government.

title: Breaking It Down: Ferrer vs. Haas
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.The secret to David Ferrers success is a baseline strategy called the 2-1. It is a three-shot sequence that begins in the ad court by initially disarming the opponent with depth, then stretches him wider off the court with direction that opens a gaping hole in the deuce court for the player to finish the point.

title: Yvonne Brill, a Pioneering Rocket Scientist, Dies at 88
description: She was a brilliant rocket scientist who followed her husband from job to job and took eight years off from work to raise three children. The worlds best mom, her son Matthew said.

title: Hitched to an Aging Star: Anatomy of a Deal, and Doubts
description: Yankees pitcher Mariano Rivera was convinced that Alex Rodriguez had made a colossal blunder.

title: Labor and Business Reach Deal on Immigration Issue
description: WASHINGTON  The nations top business and labor groups have reached an agreement on a guest worker program for low-skilled immigrants, a person with knowledge of the negotiations said on Saturday. The deal clears the path for broad immigration legislation to be introduced when Congress returns from its two-week recess in mid-April.

title: Embracing a Mexican-American Subculture
description: A scene with roots in East Los Angeles has spread to places like Japan and New Zealand. Its devotees share a simple connection, beyond a few Spanish words: lowrider cars and bikes.

title: If a Fund Turns on a Dime, Watch Your Dollars
description: LAST October, shareholders in the Willow Fund, a closed-end investment fund sponsored and sold by UBS, received some disturbing news: the fund, which had assets of almost $500 million in 2006, was being liquidated.

title: An American Quilt of Privacy Laws, Incomplete
description: WE dont need a new platform. We just need to rebrand.

title: Want to Know Me? Just Read My User Manual
description: This interview with  Ivar Kroghrud, the lead strategist at QuestBack, which specializes in feedback management, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant. Mr. Kroghrud, a co-founder of the firm, was its C.E.O. for 13 years.

title: A Sustainable Budget Should Endure Any Storm
description: IN the national debate over fiscal policy, an important question is what the long-run goal should be. Representative Paul D. Ryan, chairman of the House Budget Committee, has a plan to balance the federal budget in 10 years. When asked if he would do the same, President Obama demurred.

title: Thomas McEvilley, Critic and Defender of Non-Western Art, Dies at 73
description: In 1984, when the Museum of Modern Art in New York opened its exhibition Primitivism in 20th Century Art: Affinity of the Tribal and the Modern, the reception was generally favorable. Then came Thomas McEvilleys shattering review in Artforum magazine.

title: On Being Catholic
description: An old friend and mentor of mine, Ernan McMullin, was a philosopher of science widely respected in his discipline. He was also a Catholic priest. I dont know how many times fellow philosophers at professional meetings drew me aside and asked, Does Ernan really believe that stuff? (He did.) Amid all the serious and generally respectful coverage of the papal resignation and the election of a new pope, I often detect an undertone of this same puzzlement. Can reflective and honest intellectuals actually believe that stuff?

title: Those Irritating Verbs-as-Nouns
description: Do you have a solve for this problem? Lets all focus on the build. Thats the take-away from todays seminar. Or, to quote a song that was recently a No. 1 hit in Britain, Would you let me see beneath your beautiful?

title: Phil Ramone, Producer for Musics Biggest Stars, Dies at 79
description: Phil Ramone, a prolific record producer and engineer who worked with some of the biggest music stars of the last 50 years, including Ray Charles, Frank Sinatra, Paul Simon, Billy Joel and Barbra Streisand, died on Saturday in Manhattan. He was 79. (Though it was widely reported that he was 72, public records and his family confirm that he was born on Jan. 5, 1934.)

title: Still at a Trot, This Bull May Have Farther to Go
description: FOR the last four years, market watchers have bemoaned the muted economic recovery, with its sluggish growth, tepid job creation and continuing investor fears.

title: Letting Down Our Guard With Web Privacy
description: SAY youve come across a discount online retailer promising a steal on hand-stitched espadrilles for spring. You start setting up an account by offering your e-mail address  but before you can finish, theres a ping on your phone. A text message. You read it and respond, then return to the Web site, enter your birth date, click F for female, agree to the companys terms of service and carry on browsing.

title: Alford Is Hired as the Coach at U.C.L.A.
description: Eleven days ago, New Mexico announced a 10-year contract extension for Coach Steve Alford, who agreed to coach the Lobos until 2023. But on Saturday, U.C.L.A. announced that Alford would be its next coach, the latest man charged with returning the Bruins to glory.

title: State-Wrecked: The Corruption of Capitalism in America
description: GREENWICH, Conn.The Dow Jones and Standard & Poors 500 indexes reached record highs on Thursday, having completely erased the losses since the stock markets last peak, in 2007. But instead of cheering, we should be very afraid.

title: Victory Strengthens a Case for the Derby
description: HALLANDALE BEACH, Fla.  Orbs owners, the esteemed Phipps Stable and Stuart Janney III, declined to speak about the Kentucky Derby ahead of the Florida Derby on Saturday, insisting they had not yet caught Derby fever.

title: Why Innovators Get Better With Age
description: WE need some gray hair once referred to needing someone with more experience. But I havent heard that expression in a very long time.

title: Sold on Staplers
description: To the Editor:

title: Soda Wars, Revisited
description: To the Editor:

title: Freelancers, Organized
description: To the Editor:

title: Freed From Its Cage, the Gentler Robot
description: FACTORY robots are usually caged off from humans on the assembly line lest the machines powerful steel arms deliver an accidental, bone-crunching right hook.

title: Setting Yourself Apart
description: IM a first-generation American. My father was born in Poland and changed his last name when he came to this country. My mothers family was from Sweden. My family owned two bakeries, and my siblings and I were expected to work in them. I started out cleaning the bakeries and made deliveries for the catering part of the business when I got my drivers license.

title: Fatigue May Be a Foe for Duke
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Before anyone could ask a question at the news conference after Dukes win over Michigan State, Blue Devils Coach Mike Krzyzewski made a request.

title: Before Facing Duke, Pitino Lets Sarcasm Flow
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Louisville Coach Rick Pitino is several decades removed from his upbringing on Long Island, but he has not lost his biting New York sense of sarcasm.

title: Dieng of Louisville Learns Fast
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Louisville guard Russ Smith used to room with Gorgui Dieng on the road, the oddest of odd couples, so he can neatly summarize how much the Senegal native has matured off the court.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, March 31
description: Two members of the bipartisan Senate group working on overhauling immigration policy Senator Charles E. Schumer, Democrat of New York, and Senator Jeff Flake, Republican of Arizona  will be on NBCs Meet the Press. Business and labor leaders reached a deal on a guest worker program for low-skilled immigrants on Friday.

title: McIlroy Battles Mental Mistakes
description: HUMBLE, Texas  At Redstone Golf Club on Saturday, Rory McIlroy stood over a five-foot birdie putt, which would have gotten him to four under for the day and inside the top 10 for the Houston Open.

title: Special Features
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Now this is what a Sunday puzzle is supposed to be like. Great, crunchy fill, with little to no junk. Multilayered, with more than one surprise to uncover. And that extra surprise is what keeps you going through the longer Sunday solve.

title: Election Results Upheld in Kenya
description: The countrys Supreme Court unanimously backed the election victory of Uhuru Kenyatta as president and dismissed charges of vote rigging.

description: Trainers at CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrate how to perform air squats.

description: Trainers at CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrate how to perform sumo deadlift high-pulls.

title: Investigating a Chemicals Hazards
description: The New York Times reviewed documents related to the hazards of a chemical known as nPB or normal propyl bromide. This chemical is commonly used as a solvent in auto body shops and electronics manufacturing.

title: In Twist, Safety Push Creates Toxic Risk
description: The governments forced removal of one type of chemical paved the way for something worse: a substance that threatens the health of workers who handle it each day.

title: A Yankees Final Exhibition Is Less About Baseball
description: WEST POINT, N.Y.  It was two days before the start of a potentially fraught regular season for the Yankees, and still, baseball here felt beside the point.

title: Deadlifts
description: Trainers at CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrate how to perform deadlifts.

title: Kettlebell Swings
description: Trainers at CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrate how to perform kettlebell swings.

description: UConn routed Maryland, Kentucky pushed out Delaware and Georgia escaped Stanford to advance to the Round of 8.

title: Muscle Up
description: A trainer from CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrates how to perform strict muscle ups.

title: Pull-Ups
description: Trainers at CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrate how to perform pull-ups.

title: Orange Cut Down Nets That They Barely Used
description: WASHINGTON  On the same court where he and his teammates had been obliterated in a regular-season loss three weeks ago, Syracuses Brandon Triche found himself staring at the scoreboard high above Verizon Center on Saturday afternoon. About 11 minutes remained in Syracuses East Region final against Marquette, but Triche kept looking at the clock, wishing hard that the minutes would tick away.

title: Push-Ups
description: Trainers at CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrate how to perform push-ups.

description: Trainers at CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrate how to perform rope climbs.

description: Trainers at CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrate how to perform the row most efficiently.

description: Trainers at CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrate how to perform box jumps.

description: Trainers at CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrate how to perform wall balls.

title: Curious Grade for Teachers: Nearly All Pass
description: Across the country, education reformers and their allies in both parties have revamped the way teachers are graded, abandoning methods under which nearly everyone was deemed satisfactory, even when students were falling behind.

title: Were One Big Team, So Run Those Stairs
description: AT 12:30 p.m. on a Tuesday, the chief executive of Datalogix was spider-crawling across a conference room floor. All around him, account managers and data analysts were thrusting 20-pound medicine balls overhead, while their Spandex-clad co-workers sprinted up and down the lobbys carpeted staircase.

title: Sweating It for the Company
description: Trainers at CrossFit Sanitas Boulder demonstrate how to perform various exercises. The heavy-duty fitness regimen is increasingly being offered at businesses to improve worker productivity and lower health insurance costs.

title: 9-Year-Old Breaks Record for Youngest U.S. Master
description: A 9-year-old from Madison, Wis., became the youngest chess master in American history last weekend when his rating passed 2,200 after he won two games at the Midwest Open Team Chess Festival in Dayton, Ohio.

title: New Ideological Battle in Pakistan: Traffic Circles Name
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  If ever a squabble over a street name could sum up a nations identity crisis, it is happening in Lahore, Pakistans cultural capital.

title: Not Playing Her Best, Williams Is Still Good Enough vs. Sharapova
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Serena Williams now stands alone as the woman with the most Sony Open championships after storming back to defeat Maria Sharapova, 4-6, 6-3, 6-0, in Saturdays final. It was her sixth title in the event, one better than Steffi Graf. She solidified her world No. 1 ranking by winning the last 10 games after being broken in the fifth game of the second set.

title: A Wary Easter Weekend for Christians in Syria
description: DAMASCUS, Syria  Torches flickered outside the church. Little girls wore their sparkly Easter best. Children bearing lanterns filed out through the heavy gilt doors, as worshipers carried an icon of Jesus and a cross covered with carnations.

title: Santana to Have Shoulder Surgery Again, Almost Certainly Ending Mets Career
description: The Mets said Johan Santana would have surgery Tuesday on his left shoulder. Given the gravity of the injury  a tear of the capsule in the left-handers shoulder  there is no chance he will pitch this season.

title: Shot Becomes a Youthful Vision Realized
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  His teammates have talked about framing a picture of the shot as a keepsake. For Michigan fans, it has already ascended into Wolverines lore, a thunderbolt fired from between the 3-point line and midcourt, one Trey Burke had always visualized growing up in Columbus, Ohio.

title: College Rivalry, or Differences Over Policy?
description: Is this about Bill Powers or U.T.s tower?

title: Christians in Syria Celebrate Good Friday With Hope and Fear
description: Easter weekend is usually the years most festive for Syrian Christians, but this year, it is infused with grave uncertainty.

title: A Texas Senate Bill Would Revise the States End-of-Life Procedure
description: Texas lawmakers have grappled year after year over whether families or medical professionals should decide when to end a terminally ill patients life-sustaining care. This year, they seem closer to a compromise.

title: Mets Make Final Preparations
description: Manager Terry Collins was in a jovial mood before the Mets played their spring training finale against the Baltimore Orioles. His roster was nearly set and despite a spate of injuries, two of his stars, David Wright and Daniel Murphy, appeared to be on the mend.

title: Your States Gun Control Just Got Stricter? Come on Down!
description: Gov. Rick Perry speaks wistfully  almost lovingly  about a rifle he recently fired while he was at a range in Leander owned by the manufacturer LaRue Tactical. Im incredibly passionate about a well-made piece of equipment, Mr. Perry said in a phone interview last week, whether its an automobile or a weapon.

title: Klan Protests in Memphis Over Renaming of Three Parks
description: MEMPHIS  The Ku Klux Klan rallied in Memphis on Saturday to protest the City Councils decision last month to rename three city parks that honored Confederate troops.

title: Using More Than Skill, a Gator Grows Up
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  The tattoos are the essence of Florida guard Mike Rosario, his testimonials. They cover his body, and he is not even sure how many there are  more than 60, he guesses. Rosario is the canvas for his story.

title: Cowboy Stuntman Was an Olympic Medalist, Too
description: The wood-paneled walls and shelves of Dean Smiths modest home, about 20 miles south of Graham in rural Stephens County, are cluttered with photographs and memorabilia from a lifetime and then some. A visitor might think he had stumbled into the living room of a real-life Forrest Gump.

title: A Game Forever Links Krzyzewski and Pitino
description: INDIANAPOLIS  For Duke, the living history lessons convene all over the place.

title: As OSHA Emphasizes Safety, Long-Term Health Risks Fester
description: TAYLORSVILLE, N.C.  Sheri Farley walks with a limp. The only job she could hold would be one where she does not have to stand or sit longer than 20 minutes, otherwise pain screams down her spine and up her legs.

title: Hillary Clinton Looks Ahead
description: The Timess Jim Rutenberg on the rampant speculation about the former secretary of states presidential ambitions.

title: A Clinton in Transition Keeps Opponents and Donors Frozen
description: Hillary Clinton left the State Department nearly two months ago, but she still needs a staff to keep up with the considerable business of being Hillary Clinton. A half-dozen people now work for the former secretary of state and Democratic presidential candidate in a tiny corporate space on Connecticut Avenue in Washington, in what is called her transition office.

title: Fab Freshmen at Michigan, 2013 Version
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Newcomer. Beginner. Novice.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 30, 2013

title: Wichita State Upsets Ohio State to Emerge From Topsy-Turvy West
description: LOS ANGELES  Gregg Marshall sat atop a stage, squinted at the bright lights that reflected off his glasses and tried to make sense of all that had occurred the past two weeks. He needed a few more hours, both to process and to explain.

title: One More Time, an Old-Fashioned Big East Game
description: WASHINGTON

title: Mother and Baby Critically Injured in Crash at Brooklyn Bus Stop
description: At least 10 people were injured, including a mother and her baby, when a car ran up on a sidewalk and rammed through a bus stop in Brooklyn on Saturday, the authorities said.

title: Bob Turley, Pitcher With a Blazing Fastball, Dies at 82
description: Bob Turley, a Cy Young Award-winning right-handed pitcher whose blazing fastball bored in on baffled hitters like a dissolving aspirin and lifted the Yankees to a come-from-behind victory over the Milwaukee Braves in the 1958 World Series, died on Saturday in Atlanta. He was 82.

title: Oil Pipeline Ruptures in Arkansas
description: Emergency crews worked Saturday to contain several thousand gallons of crude oil that spilled from a ruptured Exxon Mobil pipeline in central Arkansas.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, March 31
description: Im the first to admit this is broken. Meanwhile, tens of thousands of people end up on the gurney.

title: M.L.S. Saturday Recap: Henry, Donovan, Green Grass and White Stripes
description: One had to figure the Red Bulls would eventually score another goal, and that Thierry Henry would eventually notch his first, and that the team would one day win a game.

title: Corrections: March 31, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Knicks Playing the Way They Did in the Good Old Days, Four Months Ago
description: The Knicks could be the team with the longest winning streak in the league when they arrive in Miami to play the Heat on Tuesday. First, though, they will need to beat the Boston Celtics on Sunday.

title: Elizabeth Cuenin, Eric Kissack
description: Elizabeth Elaine Cuenin and Eric Glenn Kissack were married Saturday evening at the Los Angeles River Center, an event space in Los Angeles. The Rev. Walter H. Cuenin, a Roman Catholic priest and an uncle of the bride, officiated.

title: Georgi Balinov and Bradford Shellhammer
description: Georgi Dimitrov Balinov and Bradford Shane Shellhammer were married Wednesday at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau by Michael McSweeney, the New York City clerk. On Saturday, the comedian and actress Sandra Bernhard, who is also a Universal Life minister, led a nondenominational ceremony before relatives and friends at the Russian Tea Room in New York.

title: John Lynch, Matthew Wehland
description: John Joseph Lynch and Matthew Henry Colbert Wehland were married Friday by James Hart, a Universal Life minister, at Oakland Manor in Columbia, Md.

title: Amy Jain and Pratik Patel
description: Amy Kumari Jain and Pratik Prakash Patel were married Saturday at the Ritz-Carlton in Dallas. Harshvardhan Shukla, a Hindu priest, officiated.

title: Ruchira Saha, Raghav Chopra
description: Ruchira Saha and Raghav Chopra were married Saturday by Pandit Krishna Bhat Varanasi, a Hindu priest, at the Palm House at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

title: Rhoda Sweeney and Fred Drucker
description: Rhoda Davis Sweeney and Fred Lawrence Drucker were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Michael P. Sternfield at the Chicago Sinai Congregation in Chicago.

title: Isabelle Dikland, Amy Clement
description: Isabelle Antonia Dikland and Amy Delphia Clement were married Friday at the Moultrie Courthouse in Washington. Magistrate Judge John King, who is retired from the District of Columbia Superior Court, officiated.

description: Romance Aided by Counseling

description: An Illness Creates a Permanent Bond
