description: Chiyel Raah Hayles, a daughter of Wendy Kirkland Hayles and Fitz-Albert A. Hayles of Linden, N.J., was married Saturday to Gregory Scott Lum, a son of Celine Smith Lum and Samuel C. Lum, also of Linden. The Rev. Michelle Doran McBean, who was ordained by the Open Ministry in Los Angeles, officiated at Boulevard Five72, a restaurant in Kenilworth, N.J.

title: Natasha Trivers and Jonathan Howard
description: Natasha Roberta Trivers and Jonathan Charles Howard were married Saturday evening at Giando on the Water, a restaurant in Brooklyn. Damion Clark, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Emily Keast, Matteson Ellis
description: Emily Katherine Keast, a daughter of Mary Jane Keast and David G. Keast of Dalhart, Tex., was married Saturday evening to James Matteson Ellis, the son of Janelle Mayeux Ellis and James E. Ellis, both of Dallas. The Rev. Miles R. Brandon II, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the Green Pastures Victorian Estate, an event space in Austin, Tex.

title: Nets Promising Western Swing Ends With a Thud
description: SALT LAKE CITY  Randy Foye made five 3-pointers in the third quarter Saturday as the Utah Jazz went on a 22-11 run to take control of a close game and defeat the Nets, 116-107, at Energy Solutions Arena.

title: With Mets and Yankees, It May Be Pick Your Poison
description: So here we are, at the start of the 2013 season, wondering whether it is possible that both the Yankees and Mets will finish below .500 this year.

title: In Bitter Loss for Buckeyes, Something Was Missing: Them
description: LOS ANGELES  When Aaron Craft caught the ball on the right wing, with Ohio State behind by 6 and less than a minute remaining, the crowd was tense, the games outcome was uncertain, and the first half seemed so far away.

title: Slain Texas Lawman Had Pledged to Hunt Down Scum
description: KAUFMAN, Tex.  After the daylight assassination of his deputy two months ago, Mike McLelland, the district attorney in largely rural Kaufman County, responded with a flash of angry bravado, denigrating the perpetrators as scum and vowing to hunt them down.

title: Mens N.C.A.A. Tournament: March 30
description: Syracuses defense smothered Marquette and Wichita State upset Ohio State.

title: Easter in Asia Marked by Baptisms and Crucifixions
description: BEIJING  If past years are anything to go by, thousands of Chinese were to be baptized Catholic on Easter Sunday, in a reflection of an increasingly intense search for spirituality in an officially atheist nation.

title: Sino- African Relations
description: Chinas inroads to Africa alarm the West.

title: Defending a Childs Right to Fight
description: Is there any father who hasnt wished at least once during his sons metamorphosis from little savage to a little less savage, Wont some kid pound my kid?

title: Hillary and the 2016 Presidential Election. Yes, 2016.
description: Rendezvouss editor, Marcus Mabry, speaks with Jim Rutenberg, a Times political correspondent, on the rampant speculation over Hillary Clintons political ambitions  and the evidence that suggests she is.

title: The ECB and the Austerity Trap
description: Simon Wren-Lewis tries to show some sympathy for the devil: he tries to get into the mindset of European officials who defend austerity. And he gets at an important point in the process, although he may let the austerians off too lightly.

title: A Word of Caution From Rubio on Immigration
description: Read an updated version of this post.12:45 p.m. | Updated As several of the senators taking part in a bipartisan effort to overhaul to the nations immigration laws appeared on the Sunday talk shows to sound an optimistic note, Senator Marco Rubio, Republican of Florida and a member of the group, offered a strongly worded note of caution. In a statement released by his office on Sunday, the headline  in all capital letters  read: No Final Agreement on Immigration Legislation Yet.

title: Indebtedness Dwarfs the Economy
description: Chart shows the total credit market of the United States as a percent of G.D.P.

title: A Fighter for Tenants Relaces Her Gloves
description: It was 1959, and a painter and actress from Greenwich Village posted an open letter to the people of New York around Manhattan, warning that a plan by the formidable Robert Moses, then the city parks commissioner, jeopardized Shakespeare in the Park. Moses eventually dropped the plan. At the top of the letter, which Doris Diether still keeps, appear the handwritten words start of my civic career.

title: Fresh Thoughts from Authors of a Paper on 11,300 Years of Global Temperature Changes
description: April 1, 12:17 a.m. | Update below |Theres been vigorous discussion here and elsewhere (e.g., Climate Audit and Skeptical Science) of the methods and findings in A Reconstruction of Regional and Global Temperature for the Past 11,300 Years, a recent Science paper by Shaun A. Marcott, Jeremy D. Shakun, Peter U. Clark and Alan C. Mix.

title: The Child, the Tablet and the Developing Mind
description: I recently watched my sister perform an act of magic.

title: What's on Sunday
description: 12:30 P.M. (Cartoon Network) CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS (2009) Bill Hader, Anna Faris and Andy Samberg, among others, lend their voices to this animated comedy about an eccentric inventor, above, who creates a machine that can transform water into food. But the machine malfunctions and is accidentally launched into the atmosphere, where it begins to affect the weather, turning rain into cheeseburgers and a tornado into a swirling mass of spaghetti and meatballs. Parents will enjoy tracking the endless stream of movie and television sendups, Daniel M. Gold wrote in The New York Times, adding, If the filmmakers opt to make only light statements about junk food, obesity and solid waste, they at least leave the audience sated on a single serving of inspired lunacy.

title: G.I. Joe: Retaliation Has a Strong Start
description: G.I. Joe: Retaliation was a burly No. 1 at North American theaters over the Easter weekend, validating an unusual decision by Paramount Pictures to delay its release so that it could rework parts of the plot. Retaliation, which cost at least $130 million to make, took in about $41.2 million over the weekend, for a total since opening on Thursday of $51.7 million. Overseas, the movie  originally planned for release last summer  generated an additional $80.3 million in ticket sales.

title: Maestros Steady Hand Helps Resurrect Rome Opera
description: ROME  The work was by Verdi. Three fine young singers held the Rome Operas stage. But the spotlight, one night last month, was unmistakably on the maestro in the pit, Riccardo Muti.

title: Cranky Old Men
description: Shorter David Stockman:

title: From a Tricycle to Many Vehicles
description: TALL AND STRIKING (imagine a more debonair, calmly coifed Edward Scissorhands) Joseph Keckler stood in the middle of a stage, rehearsing his new work, I am an Opera. Then theres a Minotaur, he explained to an observer. He turns out to be a delightful companion.

title: As Banks in Cyprus Falter, Other Tax Havens Step In
description: LIMASSOL, Cyprus  Bloodied by a harsh bailout deal that drives a stake through the heart of this Mediterranean countrys oversize financial industry, Cyprus now faces a further blow to its role as an offshore tax haven: the vultures from competing territories are circling.

title: Hagel Warns of Big Squeeze at the Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON  Ending his first month as defense secretary, Chuck Hagel invited six young enlisted personnel for lunch in his private Pentagon office. Without military or civilian aides, Mr. Hagel himself took extensive notes as the sergeants and petty officers poured out their concerns about pay, benefits, training and sexual assault  issues that would decide whether they make the military a way of life or just a way station in life.

title: Israel Taps an Offshore Natural Gas Field
description: JERUSALEM  Israel moved closer to its goal of energy independence on Sunday as natural gas from a large offshore field began flowing into the country, a harbinger of important change that will benefit the country strategically and economically, officials said.

title: TV Taps the Foreign Idea Factory
description: Ideas may not fall out of trees, but they do come in the mail from Sydney and Tel Aviv. Of the 100 or so pilot episodes being shot as candidates for the broadcast television networks fall lineups, at least a dozen are based on shows from Argentina, Australia, Britain or Israel.

title: Inventive New Works Swoop In
description: All the works in the 30th anniversary season of the Bill T. Jones/Arnie Zane Dance Company at the Joyce Theater are set to classics of chamber music, played live. But where the first program is dominated by celebrated dances freighted with history, the second consists of two premieres created for and by the current company. In the older works the dancers look dutiful; in the new they look wonderfully like themselves.

title: As Market Heats Up, Trading Slips Into Shadows
description: Wall Street is embracing its dark side.

title: Baby Giraffe Draws Attention to Sanctuary
description: GREENWICH, Conn.  In February, the LEO Zoological Conservation Center proclaimed to the world the birth of a male eastern mountain bongo, a large African antelope. That did not get much notice.

title: Economic Reports for the Week Ahead
description: ECONOMIC REPORTS Data to be released this week includes the I.S.M. manufacturing index for March and construction spending for February (Monday); factory orders for February (Tuesday); A.D.P. employment and the I.S.M. nonmanufacturing index for March (Wednesday); weekly jobless claims (Thursday); and unemployment for March and the trade deficit and consumer credit for February (Friday).

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: PBS to Show Block of Martha Programs
description: Fans of Martha Stewart who since last fall have been tuning into her Cooking School program on PBS for advice on how to braise, roast and saut are about to get some sweeter wisdom on how to handle the often overlooked stars of menus: baked goods and desserts.

title: Dolan Says the Catholic Church Should Be More Welcoming to Gay People
description: On Easter Sunday, weeks after he helped elect a new pope for a church struggling with declining numbers and controversy over social issues, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan said that the Roman Catholic Church could be more welcoming of gay men and lesbians despite opposing same-sex marriage.

title: Social Marketing Drives a New York Renaissance
description: NEW YORK, New York, a wonderful town, according to the song  or, if you prefer the unexpurgated lyric from the Broadway version, a hell of a town. Either way, that was the sentiment back in the day when mad men ruled Madison Avenue.

title: Murrays Sony Open Title Is a Matter of Perseverance, and a Few Inches
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Andy Murray needed every bit of energy he could muster Sunday to capture his second Sony Open championship, defeating David Ferrer, 2-6, 6-4, 7-6 (1).

title: Papers Worldwide Embrace Web Subscriptions
description: SERRAVAL, France  Newspapers, once reluctant to try to charge readers for access to their Web sites, have begun doing so in droves.

title: Boeheim Maintains a Passion as Intense as His Defense
description: WASHINGTON

title: Michigan Barrels Into the Final Four After a 20-Year Absence
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  The scissors seemed awkward in their hands, and rightfully so. It had been 20 years since a Michigan basketball team had climbed a ladder this high, and as these Wolverines celebrated and carefully snipped away at the nets, they had proved worthy of creating a new legacy.

title: Then Life Got in the Way
description: The principals in Meg Wolitzers heavily detailed new novel, The Interestings, are only in their midteens when they decide to give themselves the label of the title, hoping the nickname will stick for life. This is a bravely embarrassing move for Ms. Wolitzer. Surely she knows that self-dramatizing, narcissistic teenagers arent necessarily interesting, let alone Interesting with a capital I.

title: Echoes of Languages No Longer Heard
description: The Vanishing Languages project by Kevin James, a New York-based trombonist and composer, is a rare hybrid of conservation effort and memorial, new music and ancient languages. Prodded by Unesco statistics that predict that by the end of the century half of the worlds 6,000 languages will be extinct, Mr. James spent months in the field tracking down and recording the last remaining speakers of four critically endangered tongues: Hokkaido Ainu, an aboriginal language from northern Japan, the American Indian Quileute from western Washington, and Dalabon and Jawoyn, aboriginal languages from Arnhem Land in Australia.

title: Raging Against the Fates, With Intermittent Elegies
description: Visions of murder, catastrophe, transfiguration and desperate love issued from the Beacon Theater stage on Friday night, set to dirges, stomps and inexorable crescendos. Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds  along with a string ensemble, the backup singers Sharon Van Etten (who opened the concert) and Shilpa Ray, and a youth choir, the Harlem Voices  were midway through a sold-out three-night stand. Songs from their new album, Push the Sky Away (Bad Seed Ltd.), started and ended the set. In between they revisited material recorded over the last three decades.

title: Discovery Expands Its Reach Overseas
description: Alana Thompson, the 7-year-old beauty queen known as Honey Boo Boo, has had some mishaps in child pageants in the Deep South, where her reality show on Discovery Communications TLC channel is based. But the chubby and charming contestant and her overbearing parents are big in Brazil.

title: Spring North American Championships
description: ST. LOUIS  At the Spring North American Championships here last month the winners of the Lebhar IMP Pairs were Kent Mignocchi and Joel Wooldridge of New York City. They did well in the diagramed deal from the first session on the second and last day, when Wooldridge read the cards perfectly.

title: Disco and Villains in 1983 Bollywood
description: In its first scene, set at the Funkytown Disco in Bombay  year: 1983  Himmatwala loads on the period markers, with quick nods to Michael Jackson, Madonna and, of course, the reign of disco in a song-and-dance number (called Thank God Its Friday, no less) full of flashing lights and silver-clad hoofers.

title: Archaeologists of Vinyl Rejoice in Return Home
description: The Moving Sidewalks, in their first gig in nearly 44 years on Saturday night at B. B. King Blues Club and Grill, played some pretty nice gear for a band that never had a national hit. Tube amplifiers by Magnatone, the recently revived pre-70s American brand, handsome in design, broad and deep in sound; custom-made Telecaster-like guitars with psychedelic blob patterns swirling on a small screen underneath the strings, as if iPads had been built into the instruments bodies.

title: Nuzzling (or Is It Nudging?) Their Way Through a Duet
description: The choreographer Ursula Eagly and her collaborator, Abby Block, struck crooked poses in the middle of a pristine white floor at the Chocolate Factory on Thursday. They might have been innocent girls pretending to be trees, except that the discomfort of the posing, combined with their dazed and wandering eyes, suggested something awry.

title: Could the Killings Be Connected?
description: With the murder of a Texas prosecutor on Saturday, less than two months after one of his assistants was killed, investigators say they cant rule out a connection to white supremacist groups, and another prominent murder. Here is a timeline of those events.

title: Laughing at Rappers, Who Laugh Right Back
description: Its almost certainly too soon, and definitely futile, to be discussing what constitutes golden ages of any Internet pursuit, but in the area of hip-hop humor the peaks may have already been set.

title: An Eyewear Companys Simple Sell
description: The start-up Warby Parker is one of a number of new innovators that has decided to design, manufacture and sell its inexpensive products directly to its Web-savvy customers.

title: Anthony Can Learn From Pierces Career Arc
description: Shaquille ONeal is generally credited as the first to describe Paul Pierce as the truth, which eventually stuck as an uppercase nickname. But there were years before that when Pierce, upon consideration for membership in the fraternity of authentic N.B.A. elites, was dismissed as anything but.

title: Islamist Fighters Slip Back Into Timbuktu and Are Repelled by French and Malians
description: PARIS  A small band of radical Islamist fighters battled French and Malian soldiers for hours in a firefight in Timbuktu on Sunday after infiltrating the Malian city overnight, Malian officials and witnesses said.

title: Indies Grab the Controls at a Game Conference
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The Game Developers Conference is the kind of place where controllers for the PlayStation 4, Sonys forthcoming console, sit under glass like the Hope Diamond, and where designers and other industry professionals line up for hours to try the Oculus Rift virtual-reality headset, which has begun shipping as prototypes to those who paid $300 for a development kit.

title: Game Developers Conference
description: Scenes from the gathering in San Francisco.

title: E-Commerce Companies Bypass the Middlemen
description: When the founders of a start-up that sells eyeglasses online, Warby Parker, began investigating why designer glasses cost several hundred dollars, they discovered that everyone in the process was taking a cut: designers, manufacturers, brands, wholesalers and retailers.

title: Smoky Voice Covers the Ground From Gloomy to Morbid
description: If an enormous sculpture is placed in a small room, or a miniature is marooned on a vast museum wall, the art can lose its impact. Particular genres of music also need to be performed in an appropriate space to be best enjoyed.

title: Art Collector Buried After Three-Week Delay
description: Merton D. Simpson, the painter and influential collector of African art, was buried on Saturday in his hometown, Charleston, S.C., three weeks after his death at 84. The delay stemmed from bitter infighting among his family, friends and a court-appointed guardian.

title: Calculating the Impact of Cypruss Bailout
description: WHAT are the implications of the huge losses  60 percent  that the Cypriot bailout is imposing on the biggest depositors of that countrys two largest banks?

title: Fool
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  No, Im not calling you all FOOLs. And lest you think that Gary J. Whitehead is trying to insult us, please note todays date. Yes, its April FOOLs Day, and todays puzzle is all about FOOLs and being FOOLed.

title: Rates of A.D.H.D. Diagnosis in Children
description: Nearly one in five high school-aged boys has been given a diagnosis of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

title: Once a Cuckoos Nest, Now a Museum
description: SALEM, Ore.  Nurse Ratched slept here.

title: Egyptian Satirist Posts Bail as Authorities Press Case
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian television satirist who was summoned by prosecutors on charges that he had insulted President Mohamed Morsi was ordered to post bail on Sunday, indicating that the authorities were continuing to pursue their investigation of the popular host.

title: Russians Selectively Blocking Internet
description: MOSCOW  The Russian government in recent weeks has been making use of a new law that gives it the power to block Internet content that it deems illegal or harmful to children.

title: Treating Cancer Patients, and Costs
description: To the Editor:

title: Should Small Knives Be Permitted on Planes?
description: To the Editor:

title: Scrub Away Your Worries
description: To the Editor:

title: More Stockman
description: Not much more, I promise. As Mark Thoma points out, the verdict among everyone who knows anything is that Stockmans piece, mysteriously given star treatment, was pathetic and embarrassing. Its full of big numbers that are scary because theyre big numbers  weve run a current account deficit of $8 trillion. So? We have a $16 trillion a year economy; Americas net international investment position is a debt of about 30 percent of GDP, which isnt that big; our balance of investment income is still positive. But its EIGHT TRILLION DOLLARS!

title: Data Storage Player Prepares to Compete Overseas
description: LONDON  Box, an online business data storage and management company, plans to expand its sales force and team of developers by opening offices in Germany and France in coming months, building on its first overseas foray last summer in Britain.

title: N.Y.U. and the Village
description: To the Editor:

title: Pope Calls for Peace in All the World in First Easter Message
description: VATICAN CITY  In his first Easter Sunday message, Pope Francis passionately called for peace in all the world, urging Israelis and Palestinians to resume negotiations to end a conflict that has lasted all too long, calling for an end to the civil war in Syria, and promoting a renewed spirit of reconciliation on the Korean Peninsula, where tensions have been rising.

title: The Tar Sands Disaster
description: WATERLOO, Ontario

title: New Disney Characters Make It Big in TVs Preschool Playground
description: LOS ANGELES  Sorry, Dora. Youve been dethroned.

title: 2 Men in China Die of Lesser-Known Strain of Bird Flu
description: SHANGHAI  Two men have died here after contracting a strain of avian flu that had not been previously found in humans, Xinhua, Chinas official news agency, reported Sunday.

title: From Asylum to Museum
description: The hospital once known as the Oregon State Insane Asylum is one of only a few institutions around the world that house museums inside of still-functioning treatment facilitys.

title: Disney Junior Finds Ratings Success
description: As Disney Juniors ratings catch up to Nick Jr.s, Brooks Barnes of The New York Times sits down with the Disney executive Nancy Kanter to discuss the success of Disneys childrens programming.

title: Rubio Says Immigration Bill Still Has a Way to Go
description: WASHINGTON  As several of the eight senators taking part in a bipartisan effort to overhaul to the nations immigration laws appeared on television Sunday to voice optimism about the negotiations, Senator Marco Rubio, a member of the group, issued a strongly worded message of caution.

title: Tracking Cicadas, With Helpers
description: The 17-year Magicicada Brood II cicadas are coming, and WNYC and its nationally distributed Radiolab program will be there to welcome them  after a mad sprint to persuade hundreds of listeners in the next two weeks to build temperature sensors and stick them in the ground, from Virginia to Connecticut.
